[Cataraqui County]1-cataraqui county extending from [the northernmost line of [the village]474-the village known as [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay on the south to [the Canadian border]475-the canadian border]473-the northernmost line of the village known as three mile bay on the south to the canadian border , on the north a distance of fifty miles . And from [Senaschet]3-senaschet and [Indian Lakes]4-indian lakes on the east to [the Rock]5-the rock and [Scarf Rivers]6-scarf rivers on the west — a width of thirty miles . [[Its]1-cataraqui county greater portion covered by uninhabited forests and [lakes]477-lakes]476-its greater portion covered by uninhabited forests and lakes , yet dotted here and there with such [villages and hamlets]478-villages and hamlets as [Koontz]7-koontz , [Grass Lake]21-grass lake , [North Wallace]9-north wallace , [Brown Lake]10-brown lake , with [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , [the county seat]479-the county seat , numbering no less than two thousand souls of [the fifteen thousand in [the entire county]481-the entire county]480-the fifteen thousand in the entire county . And [the central square of [the town]483-the town occupied by [the old and yet not ungraceful county courthouse]484-the old and yet not ungraceful county courthouse]482-the central square of the town occupied by the old and yet not ungraceful county courthouse , a cupola with a clock and some pigeons surmounting [it]485-it , [the four principal business streets of [the small town]487-the small town facing [it]485-it]486-the four principal business streets of the small town facing it .

In [the office of [the County Coroner]489-the county coroner in the northeast corner of [the building on Friday]490-the building on friday]488-the office of the county coroner in the northeast corner of the building on friday , July ninth , one [Fred Heit]177-fred , [coroner]491-coroner , [a large and broad - shouldered individual with a set of gray - brown whiskers such as might have graced [a Mormon elder]493-a mormon elder]492-a large and broad - shouldered individual with a set of gray - brown whiskers such as might have graced a mormon elder . [His]177-fred face was large and [his]177-fred hands and [his]177-fred feet also . And [his]177-fred girth was proportionate .

At the time that this presentation begins , about two - thirty in the afternoon , [he]177-fred was lethargically turning the leaves of a mail - order catalogue for which [[his]177-fred wife]494-his wife had asked [him]177-fred to write . And while deciphering from its pages the price of shoes , jackets , hats , and caps for [[his]177-fred five omnivorous children]495-his five omnivorous children , a greatcoat for [himself]177-fred of soothing proportions , high collar , broad belt , large , impressive buttons chancing to take [his]177-fred eye , [he]177-fred had paused to consider regretfully that the family budget of three thousand dollars a year would never permit of so great luxury this coming winter , particularly since [[his]177-fred wife]494-his wife , [Ella]178-ella , had had [her]178-ella mind upon a fur coat for at least three winters past .

However [his]177-fred thoughts might have eventuated on this occasion , [they]497-they were interrupted by the whirr of a telephone bell .

" Yes , this is [Mr. Heit]179-mr. heit speaking — [Wallace Upham of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]12-wallace upham of big bittern . Why , yes , go on , [Wallace]180-wallace — [young couple]4136-young couple drowned — all right , just wait a minute — "[177-fred]

[Slowly Mr. Heit]179-mr. heit restored the receiver to the hook and as slowly arose from the capacious walnut - hued chair in which [he]180-wallace sat , stroking [his]180-wallace heavy whiskers , while [he]180-wallace eyed [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , [combination typist]509-combination typist , [record clerk]510-record clerk , and what not .

" [You]180-wallace got all that down , did [you]180-wallace , [Earl]181-earl newcomb ? "[180-wallace]

[We]4138-we may have to stay up there until tomorrow . [You]180-wallace never can tell in these cases how [they]4143-they 're going to turn out and it 's best to be on the safe side . "[180-wallace]

[Heit]183-mrs. heit turned to [a coat - room in one corner of [the musty old room]512-the musty old room]511-a coat - room in one corner of the musty old room and extracted a large , soft - brimmed , straw hat , the downward curving edges of which seemed to heighten the really bland and yet ogreish effect of [his]513-his protruding eyes and voluminous whiskers , and having thus equipped [himself]183-mrs. heit , said : " [I]183-mrs. heit 'm just going in [[the sheriff]4144-the sheriff 's office]4145-the sheriff 's office a minute , [Earl]181-earl newcomb . [You]181-earl newcomb 'd better call up [the Republican]16-the republican and [the Democrat]4146-the democrat and tell ['em]4147-'em about this , so [they]4147-'em wo n't think [we]4148-we 're slightin ' ['em]4147-'em . Then [I]183-mrs. heit 'll meet [you]181-earl newcomb down at [the station]4149-the station . "[183-mrs. heit] And [he]513-his lumbered out .

And [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , [a tall , slender , shock - headed young man of perhaps nineteen , and of a very serious , if at times befuddled , manner]514-a tall , slender , shock - headed young man of perhaps nineteen , and of a very serious , if at times befuddled , manner , at once seized a sheaf of subpoenas , and while stuffing these in [his]181-earl newcomb pocket , sought to get [Mrs. Heit]183-mrs. heit on the telephone . And then , after explaining to the newspapers about a reported double drowning at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , [he]181-earl newcomb seized [his]181-earl newcomb own blue - banded straw hat , some two sizes too large for [him]181-earl newcomb , and hurried down [the hall]515-the hall , only to encounter , opposite [the wide - open office door of [the district attorney]517-the district attorney]516-the wide - open office door of the district attorney , [Zillah Saunders]184-zillah saunders , [spinster]518-spinster and [solitary stenographer to [the locally somewhat famous and mercurial [Orville W. Mason]185-mason , [district attorney]521-district attorney]520-the locally somewhat famous and mercurial orville w. mason , district attorney]519-solitary stenographer to the locally somewhat famous and mercurial orville w. mason , district attorney . [She]183-mrs. heit was on [her]183-mrs. heit way to [[the auditor]522-the auditor 's office]523-the auditor 's office , but being struck by the preoccupation and haste of [Mr. Newcomb]186-mr. newcomb , usually so much more deliberate , [she]183-mrs. heit now called : " Hello , [Earl]181-earl newcomb . What 's the rush ? Where [you]181-earl newcomb going so fast ? "[183-mrs. heit]

" Double drowning up at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , [we]4150-we hear . Maybe something worse . [Mr. Heit]179-mr. heit 's going up and [I]183-mrs. heit 'm going along . [We]4150-we have to make that 3:10 . "[183-mrs. heit]

" Who said so ? Is it [anyone from here]4151-anyone from here ? "[183-mrs. heit]

" Do n't know yet , but do n't think so . " [My]183-mrs. heit goodness , if it 's a crime , [Mr. Mason'll]188-mr. mason'll be interested , wo n't [he]188-mr. mason'll ? "[183-mrs. heit]

" Sure , [I]183-mrs. heit 'll telephone [him]179-mr. heit , or [Mr. Heit]179-mr. heit will . If [you]181-earl newcomb see [Bud Parker]189-bud parker or [Karel Badnell]190-karel badnell , tell 'em [I]183-mrs. heit had to go out of [town]4153-town , and call up [[my]183-mrs. heit mother]4154-my mother for [me]183-mrs. heit , will [you]181-earl newcomb , [Zillah]184-zillah saunders , and tell [her]4154-my mother , too . " Sure [I]183-mrs. heit will , [Earl]181-earl newcomb . "[183-mrs. heit]

" Thanks . "[183-mrs. heit]

And , highly interested by this latest development in the ordinary humdrum life of [[his]524-his chief]525-his chief , [he]524-his skipped gayly and even eagerly down [the south steps of [the Cataraqui County Courthouse]527-the cataraqui county courthouse]526-the south steps of the cataraqui county courthouse , while [Miss Saunders]191-miss saunders , knowing that [[her]191-miss saunders own chief]528-her own chief was off on some business connected with the approaching County Republican Convention , and there being [no one else in [[his]524-his office]530-his office with whom [she]191-miss saunders could communicate at this time]529-no one else in his office with whom she could communicate at this time , went on to [[the auditor]522-the auditor 's office]523-the auditor 's office , where it was possible to retail to [any who might be assembled there]533-any who might be assembled there , all that [she]191-miss saunders had gathered concerning this seemingly important lake tragedy .

The information obtained by [Coroner Heit]192-heit and [[his]192-heit assistant]534-his assistant was of a singular and disturbing character . In the first instance , because of the disappearance of [a boat]535-a boat and [an apparently happy and attractive couple bent on sight - seeing]536-an apparently happy and attractive couple bent on sight - seeing , an early morning search , instigated by [the inn - keeper of [this region]538-this region]537-the inn - keeper of this region , had revealed , in [Moon Cove]18-moon cove , the presence of [the overturned canoe]539-the overturned canoe , also the hat and veil . And [immediately such available employees]540-immediately such available employees , as well as [guides]541-guides and [guests of the Inn]542-guests of the inn , as could be impressed , had begun diving into [the waters]543-the waters or by means of long poles equipped with hooks attempting to bring one or both bodies to the surface . The fact , as reported by [Sim Shoop]193-sim shoop , [the guide]544-the guide , as well as [the innkeeper]545-the innkeeper and [the boathouse lessee]546-the boathouse lessee , that [the lost girl]547-the lost girl was both young and attractive and [[her]547-the lost girl companion]548-her companion seemingly [a youth of some means]549-a youth of some means , was sufficient to whet the interest of [this lake group of [woodsmen]551-woodsmen and [inn employees]552-inn employees]550-this lake group of woodsmen and inn employees to a point which verged on sorrow . And in addition , there was intense curiosity as to how , on so fair and windless a day , so strange an accident could have occurred .

But what created far more excitement after a very little time was the fact that at high noon [one of the men who trolled — [John Pole]194-john pole]553-one of the men who trolled — john pole — [a woodsman]554-a woodsman , was at last successful in bringing to [the surface]555-the surface [Roberta]195-roberta [herself]195-roberta , drawn upward by the skirt of [her]195-roberta dress , obviously bruised about the face — the lips and nose and above and below the right eye — a fact which to [those who were assisting at once]556-those who were assisting at once seemed to be suspicious . Indeed , [John Pole]194-john pole , who with [Joe Rainer]196-joe [at the oars]557-at the oars was [the one who had succeeded in bringing [her]195-roberta to the surface]558-the one who had succeeded in bringing her to the surface , had exclaimed at once on seeing [her]195-roberta : " Why , the pore little thing ! [She]195-roberta do n't seem to weigh more'n nothin' at all . It 's a wonder tuh [me]553-one of the men who trolled — john pole [she]195-roberta coulda sunk . "[553-one of the men who trolled — john pole] And then reaching over and gathering [her]195-roberta in [his]553-one of the men who trolled — john pole strong arms , [he]553-one of the men who trolled — john pole drew [her]195-roberta in , dripping and lifeless , while [[his]553-one of the men who trolled — john pole companions]559-his companions signaled to [the other searchers , who came swiftly]560-the other searchers , who came swiftly . And putting back from [her]195-roberta face the long , brown , thick hair which the action of the water had swirled concealingly across it , [he]553-one of the men who trolled — john pole had added : " [I]553-one of the men who trolled — john pole do declare , [Joe]196-joe ! Looka here . It does look like [the child mighta been hit by somethin']4155-the child mighta been hit by somethin' ! Looka here , [Joe]196-joe ! "[553-one of the men who trolled — john pole] And soon [the group of woodsmen]561-the group of woodsmen and inn guests in [[their]561-the group of woodsmen boats]562-their boats alongside were looking at the brownish - blue marks on [Roberta]195-roberta 's face .

And forthwith , even while the body of [Roberta]195-roberta was being taken north to [the boat - house]563-the boat - house , and the dragging for the body of [the lost man]564-the lost man was resumed , suspicions were being voiced in such phrases as : " Well , it looks kinda queer — them marks — an ' all,—don't it ? It 's curious [a boat like that coulda upset]4156-a boat like that coulda upset on a day like yesterday . "[195-roberta] " [We]4157-we 'll soon know if [he]564-the lost man 's down there or not ! "[195-roberta] ; the feeling , following failure after hours of fruitless search for [him]564-the lost man , definitely coalescing at last into the conclusion that more than likely [he]564-the lost man was not down there at all — a hard and stirring thought to all .

Subsequent to this , [the guide who had brought [Clyde]197-clyde and [Roberta]195-roberta from [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge conferring with [the inn - keepers]566-the inn - keepers at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern and [Grass Lake]21-grass lake]565-the guide who had brought clyde and roberta from gun lodge conferring with the inn - keepers at big bittern and grass lake , it was factually determined : ( 1 ) that [the drowned girl]567-the drowned girl had left [her]567-the drowned girl bag at [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge whereas [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden had taken [his]564-the lost man with [him]564-the lost man ; ( 2 ) that there was a disturbing discrepancy between the registration at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake and that at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , the names [Carl Graham]199-carl graham and [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden being carefully discussed by [the two inn - keepers]568-the two inn - keepers and the identity of [the bearer as to looks established]569-the bearer as to looks established ; and ( 3 ) that [the said Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden or [Carl Graham]199-carl graham had asked of [the guide who had driven [him]564-the lost man over to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern whether there were many people on [the lake]571-the lake]570-the guide who had driven him over to big bittern whether there were many people on the lake that day . And thereafter the suspicions thus far engendered further coalescing into the certainty that there had been foul play . There was scarcely any doubt of it .

Immediately upon [his]564-the lost man arrival [Coroner Heit]192-heit was made to understand that [these men of [the north woods]573-the north woods]572-these men of the north woods were deeply moved and in addition determined in [their]572-these men of the north woods suspicions . [They]572-these men of the north woods did not believe that the body of [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden or [Carl Graham]199-carl graham had ever sunk to [the bottom of [the lake]571-the lake]574-the bottom of the lake . With the result that [Heit]192-heit on viewing the body of [the unknown girl]576-the unknown girl laid carefully on a cot in [the boat - house]563-the boat - house , and finding [her]576-the unknown girl young and attractive , was strangely affected , not only by [her]576-the unknown girl looks but this circumambient atmosphere of suspicion . Worse yet , on retiring to [the office of [the manager of [the inn]503-the inn]579-the manager of the inn]578-the office of the manager of the inn , and being handed the letter found in the pocket of [Roberta]195-roberta 's coat , [he]564-the lost man was definitely swayed in the direction of a somber and unshakable suspicion . For [he]564-the lost man read :

[Grass Lake]21-grass lake , [N. Y.]22-n. y. , July 8th .

And in the upper right - hand corner of the paper , as well as on the envelope , were printed the words : " [Grass Lake Inn]23-grass lake inn , [Grass Lake]21-grass lake , [N. Y.]22-n. y. , [Jack Evans]200-jack evans , Prop . "[564-the lost man] And the letter had evidently been written the morning after the night [they]581-they had spent at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake as [Mr.]582-mr. and [Mrs. Carl Graham]199-carl graham .

The waywardness of [young girls]583-young girls !

For plainly , as this letter indicated , [these two]584-these two had stayed together as [man]585-man and [wife]586-wife at [that inn]587-that inn when [they]584-these two were not as yet married . [He]564-the lost man winced as [he]564-the lost man read , for [he]564-the lost man had [daughters of [his]564-the lost man own]588-daughters of his own of whom [he]564-the lost man was exceedingly fond . But at this point [he]564-the lost man had a thought . A quadrennial county election was impending , the voting to take place the following November , at which were to be chosen for three years more the entire roster of [county offices]589-county offices , [his]564-the lost man own included , and in addition this year [a county judge whose term was for six years]590-a county judge whose term was for six years . In August , some six weeks further on , were to be held the county Republican and Democratic conventions at which were to be chosen the regular party nominees for these respective offices . Yet for [no one of [these places]592-these places]591-no one of these places , thus far , other than that of [the county judgeship]593-the county judgeship , could [the present incumbent of the office of district attorney]594-the present incumbent of the office of district attorney possibly look forward with any hope , since already [he]594-the present incumbent of the office of district attorney had held the position of [district attorney]521-district attorney for two consecutive terms , a length of office due to the fact that not only was [he]594-the present incumbent of the office of district attorney [a good orator of the inland political stripe]596-a good orator of the inland political stripe but also , as [the chief legal official of [the county]499-the county]597-the chief legal official of the county , [he]594-the present incumbent of the office of district attorney was in a position to do one and another of [[his]594-the present incumbent of the office of district attorney friends]599-his friends a favor . But now , unless [he]594-the present incumbent of the office of district attorney were so fortunate as to be nominated and subsequently elected to [this county]600-this county judgeship , defeat and political doldrums loomed ahead . For during all [his]564-the lost man term of office thus far , there had been no really important case in connection with which [he]564-the lost man had been able to distinguish [himself]564-the lost man and so rightfully and hopefully demand further recognition from [the people]601-the people . But this ...

But now , as [the Coroner]602-the coroner shrewdly foresaw , might not this case prove the very thing to fix the attention and favor of [the people]601-the people upon [one man]604-one man — [the incumbent district attorney]605-the incumbent district attorney — [a close and helpful friend of [his]564-the lost man]606-a close and helpful friend of his , thus far — and so sufficiently redound to [his]564-the lost man credit and strength , and through [him]564-the lost man to the party ticket itself , so that at the coming election all might be elected — [the reigning district attorney]607-the reigning district attorney thus winning for [himself]594-the present incumbent of the office of district attorney not only the nomination for but [his]594-the present incumbent of the office of district attorney election to the six - year term judgeship . Stranger things than this had happened in [the political world]608-the political world .

Immediately [he]564-the lost man decided not to answer any questions in regard to this letter , since it promised a quick solution of the mystery of [the perpetrator of the crime]609-the perpetrator of the crime , if there had been one , plus exceptional credit in the present political situation to whosoever should appear to be instrumental in the same . At the same time [he]564-the lost man at once ordered [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , as well as [the guide who had brought [Roberta]195-roberta and [Clyde]197-clyde to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]610-the guide who had brought roberta and clyde to big bittern , to return to [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge station from where [the couple]611-the couple had come and say that under no circumstances was the bag held there to be surrendered to any one save [himself]564-the lost man or [a representative of [the district attorney]517-the district attorney]612-a representative of the district attorney . Then , when [he]564-the lost man was about to telephone to [Biltz]14-biltz to ascertain whether there was [such a family as [Alden]195-roberta]614-such a family as alden possessing [a daughter]615-a daughter by the name of [Bert]202-bert , or possibly [Alberta]203-alberta , [he]564-the lost man was most providentially , as it seemed to [him]564-the lost man , interrupted by [two men]616-two men and [a boy]617-a boy , [trappers and hunters of this region]618-trappers and hunters of this region , who , accompanied by [a crowd of those now familiar with the tragedy]619-a crowd of those now familiar with the tragedy , were almost tumultuously ushered into [his]564-the lost man presence . For [they]620-they had news — news of the utmost importance ! As [they]620-they now related , with many interruptions and corrections , at about five o'clock of the afternoon of the day on which [Roberta]195-roberta was drowned , [they]620-they were setting out from [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay , [some twelve miles south of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]621-some twelve miles south of big bittern , to hunt and fish in and near [this lake]622-this lake . And , as [they]620-they now unanimously testified , on the night in question , at about nine o'clock , as [they]620-they were nearing [the south shore of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]623-the south shore of big bittern — perhaps three miles to [the south of [it]13-big bittern]624-the south of it — [they]620-they had encountered [a young man]625-a young man , whom [they]620-they took to be [some stranger making [his]625-a young man way from [the inn at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]627-the inn at big bittern south to [[the village]474-the village at [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay]629-the village at three mile bay]626-some stranger making his way from the inn at big bittern south to the village at three mile bay . [He]625-a young man was [a smartishly and decidedly well dressed youth for these parts]630-a smartishly and decidedly well dressed youth for these parts , as [they]620-they now said — wearing a straw hat and carrying a bag , and at the time [they]620-they wondered why such a trip on foot and at such an hour since there was [a train]631-a train south early next morning which reached [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay in an hour 's time . And why , too , should [he]625-a young man have been so startled at meeting [them]620-they ? For as [they]620-they described it , on [his]625-a young man encountering [them]620-they in [the woods]632-the woods thus , [he]625-a young man had jumped back as though startled and worse — terrified — as though about to run . To be sure , the lantern one of [them]620-they was carrying was turned exceedingly low , the moon being still bright , and [they]620-they had walked quietly , as became [men who were listening for wild life of any kind]633-men who were listening for wild life of any kind . At the same time , surely this was [a perfectly safe part of [the country]635-the country]634-a perfectly safe part of the country , traversed for the most part by [honest citizens such as [themselves]620-they]636-honest citizens such as themselves , and there was no need for [a young man]625-a young man to jump as though [he]625-a young man were seeking to hide in [the brush]638-the brush . However , when [the youth]639-the youth , [Bud Brunig]204-bud brunig , who carried the light , turned it up [the stranger]640-the stranger seemed to recover [his]640-the stranger poise and after a moment in response to [their]620-they " Howdy "[640-the stranger] had replied : " How do [you]640-the stranger do ? How far is it to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay ? "[640-the stranger] and [they]620-they had replied , " About seven mile . "[620-they] And then [he]640-the stranger had gone on and [they]620-they also , discussing the encounter .

And now , since the description of [this youth]641-this youth tallied almost exactly with that given by [the guide who had driven [Clyde]197-clyde over from [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge]642-the guide who had driven clyde over from gun lodge , as well as that furnished by [the innkeepers at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern and [Grass Lake]21-grass lake]643-the innkeepers at big bittern and grass lake , it seemed all too plain that [he]641-this youth must be [the same youth who had been in [that boat]645-that boat with [the mysterious dead girl]646-the mysterious dead girl]644-the same youth who had been in that boat with the mysterious dead girl .

At once [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb suggested to [[his]181-earl newcomb chief]525-his chief that [he]181-earl newcomb be permitted to telephone to [the one inn - keeper at [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay]648-the one inn - keeper at three mile bay to see if by any chance [this mysterious stranger]649-this mysterious stranger had been seen or had registered [there]650-there . [He]641-this youth had not . Nor apparently at that time had [he]641-this youth been seen by any other than [the three men]651-the three men . In fact , [he]641-this youth had vanished as though into air , although by nightfall of this same day it was established that on the morning following the chance meeting of [the men]652-the men with [the stranger]640-the stranger , [a youth of somewhat the same description and carrying a bag , but wearing a cap — not a straw hat]654-a youth of somewhat the same description and carrying a bag , but wearing a cap — not a straw hat — had taken passage for [Sharon]25-sharon on [the small lake steamer " Cygnus]4158-the small lake steamer " cygnus "[654-a youth of somewhat the same description and carrying a bag , but wearing a cap — not a straw hat] plying between [that place]655-that place and [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay . But again , beyond that point , [the trail]656-the trail appeared to be lost . [No one at [Sharon]25-sharon]657-no one at sharon , at least up to this time , seemed to recall either the arrival or departure of [any such person]658-any such person . Even [the captain]659-the captain [himself]659-the captain , as [he]659-the captain later testified , had not particularly noted [his]659-the captain debarkation — there were [some fourteen others going down [the lake]571-the lake]660-some fourteen others going down the lake that day and [he]659-the captain could not be sure of [any one person]662-any one person .

But in so far as [the group at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]663-the group at big bittern was concerned , the conclusion slowly but definitely impressed itself upon all those present that whoever [this individual]664-this individual was , [he]664-this individual was [an unmitigated villain]665-an unmitigated villain — [a reptilian villain]666-a reptilian villain ! And forthwith there was doubled and trebled in the minds of all a most urgent desire that [he]664-this individual be overtaken and captured . [The scoundrel]667-the scoundrel ! [The murderer]668-the murderer ! And at once there was broadcast throughout [this region]538-this region by word of mouth , telephone , telegraph , to such papers as [The Argus]26-the argus and [Times - Union of [Albany]28-albany]27-times - union of albany , and [The Star of Lycurgus]670-the star of lycurgus , the news of this pathetic tragedy with the added hint that it might conceal a crime of the gravest character .

[Coroner Heit]192-heit , [his]192-heit official duties completed for the time being , found [himself]192-heit pondering , as [he]192-heit traveled south on the lake train , how [he]192-heit was to proceed farther . What was the next step [he]192-heit should take in this pathetic affair ? For [the coroner]602-the coroner , as [he]192-heit had looked at [Roberta]195-roberta before [he]192-heit left was really deeply moved . [She]195-roberta seemed so young and innocent - looking and pretty . The little blue serge dress lying heavily and clinging tightly to [her]195-roberta , [her]195-roberta very small hands folded across [her]195-roberta breast , [her]195-roberta warm , brown hair still damp from its twenty - four hours in the water , yet somehow suggesting some of the vivacity and passion that had invested [her]195-roberta in life — all seemed to indicate a sweetness which had nothing to do with crime .

But deplorable as it might be , and undoubtedly was , there was another aspect of the case that more vitally concerned [himself]192-heit . Should [he]192-heit go to [Biltz]14-biltz and convey to [the Mrs. Alden]187-mrs. alden of the letter the dreadful intelligence of [[her]187-mrs. alden daughter]672-her daughter 's death , at the same time inquiring about the character and whereabouts of [the man who had been with [her]195-roberta]673-the man who had been with her , or should [he]192-heit proceed first to [[District Attorney Mason]205-district attorney mason 's office in [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]674-district attorney mason 's office in bridgeburg and having imparted to [him]192-heit all of the details of the case , allow [that gentleman]675-that gentleman to assume the painful responsibility of devastating [a probably utterly respectable home]676-a probably utterly respectable home ? For there was the political situation to be considered . And while [he]192-heit [himself]192-heit might act and so take personal credit , still there was this general party situation to be thought of . [A strong man]677-a strong man should undoubtedly head and so strengthen the party ticket this fall and here was the golden opportunity . The latter course seemed wiser . It would provide [[his]192-heit friend]678-his friend , [the district attorney]517-the district attorney , with [his]192-heit great chance . Arriving in [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg in this mood , [he]192-heit ponderously invaded [the office of [Orville W. Mason]185-mason]680-the office of orville w. mason , [the district attorney]517-the district attorney , who immediately sat up , all attention , sensing something of import in [the coroner]602-the coroner 's manner .

[Mason]185-mason was [a short , broad - chested , broad - backed and vigorous individual physically]683-a short , broad - chested , broad - backed and vigorous individual physically , but in [his]185-mason late youth had been so unfortunate as to have an otherwise pleasant and even arresting face marred by a broken nose , which gave to [him]185-mason a most unprepossessing , almost sinister , look . Yet [he]185-mason was far from sinister . Rather , romantic and emotional . [His]185-mason boyhood had been one of poverty and neglect , causing [him]185-mason in [his]185-mason later and somewhat more successful years to look on [those with whom life]684-those with whom life had dealt more kindly as too favorably treated . [The son of [[a poor farmer]686-a poor farmer 's widow]687-a poor farmer 's widow]685-the son of a poor farmer 's widow , [he]185-mason had seen [[his]185-mason mother]688-his mother put to such straits to make ends meet that by the time [he]185-mason reached the age of twelve [he]185-mason had surrendered nearly all of the pleasures of youth in order to assist [her]688-his mother . And then , at fourteen , while skating , [he]185-mason had fallen and broken [his]185-mason nose in such a way as to forever disfigure [his]185-mason face . Thereafter , feeling [himself]185-mason handicapped in the youthful sorting contests which gave to [other boys the female companions [he]185-mason most craved]689-other boys the female companions he most craved , [he]185-mason had grown exceedingly sensitive to the fact of [his]185-mason facial handicap . And this had eventually resulted in what [the Freudians]206-the freudians are accustomed to describe as a psychic sex scar .

At the age of seventeen , however , [he]185-mason had succeeded in interesting [the publisher and editor of the [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg Republican]690-the publisher and editor of the bridgeburg republican to the extent that [he]185-mason was eventually installed as [official local news - gatherer of [the town]483-the town]691-official local news - gatherer of the town . Later [he]185-mason came to be [the Cataraqui County correspondent of such papers as [the Albany Times - Union]29-the albany times - union]693-the cataraqui county correspondent of such papers as the albany times - union and the [Utica]30-utica Star , ending eventually at the age of nineteen with the privilege of studying law in the office of [one ex - Judge Davis Richofer , of [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]694-one ex - judge davis richofer , of bridgeburg . And a few years later , after having been admitted to the bar , [he]185-mason had been taken up by [several county politicians and [merchants]696-merchants who saw to it that [he]185-mason was sent to [the lower house of the state legislature]697-the lower house of the state legislature for some six consecutive years , where , by reason of a modest and at the same time shrewd and ambitious willingness to do as [he]185-mason was instructed , [he]185-mason attained favor with those at [the capital]698-the capital while at the same time retaining the good will of [[his]185-mason home - town sponsors]699-his home - town sponsors]695-several county politicians and merchants who saw to it that he was sent to the lower house of the state legislature for some six consecutive years , where , by reason of a modest and at the same time shrewd and ambitious willingness to do as he was instructed , he attained favor with those at the capital while at the same time retaining the good will of his home - town sponsors . Later , returning to [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg and possessing some gifts of oratory , [he]185-mason was given , first , the position of [assistant district attorney]700-assistant district attorney for four years , and following that elected auditor , and subsequently [district attorney]521-district attorney for two terms of four years each . Having acquired so high a position locally , [he]185-mason was able to marry [the daughter of [a local druggist of some means]703-a local druggist of some means]702-the daughter of a local druggist of some means , and [two children]704-two children had been born to [them]705-them .

In regard to this particular case [he]185-mason had already heard from [Miss Saunders]191-miss saunders all [she]191-miss saunders knew of the drowning , and , like [the coroner]602-the coroner , had been immediately impressed with the fact that the probable publicity attendant on such a case as this appeared to be might be just what [he]185-mason needed to revive a wavering political prestige and might perhaps solve the problem of [his]185-mason future . At any rate [he]185-mason was most intensely interested . So that now , upon sight of [Heit]192-heit , [he]185-mason showed plainly the keen interest [he]185-mason felt in the case .

" Well , [Colonel Heit]207-heit ? "[185-mason]

" Well , [Orville]185-mason , [I]207-heit 'm just back from [Big Bittern]13-big bittern . It looks to [me]207-heit as though [I]207-heit 've got a case for [you]185-mason now that 's going to take quite a little of [your]185-mason time . "[207-heit]

[Heit]207-heit 's large eyes bulged and conveyed hints of much more than was implied by [his]207-heit non - committal opening remark .

" [You]517-the district attorney mean that drowning up there ? "[517-the district attorney] returned [the district attorney]517-the district attorney .

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . Just that , "[602-the coroner] replied [the coroner]602-the coroner .

" [You]517-the district attorney 've some reason for thinking there 's something wrong up there ? "[185-mason]

" Well , the truth is , [Orville]185-mason , [I]207-heit think there 's hardly a doubt that this is a case of murder . "[207-heit] [Heit]207-heit 's heavy eyes glowed somberly . " Of course , it 's best to be on the safe side , and [I]207-heit 'm only telling [you]185-mason this in confidence , because even yet [I]207-heit 'm not absolutely positive that [that young man]4160-that young man 's body may not be in [the lake]571-the lake . But it looks mighty suspicious to [me]207-heit , [Orville]185-mason . There 's been at least [fifteen men up there]4162-fifteen men up there in [row - boats]4163-row - boats all day yesterday and to - day , dragging [the south part of [that lake]4165-that lake]4164-the south part of that lake . [I]207-heit had [a number of [the boys]4167-the boys]4166-a number of the boys take soundings here and there , and the water ai n't more than twenty - five feet deep at any point . But so far [they]4162-fifteen men up there have n't found any trace of [him]4160-that young man . [They]4162-fifteen men up there brought [her]4160-that young man up about one o'clock yesterday , after [they]4162-fifteen men up there 'd been only dragging a few hours , and [a mighty pretty girl]4168-a mighty pretty girl [she]4168-a mighty pretty girl is too , [Orville]185-mason — quite young — not more than eighteen or twenty , [I]207-heit should say . But there are some very suspicious circumstances about it all that make [me]207-heit think that [he]4160-that young man ai n't in there . In fact , [I]207-heit never saw a case that [I]207-heit thought looked more like a devilish crime than this . "[207-heit]

As [he]709-he said this , [he]709-he began to search in the right - hand pocket of [his]709-he well - worn and baggy linen suit and finally extracted [Roberta]195-roberta 's letter , which [he]709-he handed [[his]709-he friend]678-his friend , drawing up a chair and seating [himself]709-he while [the district attorney]517-the district attorney proceeded to read .

" Well , this does look rather suspicious , do n't it ? "[709-he] [he]709-he announced , as [he]709-he finished . " [You]207-heit say [they]4169-they have n't found [him]4160-that young man yet . Well , have [you]207-heit communicated with [this woman]4170-this woman to see what [she]4170-this woman knows about it ? "[709-he]

" No , [Orville]185-mason , [I]207-heit have n't , "[207-heit] replied [Heit]207-heit , slowly and meditatively . " And [I]207-heit 'll tell [you]185-mason why . The fact is , [I]207-heit decided up [there]650-there last night that this was something [I]207-heit had better talk over with [you]185-mason before [I]207-heit did anything at all . [You]185-mason know what the political situation here is just now . And how the proper handling of a case like this is likely to affect public opinion this fall . And while [I]207-heit certainly do n't think [we]4172-we ought to mix politics in with crime there certainly is no reason why [we]4172-we should n't handle this in such a way as to make it count in [our]4172-we favor . And so [I]207-heit thought [I]207-heit had better come and see [you]185-mason first . " [[My]759-my [Roberta]195-roberta]4264-my roberta dead ! [[My]759-my daughter]4265-my daughter ! Oh , no , no , [Roberta]195-roberta ! Oh , [[my]759-my God]4257-my god ! Not drowned ! " But , [Mr. Alden]182-titus , "[185-mason] consoled [Mason]185-mason , " for [your]182-titus own sake , for [[your]182-titus wife]4262-your wife 's sake , [I]185-mason must ask [you]182-titus now to calm [yourself]182-titus and help [me]185-mason consider this matter as seriously as [you]182-titus would if it were not [[your]182-titus daughter]4241-your daughter . And then , still holding [Titus]182-titus by the arm [he]182-titus proceeded to explain as swiftly and forcefully as possible , the various additional facts and suspicions in connection with the death of [Roberta]195-roberta , finally giving [him]182-titus [her]195-roberta letter to read , and winding up with : " A crime ! "[185-mason] And [he]762-his tapped the letter significantly and urgently .

The moment the suggested element of violence and wrong against [[his]762-his daughter]742-his daughter had been injected into this bitter loss , there was sufficient animal instinct , as well as curiosity , resentment and love of the chase inherent in [Titus]182-titus to cause [him]762-his to recover [his]762-his balance sufficiently to give silent and solemn ear to what [the district attorney]517-the district attorney was saying . [[His]762-his daughter]742-his daughter not only drowned , but murdered , and that by [some youth who according to this letter [she]742-his daughter was intending to marry]766-some youth who according to this letter she was intending to marry ! And [he]762-his , [[her]742-his daughter father]767-her father , not even aware of [his]762-his existence ! Strange that [[his]762-his wife]494-his wife should know and [he]762-his not . And that [Roberta]195-roberta should not want [him]762-his to know .

And at once , born for the most part of religion , convention and a general rural suspicion of all urban life and the mystery and involuteness of its ungodly ways , there sprang into [his]762-his mind the thought of [a city seducer]769-a city seducer and [betrayer]770-betrayer — [some youth of means , probably , whom [Roberta]195-roberta had met since going to [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus and who had been able to seduce [her]742-his daughter by a promise of marriage which [he]762-his was not willing to fulfil]771-some youth of means , probably , whom roberta had met since going to lycurgus and who had been able to seduce her by a promise of marriage which he was not willing to fulfil . [The scoundrel]667-the scoundrel ! [The raper]775-the raper ! [The murderer]668-the murderer !

Here [he]762-his and [[his]762-his wife]494-his wife had been thinking that [Roberta]195-roberta was quietly and earnestly and happily pursuing [her]195-roberta hard , honest way in [Lycurgus]212-lycurgus in order to help [them]778-them and [herself]195-roberta . But this in itself , as [Mason]209-mason and [the Aldens]217-the aldens [themselves]217-the aldens at once felt , was something which assuredly could not be taken to mean that [the nephew of so great a man]816-the nephew of so great a man could be accused of the murder of [Roberta]195-roberta . Wealth ! Position ! Indeed , in the face of such an accusation [Mason]209-mason was inclined to pause and consider . For the social difference between [this man]749-this man and [this girl]818-this girl from [his]749-this man point of view seemed great . At that , it might be so . Why not ? Was it not likely that [a youth of such a secure position]819-a youth of such a secure position would possibly more than another , since [she]818-this girl was so attractive as [Heit]177-fred had said , be the one to be paying casual and secret attention to [a girl like [Roberta]195-roberta]820-a girl like roberta ? Did [she]818-this girl not work in [[[his]749-this man uncle]821-his uncle 's factory]822-his uncle 's factory ? And was [she]818-this girl not poor ? And was that not part and parcel of [a rich and sophisticated youth]824-a rich and sophisticated youth 's attitude toward [a poor girl]825-a poor girl ? By reason of [his]749-this man own early buffetings at the mood of chance and established prosperity the idea appealed to [him]749-this man intensely . [The wretched rich]826-the wretched rich ! [The indifferent rich]827-the indifferent rich ! And here were [[her]818-this girl mother]752-her mother and [father]829-father obviously believing most firmly in [her]818-this girl innocence and virtue .

Further questioning of [Mrs. Alden]187-mrs. alden only brought out the fact that [she]187-mrs. alden had never seen [this particular youth]830-this particular youth , and had never even heard of any other . " [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden ! [Carl Graham]199-carl graham ! [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde ! "[840-the intitials] and at once the identity of [the intitials]840-the intitials as well as the related euphony of the names gave [him]182-titus pause . [He]182-titus decided [he]182-titus did not . This was a case of sly , evil seduction as well as murder . Oh , [the scoundrel]667-the scoundrel ! And still at large . But this particular contact with the dead , made at ten o'clock at night in [the receiving parlors of [the Lutz Brothers]220-the lutz brothers]862-the receiving parlors of the lutz brothers , [Undertakers]863-undertakers , and with [Titus Alden]182-titus falling on [his]182-titus knees by the side of [[his]182-titus daughter]742-his daughter and emotionally carrying [her]742-his daughter small , cold hands to [his]182-titus lips while [he]182-titus gazed feverishly and protestingly upon [her]742-his daughter waxy face , framed by [her]742-his daughter long brown hair , was scarcely such as to promise an unbiased or even legal opinion . And now [Titus Alden]182-titus injected a new and most dramatic note into the situation . "[182-titus] [He]182-titus gestured toward [[his]182-titus dead child]873-his dead child . " [I]182-titus have no money to help prosecute [a scoundrel like that]4303-a scoundrel like that . [His]182-titus voice broke and seemingly [he]182-titus was in danger of falling as [he]182-titus turned toward [Roberta]195-roberta again . [Mr. Mason]209-mason , because of [his]209-mason deep , if easily aroused , emotion , as well as the presence of [the thrilled audience]875-the thrilled audience , was in [his]209-mason most forceful as well as [his]209-mason very best oratorical mood .

" That 's the ticket , [Orville]185-mason . [You]182-titus 're the kind of [a district attorney [we]4320-we like]4319-a district attorney we like . "[224-eddie sells] And [Everett Beeker]221-everett beeker now called out : " Go to it , [Mr. Mason]209-mason . [We]4320-we 're with [you]209-mason to [a man]4220-a man when it comes to that . "[221-everett beeker] And [Fred Heit]177-fred , as well as [[his]177-fred assistant]534-his assistant , touched by [Mason]209-mason 's dramatic stand , [his]209-mason very picturesque and even heroic appearance at the moment , now crowded closer , [Heit]177-fred to take [[his]177-fred friend]678-his friend by the hand , [Earl]181-earl newcomb to exclaim : " More power to [you]209-mason , [Mr. Mason]209-mason . " That 's right , too . [I]209-mason was almost forgetting that , "[209-mason] exclaimed [Mason]209-mason , most calmly and practically at the moment , the previous burst of oratory and emotion having by now been somehow merged in [his]209-mason own mind with the exceptional burst of approval which up to this hour [he]209-mason had never experienced in any case with which previously [he]209-mason had been identified .

As [he]209-mason proceeded to [[his]209-mason office]530-his office , accompanied by [Alden]182-titus and [the officials in this case]880-the officials in this case , [his]209-mason thought was running on the motive of this heinous crime — the motive . And because of [his]209-mason youthful sexual deprivations , [his]209-mason mind now tended continually to dwell on that . And meditating on the beauty and charm of [Roberta]195-roberta , contrasted with [her]195-roberta poverty and [her]195-roberta strictly moral and religious upbringing , [he]209-mason was convinced that in all likelihood [this man]749-this man or [boy]882-boy , whoever [he]209-mason was , had seduced [her]195-roberta and then later , finding [himself]209-mason growing tired of [her]195-roberta , had finally chosen this way to get rid of [her]195-roberta — this deceitful , alleged marriage trip to [the lake]571-the lake . And at once [he]209-mason conceived an enormous personal hate for [the man]504-the man . [The wretched rich]826-the wretched rich ! [The idle rich]886-the idle rich ! [The wastrel and evil rich]887-the wastrel and evil rich — [a scion or representative of whom [this young Clyde Griffiths]889-this young clyde griffiths was]888-a scion or representative of whom this young clyde griffiths was . If [he]209-mason could but catch [him]504-the man .

At the same time it now suddenly occurred to [him]209-mason that because of the peculiar circumstances attending this case — [this girl]818-this girl cohabiting with [this man]749-this man in this way — [she]818-this girl might be pregnant . And at once this suspicion was sufficient , not only to make [him]209-mason sexually curious in regard to all the details of the life and courtship that had led to this — but also very anxious to substantiate for [himself]209-mason whether [his]209-mason suspicions were true . Immediately [he]209-mason began to think of [a suitable doctor to perform an autopsy]892-a suitable doctor to perform an autopsy — if not here , then in [Utica]30-utica or [Albany]28-albany — also of communicating to [Heit]209-mason [his]209-mason suspicions in the connection , and of having this , as well as the import of the blows upon [her]818-this girl face , determined .

But in regard to the bag and its contents , which was the immediate matter before [him]209-mason , [he]209-mason was fortunate in finding one additional bit of evidence of the greatest importance . For , apart from the dresses and hats made by [Roberta]195-roberta , [her]195-roberta lingerie , a pair of red silk garters purchased at [[Braunstein]225-braunstein 's in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus]893-braunstein 's in lycurgus and still in [their]894-their original box , there was the toilet set presented by [Clyde]197-clyde to [her]818-this girl the Christmas before . And the writing a hurried scrawl , since it had been written at a time when [Clyde]197-clyde was most anxious to be elsewhere than with [her]818-this girl .

At once it occurred to [Mason]209-mason — how odd that the presence of this toilet set in this bag , together with the card , should not have been known to [the slayer]895-the slayer . But if it were , and [he]209-mason had not removed the card , could it be possible that [this same Clyde]197-clyde was [the slayer]895-the slayer ? Would [a man contemplating murder]897-a man contemplating murder fail to see a card such as this , with [his]897-a man contemplating murder own handwriting on it ? " [I]233-mrs. peyton am sorry , [Madam]4361-madam , but [I]233-mrs. peyton am compelled to ask [you]4361-madam to show [us]933-the two [[his]197-clyde room]928-his room . "[233-mrs. peyton] And at once struck by the futility of contending with the law , [she]233-mrs. peyton now nervously indicated [[Clyde]197-clyde 's room]932-clyde 's room , feeling still that some insane and most unfair and insulting mistake was being made .

But [the two]933-the two having proceeded to [[Clyde]197-clyde 's room]932-clyde 's room , [they]933-the two began to look here and there . " What about this , [chief]4364-chief ? Will [you]4364-chief take it away or open it here ? "[185-mason]

" [I]185-mason think , "[185-mason] said [Mason]185-mason solemnly , " [we]4365-we 'd better open that right here , [Faunce]234-mr. faunce . At this point , [Mrs. Peyton]233-mrs. peyton , most astounded by these developments , and anxious to avoid any such rough procedure , exclaimed : " [You]4364-chief can have a hammer if [you]4364-chief wish , but why not wait and send for [a key man]4366-a key man ?
