However , [the detective]931-the detective having secured the hammer and jarred the lock loose , there lay revealed in a small top crate various unimportant odds and ends of [Clyde]197-clyde 's wardrobe — socks , collars , ties , a muffler , suspenders , a discarded sweater , a pair of not too good high - top winter shoes , a cigarette holder , a red lacquer ash tray , and a pair of skates . But in addition among these , in the corner in one compact bundle , the final fifteen letters of [Roberta]195-roberta , written [him]197-clyde from [Biltz]14-biltz , together with a small picture of [herself]195-roberta given [him]197-clyde the year before , as well as another small bundle consisting of all the notes and invitations written [him]197-clyde by [Sondra]238-sondra up to the time [she]238-sondra had departed for [Pine Point]42-pine point , The letters written from there [Clyde]197-clyde had taken with [him]197-clyde — laid next [his]197-clyde heart . And , even more incriminating , a third bundle , consisting of eleven letters from [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , the first two addressed to [Harry Tenet]239-harry tenet , care of general delivery , [Chicago]43-chicago — a most suspicious circumstance on the surface — whereas the others of the bundle were addressed to [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , not only care of [the Union League , [Chicago]43-chicago]44-the union league , chicago , but to [Lycurgus]212-lycurgus .

Without waiting further to see what else the trunk might contain , [the district attorney]517-the district attorney began opening these and reading — first three from [Roberta]195-roberta , after which the reason [she]195-roberta had gone to [Biltz]14-biltz was made perfectly plain — then the three first letters from [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , on most pathetically commonplace stationery , as [he]197-clyde could see , hinting at the folly of the life as well as the nature of the accident that had driven [him]197-clyde from [Kansas City]45-kansas city , and at the same time advising [him]197-clyde most solicitously and tenderly as to the proper path for [his]197-clyde feet in the future , the general effect of which was to convey to [a man of [Mason]185-mason 's repressed temperament and limited social experience the impression that from the very beginning [this individual]664-this individual had been of a loose , wayward and errant character]946-a man of mason 's repressed temperament and limited social experience the impression that from the very beginning this individual had been of a loose , wayward and errant character .

At the same time , and to [his]197-clyde surprise , [he]197-clyde now learned that except for what [[his]197-clyde rich uncle]948-his rich uncle might have done for [him]197-clyde here , [Clyde]197-clyde was obviously of [a poor , as well as highly religious , branch of the Griffiths family]949-a poor , as well as highly religious , branch of the griffiths family , and while ordinarily this might have influenced [him]197-clyde in [Clyde]197-clyde 's favor a little , still now , in view of the notes of [Sondra]238-sondra , as well as the pathetic letters of [Roberta]195-roberta and [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother 's reference to some earlier crime in [Kansas City]45-kansas city , [he]197-clyde was convinced that not only was [Clyde]197-clyde of such a disposition as could plot such a crime but also [one who could execute it in cold blood]951-one who could execute it in cold blood . That crime in [Kansas City]45-kansas city . [He]197-clyde must wire [the district attorney]517-the district attorney [there]650-there for particulars .

And with this thought in mind , [he]197-clyde now scanned more briefly but none the less sharply and critically the various notes or invitations or love messages from [Sondra]238-sondra , all on heavily perfumed and monogrammed stationery , which grew more and more friendly and intimate as the correspondence progressed , until toward the last [they]954-they invariably began :

" [Clydie - Mydie]240-clydie - mydie , "[954-they] or " [Sweetest Black Eyes]241-sweetest black eyes , "[954-they] or " [[My]954-they sweetest boy]4367-my sweetest boy , "[954-they] and were signed " [Sonda]242-sonda , "[954-they] or " [Your]4368-your own [Sondra]238-sondra . "[954-they] And some of [them]954-they dated so recently as May 10th , May 15th , May 26th , or up to the very time at which , as [he]197-clyde instantly noted , [Roberta]195-roberta 's most doleful letters began to arrive .

It was all so plain , now . [One]955-one secretly betrayed girl in the background while [he]197-clyde had the effrontery to ingratiate [himself]197-clyde into the affections of another , this time obviously one of much higher social position here .

Although fascinated and staggered by this interesting development , [he]197-clyde at the same time realized that this was no hour in which to sit meditating . Far from it . This trunk must be transferred at once to [[his]197-clyde hotel]956-his hotel . Later [he]197-clyde must go forth to find out , if [he]197-clyde could , exactly where [this individual]664-this individual was , and arrange for [his]197-clyde capture . And while [he]197-clyde ordered [the detective]931-the detective to call up [the police department]959-the police department and arrange for the transfer of the trunk to [[his]197-clyde room]928-his room at [the Lycurgus House]961-the lycurgus house , [he]197-clyde hurried next to [the residence of [Samuel Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths]962-the residence of samuel griffiths , only to learn that [no member of [the family]964-the family]963-no member of the family was then in [the city]965-the city . [They]966-they were all at [Greenwood Lake]46-greenwood lake . But a telephone message to [that place]655-that place brought the information that in so far as [they]966-they knew , this same [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , [[their]966-they nephew]968-their nephew , was at [the Cranston lodge on [Twelfth Lake]40-twelfth lake]969-the cranston lodge on twelfth lake , near [Sharon]25-sharon , adjoining [the Finchley lodge]970-the finchley lodge . The name [Finchley]238-sondra , together with [the town of Sharon]971-the town of sharon , being already identified in [Mason]185-mason 's mind with [Clyde]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde at once decided that if [he]197-clyde were still anywhere in [this region]538-this region , [he]197-clyde would be [there]650-there — at [the summer home perhaps of [this girl who had written [him]197-clyde the various notes and invitations [he]197-clyde had seen]975-this girl who had written him the various notes and invitations he had seen — [this Sondra Finchley]238-sondra]974-the summer home perhaps of this girl who had written him the various notes and invitations he had seen — this sondra finchley . Also had not [the captain of the " Cygnus "]4369-the captain of the " cygnus "[197-clyde] declared that [he]197-clyde had seen [the youth who had come down from [Three Mile Bay debark]2-three mile bay there]976-the youth who had come down from three mile bay debark there ? [Eureka]243-eureka ! [He]197-clyde had [him]976-the youth who had come down from three mile bay debark there !

And at once , after meditating sharply on the wisdom of [his]197-clyde course , [he]197-clyde decided to proceed to [Sharon]25-sharon and [Pine Point]42-pine point [himself]197-clyde . But in the meantime being furnished with an accurate description of [Clyde]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde now furnished this as well as the fact that [he]197-clyde was wanted for murder , not only to [the district attorney]517-the district attorney and [the chief of police of [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus]978-the chief of police of lycurgus , but to [Newton Slack]244-slack , [the sheriff at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]979-the sheriff at bridgeburg , as well as to [Heit]177-fred and [[his]177-fred own assistant]980-his own assistant , urging [all three]981-all three to proceed at once to [Sharon]25-sharon , where [he]197-clyde would meet [them]981-all three .

At the same time , speaking as though for [Mrs. Peyton]233-mrs. peyton , [he]197-clyde now called upon [the long distance telephone [the Cranston lodge]983-the cranston lodge at [Pine Point]42-pine point]982-the long distance telephone the cranston lodge at pine point , and getting [the butler on the wire]984-the butler on the wire , inquired whether [Mr. Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde chanced to be [there]650-there . " Yes [sir]4137-sir , [he]197-clyde is , [sir]4137-sir , but [he]197-clyde 's not here now , [sir]4137-sir . [I]197-clyde think [he]197-clyde 's on a camping party farther up [the lake]571-the lake , [sir]4137-sir . Any message , [sir]4137-sir ? "[197-clyde] And in response to further inquiries , [he]197-clyde replied that [he]197-clyde could not say exactly — [a party]986-a party had gone , presumably , to [Bear Lake]50-bear lake some thirty miles farther up , but when it would return [he]197-clyde could not say — not likely before a day or two . But distinctly this same [Clyde]197-clyde was with [that party]987-that party .

And at once [Mason]185-mason recalled [the sheriff at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]979-the sheriff at bridgeburg , instructing [him]979-the sheriff at bridgeburg to take four or five deputies with [him]979-the sheriff at bridgeburg so that [the searching party]989-the searching party might divide at [Sharon]25-sharon and seize this same [Clyde]197-clyde wherever [he]197-clyde chanced to be . And throw [him]197-clyde in [jail]990-jail at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , where [he]197-clyde could explain , with all due process of law , the startling circumstances that thus far seemed to unescapably point to [him]197-clyde as [the murderer of [Roberta Alden]195-roberta]991-the murderer of roberta alden .

In the interim the mental state of [Clyde]197-clyde since that hour when , the water closing over [Roberta]195-roberta , [he]197-clyde had made [his]197-clyde way to [the shore]992-the shore , and then , after changing [his]197-clyde clothes , had subsequently arrived at [Sharon]25-sharon and [the lakeside lodge of [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons]993-the lakeside lodge of the cranstons , was almost one of complete mental derangement , mainly caused by fear and confusion in [his]197-clyde own mind as to whether [he]197-clyde did or did not bring about [her]195-roberta untimely end . At the same time at [the lakeside]994-the lakeside the realization that if by any chance [he]197-clyde were then and there found , skulking south rather than returning north to [the inn at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]627-the inn at big bittern to report this seeming accident , there would be sufficient hardness and cruelty to the look of it all to convince [any one]4181-any one that a charge of murder should be made against [him]197-clyde , had fiercely tortured [him]197-clyde . For , as [he]197-clyde now saw it , [he]197-clyde really was not guilty — was [he]197-clyde , since at the last moment [he]197-clyde had experienced that change of heart ?

But who was going to believe that now , since [he]197-clyde did not go back to explain ? And it would never do to go back now ! For if [Sondra]238-sondra should hear that [he]197-clyde had been on [this lake]622-this lake with [this factory girl]998-this factory girl — that [he]197-clyde had registered with [her]998-this factory girl as [husband]999-husband and [wife]586-wife ... [God]246-god !

And then trying to explain to [[his]197-clyde uncle]821-his uncle afterwards , or [[his]197-clyde cold , hard cousin]1002-his cold , hard cousin — or [all those smart , cynical Lycurgus people]1003-all those smart , cynical lycurgus people ! No ! No ! Having gone so far [he]197-clyde must go on . Disaster — if not death — lay in the opposite direction . [He]197-clyde would have to make the best of this terrible situation — make the best of this plan that had ended so strangely and somewhat exculpatorily for [him]197-clyde .

And yet [these woods]1004-these woods ! This approaching night . The eerie loneliness and danger of it all now . How now to do , what to say , if met by [any one]4181-any one . [He]197-clyde was so confused — mentally and nervously sick . The crackle of a twig and [he]197-clyde leaped forward as a hare .

And in this state it was that , after having recovered [his]197-clyde bag and changed [his]197-clyde clothes , wringing out [his]197-clyde wet suit and attempting to dry it , then packing it in [his]197-clyde bag under some dry twigs and pine - needles and burying the tripod beneath a rotting log , that [he]197-clyde plunged into [the woods]632-the woods after night had fallen . Yet meditating more and more on [his]197-clyde very strange and perilous position . For supposing , just as [he]197-clyde had unintentionally struck at [her]1007-her , and [they]1008-they had fallen into [the water]1009-the water and [she]1007-her uttered those piercing and appealing cries , there had been [some one on]1010-some one on [the shore]992-the shore — [some one watching]1012-some one watching — [one of [those strong , hardy men whom [he]197-clyde [had seen loitering about during the day and who might even at this moment be sounding a local alarm that would bring a score of such men]1015-had seen loitering about during the day and who might even at this moment be sounding a local alarm that would bring a score of such men to the work of hunting for [him]197-clyde this very night]1014-those strong , hardy men whom he had seen loitering about during the day and who might even at this moment be sounding a local alarm that would bring a score of such men to the work of hunting for him this very night]1013-one of those strong , hardy men whom he had seen loitering about during the day and who might even at this moment be sounding a local alarm that would bring a score of such men to the work of hunting for him this very night ! [A man]4220-a man hunt ! And [they]1017-they would take [him]197-clyde back and [no one]4176-no one would ever believe that [he]197-clyde had not intentionally struck [her]1007-her ! [They]1017-they might even lynch [him]197-clyde before [he]197-clyde could so much as secure a fair trial . It was possible . It had been done . A rope around [his]197-clyde neck . Or shot down in [these woods]1004-these woods , maybe . And without an opportunity to explain how it had all come about — how harried and tortured [he]197-clyde had been by [her]1007-her for so long . [They]1017-they would never understand that .

And so thinking [he]197-clyde hurried faster and faster — as fast as strong and serried and brambly young firs and dead branches that cracked most ominously at times would permit , thinking always as [he]197-clyde went that [the road to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay]1020-the road to three mile bay must be to [his]197-clyde right hand , the moon to [his]197-clyde left when it should rise .

But , [God]246-god , what was that ?

Oh , that terrible sound !

Like a whimpering , screeching spirit in this dark !

There !

What was it ?

[He]197-clyde dropped [his]197-clyde bag and in a cold sweat sunk down , crouching behind a tall , thick tree , rigid and motionless with fear .

That sound !

But only a screech - owl ! [He]197-clyde had heard it several weeks before at [the Cranston lodge]983-the cranston lodge . But [here]4244-here ! In [this wood]1023-this wood ! This dark ! [He]197-clyde must be getting on and out of here . There was no doubt of that . [He]197-clyde must not be thinking such horrible , fearful thoughts , or [he]197-clyde would not be able to keep up [his]197-clyde strength or courage at all .

But that look in the eyes of [Roberta]195-roberta ! That last appealing look ! [God]246-god ! [He]197-clyde could not keep from seeing it ! [Her]195-roberta mournful , terrible screams ! Could [he]197-clyde not cease from hearing [them]1024-them — until [he]197-clyde got out of [here]4244-here anyhow ?

Had [she]195-roberta understood , when [he]197-clyde struck [her]195-roberta , that it was not intentional — a mere gesture of anger and protest ? Did [she]195-roberta know that now , wherever [she]195-roberta was — in [the bottom of [the lake]571-the lake]574-the bottom of the lake — or here in [the dark of [these woods]1004-these woods beside [him]197-clyde]1028-the dark of these woods beside him , mayhap ? [Ghosts]247-ghosts ! [Hers]1030-hers . But [he]197-clyde must get out of this — out of this ! [He]197-clyde must — and yet the safety of [these woods]1004-these woods , too . [He]197-clyde must not be too brash in stepping out into [any road]1032-any road , either . [Pedestrians]248-pedestrians ! [People]1033-people in search of [him]197-clyde , maybe ! But did [people]1033-people really live after death ? Were there ghosts ? And did [they]1033-people know the truth ? Then [she]195-roberta must know — but how [he]197-clyde plotted before that , too . And what would [she]195-roberta think of that ! And was [she]195-roberta here now reproachfully and gloomily pursuing [him]197-clyde with mistaken accusations , as true as it might be that [he]197-clyde had intended to kill [her]195-roberta at first ? [He]197-clyde had ! [He]197-clyde had ! And that was the great sin , of course . Even though [he]197-clyde had not killed [her]195-roberta , yet something had done it for [him]197-clyde ! That was true .

But ghosts — [God]246-god — spirits that might pursue [you]1035-you after [they]1033-people were dead , seeking to expose and punish [you]1035-you — seeking to set [people]1033-people on [your]1035-you track , maybe ! Who could tell ? [[His]197-clyde mother]688-his mother had confessed to [him]197-clyde and [Frank]249-frank and [Esta]250-esta and [Julia]251-julia that [she]688-his mother believed in ghosts .

And then at last the moon , after three such hours of stumbling , listening , waiting , perspiring , trembling . [No one]4176-no one in sight now , thank [God]246-god ! And the stars overhead — bright and yet soft , as at [Pine Point]42-pine point where [Sondra]238-sondra was . If [she]195-roberta could see [him]197-clyde now , slipping away from [Roberta]195-roberta dead in [that lake]4165-that lake , [his]197-clyde own hat upon the waters there ! If [she]195-roberta could have heard [Roberta]195-roberta 's cries ! How strange , that never , never , never would [he]197-clyde be able to tell [her]195-roberta that because of [her]195-roberta , [her]195-roberta beauty , [his]197-clyde passion for [her]195-roberta and all that [she]195-roberta had come to mean to [him]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde had been able to ... to ... to ... well , attempt this terrible thing — kill [a girl whom once [he]197-clyde had loved]1040-a girl whom once he had loved . And all [his]197-clyde life [he]197-clyde would have this with [him]197-clyde , now,—this thought ! [He]197-clyde would never be able to shake it off — never , never , never . And [he]197-clyde had not thought of that , before . It was a terrible thing in its way , just that , was n't it ?

But then suddenly there in the dark , at about eleven o'clock , as [he]197-clyde afterwards guessed , the water having stopped [his]197-clyde watch , and after [he]197-clyde had reached [the highroad to the west]1041-the highroad to the west — and walked a mile or two , — [those three men]4204-those three men , quick , like ghosts coming out of the shadow of [the woods]632-the woods . [He]197-clyde thought at first that having seen [him]197-clyde at the moment [he]197-clyde had struck [Roberta]195-roberta or the moment afterward , [they]4204-those three men had now come to take [him]197-clyde . The sweating horror of that moment ! And [that boy who had held up the light]1044-that boy who had held up the light the better to see [his]197-clyde face . And no doubt [he]197-clyde had evinced most suspicious fear and perturbation , since at the moment [he]197-clyde was most deeply brooding on all that had happened , terrorized really by the thought that somehow , in some way , [he]197-clyde had left some clue that might lead directly to [him]197-clyde . And [he]197-clyde did jump back , feeling that these were men sent to seize [him]197-clyde . But at that moment , [the foremost]1045-the foremost , [a tall , bony man , without appearing to be more than amused at [his]1045-the foremost obvious cowardice]1046-a tall , bony man , without appearing to be more than amused at his obvious cowardice , had called , " Howdy , [stranger]4376-stranger ! "[1045-the foremost] while [the youngest , without appearing to be suspicious at all]1047-the youngest , without appearing to be suspicious at all , had stepped forward and then turned up the light . And it was then that [he]197-clyde had begun to understand that [they]4204-those three men were just [countrymen]1048-countrymen or [guides]541-guides — not [a posse in pursuit of [him]197-clyde]1050-a posse in pursuit of him — and that if [he]197-clyde were calm and civil [they]4204-those three men would have no least suspicion that [he]197-clyde was the murderer that [he]197-clyde was .

But afterward [he]197-clyde had said to himself—"But [they]4204-those three men will remember [me]197-clyde , walking along [this lonely road]4377-this lonely road at this hour with this bag , wo n't [they]4204-those three men ? "[197-clyde] And so at once [he]197-clyde had decided that [he]197-clyde must hurry — hurry — and not be seen by [any others]1051-any others anywhere there .

Then , hours later and just as the moon was lowering toward the west , a sickly yellow pallor overspreading [the woods]632-the woods and making the night even more wretched and wearisome , [he]197-clyde had come to [Three Mile Bay]1053-three mile bay [itself]1053-three mile bay — [a small collection of native and summer cottages nestling at the northernmost end of what was known as [the Indian Chain]1055-the indian chain]1054-a small collection of native and summer cottages nestling at the northernmost end of what was known as the indian chain . And in [it]1053-three mile bay , as [he]197-clyde could see from a bend in [the road]1056-the road , a few pale lights still twinkling . [Stores]1057-stores . [Houses]1058-houses . Street lamps . But all dim in the pale light — so dim and eerie to [him]197-clyde . One thing was plain — at this hour and dressed as [he]197-clyde was and with [his]197-clyde bag in hand , [he]197-clyde could not enter [there]650-there . That would be to fix curiosity as well as suspicion on [him]197-clyde , assuredly , if [any one]4181-any one was still about . And as [the launch that ran between [this place]1062-this place and [Sharon]25-sharon]1061-the launch that ran between this place and sharon , from whence [he]197-clyde would proceed to [Pine Point]42-pine point , did not leave until eight - thirty , [he]197-clyde must hide away in the meantime and make [himself]197-clyde as presentable as possible .

And accordingly re - entering a thicket of pines that descended to [the very borders of [the town]483-the town]1063-the very borders of the town , there to wait until morning , being able to tell by a small clock - face which showed upon the sides of [a small church tower]1065-a small church tower , when the hour for emerging had arrived . But , in the interim debating,—"Was it wise so to do ? "[4204-those three men] For who might not be here to wait for [him]197-clyde ? [Those three men]4204-those three men — or [some one else who might have seen?—Or [an officer]1068-an officer , notified from somewhere else]1067-some one else who might have seen?—or an officer , notified from somewhere else . Yet deciding after a time that it was best to go just the same . For to stalk along in [the woods west of [this lake]622-this lake]1069-the woods west of this lake — and by night rather than day — seeing that by day [he]197-clyde might be seen , and when by taking [this boat]1071-this boat [he]197-clyde could reach in an hour and a half — or two hours at the most — [the Cranston lodge at [Sharon]25-sharon]1072-the cranston lodge at sharon , whereas by walking [he]197-clyde would not arrive until to - morrow,—was not that unwise , more dangerous ? Besides , [he]197-clyde had promised [Sondra]238-sondra and [Bertine]252-bertine that [he]197-clyde would be there Tuesday . And here it was Friday ! Again , by tomorrow , might not a hue and cry be on — [his]197-clyde description sent here and there — whereas this morning — well , how could [Roberta]195-roberta have been found as yet ? No , no . Better this way . For who knew [him]197-clyde here — or could identify [him]197-clyde as yet with either [Carl Graham]199-carl graham or [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden . Best go this way,—speedily , before anything else in connection with [her]195-roberta developed . Yes , yes . And finally , the clock - hands pointing to eight - ten , making [his]197-clyde way out , [his]197-clyde heart beating heavily as [he]197-clyde did so .

At the foot of [this street]1073-this street was the launch which steamed from here to [Sharon]25-sharon . And as [he]197-clyde loitered [he]197-clyde observed [the bus]506-the bus from [Raquette Lake]52-raquette lake approaching . It now occurred to [him]197-clyde , if [he]197-clyde encountered [any one [he]197-clyde knew on [the steamer dock]1076-the steamer dock or [boat]1077-boat]1075-any one he knew on the steamer dock or boat , could [he]197-clyde not say that [he]197-clyde was fresh from [Raquette Lake]52-raquette lake , where [Sondra]238-sondra , as well as [Bertine]252-bertine , had [many friends]1078-many friends , or in case [they]1078-many friends [themselves]1078-many friends came down on [the boat]4231-the boat , that [he]197-clyde had been [there]650-there the day before . What matter whose name or lodge [he]197-clyde mentioned — an invented one , if need be .

And so , at last , making [his]197-clyde way to [the boat]4231-the boat and boarding [it]4231-the boat . And later at [Sharon]25-sharon , leaving [it]4231-the boat again and without , as [he]197-clyde thought , appearing to attract any particular attention at either end . For , although there were [some eleven passengers]1082-some eleven passengers , [all strangers to [him]197-clyde]1083-all strangers to him , still [no one other than [a young country girl in a blue dress and a white straw hat , whom [he]197-clyde guessed to be from this vicinity]1085-a young country girl in a blue dress and a white straw hat , whom he guessed to be from this vicinity , appeared to pay any particular attention to [him]197-clyde]1084-no one other than a young country girl in a blue dress and a white straw hat , whom he guessed to be from this vicinity , appeared to pay any particular attention to him . And [her]1085-a young country girl in a blue dress and a white straw hat , whom he guessed to be from this vicinity glances were admiring rather than otherwise , although sufficient , because of [his]197-clyde keen desire for secrecy , to cause [him]197-clyde to retire to the rear of [the boat]4231-the boat , whereas [the others]903-the others appeared to prefer the forward deck . And once in [Sharon]25-sharon , knowing that [the majority]1088-the majority were making for [the railway station]1089-the railway station to catch [the first morning train]1090-the first morning train down , [he]197-clyde followed briskly in [their]1088-the majority wake , only to turn into [the nearest lunch - room]1091-the nearest lunch - room in order to break the trail , as [he]197-clyde hoped . For although [he]197-clyde had walked the long distance from [Big Bittern]13-big bittern to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay , and previously had rowed all afternoon , and merely made a pretense of eating the lunch which [Roberta]195-roberta had prepared at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake , still even now [he]197-clyde was not hungry . Then seeing [a few passengers]1092-a few passengers approaching from [the station]4149-the station , yet [none whom [he]197-clyde knew]1094-none whom he knew , [he]197-clyde joined [these]1092-a few passengers again as though just coming to [the inn]503-the inn and launch from [the train]4140-the train .

For at this time there had come to [him]197-clyde the thought that [this south train from [Albany]28-albany]1097-this south train from albany , as well as [Utica]30-utica being due [here]4244-here at this hour , it was only natural that [he]197-clyde should seem to come on that . Pretending first , therefore , to be going to [the station]4149-the station , yet stopping en route to telephone [Bertine]252-bertine and [Sondra]238-sondra that [he]197-clyde was [here]4244-here , and being assured that [a car rather than a launch]1101-a car rather than a launch would be sent for [him]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde explained that [he]197-clyde would be waiting on [the west veranda of [the inn]503-the inn]1102-the west veranda of the inn . En route also [he]197-clyde stopped at [a news stand]1104-a news stand for a morning paper , although [he]197-clyde knew there could be nothing in it as yet . And [he]197-clyde had barely crossed to [the veranda of [the inn]503-the inn]1105-the veranda of the inn and seated [himself]197-clyde before [the Cranston car]1107-the cranston car approached .

And in response to the greeting of [[the Cranston]253-grant family chauffeur , whom [he]197-clyde knew well]1108-the cranston family chauffeur , whom he knew well , and who smiled most welcomingly , [he]197-clyde was now able to achieve a seemingly easy and genial smile , though still inwardly troubled by [his]197-clyde great dread . For no doubt by now , as [he]197-clyde persistently argued with [himself]197-clyde , [the three men whom [he]197-clyde had met]1109-the three men whom he had met had reached [Big Bittern]13-big bittern . And by now both [Roberta]195-roberta and [he]197-clyde must assuredly have been missed , and maybe , who knows , the upturned boat with [his]197-clyde hat and [her]195-roberta veil discovered ! If so , might [they]1109-the three men whom he had met not have already reported that [they]1109-the three men whom he had met had seen [such a man as [himself]197-clyde]1110-such a man as himself , carrying a bag , and making [his]197-clyde way to [the south]725-the south in the night ? And , if so , would not that , regardless of whether the body was found or not , cause [them]1109-the three men whom he had met to become dubious as to whether a double drowning had occurred ? And supposing by some strange chance [her]195-roberta body should come to the surface ? Then what ? And might there not be a mark left by that hard blow [he]197-clyde had given [her]195-roberta ? If so , would [they]1109-the three men whom he had met not suspect murder , and [his]197-clyde body not coming up and [those men describing [the man [they]1109-the three men whom he had met had seen]1113-the man they had seen]1112-those men describing the man they had seen , would not [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden or [Carl Graham]199-carl graham be suspected of murder ?

But neither [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden nor [Carl Graham]199-carl graham were [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde by any means . And [they]1109-the three men whom he had met could not possibly identify [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde — with either [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden or [Carl Graham]199-carl graham . For had [he]197-clyde not taken every precaution , even searching through [Roberta]195-roberta 's bag and purse there at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake while at [his]197-clyde request after breakfast [she]195-roberta had gone back to see about the lunch ? Had [he]197-clyde not ? True , [he]197-clyde had found those two letters from [that girl]4343-that girl , [Theresa Bouser]255-theresa bouser , addressed to [Roberta]195-roberta at [Biltz]14-biltz , and [he]197-clyde had destroyed them before ever leaving for [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge . And as for that toilet set in its original case , with the label " Whitely - Lycurgus "[255-theresa bouser] on it , while it was true that [he]197-clyde had been compelled to leave that , still might not [any one]4181-any one — [Mrs. Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden , or [Mrs. Carl Graham]199-carl graham — have bought that in Whitely 's , and so without the possibility of its being traced to [him]197-clyde ? Assuredly . And as for [her]195-roberta clothes , even assuming that [they]1116-they did go to prove [her]195-roberta identity , would it not be assumed , by [[her]195-roberta parents]4219-her parents as well as [others]1118-others , that [she]195-roberta had gone on this trip with [a strange man by the name of [Golden]198-clifford golden or [Graham]199-carl graham]1119-a strange man by the name of golden or graham , and would [they]1116-they not want that hushed up without further ado ? At any rate , [he]197-clyde would hope for the best — keep up [his]197-clyde nerve , put on a strong , pleasant , cheerful front here , so that [no one]4176-no one would think of [him]197-clyde as [the one]1121-the one , since [he]197-clyde had not actually killed [her]195-roberta , anyhow .

Here [he]197-clyde was in [this fine car]1122-this fine car . And [Sondra]238-sondra , as well as [Bertine]252-bertine , waiting for [him]197-clyde . [He]197-clyde would have to say that [he]197-clyde was just up from [Albany]28-albany — had been on some errand over there for [[his]197-clyde uncle]821-his uncle which had taken all of this time since Tuesday . And while [he]197-clyde should be blissfully happy with [Sondra]238-sondra , still here were all of those dreadful things of which now all of the time [he]197-clyde would be compelled to think . The danger that in some inadvertent way [he]197-clyde had not quite covered all the tracks that might lead to [him]197-clyde . And if [he]197-clyde had not ! Exposure ! Arrest ! Perhaps a hasty and unjust conviction — punishment , even ! Unless [he]197-clyde was able to explain about that accidental blow . The end of all [his]197-clyde dreams in connection with [Sondra]238-sondra — [Lycurgus]212-lycurgus — the great life that [he]197-clyde had hoped for [himself]197-clyde . But could [he]197-clyde explain as to that ? Could [he]197-clyde ? [God]246-god !

From Friday morning until the following Tuesday noon , moving amid such scenes as previously had so exhilarated and enthralled [him]197-clyde , [Clyde]197-clyde was now compelled to suffer the most frightful fears and dreads . For , although met by [Sondra]238-sondra , as well as [Bertine]252-bertine , at the door of [the Cranston lodge]983-the cranston lodge , and shown by [them]1125-them to [the room [he]197-clyde was to occupy]1126-the room he was to occupy , [he]197-clyde could not help but contrast every present delight here with the danger of [his]197-clyde immediate and complete destruction .

As [he]197-clyde had entered , [Sondra]238-sondra had poutingly whispered , so that [Bertine]252-bertine might not hear : " [Baddie]4378-baddie ! Staying down [there]650-there a whole week when [you]4378-baddie might have been up [here]4244-here . And [Sondra]238-sondra planning everything for [you]4378-baddie ! [You]4378-baddie ought to have a good spanking . [I]238-sondra was going to call up to - day to see where [you]4378-baddie were . "[238-sondra] Yet at the same time [her]238-sondra eyes conveying the infatuation that now dominated [her]238-sondra .

And [he]197-clyde , in spite of [his]197-clyde troubled thoughts achieving a gay smile , — for once in [her]238-sondra presence even the terror of [Roberta]195-roberta 's death , [his]197-clyde own present danger appeared to dwindle . If only all went well , now,—nothing were traced to [him]197-clyde ! A clear path ! A marvelous future ! [Her]238-sondra beauty ! [Her]238-sondra love ! [Her]238-sondra wealth . And yet , after being ushered to [[his]197-clyde room]928-his room , [his]197-clyde bag having been carried in before [him]197-clyde , at once becoming nervous as to the suit . It was damp and wrinkled . [He]197-clyde must hide it on one of the upper shelves of [a closet]1128-a closet , maybe . And the moment [he]197-clyde was alone and the door locked , taking it out , wet and wrinkled , the mud of [the shores of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]1129-the shores of big bittern still about the legs — yet deciding perhaps not — perhaps [he]197-clyde had better keep it locked in [his]197-clyde bag until night when [he]197-clyde could better decide what to do . Yet tying up in a single bundle , in order to have them laundered , other odds and ends [he]197-clyde had worn that day . And , as [he]197-clyde did so , terribly , sickeningly conscious of the mystery and drama as well as the pathos of [his]197-clyde life — all [he]197-clyde had contacted since [his]197-clyde arrival in [the east]1130-the east , how little [he]197-clyde had in [his]197-clyde youth . How little [he]197-clyde had now , really . The spaciousness and grandeur of [this room]1131-this room as contrasted with [the one [he]197-clyde occupied in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus]1132-the one he occupied in lycurgus . The strangeness of [his]197-clyde being [here]4244-here at all after yesterday . [The blue waters of [this bright lake]1135-this bright lake]1134-the blue waters of this bright lake without as contrasted with the darker ones of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern . And on the green - sward that reached from [this bright , strong , rambling house]1136-this bright , strong , rambling house , with [its]1136-this bright , strong , rambling house wide veranda and striped awnings to [the shore of [the lake]571-the lake itself]1137-the shore of the lake itself , [Stuart Finchley]256-stuart and [Violet Taylor]257-violet taylor , together with [Frank Harriet]249-frank and [Wynette Phant]258-wynette phant , in the smartest of sport clothes , playing tennis , while [Bertine]252-bertine and [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott tolled in the shade of a striped marquee swing .

And , [he]197-clyde [himself]197-clyde , after bathing and dressing , assuming a jocular air although [his]197-clyde nerves remained tense and [his]197-clyde mood apprehensive . "[238-sondra] And then more talk of horses and dogs . And [Clyde]197-clyde , listening intently in [his]197-clyde anxiety to seem an integral part of it all , yet brooding on all that so desperately concerned [him]197-clyde . [Those three men]4204-those three men . [Roberta]195-roberta . Maybe [they]4204-those three men had found [her]195-roberta body by now — who could tell , yet saying to [himself]197-clyde — why so fearsome ? And then [Sondra]238-sondra , sensing a note of depression about [him]197-clyde . And then [Burchard]260-burchard shooting [the boat]4231-the boat out in [the lake]571-the lake with a whir that set [it]4231-the boat bounding like a porpoise — and [Clyde]197-clyde gazing half in a dream , half delight and hope and the other half a cloud of shadow and terror , with arrest and death , maybe , stalking close behind . For in spite of all [his]260-burchard preliminary planning , [he]260-burchard was beginning to feel that [he]260-burchard had made a mistake in openly coming out of [the wood]1152-the wood this morning . And yet had it not been best , since the only alternative was that of remaining [there]650-there by day and coming out at night and following [the shore road]1154-the shore road on foot to [Sharon]25-sharon ? But here now , this bright day , with seemingly no cares of any kind , for [these others]1155-these others at least , however dark and bleak [his]260-burchard own background might be . "[238-sondra]

" [Charlie Chaplin]271-charlie chaplin , "[260-burchard] volunteered [Taylor]260-burchard , at the same time proceeding to ricochet [the boat]4231-the boat as roughly and erratically as possible in order to make [her]238-sondra lose [her]238-sondra balance .

" Oh , [you]238-sondra silly ! " See if [you]260-burchard can upset [me]238-sondra now , [Burchy]270-burchy , "[238-sondra] [she]238-sondra called .

And [Burchard]260-burchard , throwing [the boat]4231-the boat from side to side as swiftly as [he]260-burchard dared , with [Jill Trumbull]261-jill trumbull , anxious for [her]261-jill trumbull own safety , calling : " Oh , say , what do [you]260-burchard want to do ? Drown [us]4393-us all ? "[261-jill trumbull] at which [Clyde]197-clyde winced and blanched as though struck .

At once [he]197-clyde felt sick , weak . [He]197-clyde had never imagined that it was going to be like this ; that [he]197-clyde was going to suffer so . [He]197-clyde had imagined that it was all going to be different . And yet here [he]197-clyde was , blanching at every accidental and unintended word ! Why , if [he]197-clyde were put to any real test — [an officer]1068-an officer descending on [him]197-clyde unexpectedly and asking [him]197-clyde where [he]197-clyde had been yesterday and what [he]197-clyde knew of [Roberta]195-roberta 's death — why , [he]197-clyde would mumble , shiver , not be able to talk , maybe — and so give [his]197-clyde whole case away would n't [he]197-clyde ! [He]197-clyde must brace up , try to look natural , happy — mustn't [he]197-clyde — for this first day at least .

Fortunately in the speed and excitement of the play , [the others]903-the others seemed not to notice the startling effect of the remark upon [him]197-clyde , and [he]197-clyde managed by degrees to recover [his]197-clyde outward composure . Then [the launch]1161-the launch approached [the Casino]60-the casino and [Sondra]238-sondra , wishing to execute some last showy stunt , jumped up and catching the rail pulled [herself]238-sondra up , while [the boat]4231-the boat rolled past only to reverse later . And [Clyde]197-clyde , because of a happy smile in [his]197-clyde direction , was seized by an uncontrollable desire for [her]238-sondra — [her]238-sondra love , sympathy , generosity , courage . And so now , to match [her]238-sondra smiles , [he]197-clyde jumped up and after assisting [Jill]261-jill trumbull to the steps , quickly climbed up after [her]238-sondra , pretending a gayety and enthusiasm that was as hollow inwardly as outwardly it was accurate .

" Gee ! Some athlete [you]197-clyde are ! "[197-clyde]

And then on the links a little later with [her]238-sondra , and under [her]238-sondra guidance and direction , playing as successful a game as it was possible with [his]197-clyde little experience and as troubled as [he]197-clyde was . And [she]238-sondra , because of the great delight of having [him]197-clyde all to [herself]238-sondra in shadowy hazards where [they]1163-they might kiss and embrace , beginning to tell [him]197-clyde of a proposed camping trip which [she]238-sondra , [Frank Harriet]249-frank , [Wynette Phant]258-wynette phant , [Burchard Taylor]260-burchard , [[her]238-sondra brother]1164-her brother [Stuart]256-stuart , [Grant Cranston]253-grant and [Bertine]252-bertine , as well as [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott , [Perley Haynes]272-perley haynes , [Jill Trumbull]261-jill trumbull and [Violet Taylor]257-violet taylor , had been organizing for a week , and which was to begin on the morrow afternoon , with a motor trip thirty miles up [the lake]571-the lake and then forty miles east to [a lake known as Bear]1166-a lake known as bear , along which , with tents and equipment , [they]1167-they were to canoe to [certain beaches]1168-certain beaches and scenes known only to [Harley]259-harley baggott and [Frank]249-frank . Different days , different points . [The boys]4167-the boys would kill squirrels and catch fish for food . Also there would be moonlight trips to [an inn]1170-an inn that could be reached by [boat]1077-boat , so [they]1167-they said . [A servant or two or three from different homes]1172-a servant or two or three from different homes was to accompany [them]1167-they , as well as [a chaperon or two]1173-a chaperon or two . But , oh , the walks in [the woods]632-the woods ! The opportunities for love — canoe trips on [the lake]571-the lake — hours of uninterrupted love - making for at least a week !

In spite of all that had occurred thus far to give [him]1176-he pause , [he]1176-he could not help thinking that whatever happened , was it not best to go ? How wonderful to have [her]1177-her love [him]1176-he so ! And what else here could [he]1176-he do ? It would take [him]1176-he out of this , would it not — farther and farther from the scene of the — of the — accident and in case [any one]4181-any one were looking for [any one who looked like [him]1176-he]1179-any one who looked like him , for instance — well , [he]1176-he would not be around where [he]1176-he could be seen and commented upon . [Those three men]4204-those three men .

Yet , as it now instantly occurred to [him]1176-he , under no circumstances must [he]1176-he leave [here]4244-here without first finding out as definitely as possible whether [any one]4181-any one was as yet suspected . And once at [the Casino]1183-the casino , and for the moment left alone , [he]1176-he learned on inquiring at the news stand that there would be no [Albany]28-albany , [Utica]30-utica , or any local afternoon paper there until seven or seven - thirty . [He]1176-he must wait until then to know .

And so although after the lunch there was swimming and dancing , then a return to [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons with [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott and [Bertine]252-bertine — [Sondra]238-sondra going to [Pine Point]42-pine point , with an agreement to meet [him]1176-he afterwards at [the Harriets]237-the harriets ' for dinner — still [his]1176-he mind was on the business of getting these papers at the first possible opportunity . Yet unless , as [he]1176-he now saw , [he]1176-he was so fortunate as to be able to stop on [his]1176-he way from [[the Cranstons]245-the cranstons ' to [the Harriets]237-the harriets ']1184-the cranstons ' to the harriets ' and so obtain one or all , [he]1176-he must manage to come over to [this Casino]1185-this casino in the morning before leaving for [Bear Lake]50-bear lake . [He]1176-he must have [them]1186-them . [He]1176-he must know what , if anything , was either being said or done so far in regard to [that drowned couple]1187-that drowned couple .

But on [his]1176-he way to [Harriets]237-the harriets ' [he]1176-he was not able to get the papers . [They]1186-them had not come . And none at [the Harriets]237-the harriets ' either , when [he]1176-he first arrived . Yet sitting on [the veranda]1139-the veranda about a half hour later , talking with [the others]903-the others although brooding as to all this , [Sondra]238-sondra [herself]238-sondra appeared and said : " Oh , say , [people]1033-people ! [I]238-sondra 've got something to tell [you]1033-people . [Two people]4395-two people were drowned this morning or yesterday up at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , so [Blanche Locke]273-blanche locke was telling [me]238-sondra just now over the phone . [She]273-blanche locke 's up at [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay today and [she]273-blanche locke says [they]4395-two people 've found the body of [the girl]4152-the girl but not [the man]504-the man yet . [They]4395-two people were drowned in [the south part of [the lake]571-the lake]4398-the south part of the lake somewhere , [she]273-blanche locke said . "[238-sondra]

At once [Clyde]197-clyde sat up , rigid and white , [his]197-clyde lips a bloodless line , [his]197-clyde eyes fixed not on anything here but rather the distant scene at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern — the tall pines , the dark water closing over [Roberta]195-roberta . Then [they]1190-we had found [her]195-roberta body . And now would [they]1190-we believe that [his]197-clyde body was down there , too , as [he]197-clyde had planned ? But , listen ! [He]197-clyde must hear in spite of [his]197-clyde dizziness .

" Gee , that 's tough ! "[260-burchard] observed [Burchard Taylor]260-burchard , stopping [his]260-burchard strumming on a mandolin . " Anybody [we]1190-we know ? "[260-burchard]

" [She]195-roberta says [she]195-roberta did n't hear yet . "[260-burchard]

" [I]249-frank never did like [that lake]4165-that lake , "[249-frank] put in [Frank Harriet]249-frank . " It 's too lonely . [Dad]274-dad and [I]249-frank and [Mr. Randall]275-mr. randall were up there fishing last summer , but [we]1190-we did n't stay long . It 's too gloomy . "[249-frank]

" [We]1190-we were up there three weeks ago — don't [you]238-sondra remember , [Sondra]238-sondra ? "[259-harley baggott] added [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott . " [You]238-sondra did n't care for it . "[259-harley baggott]

" Yes , [I]238-sondra remember , "[238-sondra] replied [Sondra]238-sondra . " [A dreadfully lonely place]4401-a dreadfully lonely place . [I]238-sondra ca n't imagine [any one]4181-any one wanting to go up there for anything . "[238-sondra]

" Well , [I]260-burchard only hope it is n't [any one [we]1190-we know from around here]4403-any one we know from around here , "[260-burchard] added [Burchard]260-burchard , thoughtfully . " It would put a crimp in the fun around here for a while , anyhow . "[260-burchard]

And [Clyde]197-clyde unconsciously wet [his]197-clyde dry lips with [his]197-clyde tongue and swallowed to moisten [his]197-clyde already dry throat .

" [I]258-wynette phant do n't suppose any of to - day 's papers would have anything about it yet . Has [any one]4181-any one looked ? "[258-wynette phant] inquired [Wynette Phant]258-wynette phant , who had not heard [Sondra]238-sondra 's opening remark .

" There ai n't no papers , "[260-burchard] commented [Burchard Taylor]260-burchard . " Besides , it 's not likely yet , did n't [Sondra]238-sondra say [she]238-sondra just heard it from [Blanche Locke]273-blanche locke over the phone ? [She]273-blanche locke 's up near [there]650-there . "[260-burchard]

" Oh , yes , that 's right . "[260-burchard]

And yet might not that small local afternoon paper of [Sharon]25-sharon — The Banner , was n't it — have something as to this ? If only [he]260-burchard could see it yet to - night !

But another thought ! For Heaven 's sake ! It came to [him]260-burchard now for the first time . [His]260-burchard footprints ! Were there any in [the mud of [that shore]1192-that shore]1191-the mud of that shore ? [He]260-burchard had not even stopped to look , climbing out so hastily as [he]260-burchard did . And might there not have been ? And then would [they]1193-they not know and proceed to follow [him]260-burchard — [the man]504-the man [those three men]4204-those three men saw ? [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden ! That ride down this morning . [His]260-burchard going out to [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons ' in [[their]4204-those three men car]1196-their car . That wet suit over in [the room]936-the room at [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons ' ! Had [any one in [his]260-burchard absence]1198-any one in his absence been in [[his]260-burchard room]928-his room as yet to look , examine , inquire — open [his]260-burchard bag , maybe ? [An officer]1068-an officer ? God ! It was there in [his]260-burchard bag . But why in [his]260-burchard bag or anywhere else near [him]260-burchard now ? Why had [he]260-burchard not hidden it before this — thrown it in [the lake]571-the lake here , maybe , with a stone in it ? That would keep it down . God ! What was [he]260-burchard thinking in the face of such a desperate situation as this ? Supposing [he]260-burchard did need the suit !

[He]260-burchard was now up , standing — mentally and physically frozen really — [his]260-burchard eyes touched with a stony glaze for the moment . [He]260-burchard must get out of here . [He]260-burchard must go back there , at once , and dispose of that suit — drop it in [the lake]571-the lake — hide it somewhere in [those woods]1203-those woods beyond [the house]748-the house ! And yet — [he]260-burchard could not do that so swiftly , either — leave so instantly after this light conversation about the drowning of [those two people]1205-those two people . How would that look ?

And as instantly there came the thought — no — be calm — show no trace of excitement of any kind , if [you]1206-you can manage it — appear cool — make some unimportant remark , if [you]1206-you can .

And so now , mustering what nervous strength [he]260-burchard had , and drawing near to [Sondra]238-sondra , [he]260-burchard said : " Too bad , eh ? "[260-burchard] Yet in a voice that for all its thinly - achieved normality was on the borderline of shaking and trembling . [His]260-burchard knees and [his]260-burchard hands , also .

" Yes , it certainly is , "[238-sondra] replied [Sondra]238-sondra , turning to [him]260-burchard alone now . " [I]238-sondra always hate to hear of anything like that , do n't [you]260-burchard ? [Mother]276-mother worries so about [Stuart]256-stuart and [me]238-sondra fooling around [these lakes]4406-these lakes as it is . "[238-sondra]

" Yes , [I]260-burchard know . "[260-burchard] [His]260-burchard voice was thick and heavy . [He]260-burchard could scarcely form the words . They were smothered , choked . [His]260-burchard lips tightened to a thinner white line than before . [His]260-burchard face grew paler still .

" Why , what 's the matter , [Clydie]240-clydie - mydie ? "[238-sondra] [Sondra]238-sondra asked , of a sudden , looking at [him]260-burchard more closely . " [You]260-burchard look so pale ! [Your]260-burchard eyes . Anything wrong ? Are n't [you]260-burchard feeling well tonight , or is it this light out here ? "[238-sondra]

[She]238-sondra turned to look at some of [the others]903-the others in order to make sure , then back at [him]260-burchard . And [he]260-burchard , feeling the extreme importance of looking anything but the way [she]238-sondra was describing [him]260-burchard now drew [himself]260-burchard up as best [he]260-burchard could , and replied : " Oh , no . It must be the light , [I]260-burchard guess . Sure , it 's the light . [I]260-burchard had — a — a hard day yesterday , that 's all . [I]260-burchard should n't have come over to - night , [I]260-burchard suppose . "[260-burchard] And then achieving the weirdest and most impossible of smiles . And [Sondra]238-sondra , gazing most sympathetically , adding : " Was [he]260-burchard so tired ? [[My]238-sondra Clydie]4407-my clydie - [[mydie]238-sondra boy]4408-mydie boy , after [his]260-burchard work yesterday . "[238-sondra]

[She]1208-she turned as if to speak to [Frank]249-frank , but [Clyde]197-clyde , all but panic - stricken by this latest suggestion , and yet angling for an excuse to leave , exclaimed earnestly and yet shakily : " Please , please do n't , [darling]4385-darling . [I]197-clyde — [I]197-clyde — don't want [you]4385-darling to . [I]197-clyde 'll be all right . [I]197-clyde 'm not feeling as good as [I]197-clyde should , but [I]197-clyde 'll be all right . "[197-clyde]

[Sondra]238-sondra , because of [his]197-clyde strained and as [she]238-sondra now fancied almost peevish tone , desisted with : " All right , [honey]4384-honey . All right . But if [you]4385-darling do n't feel well , [I]238-sondra wish [you]4385-darling would let [me]238-sondra get [Frank]249-frank to take [you]4385-darling down or go [upstairs]4415-upstairs . [He]197-clyde wo n't mind .
