Wo n't [[my]238-sondra baby boy]4409-my baby boy do something like that ? "[238-sondra]

And [Clyde]197-clyde saying : " Well , [I]197-clyde think [I]197-clyde 'll go up and get a drink , anyhow . "[197-clyde] And disappearing in [one of the spacious baths of [the Harriet home]1210-the harriet home]1209-one of the spacious baths of the harriet home , locking the door and sitting down and thinking , thinking — of [Roberta]195-roberta 's body recovered , of the possibilities of a bruise of some kind , of the possibility of the print of [his]197-clyde own feet in [the mud and sandy loam of [the shore]992-the shore]1211-the mud and sandy loam of the shore ; of that suit over at [the Cranstons ']1213-the cranstons ' , [the men in the wood]1214-the men in the wood , [Roberta]195-roberta 's bag , hat and coat , [his]197-clyde own liningless hat left on [the water]1009-the water — and wondering what next to do . How to act ! How to talk ! Whether to go [downstairs]1216-downstairs to [Sondra]238-sondra now and persuade [her]238-sondra to go , or whether to stay and suffer and agonize ? And what would the morrow 's papers reveal ? What ? What ? And was it wise , in case there was any news which would make it look as though eventually [he]197-clyde was to be sought after , or in any way connected with this , to go on that proposed camping trip tomorrow ! Or , wiser , to run away from [here]4244-here ? [He]197-clyde had some money now . [He]197-clyde could go to [New York]63-new york , [Boston]64-boston , [New Orleans]65-new orleans where [Ratterer]277-ratterer was — but oh , no — not where [any one]4181-any one knew [him]197-clyde .

Oh , [God]246-god ! The folly of all [his]197-clyde planning in connection with all this to date ! The flaws ! Had [he]197-clyde ever really planned it right from the start ? Had [he]197-clyde ever really imagined , for instance , that [Roberta]195-roberta 's body would be found in [that deep water]1219-that deep water ? And yet , here it was — risen so soon — this first day — to testify against [him]197-clyde ! And although [he]197-clyde had signed as [he]197-clyde had on those registers up there , was it not possible now , on account of [those three men]4204-those three men and [that girl on [that boat]645-that boat]1221-that girl on that boat , for [him]197-clyde to be traced ? [He]197-clyde must think , think , think ! And get out of [here]4244-here as soon as possible , before anything really fatal in connection with that suit should happen .

Growing momentarily weaker and more terrorized , [he]197-clyde now decided to return to [[Sondra]238-sondra below]1224-sondra below , and say that [he]197-clyde was really feeling quite sick and that if [she]238-sondra did not object [he]197-clyde would prefer to go [home]4141-home with [her]238-sondra , if [she]238-sondra could arrange it . And consequently , at ten - thirty , when the evening still had hours to go , [Sondra]238-sondra announced to [Burchard]260-burchard that [she]238-sondra was not feeling well and would [he]260-burchard run [her]238-sondra and [Clyde]197-clyde and [Jill]261-jill trumbull down to [[her]238-sondra place]1226-her place , but that [she]238-sondra would see [them]1227-them all on the morrow in time for the proposed departure for [Bear Lake]50-bear lake .

And [Clyde]197-clyde , though brooding as to whether this early leaving on [his]197-clyde part was not another of those wretched errors which had seemed to mark every step of this desperate and murderous scheme so far , finally entering [the swift launch]1228-the swift launch and being raced to [the Cranston lodge]983-the cranston lodge in no time . And once [there]650-there , excusing [himself]197-clyde to [Burchard]260-burchard and [Sondra]238-sondra as nonchalantly and apologetically as might be , and then hurrying to [[his]197-clyde own room]1231-his own room only to find the suit as [he]197-clyde had left it — no least evidence that [any one]4181-any one had been there to disturb the serenity of [[his]197-clyde chamber]1233-his chamber . Just the same , nervously and suspiciously , [he]197-clyde now took it out and tied it up , and then waiting and listening for a silent moment in which to slip from [the house]748-the house unobserved — finally ambled out as though going for a short walk . And then , by [the shore of [the lake]571-the lake]1235-the shore of the lake — about a quarter of a mile distant from [the house]748-the house — seeking out a heavy stone and tying the suit to that . And then throwing it out into [the water]1009-the water , as far as [his]197-clyde strength would permit . And then returning , as silently and gloomily and nervously as [he]197-clyde had gone , and brooding and brooding as to what the morrow might reveal and what , if any appeared to question [him]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde would say .

The morrow dawned after an all but sleepless night , harrowed by the most torturesome dreams in regard to [Roberta]195-roberta , [men who arrived to arrest [him]197-clyde]1239-men who arrived to arrest him , and [the hike]1240-the hike , until at last [he]197-clyde arose , [his]197-clyde nerves and eyes aching . Then , venturing to come [downstairs]1216-downstairs about an hour later , [he]197-clyde saw [Frederick]278-frederick , [the chauffeur who had driven [him]197-clyde out the day before , getting [one of the cars]1243-one of the cars out]1242-the chauffeur who had driven him out the day before , getting one of the cars out . And thereupon instructing [him]197-clyde to bring all the morning [Albany]28-albany and [Utica]30-utica papers . And about nine - thirty , when [he]197-clyde returned , proceeding to [[his]197-clyde room]928-his room with [them]1245-them , where , locking the door and spreading one of the papers before [him]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde was immediately confronted by the startling headlines :

" [MYSTERY IN GIRL]279-mystery in girl 'S DEATH BODY FOUND YESTERDAY IN [ADIRONDACK LAKE]66-adirondack lake MAN COMPANION MISSING "[197-clyde] And at once strained and white [he]197-clyde sat down in one of the chairs near the window and began to read :

" [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , N. Y. , July 9.—The body of [an unknown girl]4421-an unknown girl , presumably [the wife of [a young man who registered first on Wednesday morning at [Grass Lake Inn]23-grass lake inn]4423-a young man who registered first on wednesday morning at grass lake inn , [Grass Lake]21-grass lake , N. Y. , as [Carl Graham]199-carl graham and [wife]586-wife , and later , Thursday noon , at [Big Bittern Lodge]67-big bittern lodge , [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , as [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden and [wife]586-wife]4422-the wife of a young man who registered first on wednesday morning at grass lake inn , grass lake , n. y. , as carl graham and wife , and later , thursday noon , at big bittern lodge , big bittern , as clifford golden and wife was taken from the waters of [the south end of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]4426-the south end of big bittern just before noon yesterday . Because of [an upturned boat]4427-an upturned boat , as well as [a man]4220-a man 's straw hat found floating on the water in [Moon Cove]18-moon cove , dredging with hooks and lines had been going on all morning ... Up to seven o'clock last evening , however , the body of [the man]504-the man had not as yet been recovered , and according to [Coroner Heit of [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]192-heit , who by two o'clock had been summoned to the scene of the tragedy , it was not considered at all likely that it would be . Several marks and abrasions found upon [the dead girl]4430-the dead girl 's head and face , as well as the testimony of [three men who arrived on the scene while the search was still on]4431-three men who arrived on the scene while the search was still on and testified to having met [a young man who answered to the description of [Golden]198-clifford golden or [Graham]199-carl graham in [the woods to the south of the lake]4433-the woods to the south of the lake the night before]4432-a young man who answered to the description of golden or graham in the woods to the south of the lake the night before , caused [many]4434-many to conclude that a murder had been committed and that [the murderer]668-the murderer was seeking to make [his]668-the murderer escape .[197-clyde]

" [The girl]4152-the girl 's brown leather traveling bag , as well as a hat and coat belonging to [her]4152-the girl , were left , the bag in [[the ticket agent]4437-the ticket agent 's room]4438-the ticket agent 's room at [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge , which is [the railway station five miles east of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]4439-the railway station five miles east of big bittern , and the hat and coat in [the coatroom of [the inn at [the Lake]69-the lake]4441-the inn at the lake]4440-the coatroom of the inn at the lake , whereas [Graham]199-carl graham or [Golden]198-clifford golden is said to have taken [his]4432-a young man who answered to the description of golden or graham in the woods to the south of the lake the night before suitcase with [him]4432-a young man who answered to the description of golden or graham in the woods to the south of the lake the night before into [the boat]4231-the boat .[197-clyde]

" According to [the innkeeper at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]4443-the innkeeper at big bittern , [the couple on [their]4444-the couple on their arrival arrival]4444-the couple on their arrival registered as [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden and [wife of [Albany]28-albany]4445-wife of albany . [They]4444-the couple on their arrival remained in [the inn]503-the inn but a few minutes before [Golden]198-clifford golden walked to [the boat - landing just outside]4447-the boat - landing just outside and procured [a light boat]4448-a light boat , in which , accompanied by [the girl]4152-the girl and [his]4432-a young man who answered to the description of golden or graham in the woods to the south of the lake the night before suitcase , [he]4432-a young man who answered to the description of golden or graham in the woods to the south of the lake the night before went out on [the lake]571-the lake . [They]4444-the couple on their arrival did not return , and yesterday morning [the boat]4231-the boat was found bottomside up in what is known as [Moon Cove]18-moon cove , [a small bay or extension at [the extreme south end of [the lake]571-the lake]4453-the extreme south end of the lake]4452-a small bay or extension at the extreme south end of the lake , from the waters of which soon afterwards the body of [the young woman]4455-the young woman was recovered . As there are no known rocks in [the lake]571-the lake at that point , and the wounds upon the face are quite marked , suspicion was at once aroused that [the girl]4152-the girl might have been unfairly dealt with . This , together with the testimony of [the three men]651-the three men , as well as the fact that [a man]4220-a man 's straw hat found nearby contained no lining or other method of identification , has caused [Coroner Heit]192-heit to assert that unless the body of [the man]504-the man is found [he]192-heit will assume that murder has been committed .[197-clyde]

" [Golden]198-clifford golden or [Graham]199-carl graham , as described by [innkeepers]4461-innkeepers and [guests]4462-guests and guides at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake and [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , is not more than twenty - four or twenty - five years of age , slender , dark , and not more than five feet eight or nine inches tall . At the time [he]504-the man arrived [he]504-the man was dressed in a light gray suit , tan shoes , and a straw hat and carried a brown suitcase to which was attached an umbrella and some other object , presumably a cane .[197-clyde]

" The hat and coat left by [the girl]4152-the girl at [the inn]503-the inn were of dark and light tan respectively , [her]4152-the girl dress a dark blue .[197-clyde]

" Notice has been sent to [all railroad stations in [this vicinity]4466-this vicinity]4465-all railroad stations in this vicinity to be on the lookout for [Golden]198-clifford golden , or [Graham]199-carl graham , in order that [he]504-the man may be arrested if [he]504-the man is alive and attempts to make [his]504-the man escape . The body of [the drowned girl]567-the drowned girl is to be removed to [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , [the county seat of [this county]600-this county]4468-the county seat of this county , where an inquest is later to be held . "[197-clyde] In frozen silence [he]1246-he sat and pondered . For would not the news of such a dastardly murder as this now appeared to be , together with the fact that it had been committed in [this immediate vicinity]1247-this immediate vicinity , stir up such marked excitement as to cause [many — perhaps all]1248-many — perhaps all — to scan [all goers and comers]1249-all goers and comers everywhere in the hope of detecting [the one who had thus been described]1250-the one who had thus been described ? Might it not be better , therefore , since [they]1251-they were so close on [his]1246-he trail already , if [he]1246-he were to go to [the authorities at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]1252-the authorities at big bittern or here and make a clean breast of all that had thus far occurred , the original plot and the reasons therefor , only explaining how at the very last [he]1246-he had not really killed [her]1250-the one who had thus been described — had experienced a change of heart and had not been able to do as [he]1246-he had planned ? But , no . That would be to give away to [Sondra]238-sondra and the Griffiths all that had been going on between [him]1246-he and [Roberta]195-roberta — and before it was absolutely certain that all was ended for [him]1246-he here . And besides , would [they]1251-they believe [him]1246-he now , after that flight — those reported wounds ? Did it not really look as though [he]1246-he had killed [her]1250-the one who had thus been described , regardless of how [he]1246-he might try to explain that [he]1246-he had not ?

It was not unlikely also that at least [some among all those who had seen [him]1246-he]1253-some among all those who had seen him would be able to detect [him]1246-he from this printed description , even though [he]1246-he no longer wore the gray suit or the straw hat . [God]246-god ! [They]1251-they were looking for [him]1246-he , or rather for that [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden or [Carl Graham]199-carl graham who looked like [him]1246-he , in order to charge [him]1246-he with murder ! But if [he]1246-he looked exactly like [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden and [those three men]4204-those three men came ! [He]1246-he began to shiver . And worse yet . A new and horrible thought , this — and at this instant , and for the first time flashing upon [his]1246-he mind — the similarity of those initials to [his]1246-he own ! [He]1246-he had never thought of them in an unfavorable light before , but now [he]1246-he could see that they were detrimental . Why was it that [he]1246-he had never thought of that before ? Why was it ? Why was it ? Oh , [God]246-god !

Just then a telephone call for [him]1246-he came from [Sondra]238-sondra . It was announced as from [her]238-sondra . Yet even so [he]1246-he was compelled to brace [himself]1246-he in order to make even an acceptable showing , vocally . How was [[her]238-sondra sick boy]1255-her sick boy this morning ? Any better ? How dreadful that illness last night to come on [him]1246-he so suddenly . Was [he]1246-he really all right now ? And was [he]1246-he going to be able to go on the trip all right ? That was fine . [She]238-sondra had been so frightened and so worried all night for fear [he]1246-he might be too sick to want to go . But [he]1246-he was going , so everything was all right again now . [Darling]4385-darling ! [Precious baby]1257-precious baby ! Did [[her]238-sondra baby boy]1258-her baby boy love [her]238-sondra so ? [She]238-sondra was just sure that the trip would do [him]1246-he a lot of good . But until noon , now , [dear]1259-dear , [she]238-sondra would be using all [her]238-sondra spare time getting ready , but at one , or one - thirty , [everybody]1260-everybody would be at [the Casino pier]1261-the casino pier . And then — oh , my ! Ho ! for a great old time up there ! [He]1246-he was to come with [Bertine]252-bertine and [Grant]253-grant and whoever else was coming from there , and then at [the pier]1262-the pier [he]1246-he could change to [Stuart]256-stuart 's launch . [They]1263-they were certain to have so much fun — just loads of it — but just now [she]238-sondra would have to go . Bye - bye !

And once more like a bright - colored bird [she]238-sondra was gone .

But three hours to wait before [he]1246-he could leave [here]4244-here and so avoid the danger of encountering [any one who might be looking for [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden or [Carl Graham]199-carl graham]1265-any one who might be looking for clifford golden or carl graham ! Still until then [he]1246-he could walk up [the lake shore]1266-the lake shore into [the woods]632-the woods , could n't [he?—or]1246-he sit below , [his]1246-he bag all packed , and watch who , if [anybody]1268-anybody , might approach along the long - winding path from [the road]1056-the road or by launch across [the lake]571-the lake . And if [he]1246-he saw [any one who looked at all suspicious]1271-any one who looked at all suspicious , [he]1246-he could take flight , could [he]1246-he not ? And afterwards doing just that — first walking away into [the woods]632-the woods and looking back , as might a hunted animal . Then later returning and sitting or walking , but always watching , watching . ( [What man]1273-what man was that ? [What boat]1274-what boat was that ? Where was it going ? Was it coming here , by any chance ? Who was in it ? Supposing [an officer]1068-an officer — [a detective]1276-a detective ? Then flight , of course — if there was still time . )

But , at last [one o'clock]1277-one o'clock , and [the Cranston launch]1278-the cranston launch , with [Bertine]252-bertine and [Harley]259-harley baggott and [Wynette]258-wynette phant , as well as [Grant]253-grant and [himself]253-grant , setting out for [the pier]1262-the pier . And once there , joined by [all who were going]1280-all who were going , together with [the servants]1281-the servants . And at [Little Fish Inlet]70-little fish inlet , thirty miles north , on [the eastern shore]1282-the eastern shore , [they]1283-they were met by [the cars of [the Baggotts]281-the baggotts]1284-the cars of the baggotts , [Harriets]237-the harriets and [others]1118-others , from where , with [[their]1283-they goods and canoes]1286-their goods and canoes , [they]1283-they were portaged forty miles east to [Bear Lake]50-bear lake , as lonely and as arresting almost as [Big Bittern]13-big bittern itself .

The joy of this trip if only that other thing were not hanging over [him]253-grant now . This exquisite pleasure of being near [Sondra]238-sondra , [her]238-sondra eyes constantly telling [him]253-grant how much [she]238-sondra cared . And [her]238-sondra spirit 's flame so high because of [his]253-grant presence here with [her]238-sondra now . And yet [Roberta]195-roberta 's body up ! That search for [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden — [Carl Graham]199-carl graham . [His]253-grant identical description wired as well as published everywhere . [These others]1155-these others — all of [them]1155-these others in [[their]1155-these others boats and [cars]1289-cars]1288-their boats and cars had probably read it . And yet , because of [their]1155-these others familiarity with [him]253-grant and [[his]253-grant connections]1290-his connections — [Sondra]238-sondra , [the Griffiths]1291-the griffiths — not suspecting [him]253-grant — not thinking of the description even . But if [they]1155-these others should ! If [they]1155-these others should guess ! The horror ! The flight ! The exposure ! [The police]1292-the police ! The first to desert [him]253-grant — these — all save [Sondra]238-sondra perhaps . And even [she]238-sondra , too . Yes , [she]238-sondra , of course . The horror in [her]238-sondra eyes .

And then that evening at sundown , on [the west shore of [this same lake]1294-this same lake]1293-the west shore of this same lake , on an open sward that was as smooth as any well - kept lawn , [the entire company]1295-the entire company settled , in [five different colored tents ranged about a fire like [an Indian village]1297-an indian village , with [cooks]1298-cooks ' and [servants]1299-servants ' tents]1296-five different colored tents ranged about a fire like an indian village , with cooks ' and servants ' tents in the distance . And the half dozen canoes beached like bright fish along [the grassy shore of [the lake]571-the lake]1300-the grassy shore of the lake . And then supper around an open fire . And [Baggott]259-harley baggott and [Harriet]249-frank and [Stuart]256-stuart and [Grant]253-grant , after furnishing music for [the others to dance by]1302-the others to dance by , organizing by the flare of a large gasoline lamp , a poker game . And [the others]903-the others joining in singing ribald camping and college songs , no one of which [Clyde]197-clyde knew , yet in which [he]197-clyde tried to join . And shouts of laughter . And bets as to who would be the first to catch the first fish , to shoot the first squirrel or partridge , to win the first race . And lastly , solemn plans for moving [the camp]1304-the camp at least ten miles farther east , after breakfast , on the morrow where was [an ideal beach]1305-an ideal beach , and where [they]1306-they would be within five miles of [the Metissic Inn]1307-the metissic inn , and where [they]1306-they could dine and dance to [their]1306-they heart 's content .

And then the silence and the beauty of [this camp]1308-this camp at night , after all had presumably gone to bed . The stars ! The mystic , shadowy water , faintly rippling in a light wind , the mystic , shadowy pines conferring in the light breezes , the cries of night birds and owls — too disturbing to [Clyde]197-clyde to be listened to with anything but inward distress . The wonder and glory of all this — if only — if only [he]197-clyde were not stalked after , as by [a skeleton]1309-a skeleton , by the horror not only of what [he]197-clyde had done in connection with [Roberta]195-roberta but the danger and the power of the law that deemed [him]197-clyde [a murderer]1310-a murderer ! And then [Sondra]238-sondra , [the others]903-the others having gone to bed — or off into the shadow,—stealing out for a few last words and kisses under the stars . And [he]197-clyde whispering to [her]238-sondra how happy [he]197-clyde was , how grateful for all [her]238-sondra love and faith , and at one point almost tempted to ask whether in case it should ever appear that [he]197-clyde was not as good as [she]238-sondra now seemed to imagine [him]197-clyde , [she]238-sondra would still love [him]197-clyde a little — not hate [him]197-clyde entirely — yet refraining for fear that after that exhibition of terror the preceding night [she]238-sondra might connect [his]197-clyde present mood with that , or somehow with the horrible , destructive secret that was gnawing at [his]197-clyde vitals .

And then afterwards , lying in the four - cot tent with [Baggott]259-harley baggott , [Harriet]249-frank and [Grant]253-grant , listening nervously for hours for any prowling steps that might mean — that might mean — [God]246-god — what might [they]1312-they not mean even up here?—the law ! arrest ! exposure ! Death . And waking twice in the night out of dread , destructive dreams,—and feeling as though — and fearing — that [he]197-clyde had cried out in [his]197-clyde sleep .

But then the glory of the morning once more — with its rotund and yellow sun rising over [the waters of [the lake]571-the lake]1313-the waters of the lake — and in [a cove across [the lake]571-the lake]1315-a cove across the lake wild ducks paddling about . And after a time [Grant]253-grant and [Stuart]256-stuart and [Harley]259-harley baggott , half - clad and with guns and a great show of fowling skill , foolishly setting forth in [canoes]1317-canoes in the hope of bagging some of the game with long distance shots , yet getting nothing , to the merriment of all the others . And [the boys]4167-the boys and [girls]1319-girls , stealing out in bright - colored bathing suits and silken beach robes to [the water]1009-the water , there to plunge gayly in and shout and clatter concerning the joy of it all . And breakfast at nine , with afterwards the gayety and beauty of the bright flotilla of canoes making eastward along [the southern lake shore]1321-the southern lake shore , banjos , guitars and mandolins strumming and voices raised in song , jest , laughter .

" Whatever matter wissum sweet to - day ? Face all dark . Cantum be happy out here wis [Sondra]238-sondra and [all these nicey good - baddies]4470-all these nicey good - baddies ? "[197-clyde]

And [Clyde]197-clyde as instantly realizing that [he]197-clyde must pretend to be gay and care - free .

And then [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott and [Grant]253-grant and [Harriet]249-frank at about noon announcing that [there — just ahead]1322-there — just ahead — was [the fine beach]1323-the fine beach [they]1324-they had in mind — [the Ramshorn]71-the ramshorn , [a spit of Land commanding from [its]71-the ramshorn highest point all the length and breadth of [the lake]571-the lake]1325-a spit of land commanding from its highest point all the length and breadth of the lake . And with room on [the shore]992-the shore below for all the tents and paraphernalia of [the company]1328-the company . And then , throughout this warm , pleasant Sunday afternoon , the usual program of activities — lunching , swimming , dancing , walking , card - playing , music . And [Clyde]197-clyde and [Sondra]238-sondra , like [other couples]1329-other couples , stealing off — [Sondra]238-sondra with a mandolin — to [a concealed rock far to the east of [the camp]1304-the camp , where in the shade of the pines [they]1324-they could lie]1330-a concealed rock far to the east of the camp , where in the shade of the pines they could lie — [Sondra]238-sondra in [Clyde]197-clyde 's arms — and talk of the things [they]1324-they were certain to do later , even though , as [she]1332-she now announced , [Mrs. Finchley]282-mrs. finchley was declaring that after this particular visit of [[Clyde]197-clyde 's [[her]1332-she daughter]672-her daughter]1333-clyde 's her daughter was to have nothing more to do with [him]197-clyde in any such intimate social way as this particular trip gave opportunity for . [He]197-clyde was too poor — too nondescript [a relative of [the Griffiths]197-clyde]1335-a relative of the griffiths . ( It was so that [Sondra]238-sondra , yet in a more veiled way , described [[her]238-sondra mother]752-her mother as talking . ) Yet adding : " How ridiculous , [sweetum]4471-sweetum ! But do n't [you]4471-sweetum mind . [I]238-sondra just laughed and agreed because [I]238-sondra do n't want to aggravate [her]752-her mother just now . But [I]238-sondra did ask [her]752-her mother how [I]238-sondra was to avoid meeting [you]4471-sweetum here or anywhere now since [you]4471-sweetum are as popular as [you]4471-sweetum are . [[My]238-sondra sweetum]4472-my sweetum is so good - looking . [Everybody]1260-everybody thinks so — even [the boys]4167-the boys . "[238-sondra]

At this very hour , on [the veranda of [the Silver Inn]72-the silver inn at [Sharon]25-sharon]1337-the veranda of the silver inn at sharon , [District Attorney Mason]1338-district attorney mason , with [[his]1338-district attorney mason assistant]534-his assistant [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , [Coroner Heit]192-heit and [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , and [the redoubtable Sheriff Slack]1340-the redoubtable sheriff slack , paunched and scowling , yet genial enough in ordinary social intercourse , together with [three assistants]1341-three assistants — [first , second and third deputies Kraut]1342-first , second and third deputies kraut , [Sissel]283-sissel and [Swenk]284-swenk — conferring as to the best and most certain methods of immediate capture .

" [He]1338-district attorney mason has gone to [Bear Lake]50-bear lake . [We]1343-they must follow and trap [him]1338-district attorney mason before news reaches [him]1338-district attorney mason in any way that [he]1338-district attorney mason is wanted . "[1341-three assistants]

And so [they]1343-they set forth — [this group]1344-this group — [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh and [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb about [Sharon]25-sharon [itself]25-sharon in order to gather such additional data as [they]1343-they might in connection with [Clyde]197-clyde 's arrival and departure from [here]4244-here for [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons ' on Friday , talking with and subpoenaing [any such individuals]1346-any such individuals as might throw any light on [his]197-clyde movements ; [Heit]1347-heit to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay on much the same errand , to see [Captain Mooney of the " Cygnus "]210-captain mooney[210-captain mooney] and [the three men]651-the three men and [Mason]185-mason , together with [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff and [[his]4144-the sheriff deputies]1350-his deputies , in a high - powered launch chartered for the occasion , to follow the now known course of [the only recently - departed camping party]1351-the only recently - departed camping party , first to [Little Fish Inlet]70-little fish inlet and from there , in case the trail proved sound , to [Bear Lake]50-bear lake .

And on Monday morning , while those at [Ramshorn Point]73-ramshorn point after [breaking camp]1352-breaking camp were already moving on toward [Shelter Beach]74-shelter beach fourteen miles east , [Mason]185-mason , together with [Slack]244-slack and [[his]244-slack three deputies]1353-his three deputies , arriving at [the camp]1304-the camp deserted the morning before . And there , [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff and [Mason]185-mason taking counsel with [each other]871-each other and then dividing [their]1357-their forces so that in canoes commandeered from [lone residents of [the region]1359-the region [they]1357-their now proceeded]1358-lone residents of the region they now proceeded , [Mason]185-mason and [First Deputy Kraut]285-kraut along [the south shore]502-the south shore , [Slack]244-slack and [Second Deputy Sissel]283-sissel along [the north shore]1361-the north shore , while [young Swenk]284-swenk , blazing with a desire to arrest and handcuff [some one]796-some one , yet posing for the occasion as [a lone young hunter or woodsman]1363-a lone young hunter or woodsman , paddled directly east along [the center of [the lake]571-the lake]1364-the center of the lake in search of any informing smoke or fires or tents or individuals idling along [the shores]1366-the shores . And with great dreams of being the one to capture [the murderer]668-the murderer — [I]0-i arrest [you]1368-you , [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , in the name of [the law!—yet]286-the law!—yet because of instructions from [Mason]185-mason , as well as [Slack]244-slack , grieving that instead , should [he]197-clyde detect any signs , being [the furthermost outpost]1369-the furthermost outpost , [he]197-clyde must , in order to avoid frightening the prey or losing [him]197-clyde , turn on [his]197-clyde track and from some point not so likely to be heard by [the criminal]899-the criminal fire one single shot from [his]197-clyde eight - chambered repeater , whereupon [whichever party chanced to be nearest]1371-whichever party chanced to be nearest would fire one shot in reply and then proceed as swiftly as possible in [his]197-clyde direction . But under no circumstances was [he]197-clyde to attempt to take [the criminal]899-the criminal alone , unless noting the departure by [boat]1077-boat or on foot of [a suspicious person who answered the description of]1374-a suspicious person who answered the description of [Clyde]197-clyde .

At this very hour , [Clyde]197-clyde , with [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott , [Bertine]252-bertine and [Sondra]238-sondra , in one of [the canoes]1375-the canoes , paddling eastward along with [the remainder of [the flotilla]1377-the flotilla]1376-the remainder of the flotilla , looking back and wondering . Supposing by now , [some officer]1378-some officer or [some one]796-some one had arrived at [Sharon]25-sharon and was following [him]197-clyde up here ? For would it be hard to find where [he]197-clyde had gone , supposing only that [they]1380-they knew [his]197-clyde name ?

But [they]1380-they did not know [his]197-clyde name . Had not the items in the papers proved that ? Why worry so always , especially on this utterly wonderful trip and when at last [he]197-clyde and [Sondra]238-sondra could be together again ? And besides , was it not now possible for [him]197-clyde to wander off by [himself]197-clyde into these thinly populated woods along [the shore]992-the shore to the eastward , toward that inn at [the other end of [the lake]571-the lake]1382-the other end of the lake — and not return ? Had [he]197-clyde not inquired most casually on Saturday afternoon of [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott as well as [others]1118-others as to whether there was [a road]1385-a road south or east from [the east end of [the lake]571-the lake]1386-the east end of the lake ? And had [he]197-clyde not learned there was ?

And at last , at noon , Monday , reaching [Shelter Beach]74-shelter beach , [the third spot of beauty contemplated]1388-the third spot of beauty contemplated by [the planners of this outing]1389-the planners of this outing , where [he]197-clyde helped to pitch the tents again while [the girls]1390-the girls played about .

Yet at the same hour , at [the Ramshorn site]1391-the ramshorn site , because of the ashes from [their]1392-their fires left upon [the shore]992-the shore , [young Swenk]284-swenk , most eagerly and enthusiastically , like some seeking animal , approaching and examining the same and then going on — swiftly . And but one hour later , [Mason]185-mason and [Kraut]285-kraut , reconnoitering the same spot , but without either devoting more than a cursory glance , since it was obvious that the prey had moved farther on .

But then greater speed in paddling on [the part of [Swenk]284-swenk]1394-the part of swenk , until by four [he]197-clyde arrived at [Shelter Beach]74-shelter beach . And then , descrying as many as a half dozen people in the water in the distance , at once turning and retreating in the direction of the others in order to give the necessary signal . And some two miles back firing one shot , which in its turn was responded to by [Mason]185-mason as well as [Sheriff Slack]287-slack . [Both parties]1395-both parties had heard and were now paddling swiftly east .

At once [Clyde]197-clyde in [the water]1009-the water — near [Sondra]238-sondra — hearing this was made to wonder . The ominous quality of that first shot ! Followed by those two additional signals — farther away , yet seemingly in answer to the first ! And then the ominous silence thereafter ! What was that ? And with [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott jesting : " Listen to [the guys shooting game out of season]4475-the guys shooting game out of season , will [you]197-clyde . It 's against the law , is n't it ? "[259-harley baggott]

" Hey , [you]197-clyde ! "[253-grant] [Grant Cranston]253-grant shouted . " Those are [my]253-grant ducks down there ! Let 'em alone . "[253-grant]

" If [they]4476-they ca n't shoot any better than [you]197-clyde , [Granty]288-granty , [they]4476-they will let 'em alone . "[252-bertine] This from [Bertine]252-bertine .

[Clyde]197-clyde , while attempting to smile , looked in the direction of the sound and listened like a hunted animal .

What was it now that urged [him]197-clyde to get out of [the water]1009-the water and dress and run ? Hurry ! Hurry ! To [[your]1398-your tent]1399-your tent ! To [the woods]632-the woods , quick ! Until at last heeding this , and while [most of [the others]903-the others]1401-most of the others were not looking , hurrying to [[his]197-clyde tent]1403-his tent , changing to the one plain blue business suit and cap that [he]197-clyde still possessed , then slipping into [the woods]632-the woods back of [the camp]1304-the camp — out of sight and hearing of all present until [he]197-clyde should be able to think and determine , but keeping always safely inland out of the direct view of [the water]1009-the water , for fear — for fear — who could tell exactly what those shots meant ?

Yet [Sondra]238-sondra ! And [her]238-sondra words of Saturday and yesterday and to - day . Could [he]197-clyde leave [her]238-sondra in this way , without being sure ? Could [he]197-clyde ? [Her]238-sondra kisses ! [Her]238-sondra dear assurances as to the future ! What would [she]238-sondra think now — and [those others]1407-those others — in case [he]197-clyde did not go back ? The comment which was certain to be made in the Sharon and other papers in regard to this disappearance of [his]197-clyde , and which was certain to identify [him]197-clyde with this same [Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden or [Carl Graham]199-carl graham ! was it not ?

Then reflecting also — the possible groundlessness of these fears , based on nothing more , maybe , than the chance shots of [passing hunters]1408-passing hunters on [the lake]571-the lake or in [these woods]1004-these woods . And then pausing and debating with [himself]197-clyde whether to go on or not . Yet , oh , the comfort of these tall , pillared trees — the softness and silence of these brown , carpeting needles on the ground — the clumps and thickets of underbrush under which [one]955-one could lie and hide until night should fall again . And then on — and on . But turning , none - the - less , with the intention of returning to [the camp]1304-the camp to see whether [any one]4181-any one had come [there]650-there . ( [He]197-clyde might say [he]197-clyde had taken a walk and got lost in [the woods]632-the woods . )

But about this time , behind a protecting group of trees at least [two miles west of [the camp]1304-the camp]1416-two miles west of the camp , a meeting and conference between [Mason]185-mason , [Slack]287-slack and all [the others]903-the others . And later , as a result of this and even as [Clyde]197-clyde lingered and returned somewhat nearer [the camp]1304-the camp , [Mason]185-mason , [Swenk]284-swenk paddling [the canoe]1420-the canoe , arriving and inquiring of [those who were now on [shore]1422-shore]1421-those who were now on shore if a [Mr. Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde was present and might [he]197-clyde see [him]197-clyde . And [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott , being nearest , replying : " Why , yes , sure . [He]197-clyde 's around here somewhere . "[259-harley baggott] And [Stuart Finchley]256-stuart calling : " Eh - o , [Griffiths]197-clyde ! "[256-stuart] But no reply .

Yet [Clyde]197-clyde , not near enough to hear any of this , even now returning toward [the camp]1304-the camp , very slowly and cautiously . And [Mason]185-mason concluding that possibly [he]197-clyde was about somewhere and unaware of anything , of course , deciding to wait a few minutes anyhow — while advising [Swenk]284-swenk to fall back into [the woods]632-the woods and if by any chance encountering [Slack]287-slack or any other to advise [him]197-clyde that [one man]604-one man be sent east along [the bank]1426-the bank and another west , while [he]284-swenk — [Swenk]284-swenk — proceeded in [a boat]535-a boat eastward as before to [the inn at the extreme end]1428-the inn at the extreme end , in order that from there word might be given to all as to the presence of [the suspect]1429-the suspect in [this region]538-this region .

In the meanwhile [Clyde]197-clyde by now only three - quarters of a mile east , and still whispered to by something which said : Run , run , do not linger ! yet lingering , and thinking [Sondra]238-sondra , this wonderful life ! Should [he]197-clyde go so ? And saying to [himself]197-clyde that [he]197-clyde might be making a greater mistake by going than by staying . For supposing those shots were nothing — hunters , mere game shots meaning nothing in [his]197-clyde case — and yet costing [him]197-clyde all ? And yet turning at last and saying to [himself]197-clyde that perhaps it might be best not to return at present , anyhow at least not until very late — after dark — to see if those strange shots had meant anything .

But then again pausing silently and dubiously , the while vesper sparrows and woodfinches sang . And peering . And peeking nervously .

And then all at once , not more than fifty feet distant , out of the long , tall aisles of the trees before [him]197-clyde , [a whiskered , woodsman - like type of man approaching swiftly , yet silently]1431-a whiskered , woodsman - like type of man approaching swiftly , yet silently — [a tall , bony , sharp - eyed man in a brown felt hat and a brownish - gray baggy and faded suit that hung loosely over [his]1432-a tall , bony , sharp - eyed man in a brown felt hat and a brownish - gray baggy and faded suit that hung loosely over his spare body spare body]1432-a tall , bony , sharp - eyed man in a brown felt hat and a brownish - gray baggy and faded suit that hung loosely over his spare body . And as suddenly calling as [he]197-clyde came — which caused [Clyde]197-clyde 's blood to run cold with fear and rivet [him]197-clyde to the spot .

" Hold on a moment , [mister]4477-mister ! Do n't move . [Your]197-clyde name do n't happen to be [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , does it ? "[197-clyde] And [Clyde]197-clyde , noting the sharp inquisitorial look in the eye of [this stranger]1433-this stranger , as well as the fact that [he]197-clyde had already drawn a revolver and was lifting it up , now pausing , the definiteness and authority of [the man]504-the man chilling [him]197-clyde to the marrow . Was [he]197-clyde really being captured ? Had [the officers of the law]1435-the officers of the law truly come for [him]197-clyde ? God ! No hope of flight now ! Why had [he]197-clyde not gone on ? For with each step through [the woods thus far back]1484-the woods thus far back , there had been growing within [him]209-mason the utter and unshakable conviction that in the face of whatever seeming proof or charges might now appear , [he]209-mason dared not tell anything in regard to [himself]209-mason , [his]209-mason connection with [Roberta]195-roberta , [his]209-mason visit to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern or [Grass Lake]21-grass lake . [He]209-mason dared not . For that would be the same as a confession of guilt in connection with something of which [he]209-mason was not really guilty . And [no one]4176-no one must believe — never — [Sondra]238-sondra , or [the Griffiths]197-clyde , or any of [these fine friends of [his]209-mason]1486-these fine friends of his , that [he]209-mason could ever have been guilty of such a thought , even . And yet here [they]1487-they were , all within call , and at any moment might approach and so learn the meaning of [his]209-mason arrest . And while [he]209-mason felt the necessity for so denying any knowledge in connection with all this , at the same time [he]209-mason stood in absolute terror of [this man]749-this man — the opposition and irritated mood such an attitude might arouse in [him]209-mason . That broken nose . [His]209-mason large , stern eyes .

And then [Mason]185-mason , eyeing [him]209-mason as one might an unheard - of and yet desperate animal and irritated also by [his]209-mason denial , yet assuming from [his]209-mason blanched expression that [he]209-mason might and no doubt would shortly be compelled to confess [his]209-mason guilt , continuing with : " [You]209-mason know what [you]209-mason are charged with , [Mr. Griffiths]197-clyde , of course . "[209-mason]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , [I]197-clyde just heard it from [this man]749-this man here . "[197-clyde]

" And [you]209-mason admit it ? "[209-mason]

" Why , [no sir]4525-no sir , of course [I]197-clyde do n't admit it , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , [his]197-clyde thin and now white lips drawn tight over [his]197-clyde even teeth , [his]197-clyde eyes full of a deep , tremulous yet evasive terror .

" Why , what nonsense ! What effrontery ! [You]209-mason deny being up to [Grass Lake]21-grass lake and [Big Bittern]13-big bittern on last Wednesday and Thursday ? "[209-mason]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[209-mason]

" Well , then , "[185-mason] and now [Mason]185-mason stiffened [himself]185-mason in an angry and at the same time inquisitorial way , " [I]185-mason suppose [you]209-mason are going to deny knowing [Roberta Alden]195-roberta — [the girl [you]209-mason took to [Grass Lake]21-grass lake]4527-the girl you took to grass lake , and then out on [Big Bittern]13-big bittern in [that boat]645-that boat last Thursday — [the girl [you]209-mason knew in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus all last year , who lived at [Mrs. Gilpin]294-mrs. gilpin 's and worked under [you]209-mason in [[your]209-mason department at [Griffiths & Company]76-griffiths & company]4530-your department at griffiths & company]4529-the girl you knew in lycurgus all last year , who lived at mrs. gilpin 's and worked under you in your department at griffiths & company — [the girl to whom [you]209-mason gave that toilet set last Christmas]4531-the girl to whom you gave that toilet set last christmas ! [I]185-mason suppose [you]209-mason 're going to say that [your]209-mason name is n't [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde and that [you]209-mason have n't been living with [Mrs. Peyton]233-mrs. peyton in [Taylor Street]39-taylor street , and that these are n't letters and cards from [[your]209-mason trunk]4532-your trunk there — from [Roberta Alden]195-roberta and from [Miss Finchley]295-miss finchley , all these cards and notes . "[185-mason] And extracting the letters and cards as [he]1489-his spoke and waving them before [Clyde]197-clyde . And at each point in this harangue , thrusting [his]1489-his broad face , with its flat , broken nose and somewhat aggressive chin directly before [Clyde]197-clyde 's , and blazing at [him]1489-his with sultry , contemptuous eyes , while [the latter]760-the latter leaned away from [him]1489-his , wincing almost perceptibly and with icy chills running up and down [his]1489-his spine and affecting [his]1489-his heart and brain . Those letters ! All this information concerning [him]1489-his ! And back in [his]1489-his bag in the tent there , all those more recent letters of [Sondra]238-sondra 's in which [she]238-sondra dwelt on how [they]1491-they were to elope together this coming fall . If only [he]1489-his had destroyed them ! And now [this man]749-this man might find those — would — and question [Sondra]238-sondra maybe , and all these others . [He]1489-his shrunk and congealed spiritually , the revealing effects of [his]1489-his so poorly conceived and executed scheme weighing upon [him]1489-his as the world upon the shoulders of [an inadequate Atlas]1493-an inadequate atlas .

And yet , feeling that [he]1489-his must say something and yet not admit anything . And finally replying : " [My]1494-i name 's [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde all right , but the rest of this is n't true . [I]1494-i do n't know anything about the rest of it . "[1494-i]

" Oh , come now , [Mr. Griffiths]197-clyde ! Do n't begin by trying to play fast and loose with [me]1494-i . [We]4533-we wo n't get anywhere that way . [You]197-clyde wo n't help [yourself]197-clyde one bit by that with [me]1494-i , and besides [I]1494-i have n't any time for that now . Remember [these men]4351-these men here are witnesses to what [you]197-clyde say . [I]1494-i 've just come from [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus — [[your]197-clyde room at [Mrs. Peyton's]296-mrs. peyton's]4535-your room at mrs. peyton's — and [I]1494-i have in [my]1494-i possession [your]197-clyde trunk and [this Miss Alden]195-roberta 's letters to [you]197-clyde — indisputable proof that [you]197-clyde did know [this girl]818-this girl , that [you]197-clyde courted and seduced [her]818-this girl last winter , and that since then — this spring — when [she]818-this girl became pregnant on [your]197-clyde account , [you]197-clyde induced [her]818-this girl first to go [home]4141-home and then later to go away with [you]197-clyde on this trip in order , as [you]197-clyde told [her]818-this girl , to marry [her]818-this girl . Well , [you]197-clyde married [her]818-this girl all right — to the grave — that 's how [you]197-clyde married [her]818-this girl — to the water at [the bottom of [Big Bittern Lake]77-big bittern lake]4538-the bottom of big bittern lake ! Well , [I]1494-i 'll be damned ! "[1494-i]

And as [he]1494-i spoke [his]1494-i voice grew so loud that [Clyde]197-clyde feared that it could be clearly heard in [the camp beyond]1495-the camp beyond . And that [Sondra]238-sondra [herself]238-sondra might hear it and come over . "[1494-i]

" Well , [I]185-mason 'll be damned ! "[185-mason] reiterated [Mason]185-mason . " [I]185-mason can well believe now that [you]197-clyde would kill [a girl]4540-a girl and sneak away in just such a way as [you]197-clyde did — and with [her]818-this girl in that condition ! "[197-clyde]

" Very good . But these others from [[your]197-clyde trunk in [the same room]4542-the same room]4541-your trunk in the same room are not from [Miss Alden]195-roberta to [you]197-clyde ? "[185-mason]

" [I]197-clyde do n't care to say as to that , "[197-clyde] [he]197-clyde replied , blinking feebly as [Mason]185-mason waved [Roberta]195-roberta 's letters before [him]197-clyde .

" Tst ! Tst ! Tst ! Of all things , "[185-mason] clicked [Mason]185-mason in high dudgeon . " Such nonsense ! Such effrontery ! Oh , very well , [we]4543-we wo n't worry about all that now . "[1496-i] And then pausing and getting no reply , finally adding : " Why , what a dunce [you]197-clyde are ! — what [a poor plotter]4544-a poor plotter , without even the brains not to use [your]197-clyde own initials in getting up those fake names [you]197-clyde had hoped to masquerade under — [Mr. Carl Graham]297-mr. carl graham — [Mr. Clifford Golden]298-mr. clifford golden ! "[1496-i]

At the same time , fully realizing the importance of a confession and wondering how it was to be brought about here and now , [Mason]185-mason suddenly — [Clyde]197-clyde 's expression , [his]197-clyde frozen - faced terror , suggesting the thought that perhaps [he]197-clyde was too frightened to talk at once changed [his]197-clyde tactics — at least to the extent of lowering [his]197-clyde voice , smoothing the formidable wrinkles from [his]197-clyde forehead and about [his]197-clyde mouth .

" [You]197-clyde see , it 's this way , [Griffiths]197-clyde , "[197-clyde] [he]197-clyde now began , much more calmly and simply . " Lying or just foolish thoughtless denial under such circumstances as these ca n't help [you]197-clyde in the least . It can only harm [you]197-clyde , and that 's the truth . [You]197-clyde may think [I]197-clyde 've been a little rough so far , but it was only because [I]197-clyde 've been under a great strain [myself]197-clyde in connection with this case , trying to catch up with some one [I]197-clyde thought would be a very different type from [yourself]197-clyde . Of course , [I]197-clyde do n't know . [You]197-clyde [yourself]197-clyde ought to be [the best judge]4545-the best judge , but [I]197-clyde 'm laying the thought before [you]197-clyde for what it 's worth . For , of course , here are these letters . Besides , when [we]4546-we get to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay to - morrow , as [we]4546-we will , [I]197-clyde hope , there will be [those three men who met [you]197-clyde the other night walking south from [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]4547-those three men who met you the other night walking south from big bittern . "[197-clyde]

And all this [Clyde]197-clyde registered mentally like a machine clicking to a coin , yet said nothing,—merely staring , frozen .

" And not only that , "[185-mason] went on [Mason]185-mason , very softly and most ingratiatingly , " but there 's [Mrs. Peyton]233-mrs. peyton . Oh , what nonsense ! [You]197-clyde ought to be able to see that for [yourself]197-clyde , whatever [you]197-clyde think . [You]197-clyde certainly ca n't expect to get away with that . It makes a sort of a fool out of [you]197-clyde . [You]197-clyde can see that for [yourself]197-clyde . "[185-mason]

[He]1497-he paused again , hoping for a confession . But [Clyde]197-clyde still convinced that any admission in connection with [Roberta]195-roberta or [Big Bittern]13-big bittern spelled ruin , merely stared while [Mason]185-mason proceeded to add :

" All right , [Griffiths]197-clyde , [I]185-mason 'm now going to tell [you]197-clyde one more thing , and [I]185-mason could n't give [you]197-clyde better advice if [you]197-clyde were [[my]185-mason own son]4557-my own son or [brother]4558-brother and [I]185-mason were trying to get [you]197-clyde out of this instead of merely trying to get [you]197-clyde to tell the truth . If [you]197-clyde hope to do anything at all for [yourself]197-clyde now , it 's not going to help [you]197-clyde to deny everything in the way [you]197-clyde are doing . [You]197-clyde are simply making trouble and condemning [yourself]197-clyde in [other people]4559-other people 's eyes . Why not say that [you]197-clyde did know [her]4560-her and that [you]197-clyde were up there with [her]4560-her and that [she]4560-her wrote [you]197-clyde those letters , and be done with it ? [You]197-clyde ca n't get out of that , whatever else [you]197-clyde may hope to get out of . [Any sane person]4561-any sane person — [[your]197-clyde own mother]4562-your own mother , if [she]4560-her were here — would tell [you]197-clyde the same thing . It 's too ridiculous and indicates guilt rather than innocence . Why not come clean here and now as to those facts , anyhow , before it 's too late to take advantage of any mitigating circumstances in connection with all this — if there are any ? And if [you]197-clyde do now , and [I]185-mason can help [you]197-clyde in any way , [I]185-mason promise [you]197-clyde here and now that [I]185-mason 'll be only too glad to do so . For , after all , [I]185-mason 'm not out here just to hound [a man]4220-a man to death or make [him]4220-a man confess to something that [he]4220-a man has n't done , but merely to get at the truth in the case . But if [you]197-clyde 're going to deny that [you]197-clyde even knew [this girl]818-this girl when [I]185-mason tell [you]197-clyde [I]185-mason have all the evidence and can prove it , why then — "[185-mason] and here [the district attorney]517-the district attorney lifted [his]517-the district attorney hands aloft most wearily and disgustedly .

But now as before [Clyde]197-clyde remained silent and pale . In spite of all [Mason]185-mason had revealed , and all that this seemingly friendly , intimate advice seemed to imply , still [he]197-clyde could not conceive that it would be anything less than disastrous for [him]197-clyde to admit that [he]197-clyde even knew [Roberta]195-roberta . The fatality of such a confession in the eyes of [these others here]1499-these others here . The conclusion of all [his]197-clyde dreams in connection with [Sondra]238-sondra and this life . And so , in the face of this — silence , still . And at this , [Mason]185-mason , irritated beyond measure , finally exclaiming : " Oh , very well , then . So [you]197-clyde 've finally decided not to talk , have [you]197-clyde ? "[185-mason] And [Clyde]197-clyde , blue and weak , replied : " [I]197-clyde had nothing to do with [her]195-roberta death . That 's all [I]197-clyde can say now , "[197-clyde] and yet even as [he]197-clyde said it thinking that perhaps [he]197-clyde had better not say that — that perhaps [he]197-clyde had better say — well , what ? That [he]197-clyde knew [Roberta]195-roberta , of course , had been up there with [her]195-roberta , for that matter — but that [he]197-clyde had never intended to kill [her]195-roberta — that [her]195-roberta drowning was an accident . For [he]197-clyde had not struck [her]195-roberta at all , except by accident , had [he]197-clyde ? Only it was best not to confess to having struck [her]195-roberta at all , was n't it ? For who under such circumstances would believe that [he]197-clyde had struck [her]195-roberta with a camera by accident . Best not to mention the camera , since there was no mention anywhere in the papers that [he]197-clyde had had one with [him]197-clyde .

And [he]197-clyde was still cogitating while [Mason]185-mason was exclaiming : " Then [you]197-clyde admit that [you]197-clyde knew [her]195-roberta ? "[197-clyde]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Very well , then , "[197-clyde] [he]197-clyde now added , turning to [the others]903-the others , " [I]197-clyde suppose there 's nothing for it but to take [him]197-clyde back there and see what [they]903-the others know about [him]197-clyde . And now , swiftly and coldly [he]197-clyde turned , while [Clyde]197-clyde , already shrinking at the horror of what was coming , exclaimed : " Oh , please , no ! [You]197-clyde do n't mean to do that , do [you]197-clyde ? Oh , [you]197-clyde wo n't do that ! Oh , please , no ! "[197-clyde]

"[289-nicholas kraut] " Oh , so that 's the way the wind blows , is it ? "[185-mason] exclaimed [Mason]185-mason at this . "[185-mason] And [he]185-mason paused a moment to see what effect that would have . " [We]4578-we 'll call [all those people]4579-all those people together and explain just how things are , and then see if [you]197-clyde will be willing to stand there and deny everything ! "[185-mason] But noting still a touch of hesitation in [Clyde]197-clyde [he]185-mason now added : " Bring [him]197-clyde along , [boys]4580-boys . " Oh , please , no ! Oh , [I]185-mason hope [you]197-clyde wo n't do anything like that , will [you]197-clyde , [Mr. Mason]209-mason ? "[185-mason] Beads of perspiration once more burst forth on [his]185-mason pale face and hands and [he]185-mason was deadly cold .

" Do n't want to go , eh ? "[209-mason] exclaimed [Mason]209-mason , pausing as [he]209-mason heard this . " It would hurt [your]197-clyde pride , would it , to have ['em]4582-'em know ? Now , will [you]197-clyde answer or wo n't [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason] And again [he]185-mason turned to confront [Clyde]197-clyde , who , with lips trembling and eyes confused and wavering , nervously and emphatically announced :

" Of course [I]197-clyde knew [her]4584-her . Of course [I]197-clyde did . Sure ! Those letters show that . But what of it ? [I]197-clyde did n't kill [her]4584-her . And [I]197-clyde did n't go up there with [her]4584-her with any intention of killing [her]4584-her , either . [I]197-clyde did n't . [I]197-clyde did n't , [I]197-clyde tell [you]197-clyde ! It was all an accident . [I]197-clyde did n't even want to take [her]4584-her up there . [She]4584-her wanted [me]197-clyde to go — to go away with [her]4584-her somewhere , because — because , well [you]197-clyde know — [her]4584-her letters show . And [I]197-clyde was only trying to get [her]4584-her to go off somewhere by [herself]4584-her , so [she]4584-her would let [me]197-clyde alone , because [I]197-clyde did n't want to marry [her]4584-her . That 's all . And [I]197-clyde took [her]4584-her out there , not to kill [her]4584-her at all , but to try to persuade [her]4584-her , that 's all . And [I]197-clyde did n't upset [the boat]4231-the boat — at least , [I]197-clyde did n't mean to . The wind blew [my]197-clyde hat off , and [we]4586-we — [she]4584-her and [I]197-clyde — got up at the same time to reach for it and [the boat]4231-the boat upset — that 's all . And the side of it hit [her]4584-her on the head . [I]197-clyde saw it , only [I]197-clyde was too frightened the way [she]4584-her was struggling about in the water to go near [her]4584-her , because [I]197-clyde was afraid that if [I]197-clyde did [she]4584-her might drag [me]197-clyde down . And then [she]4584-her went down . And [I]197-clyde swam ashore . And that 's the [God]246-god 's truth ! "[197-clyde]

[His]1502-he face , as [he]1502-he talked , had suddenly become all flushed , and [his]1502-he hands also . Yet [his]1502-he eyes were tortured , terrified pools of misery . [He]1502-he was thinking — but maybe there was n't any wind that afternoon and maybe [they]1503-they would find that out . Or the tripod hidden under a log . If [they]1503-they found that , would n't [they]1503-they think [he]1502-he hit [her]1504-her with that ? [He]1502-he was wet and trembling .

But already [Mason]209-mason was beginning to question [him]1502-he again .

" Now , let 's see as to this a minute . [You]1502-he say [you]1502-he did n't take [her]1504-her up there with any intention of killing [her]1504-her ? "[209-mason]

" No , [sir]4137-sir , [I]209-mason did n't . "[209-mason]

" Well , then , how was it that [you]1502-he decided to write [your]1502-he name two different ways on those registers up there at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern and [Grass Lake]21-grass lake ? "[209-mason]

" Because [I]209-mason did n't want [any one]4181-any one to know that [I]209-mason was up there with [her]1504-her . "[209-mason]

" Oh , [I]209-mason see . Did n't want any scandal in connection with the condition [she]1504-her was in ? "[209-mason]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . Yes , [sir]4137-sir , that is . "[209-mason]

" But [you]1502-he did n't mind if [her]1504-her name was scandalized in case [she]1504-her was found afterwards ? "[209-mason]

" But [I]197-clyde did n't know [she]1504-her was going to be drowned , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , slyly and shrewdly , sensing the trap in time .

" But [you]197-clyde did know that [you]197-clyde [yourself]197-clyde were n't coming back , of course . [You]197-clyde knew that , did n't [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" Why , no , [sir]4137-sir , [I]209-mason did n't know that [I]209-mason was n't coming back . [I]209-mason thought [I]209-mason was . "[209-mason]

" Pretty clever . Pretty clever , "[209-mason] thought [Mason]209-mason to [himself]209-mason , but not saying so , and then , rapidly : " And so in order to make everything easy and natural as possible for [you]197-clyde to come back , [you]197-clyde took [your]197-clyde own bag with [you]197-clyde and left hers up there . Is that the way ? How about that ? "[209-mason]

" But [I]209-mason did n't take it because [I]209-mason was going away . [We]4593-we decided to put [our]4593-we lunch in it . "[209-mason]

" [We]4593-we , or [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" [We]4593-we . "[209-mason]

" And so [you]197-clyde had to carry that big bag in order to take a little lunch along , eh ? Could n't [you]197-clyde have taken it in a paper , or in [her]4594-her bag ? "[209-mason]

" Well , [her]4594-her bag was full , and [I]209-mason did n't like to carry anything in a paper . "[209-mason]

" Oh , [I]209-mason see . Too proud and sensitive , eh ? But not too proud to carry a heavy bag all the way , say twelve miles , in the night to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay , and not ashamed to be seen doing it , either , were [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" Well , after [she]4594-her was drowned and [I]209-mason did n't want to be known as having been up there with [her]4594-her , and had to go along — "[209-mason]

[He]1505-he paused while [Mason]209-mason merely looked at [him]1505-he , thinking of the many , many questions [he]209-mason wanted to ask [him]1505-he — so many , many more , and which , as [he]209-mason knew or guessed , would be impossible for [him]209-mason to explain . Yet it was getting late , and back in [the camp]1304-the camp were [Clyde]197-clyde 's as yet unclaimed belongings — [his]197-clyde bag and possibly that suit [he]197-clyde had worn that day at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern — a gray one as [he]209-mason had heard — not this one . And to catechize [him]197-clyde here this way in the dusk , while it might be productive of much if only [he]197-clyde could continue it long enough , still there was the trip back , and en route [he]197-clyde would have ample time to continue [his]197-clyde questionings .

And so , although [he]1505-he disliked much so to do at the moment , [he]1505-he now concluded with : " Oh , well , [I]1505-he tell [you]209-mason , [Griffiths]197-clyde , [we]4595-we 'll let [you]209-mason rest here for the present . It may be that what [you]209-mason are saying is so — [I]1505-he do n't know . [I]1505-he most certainly hope it is , for [your]209-mason sake . At any rate , [you]209-mason go along there with [Mr. Kraut]290-kraut . [He]290-kraut 'll show [you]209-mason where to go . "[1505-he]

And then turning to [Swenk]284-swenk and [Kraut]290-kraut , [he]1505-he exclaimed : " All right , [boys]4580-boys . [I]1505-he 'll tell [you]4580-boys how [we]4595-we 'll do . It 's getting late and [we]4595-we 'll have to hurry a little if [we]4595-we expect to get anywhere yet tonight . [Mr. Kraut]290-kraut , suppose [you]209-mason take [this young man]4597-this young man down where [those other two boats]4598-those other two boats are and wait there . Just halloo a little as [you]209-mason go along to notify [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff and [Sissel]283-sissel that [we]4595-we 're ready . And then [Swenk]284-swenk and [I]1505-he 'll be along in [the other boat]4600-the other boat as soon as [we]4595-we can . "[1505-he]

And so saying and [Kraut]290-kraut obeying , [he]1505-he and [Swenk]284-swenk proceeded inward through the gathering dusk to [the camp]1304-the camp , while [Kraut]290-kraut with [Clyde]197-clyde went [west]1508-west , hallooing for [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff and [[his]4144-the sheriff deputy]1510-his deputy until a response was had .

The effect of [Mason]209-mason 's re - appearance in [the camp]1304-the camp with the news , announced first to [Frank Harriet]249-frank , next to [Harley Baggott]259-harley baggott and [Grant Cranston]253-grant , that [Clyde]197-clyde was under arrest — that [he]197-clyde actually had confessed to having been with [Roberta]195-roberta at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , if not to having killed [her]195-roberta , and that [he]209-mason , [Mason]209-mason , was there with [Swenk]284-swenk to take possession of [[his]209-mason property]1512-his property — was sufficient to destroy this pretty outing as by a breath . For although amazement and disbelief and astounded confusion were characteristic of the words of all , nevertheless here was [Mason]209-mason demanding to know where were [Clyde]197-clyde 's things , and asserting that it was at [Clyde]197-clyde 's request only that [he]197-clyde was not brought here to identify [his]197-clyde own possessions .

[Frank Harriet]249-frank , [the most practical of [the group]1514-the group]1513-the most practical of the group , sensing the truth and authority of this , at once led the way to [[Clyde]197-clyde 's tent]1515-clyde 's tent , where [Mason]209-mason began an examination of the contents of the bag and clothes , while [Grant Cranston]253-grant , as well as [Baggott]259-harley baggott , aware of [Sondra]238-sondra 's intense interest in [Clyde]197-clyde , departed first to call [Stuart]256-stuart , then [Bertine]252-bertine , and finally [Sondra]238-sondra — moving apart from the rest the more secretly to inform [her]238-sondra as to what was then occurring . And [she]238-sondra , following the first clear understanding as to this , turning white and fainting at the news , falling back in [Grant]253-grant 's arms and being carried to [[her]238-sondra tent]1516-her tent , where , after being restored to consciousness , [she]238-sondra exclaimed : " [I]238-sondra do n't believe a word of it ! It 's not true ! Why , it could n't be ! [That poor boy]4601-that poor boy ! Oh , [Clyde]197-clyde ! Where is [he]197-clyde ? Where have [they]903-the others taken [him]197-clyde ? "[238-sondra] But [Stuart]256-stuart and [Grant]253-grant , by no means as emotionally moved as [herself]238-sondra , cautioning [her]238-sondra to be silent . It might be true at that . Supposing it were ! [The others]903-the others would hear , would n't [they]903-the others ? And supposing it weren't — [he]1518-he could soon prove [his]1518-he innocence and be released , could n't [he]1518-he ? There was no use in carrying on like this now .

But then , [Sondra]238-sondra in [her]238-sondra thoughts going over the bare possibility of such a thing — [a girl killed by [Clyde]197-clyde at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]1519-a girl killed by clyde at big bittern — [himself]1518-he arrested and being taken off in this way — and [she]238-sondra thus publicly — or at least by [this group]1344-this group — known to be so interested in [[him,—her]197-clyde parents]1521-him,—her parents to know , [the public itself]1522-the public itself to know — maybe —

But [Clyde]197-clyde must be innocent . It must be all a mistake . And then [her]238-sondra mind turning back and thinking of that news of [the drowned girl [she]238-sondra had first heard over the telephone there at [the Harriets ']237-the harriets]1523-the drowned girl she had first heard over the telephone there at the harriets ' . And then [Clyde]197-clyde 's whiteness — [his]197-clyde illness — [his]197-clyde all but complete collapse . Oh , no!—not that ! Yet [his]197-clyde delay in coming from [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus until the Friday before . [His]197-clyde failure to write from [there]650-there . And then , the full horror of the charge returning , as suddenly collapsing again , lying perfectly still and white while [Grant]253-grant and [the others]903-the others agreed among [themselves]1526-themselves that the best thing to be done was to break up [the camp]1304-the camp , either now or early in the morning , and depart for [Sharon]25-sharon .

And [Sondra]238-sondra returning to consciousness after a time tearfully announcing that [she]238-sondra must get out of [here]4244-here at once , that [she]238-sondra could n't " endure [this place]1062-this place , "[238-sondra] and begging [Bertine]252-bertine and all [the others]903-the others to stay close to [her]238-sondra and say nothing about [her]238-sondra having fainted and cried , since it would only create talk . And thinking all the time of how , if this were all true , [she]238-sondra could secure those letters [she]238-sondra had written [him]197-clyde ! Oh , heavens ! For supposing now at this time they should fall into the hands of [the police]1292-the police or the newspapers , and be published ? And yet moved by [her]238-sondra love for [him]197-clyde and for the first time in [her]238-sondra young life shaken to the point where the grim and stern realities of life were thrust upon [her]238-sondra gay and vain notice .

And so it was immediately arranged that [she]238-sondra leave with [Stuart]256-stuart , [Bertine]252-bertine and [Grant]253-grant for the Metissic Inn at [the eastern end of [the Lake]69-the lake]1531-the eastern end of the lake , since from there , at dawn , according to [Baggott]259-harley baggott , [they]1532-they might leave for [Albany]28-albany — and so , in a roundabout way for [Sharon]25-sharon .

In the meantime , [Mason]209-mason , after obtaining possession of all [Clyde]197-clyde 's belongings here , quickly making [his]197-clyde way west to [Little Fish Inlet]70-little fish inlet and [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay , stopping only for the first night at [a farmhouse]1533-a farmhouse and arriving at [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay late on Tuesday night . Yet not without , en route , catechizing [Clyde]197-clyde as [he]197-clyde had planned , the more particularly since in going through [his]197-clyde effects in [the tent at [the camp]1304-the camp]1534-the tent at the camp [he]197-clyde had not found the gray suit said to have been worn by [Clyde]197-clyde at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern .

And [Clyde]197-clyde , troubled by this new development , denying that [he]197-clyde had worn a gray suit and insisting that the suit [he]197-clyde had on was the one [he]197-clyde had worn .

" But was n't it thoroughly soaked ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes . "[197-clyde]

" Well , then , where was it cleaned and pressed afterward ? "[197-clyde]

" In [Sharon]25-sharon . "[197-clyde]

" In [Sharon]25-sharon ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" By [a tailor there]4604-a tailor there ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" [What tailor]4606-what tailor ? "[197-clyde]

" Then [you]4137-sir wore it crumpled and wet , did [you]4137-sir , from [Big Bittern]13-big bittern to [Sharon]25-sharon ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" And [no one]4176-no one noticed it , of course . "[197-clyde]

" Not that [you]4137-sir remember , eh ? Well , [we]4609-we 'll see about that later , "[197-clyde] and deciding that unquestionably [Clyde]197-clyde was [a plotter]1536-a plotter and [a murderer]1310-a murderer . Also that eventually [he]197-clyde could make [Clyde]197-clyde show where [he]197-clyde had hidden the suit or had had it cleaned .

Next there was the straw hat found on [the lake]571-the lake . What about that ? By admitting that the wind had blown [his]197-clyde hat off , [Clyde]197-clyde had intimated that [he]197-clyde had worn a hat on [the lake]571-the lake , but not necessarily the straw hat found on [the water]1009-the water . But now [Mason]209-mason was intent on establishing within hearing of [these witnesses]1541-these witnesses , the ownership of the hat found on [the water]1009-the water as well as the existence of a second hat worn later .

" That straw hat of [yours]4137-sir that [you]4137-sir say the wind blew in [the water]1009-the water ? [You]4137-sir did n't try to get that either at the time , did [you]4137-sir ? "[197-clyde]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]
