" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" But just the same , [you]4137-sir had another straw hat when [you]4137-sir went down through [the woods]632-the woods there . Where did [you]4137-sir get that one ? "[197-clyde]

And [Clyde]197-clyde , trapped and puzzled by this pausing for the fraction of a second , frightened and wondering whether or not it could be proved that this second straw hat [he]197-clyde was wearing was the one [he]197-clyde had worn through [the woods]632-the woods . Also whether the one on [the water]1009-the water had been purchased in [Utica]30-utica , as it had . And then deciding to lie . " But [I]209-mason did n't have another straw hat . "[209-mason] Without paying any attention to that , [Mason]209-mason reached over and took the straw hat on [Clyde]197-clyde 's head and proceeded to examine the lining with its imprint — [Stark & Company]79-stark & company , [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus .

" This one has a lining , [I]209-mason see . Bought this in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , eh ? "[209-mason]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" When ? "[209-mason]

" Oh , back in June . "[197-clyde]

" But still [you]209-mason 're sure now it 's not the one [you]209-mason wore down through [the woods]632-the woods that night ? "[209-mason]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Well , where was it then ? "[209-mason]

And [Clyde]197-clyde once more pausing like [one in a trap]1545-one in a trap and thinking : [[My]0-i God]4257-my god ! How am [I]0-i to explain this now ? Why did [I]0-i admit that the one on [the lake]571-the lake was [mine]0-i ? Yet , as instantly recalling that whether [he]197-clyde had denied it or not , there were those at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake and [Big Bittern]13-big bittern who would remember that [he]197-clyde had worn a straw hat on [the lake]571-the lake , of course .

" Where was it then ? "[209-mason] insisted [Mason]209-mason .

And [Clyde]197-clyde at last saying : " Oh , [I]197-clyde was up [here]4244-here once before and wore it then . [I]197-clyde forgot it when [I]197-clyde went down the last time but [I]197-clyde found it again the other day . "[197-clyde]

" Oh , [I]197-clyde see . Very convenient , [I]197-clyde must say . "[197-clyde] [He]197-clyde was beginning to believe that [he]197-clyde had [a very slippery person to deal with]1549-a very slippery person to deal with indeed — that [he]197-clyde must think of [his]197-clyde traps more shrewdly , and at the same time determining to summon [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons and [every member of [the Bear Lake party]1551-the bear lake party]1550-every member of the bear lake party in order to discover , whether any recalled [Clyde]197-clyde not wearing a straw hat on [his]197-clyde arrival this time , also whether [he]197-clyde had left a straw hat the time before . [He]197-clyde was lying , of course , and [he]197-clyde would catch [him]197-clyde .

And so no real peace for [Clyde]197-clyde at any time between [there]650-there and [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg and [the county jail]1553-the county jail . For however much [he]197-clyde might refuse to answer , still [Mason]209-mason was forever jumping at [him]197-clyde with such questions as : Why was it if all [you]197-clyde wanted to do was to eat lunch on [shore]1422-shore that [you]197-clyde had to row all the way down to [that extreme south end of [the lake]571-the lake]1555-that extreme south end of the lake when it is n't nearly so attractive there as it is at other points ? And : Where was it that [you]197-clyde spent the rest of that afternoon — surely not just there ? And then , jumping back to [Sondra]238-sondra 's letters discovered in [his]197-clyde bag . How long had [he]197-clyde known [her]238-sondra ? Was [he]197-clyde as much in love with [her]238-sondra as [she]238-sondra appeared to be with [him]197-clyde ? Was n't it because of [her]238-sondra promise to marry [him]197-clyde in the fall that [he]197-clyde had decided to kill [Miss Alden]195-roberta ?

But while [Clyde]197-clyde vehemently troubled to deny this last charge , still for the most part [he]197-clyde gazed silently and miserably before [him]197-clyde with [his]197-clyde tortured and miserable eyes .

And then a most wretched night spent in [the garret of [a farmhouse at]1558-a farmhouse at [the west end of [the lake]571-the lake]1559-the west end of the lake]1557-the garret of a farmhouse at the west end of the lake , and on a pallet on the floor , while [Sissel]283-sissel , [Swenk]284-swenk and [Kraut]290-kraut , gun in hand , in turn kept watch over [him]197-clyde , and [Mason]209-mason and [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff and [the others]903-the others slept below stairs . And [some natives]1563-some natives , because of information distributed somehow , coming toward morning to inquire : " [We]1563-some natives hear [the feller that killed [the girl]4152-the girl]4618-the feller that killed the girl over to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern is here — is that right ? "[1563-some natives] And then waiting to see [them]1563-some natives off at dawn in [the Fords secured by [Mason]209-mason]1564-the fords secured by mason .

And again at [Little Fish Inlet]70-little fish inlet as well as [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay , [actual crowds]1565-actual crowds — [farmers]1566-farmers , [store - keepers]1567-store - keepers , [summer residents]1568-summer residents , [woodsmen]551-woodsmen , [children]1570-children — all gathered because of word telephoned on ahead apparently . And at [the latter place]1571-the latter place , [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , [Heit]1572-heit and [Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , who , because of previously telephoned information , had brought before one [Gabriel Gregg]299-gabriel gregg , [a most lanky and crusty and meticulous justice of the peace]1573-a most lanky and crusty and meticulous justice of the peace , all of [the individuals from [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]1574-the individuals from big bittern necessary to identify [him]299-gabriel gregg fully . And now [Mason]209-mason , before this local justice , charging [Clyde]197-clyde with the death of [Roberta]195-roberta and having [him]197-clyde properly and legally held as [a material witness]1575-a material witness to be lodged in [the county jail at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]1576-the county jail at bridgeburg . And then taking [him]197-clyde , along with [Burton]211-burton burleigh , [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff and [[his]4144-the sheriff deputies]1350-his deputies , to [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , where [he]197-clyde was promptly locked up .

And once [there]650-there , [Clyde]197-clyde throwing [himself]197-clyde on the iron cot and holding [his]197-clyde head in a kind of agony of despair . It was three o'clock in the morning , and just outside [the jail]1580-the jail as [they]1581-they approached [he]197-clyde had seen [a crowd of at least five hundred]1582-a crowd of at least five hundred — noisy , jeering , threatening . [For]300-for had not the news been forwarded that because of [his]197-clyde desire to marry [a rich girl [he]197-clyde had most brutally assaulted and murdered a young and charming working - girl whose only fault had been that [she]1583-a rich girl he had most brutally assaulted and murdered a young and charming working - girl whose only fault had been that she loved him too well loved [him]197-clyde too well]1583-a rich girl he had most brutally assaulted and murdered a young and charming working - girl whose only fault had been that she loved him too well . There had been hard and threatening cries of " There [he]197-clyde is , [the dirty bastard]4620-the dirty bastard ! [You]4621-you 'll swing for this yet , [you]4621-you young devil , wait and see ! "[197-clyde] This from [a young woodsman not unlike [Swenk]284-swenk in type]1584-a young woodsman not unlike swenk in type — a hard , destroying look in [his]197-clyde fierce young eyes , leaning out from [the crowd]1585-the crowd . And worse , [a waspish type of small - town slum girl , dressed in a gingham dress , who in the dim light of the arcs]1586-a waspish type of small - town slum girl , dressed in a gingham dress , who in the dim light of the arcs , had leaned forward to cry : " Lookit , [the dirty little sneak]4622-the dirty little sneak — [the murderer]668-the murderer ! [You]4621-you thought [you]4621-you 'd get away with it , didnja ? "[197-clyde]

And [Clyde]197-clyde , crowding closer to [Sheriff Slack]287-slack , and thinking : Why , [they]1587-they actually think [I]0-i did kill [her]1583-a rich girl he had most brutally assaulted and murdered a young and charming working - girl whose only fault had been that she loved him too well ! And [they]1587-they may even lynch [me]0-i ! But so weary and confused and debased and miserable that at the sight of the outer steel jail door swinging open to receive [him]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde actually gave vent to a sigh of relief because of the protection it afforded .

But once in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell , suffering none the less without cessation the long night through , from thoughts — thoughts concerning all that had just gone . [Sondra]238-sondra ! [the Griffiths]1291-the griffiths ! [Bertine]252-bertine . [All those people in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus]1590-all those people in lycurgus when [they]1590-all those people in lycurgus should hear in the morning . [[His]197-clyde mother]688-his mother eventually , [everybody]1260-everybody . Where was [Sondra]238-sondra now ? For [Mason]209-mason had told [her]688-his mother , of course , and all those others , when [he]209-mason had gone back to secure [his]209-mason things . And [they]1587-they knew [him]209-mason now for what [he]209-mason was — a plotter of murder ! Only , only , if [somebody]1593-somebody could only know how it had all come about ! If [Sondra]238-sondra , [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , [any one]4181-any one , could truly see !

Perhaps if [he]209-mason were to explain all to [this man]749-this man [Mason]209-mason now , before it all went any further , exactly how it all had happened . But that meant a true explanation as to [his]209-mason plot , [his]209-mason real original intent , that camera , [his]209-mason swimming away . That unintended blow—(and who was going to believe [him]209-mason as to that)—his hiding the tripod afterwards . Besides once all that was known would [he]209-mason not be done for just the same in connection with [Sondra]238-sondra , [the Griffiths]197-clyde — [everybody]1260-everybody . And very likely prosecuted and executed for murder just the same . Oh , heavens — murder . And to be tried for that now ; this terrible crime against [her]688-his mother proved . [They]1587-they would electrocute [him]209-mason just the same — would n't [they]1587-they ? And then the full horror of that coming upon [him]209-mason , — death , possibly — and for murder — [he]209-mason sat there quite still . [Death]301-death ! God ! If only [he]209-mason had not left those letters written [him]209-mason by [Roberta]195-roberta and [[his]209-mason mother]688-his mother in [[his]209-mason room]928-his room there at [[Mrs. Peyton]233-mrs. peyton 's]1600-mrs. peyton 's . If only [he]209-mason had removed [his]209-mason trunk to [another room]1601-another room , say , before [he]209-mason left . Why had n't [he]209-mason thought of that ? Yet as instantly thinking , might not that have been a mistake , too , being seemingly a suspicious thing to have done then ? But how came [they]1587-they to know where [he]209-mason was from and what [his]209-mason name was ? Then , as instantly returning in mind to the letters in the trunk . For , as [he]209-mason now recalled , in one of those letters from [[his]209-mason mother]688-his mother [she]688-his mother had mentioned that affair in [Kansas City]45-kansas city , and [Mason]209-mason would come to know of that . If only [he]209-mason had destroyed them . [Roberta]195-roberta 's , [[his]209-mason mother]688-his mother 's , all ! Why had n't [he]209-mason ? But not being able to answer why — just an insane desire to keep things maybe — anything that related to [him]209-mason — a kindness , a tenderness toward [him]209-mason . If only [he]209-mason had not worn that second straw hat — had not met [those three men in [the woods]632-the woods]1604-those three men in the woods ! [God]246-god ! [He]209-mason might have known [they]1604-those three men in the woods would be able to trace [him]209-mason in some way . If only [he]209-mason had gone on in [that wood at [Bear Lake]50-bear lake]1606-that wood at bear lake , taking [his]209-mason suit case and [Sondra]238-sondra 's letters with [him]209-mason . Perhaps , perhaps , who knows , in [Boston]64-boston , or [New York]63-new york , or somewhere [he]209-mason might have hidden away .

Unstrung and agonized , [he]209-mason was unable to sleep at all , but walked back and forth , or sat on the side of the hard and strange cot , thinking , thinking . And at dawn , [a bony , aged , rheumy jailer , in a baggy , worn , blue uniform , bearing a black , iron tray , on which was a tinful of coffee , some bread and a piece of ham with one egg]1607-a bony , aged , rheumy jailer , in a baggy , worn , blue uniform , bearing a black , iron tray , on which was a tinful of coffee , some bread and a piece of ham with one egg . And looking curiously and yet somehow indifferently at [Clyde]197-clyde , while [he]209-mason forced it through an aperture only wide and high enough for its admission , though [Clyde]197-clyde wanted nothing at all .

And then later [Kraut]290-kraut and [Sissel]283-sissel and [Swenk]284-swenk , and eventually [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff [himself]4144-the sheriff , [each coming separately]1609-each coming separately , to look in and say : " Well , [Griffiths]197-clyde , how are [you]197-clyde this morning ? "[4144-the sheriff] or , " Hello , anything [we]1610-their can do for [you]197-clyde ? "[4144-the sheriff] , while [their]1610-their eyes showed the astonishment , disgust , suspicion or horror with which [his]4144-the sheriff assumed crime had filled [them]1610-their . Yet , even in the face of that , having one type of interest and even sycophantic pride in [his]4144-the sheriff presence [here]4244-here . For was [he]4144-the sheriff not a [Griffiths]197-clyde — [a member of the well - known social group of the big central cities to [the south of here]1613-the south of here]1612-a member of the well - known social group of the big central cities to the south of here . Also the same to [them]1610-their , as well as to [the enormously fascinated public outside]1614-the enormously fascinated public outside , as a trapped and captured animal , taken in [their]1610-their legal net by [their]1610-their own superlative skill and now held as witness to it ? And with the newspapers and [people certain to talk]1615-people certain to talk , enormous publicity for [them]1610-their — [their]1610-their pictures in the papers as well as [his]4144-the sheriff , [their]1610-their names persistently linked with [his]4144-the sheriff .

And [Clyde]197-clyde , looking at [them]1610-their between the bars , attempted to be civil , since [he]197-clyde was now in [their]1610-their hands and [they]1610-their could do with [him]197-clyde as [they]1610-their would .

In connection with the autopsy and its results there was a decided set - back . For while the joint report of [the five doctors]1616-the five doctors showed : " An injury to the mouth and nose ; the tip of the nose appears to have been slightly flattened , the lips swollen , one front tooth slightly loosened , and an abrasion of the mucous membrane within the lips"—all[1616-the five doctors] agreed that these injuries were by no means fatal . The chief injury was to the skull ( the very thing which [Clyde]197-clyde in [his]197-clyde first confession had maintained ) , which appeared to have been severely bruised by a blow of " some sharp instrument , "[1616-the five doctors] unfortunately in this instance , because of the heaviness of the blow of [the boat]4231-the boat , " signs of fracture and internal haemorrhage which might have produced death . "[1616-the five doctors]

But — the lungs when placed in water , sinking — an absolute proof that [Roberta]195-roberta could not have been dead when thrown into the water , but alive and drowning , as [Clyde]197-clyde had maintained . And no other signs of violence or struggle , although [her]195-roberta arms and fingers appeared to be set in such a way as to indicate that [she]195-roberta might have been reaching or seeking to grasp something . [The wale of [the boat]4231-the boat]1618-the wale of the boat ? Could that be ? Might [Clyde]197-clyde 's story , after all , conceal a trace of truth ? Certainly these circumstances seemed to favor [him]197-clyde a little . Yet as [Mason]209-mason and [the others]903-the others agreed , all these circumstances most distinctly seemed to prove that although [he]197-clyde might not have slain [her]195-roberta outright before throwing [her]195-roberta into [the water]1009-the water , none the less [he]197-clyde had struck [her]195-roberta and then had thrown [her]195-roberta , perhaps unconscious , into [the water]1009-the water .

But with what ? If [he]197-clyde could but make [Clyde]197-clyde say that !

And then an inspiration ! [He]197-clyde would take [Clyde]197-clyde and , although the law specifically guaranteed [accused persons]1623-accused persons against compulsions , compel [him]197-clyde to retrace the scenes of [his]197-clyde crime . And although [he]197-clyde might not be able to make [him]197-clyde commit [himself]197-clyde in any way , still , once on the ground and facing the exact scene of [his]197-clyde crime , [his]197-clyde actions might reveal something of the whereabouts of the suit , perhaps , or possibly some instrument with which [he]197-clyde had struck [her]195-roberta .

And in consequence , on the third day following [Clyde]197-clyde 's incarceration , a second visit to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , with [Kraut]290-kraut , [Heit]192-heit , [Mason]209-mason , [Burton]211-burton burleigh , [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb and [Sheriff Slack]287-slack as [[his]197-clyde companions]559-his companions , and a slow re - canvassing of all the ground [he]197-clyde had first traveled on that dreadful day . And with [Kraut]290-kraut , following instructions from [Mason]209-mason , " playing up "[290-kraut] to [him]197-clyde , in order to ingratiate [himself]197-clyde into [his]197-clyde good graces , and possibly cause [him]197-clyde to make a clean breast of it . For [Kraut]290-kraut was to argue that the evidence , so far was so convincing that [you]1625-you " never would get [a jury]4553-a jury to believe that [you]1625-you did n't do it , "[197-clyde] but that , " if [you]1625-you would talk right out to [Mason]209-mason , [he]209-mason could do more for [you]1625-you with [the judge]4625-the judge and [the governor]4626-the governor than [any one]4181-any one could — get [you]1625-you off , maybe , with life or twenty years , while this way [you]1625-you 're likely to get the chair , sure . "[290-kraut]

Yet [Clyde]197-clyde , because of that same fear that had guided [him]197-clyde at [Bear Lake]50-bear lake , maintaining a profound silence . For why should [he]197-clyde say that [he]197-clyde had struck [her]1626-her , when [he]197-clyde had not — intentionally at least ? Or with what , since no thought of the camera had come up as yet .

At [the lake]571-the lake , after definite measurements by [the county surveyor]1628-the county surveyor as to the distance from the spot where [Roberta]195-roberta had drowned to [the spot where [Clyde]197-clyde had landed]1629-the spot where clyde had landed , [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb suddenly returning to [Mason]209-mason with an important discovery . For under a log not so far from the spot at which [Clyde]197-clyde had stood to remove [his]197-clyde wet clothes , the tripod [he]197-clyde had hidden , a little rusty and damp , but of sufficient weight , as [Mason]209-mason and [all these others]1630-all these others were now ready to believe , to have delivered the blow upon [Roberta]195-roberta 's skull which had felled [her]195-roberta and so make it possible for [him]197-clyde to carry [her]195-roberta to [the boat]4231-the boat and later drown [her]195-roberta . Yet , confronted with this and turning paler than before , [Clyde]197-clyde denying that [he]197-clyde had a camera or a tripod with [him]197-clyde , although [Mason]209-mason was instantly deciding that [he]209-mason would re - question [all witnesses]1632-all witnesses to find out whether any recalled seeing a tripod or camera in [Clyde]197-clyde 's possession .

And before the close of this same day learning from [the guide who had driven [Clyde]197-clyde and [Roberta]195-roberta]1633-the guide who had driven clyde and roberta over , as well as [the boatman who had seen [Clyde]197-clyde drop [his]197-clyde bag into [the boat]4231-the boat]1634-the boatman who had seen clyde drop his bag into the boat , and [a young waitress at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake who had seen [Clyde]197-clyde and [Roberta]195-roberta going out from [the inn]503-the inn to [the station]4149-the station on the morning of [their]1639-their departure from [Grass Lake]21-grass lake]1636-a young waitress at grass lake who had seen clyde and roberta going out from the inn to the station on the morning of their departure from grass lake , that all now recalled a " yellow bundle of sticks , "[1634-the boatman who had seen clyde drop his bag into the boat] fastened to [his]197-clyde bag which must have been the very tripod .

And then [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh deciding that it might not really have been the tripod , after all with which [he]197-clyde had struck [her]195-roberta but possibly and even probably the somewhat heavier body of the camera itself , since an edge of it would explain the wound on the top of the head and the flat surface would explain the general wounds on [her]195-roberta face . And because of this conclusion , without any knowledge on the part of [Clyde]197-clyde , however , [Mason]209-mason securing [divers]1640-divers from among [the woodsmen of [the region]1359-the region]1641-the woodsmen of the region and setting [them]1640-divers to diving in the immediate vicinity of [the spot where [Roberta]195-roberta 's body had been found]1643-the spot where roberta 's body had been found , with the result that after an entire day 's diving on the part of six — and because of a promised and substantial reward , one [Jack Bogart]302-jack bogart arose with the very camera which [Clyde]197-clyde , as [the boat]4231-the boat had turned over , had let fall . Worse , after examination it proved to contain a roll of films , which upon being submitted to [an expert chemist for development]1645-an expert chemist for development , showed finally to be a series of pictures of [Roberta]195-roberta , made on [shore]1422-shore — one sitting on a log , a second posed by the side of [the boat]4231-the boat on [shore]1422-shore , a third reaching up toward the branches of a tree — all very dim and water - soaked but still decipherable . And the exact measurements of the broadest side of the camera corresponding in a general way to the length and breadth of the wounds upon [Roberta]195-roberta 's face , which caused it now to seem positive that [they]1640-divers had discovered the implement wherewith [Clyde]197-clyde had delivered the blows .

Yet no trace of blood upon the camera itself . And none upon the side or bottom of [the boat]4231-the boat , which had been brought to [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg for examination . And none upon the rug which had lain in the bottom of [the boat]4231-the boat .

In [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh there existed as sly [a person]1651-a person as might have been found in [a score of such backwoods counties as this]1652-a score of such backwoods counties as this , and soon [he]1651-a person found [himself]1651-a person meditating on how easy it would be , supposing irrefragable evidence were necessary , for [him]1651-a person or [any one]4181-any one to cut a finger and let it bleed on the rug or the side of [the boat]4231-the boat or the edge of the camera . Also , how easy to take from the head of [Roberta]195-roberta two or three hairs and thread them between the sides of the camera , or about the rowlock to which [her]195-roberta veil had been attached . And after due and secret meditation , [he]1651-a person actually deciding to visit [the Lutz Brothers morgue]1655-the lutz brothers morgue and secure a few threads of [Roberta]195-roberta 's hair . For [he]1651-a person [himself]1651-a person was convinced that [Clyde]197-clyde had murdered [the girl]4152-the girl in cold blood . And for want of a bit of incriminating proof , was such [a young , silent , vain crook as this]1657-a young , silent , vain crook as this to be allowed to escape ? Not if [he]1651-a person [himself]1651-a person had to twine the hairs about the rowlock or inside the lid of the camera , and then call [Mason]209-mason 's attention to them as something overlooked !

And in consequence , upon the same day that [Heit]192-heit and [Mason]209-mason were personally re - measuring the wounds upon [Roberta]195-roberta 's face and head , [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh slyly threading two of [Roberta]195-roberta 's hairs in between the door and the lens of the camera , so that [Mason]209-mason and [Heit]192-heit a little while later unexpectedly coming upon [them]1658-them , and wondering why [they]1658-them had not seen [them]1658-them before — nevertheless accepting [them]1658-them immediately as conclusive evidence of [Clyde]197-clyde 's guilt . Indeed , [Mason]209-mason thereupon announcing that in so far as [he]209-mason was concerned , [his]209-mason case was complete . [He]209-mason had truly traced out every step in this crime and if need be was prepared to go to trial on the morrow .

Yet , because of the very completeness of the testimony , deciding for the present , at least , not to say anything in connection with the camera — to seal , if possible , the mouth of [every one who knew]1659-every one who knew . For , assuming that [Clyde]197-clyde persisted in denying that [he]197-clyde had carried a camera , or that [[his]197-clyde own lawyer]1660-his own lawyer should be unaware of the existence of such evidence , then how damning in [court]4347-court , and out of a clear sky , to produce this camera , these photographs of [Roberta]195-roberta made by [him]197-clyde , and the proof that the very measurements of one side of the camera coincided with the size of the wounds upon [her]195-roberta face ! How complete ! How incriminating !

Also since [he]197-clyde personally having gathered the testimony was the one best fitted to present it , [he]197-clyde decided to communicate with [the governor of [the state]1663-the state]1662-the governor of the state for the purpose of obtaining a special term of [the Supreme Court for [this district]1665-this district]1664-the supreme court for this district , with [[its]1664-the supreme court for this district accompanying special session of [the local grand jury]1667-the local grand jury]1666-its accompanying special session of the local grand jury , which would then be subject to [his]197-clyde call at any time . For with this granted , [he]197-clyde would be able to impanel [a grand jury]1668-a grand jury and in the event of a true bill being returned against [Clyde]197-clyde , then within a month or six weeks , proceed to trial . Strictly to [himself]197-clyde , however , [he]197-clyde kept the fact that in view of [his]197-clyde own approaching nomination in the ensuing November election this should all prove most opportune , since in the absence of any such special term the case could not possibly be tried before the succeeding regular January term of [the Supreme]1669-the supreme [Court]80-court , by which time [he]197-clyde would be out of office and although possibly elected to [the local judgeship]1670-the local judgeship still not able to try the case in person . And in view of the state of public opinion , which was most bitterly and vigorously anti - [Clyde]197-clyde , a quick trial would seem fair and logical to [every one in [this local world]1672-this local world]1671-every one in this local world . For why delay ? Why permit [such a criminal]1673-such a criminal to sit about and speculate on some plan of escape ? And especially when [his]197-clyde trial by [him]197-clyde , [Mason]209-mason , was certain to rebound to [his]197-clyde legal and political and social fame [the country]635-the country over .

And then out of [the north woods]573-the north woods a crime sensation of the first magnitude , with all of those intriguingly colorful , and yet morally and spiritually atrocious , elements — love , romance , wealth ; poverty , death . And at once picturesque accounts of where and how [Clyde]197-clyde had lived in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , with whom [he]197-clyde had been connected , how [he]197-clyde had managed to conceal [his]197-clyde relations with [one girl]1676-one girl while obviously planning to elope with another — being wired for and published by [that type of editor]1677-that type of editor so quick to sense the national news value of crimes such as this . And telegrams of inquiry pouring in from [New York]63-new york , [Chicago]43-chicago , [Boston]64-boston , [Philadelphia]81-philadelphia , [San Francisco]82-san francisco and [other large American cities east and west]1678-other large american cities east and west , either to [Mason]209-mason direct or [the representatives of [the Associated or United Press]1680-the associated or united press in [this area]1681-this area]1679-the representatives of the associated or united press in this area , asking for further and more complete details of the crime . Who was [this beautiful wealthy girl with whom it was said this [Griffiths]197-clyde was in love]1682-this beautiful wealthy girl with whom it was said this griffiths was in love ? But [Roberta]195-roberta 's letters on the other hand being described in detail , — even excerpts of some of them — the more poetic and gloomy being furnished the Press for use , for who was there to protect [her]1682-this beautiful wealthy girl with whom it was said this griffiths was in love . Was not hanging too good for [him]197-clyde ? For en route to and from [Bear Lake]50-bear lake , as well as since , [Mason]209-mason had pored over these letters . And then [a particularly romantic young reporter from The Star]1692-a particularly romantic young reporter from the star , of [Utica]30-utica arriving at [the home of [the Aldens]217-the aldens]1693-the home of the aldens , there was immediately given to [the world]1694-the world a fairly accurate picture of the weary and defeated [Mrs. Alden]187-mrs. alden , who , too exhausted to protest or complain , merely contented [herself]187-mrs. alden with a sincere and graphic picture of [Roberta]195-roberta 's devotion to [[her]195-roberta parents]4219-her parents , [her]195-roberta simple ways of living , [her]195-roberta modesty , morality , religious devotion — how once [the local pastor of [the Methodist Church]1697-the methodist church]1696-the local pastor of the methodist church had said that [she]195-roberta was [the brightest and prettiest and kindest girl [he]1696-the local pastor of the methodist church had ever known]1698-the brightest and prettiest and kindest girl he had ever known , and how for years before leaving [home]4141-home [she]195-roberta had been as [[her]195-roberta mother]752-her mother 's own right hand . And that undoubtedly because of [her]195-roberta poverty and loneliness in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , [she]195-roberta had been led to listen to the honeyed words of [this scoundrel , who , coming to [her]195-roberta with promises of marriage , had lured [her]195-roberta into this unhallowed and , in [her]195-roberta case , all but unbelievable relationship which had led to [her]195-roberta death]1701-this scoundrel , who , coming to her with promises of marriage , had lured her into this unhallowed and , in her case , all but unbelievable relationship which had led to her death . For [she]195-roberta was good and pure and sweet and kind always . " And to think that [she]195-roberta is dead . [I]195-roberta ca n't believe it . "[195-roberta]

It was so that [[her]195-roberta mother]752-her mother was quoted .

" Only Monday a week ago [she]195-roberta was about — a little depressed , [I]752-her mother thought , but smiling , and for some reason which [I]752-her mother thought odd at the time went all over [the place]4628-the place Monday afternoon and evening , looking at things and gathering some flowers . And then [she]195-roberta came over and put [her]195-roberta arms around [me]752-her mother and said : ' [I]752-her mother wish [I]752-her mother were [a little girl]4629-a little girl again , [Mamma]304-mamma , and that [you]304-mamma would take [me]752-her mother in [your]304-mamma arms and rock [me]752-her mother like [you]304-mamma used to . ' And [I]752-her mother said , ' Why , [Roberta]195-roberta , what makes [you]195-roberta so sad to - night , anyhow ? ' And [she]195-roberta said , ' Oh , nothing . [You]304-mamma know [I]752-her mother 'm going back in the morning . And somehow [I]752-her mother feel a little foolish about it to - night . ' And to think that it was this trip that was in [her]195-roberta mind . [I]752-her mother suppose [she]195-roberta had a premonition that all would not work out as [she]195-roberta had planned . And to think [he]4630-he struck [[my]752-her mother little girl]4631-my little girl , [she]4631-my little girl [who never could harm anything , not even a fly]4632-who never could harm anything , not even a fly . "[752-her mother] And here , in spite of [herself]1703-herself , and with [the saddened Titus in the background]1704-the saddened titus in the background , [she]1703-herself began to cry silently .

But from [the Griffiths]197-clyde and [other members of this local social world]1705-other members of this local social world , complete and almost unbreakable silence . For in so far as [Samuel Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths was concerned , it was impossible for [him]216-samuel griffiths at first either to grasp or believe that [Clyde]197-clyde could be capable of such a deed . What ! That bland and rather timid and decidedly gentlemanly youth , as [he]216-samuel griffiths saw [him]197-clyde , charged with murder ? Being rather far from [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus at the time — [Upper Saranac]83-upper saranac — where [he]197-clyde was reached with difficulty by [Gilbert]305-gilbert — [he]197-clyde was almost unprepared to think , let alone act . Why , how impossible ! There must be some mistake here . [They]1706-they must have confused [Clyde]197-clyde with [some one else]1707-some one else .

Nevertheless , [Gilbert]305-gilbert proceeding to explain that it was unquestionably true , since [the girl]4152-the girl had worked in [the factory]4260-the factory under [Clyde]197-clyde , and [the district attorney at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg with whom [he]197-clyde had already been in communication]1710-the district attorney at bridgeburg with whom he had already been in communication had assured [him]197-clyde that [he]197-clyde was in possession of letters which [the dead girl]4430-the dead girl had written to [Clyde]197-clyde and that [Clyde]197-clyde did not attempt to deny them .

" Very well , then , "[216-samuel griffiths] countered [Samuel]216-samuel griffiths . " Do n't act hastily , and above all , do n't talk to [anyone outside of [Smillie]308-smillie]4633-anyone outside of smillie or [Gotboy]306-gotboy until [I]216-samuel griffiths see [you]4634-you . " [He]197-clyde 's in [Boston]64-boston to - day , "[1713-his son] returned [[his]307-brookhart son]1713-his son . " [I]1713-his son think [he]197-clyde told [me]1713-his son last Friday that [he]197-clyde would n't be back [here]4244-here until Monday or Tuesday . "[1713-his son]

[I]216-samuel griffiths 'll be down in the morning . Also tell [him]197-clyde to get in [the car]4637-the car and run up there "[216-samuel griffiths] ( [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg ) " to - day if [he]197-clyde can . [I]1713-his son must know from first hand all there is to know . Have [him]197-clyde see [Clyde]197-clyde if [he]197-clyde can , also [this district attorney]4638-this district attorney , and bring down any news that [he]197-clyde can get . And all the newspapers . [I]1713-his son want to see for [myself]1713-his son what has been published . "[1713-his son]

And at approximately the same time , in [the home of [the Finchleys]303-the finchleys on [Fourth Lake]85-fourth lake]1714-the home of the finchleys on fourth lake , [Sondra]238-sondra [herself]238-sondra , after forty - eight hours of most macerating thoughts spent brooding on the astounding climax which had put a period to all [her]238-sondra girlish fancies in regard to [Clyde]197-clyde , deciding at last to confess all to [[her]238-sondra father]767-her father , to whom [she]238-sondra was more drawn than to [[her]238-sondra mother]752-her mother . And accordingly approaching [him]197-clyde in [the library]1717-the library , where usually [he]197-clyde sat after dinner , reading or considering [his]197-clyde various affairs . But having come within earshot of [him]197-clyde , beginning to sob , for truly [she]752-her mother was stricken in the matter of [her]752-her mother love for [Clyde]197-clyde , as well as [her]752-her mother various vanities and illusions in regard to [her]752-her mother own high position , the scandal that was about to fall on [her]752-her mother and [[her]752-her mother family]1718-her family . Oh , what would [[her]238-sondra mother]752-her mother say now , after all [her]752-her mother warnings ? And [[her]238-sondra father]767-her father ? And [Gilbert Griffiths]305-gilbert and [[his]305-gilbert affianced bride]1721-his affianced bride ? And [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons , who except for [her]752-her mother influence over [Bertine]252-bertine , would never have been drawn into this intimacy with [Clyde]197-clyde ?

[Her]752-her mother sobs arresting [[her]238-sondra father]767-her father 's attention , [he]767-her father at once paused to look up , the meaning of this quite beyond [him]767-her father . Yet instantly sensing something very dreadful , gathering [her]752-her mother up in [his]767-her father arms , and consolingly murmuring : " There , there ! For heaven 's sake , what 's happened to [[my]767-her father little girl]4631-my little girl now ? Who 's done what and why ? "[767-her father] And then , with a decidedly amazed and shaken expression , listening to a complete confession of all that had occurred thus far — the first meeting with [Clyde]197-clyde , [her]752-her mother interest in [him]197-clyde , the attitude of [the Griffiths]197-clyde , [her]752-her mother letters , [her]752-her mother love , and then this — this awful accusation and arrest . And if it were true ! And [her]752-her mother name were used , and [[her]752-her mother daddy]1723-her daddy 's ! And once more [she]752-her mother fell to weeping as though [her]752-her mother heart would break , yet knowing full well that in the end [she]752-her mother would have [[her]752-her mother father]767-her father 's sympathy and forgiveness , whatever [his]767-her father subsequent suffering and mood .

And at once [Finchley]238-sondra , accustomed to peace and order and tact and sense in [[his]767-her father own home]1725-his own home , looking at [[his]767-her father daughter]742-his daughter in an astounded and critical and yet not uncharitable way , and exclaiming : " Well , well , of all things ! Well , [I]1727-i 'll be damned ! [I]1727-i am amazed , [[my]1727-i dear]4640-my dear ! [I]1727-i am astounded ! This is a little too much , [I]1727-i must say . Accused of murder ! And with letters of [yours]4640-my dear in [your]4640-my dear own handwriting , [you]4640-my dear say , in [his]767-her father possession , or in the hands of [this district attorney]4638-this district attorney , for all [we]4642-we know by now . Tst ! Tst ! Tst ! Damned foolish , [Sondra]238-sondra , damned foolish ! [[Your]4640-my dear mother]4643-your mother has been talking to [me]1727-i for months about this , and [you]4640-my dear know [I]1727-i was taking [your]4640-my dear word for it against [hers]4643-your mother . And now see what 's happened ! Why could n't [you]4640-my dear have told [me]1727-i or listened to [her]4643-your mother ? Why could n't [you]4640-my dear have talked all this over with [me]1727-i before going so far ? [I]1727-i thought [we]4642-we understood [each other]871-each other , [you]4640-my dear and [I.]1727-i [[Your]4640-my dear mother]4643-your mother and [I]1727-i have always acted for [your]4640-my dear own good , have n't [we]4642-we ? [You]4640-my dear know that . Besides , [I]1727-i certainly thought [you]4640-my dear had better sense . Really , [I]1727-i did . But a murder case , and [you]4640-my dear connected with it ! [[My]1727-i God]4257-my god ! "[1727-i]

[He]1727-i got up , [a handsome blond man in carefully made clothes]1728-a handsome blond man in carefully made clothes , and paced the floor , snapping [his]1727-i fingers irritably , while [Sondra]238-sondra continued to weep . Suddenly , ceasing [his]1727-i walking , [he]1727-i turned again toward [her]238-sondra and resumed with : " But , there , there ! There 's no use crying over it . Crying is n't going to fix it . Of course , [we]4642-we may be able to live it down in some way . [I]1727-i do n't know . [I]1727-i do n't know . [I]1727-i ca n't guess what effect this is likely to have on [you]238-sondra personally . But one thing is sure . [We]4642-we do want to know something about those letters . "[1727-i]

And forthwith , and while [Sondra]238-sondra wept on , [he]1727-i proceeded first to call [[his]1727-i wife]494-his wife in order to explain the nature of the blow — a social blow that was to lurk in [her]238-sondra memory as a shadow for the rest of [her]238-sondra years — and next to call up [Legare Atterbury]310-atterbury , [lawyer]1730-lawyer , [state senator]1731-state senator , [chairman of [the Republican State Central Committee]1733-the republican state central committee]1732-chairman of the republican state central committee and [[his]310-atterbury own private counsel]1734-his own private counsel for years past , to whom [he]310-atterbury explained the amazing difficulty in which [[his]310-atterbury daughter]742-his daughter now found [herself]742-his daughter . Also to inquire what was the most advisable thing to be done .

" Well , let [me]310-atterbury see , "[310-atterbury] came from [Atterbury]310-atterbury , " [I]310-atterbury would n't worry very much if [I]310-atterbury were [you]1727-i , [Mr. Finchley]311-mr. finchley . [I]310-atterbury think [I]310-atterbury can do something to straighten this out for [you]1727-i before any real public damage is done . Now , let [me]310-atterbury see . Who is [the district attorney of [Cataraqui County]1-cataraqui county]925-the district attorney of cataraqui county , anyhow ? [I]310-atterbury 'll have to look that up and get in touch with [him]925-the district attorney of cataraqui county and call [you]1727-i back . But never mind , [I]310-atterbury promise [you]1727-i [I]310-atterbury 'll be able to do something — keep the letters out of the papers , anyhow . Maybe out of the trial — [I'm]310-atterbury not sure — but [I]310-atterbury am sure [I]310-atterbury can fix it so that [her]4648-her name will not be mentioned , so do n't worry . "[310-atterbury]

And then [Atterbury]310-atterbury in turn calling up [Mason]209-mason , whose name [he]310-atterbury found in [[his]310-atterbury lawyers]1736-his lawyers ' directory , and at once arranging for a conference with [him]209-mason , since [Mason]209-mason seemed to think that the letters were most vital to [his]209-mason case , although [he]209-mason was so much overawed by [Atterbury]310-atterbury 's voice that [he]209-mason was quick to explain that by no means had [he]209-mason planned as yet to use publicly the name of [Sondra]238-sondra or the letters either , but rather to reserve [their]1737-their actuality for the private inspection of [the grand jury]1738-the grand jury , unless [Clyde]197-clyde should choose to confess and avoid a trial .

But [Atterbury]310-atterbury , after referring back to [Finchley]238-sondra and finding [him]209-mason opposed to any use of the letters whatsoever , or [Sondra]238-sondra 's name either , assuring [him]209-mason that on the morrow or the day after [he]209-mason would [himself]209-mason proceed to [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg with some plans and political information which might cause [Mason]209-mason to think twice before [he]209-mason so much as considered referring to [Sondra]238-sondra in any public way .

And then after due consideration by [the Finchley family]1739-the finchley family , it was decided that at once , and without explanation or apology to [any one]4181-any one , [Mrs. Finchley]282-mrs. finchley , [Stuart]256-stuart and [Sondra]238-sondra should leave for [the [Maine]86-maine coast]1741-the maine coast or [any place satisfactory to [them]1739-the finchley family]1742-any place satisfactory to them . [Finchley]238-sondra [himself]238-sondra proposed to return to [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus and [Albany]28-albany . It was not wise for [any of [them]1739-the finchley family]4346-any of them to be about where [they]1739-the finchley family could be reached by [reporters]1744-reporters or questioned by [friends]924-friends . And forthwith , [a hegira of [the Finchleys]303-the finchleys]1746-a hegira of the finchleys to [Narragansett]87-narragansett , where under the name of [Wilson]312-wilson [they]1739-the finchley family secluded [themselves]1739-the finchley family for the next six weeks . Also , and because of the same cause the immediate removal of [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons to one of [the Thousand Islands]88-the thousand islands , where there was [a summer colony not entirely unsatisfactory to [their]1739-the finchley family fancy]1747-a summer colony not entirely unsatisfactory to their fancy . But on the part of [the Baggotts]281-the baggotts and [the Harriets]237-the harriets , the contention that [they]1739-the finchley family were not sufficiently incriminated to bother and so remaining exactly where [they]1739-the finchley family were at [Twelfth Lake]40-twelfth lake . But all talking of [Clyde]197-clyde and [Sondra]238-sondra — this horrible crime and the probable social destruction of [all those who had in any way been thus innocently defiled by it]1748-all those who had in any way been thus innocently defiled by it .

And in the interim , [Smillie]308-smillie , as directed by [Griffiths]197-clyde , proceeding to [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , and after two long hours with [Mason]209-mason , calling at [the jail]1580-the jail to see [Clyde]197-clyde . And because of authorization from [Mason]209-mason being permitted to see [him]197-clyde quite alone in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell . [Smillie]308-smillie having explained that it was not the intention of [the Griffiths]197-clyde to try to set up any defense for [Clyde]197-clyde , but rather to discover whether under the circumstances there was a possibility for a defense , [Mason]209-mason had urged upon [him]209-mason the wisdom of persuading [Clyde]197-clyde to confess , since , as [he]209-mason insisted , there was not the slightest doubt as to [his]197-clyde guilt , and a trial would but cost [the county]499-the county money without result to [Clyde]197-clyde — whereas if [he]197-clyde chose to confess , there might be some undeveloped reasons for clemency — at any rate , a great social scandal prevented from being aired in the papers .

And thereupon [Smillie]308-smillie proceeding to [Clyde]197-clyde in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell where brooding most darkly and hopelessly [he]308-smillie was wondering how to do . Yet at the mere mention of [Smillie]308-smillie 's name shrinking as though struck . [The Griffiths]197-clyde — [Samuel Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths and [Gilbert]305-gilbert ! [[Their]1753-their personal representative]1754-their personal representative . And now what would [he]197-clyde say ? For no doubt , as [he]308-smillie now argued with [himself]308-smillie , [Smillie]308-smillie , having talked with [Mason]209-mason , would think [him]197-clyde guilty . And what was [he]197-clyde to say now ? What sort of a story tell — the truth or what ? But without much time to think , for even while [he]308-smillie was trying to do so [Smillie]308-smillie had been ushered into [his]308-smillie presence . And then moistening [his]308-smillie dry lips with [his]308-smillie tongue , [he]308-smillie could only achieve , " Why , how do [you]308-smillie do , [Mr. Smillie]308-smillie ? "[308-smillie] to which [the latter]760-the latter replied , with a mock geniality , " Why , hello , [Clyde]197-clyde , certainly sorry to see [you]197-clyde tied up in [a place like this]4649-a place like this . "[760-the latter] And then continuing : " The papers and [the district attorney]517-the district attorney over here are full of a lot of stuff about some trouble [you]197-clyde 're in , but [I]760-the latter suppose there ca n't be much to it — there must be some mistake , of course . And that 's what [I]760-the latter 'm up here to find out . [[Your]197-clyde uncle]4651-your uncle telephoned [me]760-the latter this morning that [I]760-the latter was to come up and see [you]197-clyde to find out how [they]4651-your uncle come to be holding [you]197-clyde . Of course , [you]197-clyde can understand how [they]4651-your uncle feel down there . So [they]4651-your uncle wanted [me]760-the latter to come up and get the straight of it so as to get the charge dismissed , if possible — so now if [you]197-clyde 'll just let [me]760-the latter know the ins and outs of this — [you]197-clyde know — that is — "[760-the latter]

[He]1756-he paused there , confident because of what [the district attorney]517-the district attorney had just told [him]1756-he , as well as [Clyde]197-clyde 's peculiarly nervous and recessive manner , that [he]1756-he would not have very much that was exculpatory to reveal .

And [Clyde]197-clyde , after moistening [his]197-clyde lips once more , beginning with : " [I]197-clyde suppose things do look pretty bad for [me]197-clyde , [Mr. Smillie]308-smillie . [I]197-clyde did n't think at the time that [I]197-clyde met [Miss Alden]195-roberta that [I]197-clyde would ever get into such a scrape as this . But [I]197-clyde did n't kill [her]195-roberta , and that 's the [God]246-god 's truth . [I]197-clyde never even wanted to kill [her]195-roberta or take [her]195-roberta up to [that lake]4165-that lake in the first place . And that 's the truth , and that 's what [I]197-clyde told [the district attorney]517-the district attorney . [I]197-clyde know [he]517-the district attorney has some letters from [her]195-roberta to [me]197-clyde , but they only show that [she]195-roberta wanted [me]197-clyde to go away with [her]195-roberta — not that [I]197-clyde wanted to go with [her]195-roberta at all — "[197-clyde]

[He]1758-i paused , hoping that [Smillie]308-smillie would stamp this with [his]308-smillie approval of faith . And [Smillie]308-smillie , noting the agreement between [his]1758-i and [Mason]209-mason 's assertions , yet anxious to placate [him]308-smillie , returned : " Yes , [I]308-smillie know . [He]308-smillie was just showing them to [me]308-smillie . "[308-smillie]

" [I]197-clyde knew [he]308-smillie would , "[197-clyde] continued [Clyde]197-clyde , weakly . " But [you]197-clyde know how it is sometimes , [Mr. Smillie]308-smillie , "[1758-i] [his]1758-i voice , because of [his]1758-i fears that [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff or [Kraut]290-kraut were listening , pitched very low . " [A man]4220-a man can get in a jam with [a girl]4540-a girl when [he]4220-a man never even intended to at first . [You]197-clyde know that [yourself]197-clyde . " Oh , [I]1760-he see . "[1760-he]

And so by degrees , and growing less and less tense as [he]1760-he proceeded , since [Smillie]308-smillie appeared to be listening with sympathy , [he]1760-he now outlined most of the steps of [his]1760-he early intimacy with [Roberta]195-roberta , together with [his]1760-he present defense . But with no word as to the camera , or the two hats or the lost suit , which things were constantly and enormously troubling [him]1760-he . How could [he]1760-he ever explain these , really ? And with [Smillie]308-smillie at the conclusion of this and because of what [Mason]209-mason had told [him]1760-he , asking : " But what about those two hats , [Clyde]197-clyde ? [This man over here]4662-this man over here was telling [me]209-mason that [you]197-clyde admit to having two straw hats — the one found on [the lake]571-the lake and the one [you]197-clyde wore away from there . "[209-mason]

And [Clyde]197-clyde , forced to say something , yet not knowing what , replying : " But [they]4664-they 're wrong as to [my]197-clyde wearing a straw hat away from there , [Mr. Smillie]308-smillie , it was a cap . "[197-clyde]

" [I]308-smillie see . But still [you]197-clyde did have a straw hat up at [Bear Lake]50-bear lake , [he]4662-this man over here tells [me]308-smillie . "[308-smillie]

" Yes , [I]197-clyde had one [there]650-there , but as [I]197-clyde told [him]4662-this man over here , that was the one [I]197-clyde had with [me]197-clyde when [I]197-clyde went up to [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons ' the first time . [I]197-clyde told [him]4662-this man over here that . [I]197-clyde forgot it and left it there . "[197-clyde]

" Oh , [I]308-smillie see . But now there was something about a suit — a gray one , [I]308-smillie believe — that [he]4662-this man over here says [you]197-clyde were seen wearing up there but that [he]4662-this man over here ca n't find now ? Were [you]197-clyde wearing one ? "[308-smillie]

" No . [I]197-clyde was wearing the blue suit [I]197-clyde had on when [I]197-clyde came down [here]4244-here . [They]4667-they 've taken that away now and given [me]197-clyde this one . "[197-clyde]

" But [he]4662-this man over here says that [you]197-clyde say [you]197-clyde had it dry - cleaned at [Sharon]25-sharon but that [he]4662-this man over here ca n't find [any one]4181-any one there who knows anything about it . " Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" By whom ? "[308-smillie]

" Well , [I]197-clyde ca n't just remember now . But [I]197-clyde think [I]197-clyde can find [the man]504-the man if [I]197-clyde were to go up there again — [he]504-the man 's near [the depot]4672-the depot , "[197-clyde] but at the same time looking down and away from [Smillie]308-smillie .

And then [Smillie]308-smillie , like [Mason]209-mason before [him]308-smillie , proceeding to ask about the bag in [the boat]4231-the boat , and whether it had not been possible , if [he]308-smillie could swim to [shore]1422-shore with [his]308-smillie shoes and suit on , for [him]308-smillie to have swam to [Roberta]195-roberta and assisted [her]195-roberta to cling to [the overturned boat]1763-the overturned boat . And [Clyde]197-clyde explaining , as before , that [he]197-clyde was afraid of being dragged down , but adding now , for the first time , that [he]197-clyde had called to [her]195-roberta to hang on to [the boat]4231-the boat , whereas previously [he]197-clyde had said that [the boat]4231-the boat drifted away from [them]1766-them . And [Smillie]308-smillie recalled that [Mason]209-mason had told [him]308-smillie this . Also , in connection with [Clyde]197-clyde 's story of the wind blowing [his]197-clyde hat off , [Mason]209-mason had said [he]209-mason could prove by [witnesses]1767-witnesses , as well as the U. S. Government reports , that there was not a breath of air stirring on that most halcyon day . And so , plainly , [Clyde]197-clyde was lying . [His]197-clyde story was too thin . Yet [Smillie]308-smillie , not wishing to embarrass [him]197-clyde , kept saying : " Oh , [I]308-smillie see , "[308-smillie] or , " To be sure , "[308-smillie] or " That 's the way it was , was it ? "[308-smillie]

And then finally asking about the marks on [Roberta]195-roberta 's face and head . For [Mason]209-mason had called [his]209-mason attention to [them]1766-them and insisted that no blow from [a boat]535-a boat would make both abrasions . But [Clyde]197-clyde sure that [the boat]4231-the boat had only struck [her]195-roberta once and that all the bruises had come from that or else [he]197-clyde could not guess from what [they]1766-them had come . But then beginning to see how hopeless was all this explanation . For it was so plain from [his]197-clyde restless , troubled manner that [Smillie]308-smillie did not believe [him]197-clyde . Quite obviously [he]197-clyde considered [his]197-clyde not having aided [Roberta]195-roberta as dastardly — a thin excuse for letting [her]195-roberta die .

And so , too weary and disheartened to lie more , finally ceasing . And [Smillie]308-smillie , too sorry and disturbed to wish to catechize or confuse [him]197-clyde further , fidgeting and fumbling and finally declaring : " Well , [I]308-smillie 'm afraid [I]308-smillie 'll have to be going now , [Clyde]197-clyde . [The roads]4673-the roads are pretty bad between here and [Sharon]25-sharon . But [I]308-smillie 've been mighty glad to hear [your]197-clyde side of it . And [I]308-smillie 'll present it to [[your]197-clyde uncle]4651-your uncle just as [you]197-clyde have told it to [me]308-smillie . But in the meantime , if [I]308-smillie were [you]197-clyde , [I]308-smillie would n't do any more talking than [I]308-smillie could help — not until [you]197-clyde hear further from [me]308-smillie . [I]308-smillie was instructed to find [an attorney up here]4675-an attorney up here to handle this case for [you]197-clyde , if [I]308-smillie could , but since it 's late and [Mr. Brookhart]307-brookhart , [[our]4676-our chief counsel]4677-our chief counsel , will be back to - morrow , [I]308-smillie think [I]308-smillie 'll just wait until [I]308-smillie can talk to [him]4651-your uncle . So if [you]197-clyde 'll take [my]308-smillie advice , [you]197-clyde 'll just not say anything until [you]197-clyde hear from [him]4651-your uncle or [me]308-smillie . Either [he]4651-your uncle 'll come or [he]4651-your uncle 'll send some one — [he'll]4651-your uncle bring a letter from [me]308-smillie , whoever [he]4651-your uncle is , and then [he]4651-your uncle 'll advise [you]197-clyde . "[308-smillie]

And with this parting admonition , leaving [Clyde]197-clyde to [his]197-clyde thoughts and [himself]197-clyde feeling no least doubt of [his]197-clyde guilt and that nothing less than [the Griffiths]197-clyde ' millions , if so [they]1770-they chose to spend them , could save [him]197-clyde from a fate which was no doubt due [him]197-clyde .

And then on the following morning [Samuel Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths , with [[his]216-samuel griffiths own son]1771-his own son [Gilbert]305-gilbert standing by , in [the large drawing room of [[their]1770-they [Wykeagy Avenue]89-wykeagy avenue mansion]1773-their wykeagy avenue mansion]1772-the large drawing room of their wykeagy avenue mansion , listening to [Smillie]308-smillie 's report of [his]308-smillie conference with [Clyde]197-clyde and [Mason]209-mason . And [Smillie]308-smillie reporting all [he]308-smillie had heard and seen . And with [Gilbert Griffiths]305-gilbert , unbelievably shaken and infuriated by all this , exclaiming at one point :

" Why , [the little devil]4678-the little devil ! The little beast ! But what did [I]305-gilbert tell [you]305-gilbert , [Dad]274-dad ? Did n't [I]305-gilbert warn [you]305-gilbert against bringing [him]668-the murderer on ? "[305-gilbert]

And [Samuel Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths after meditating on this reference to [his]216-samuel griffiths earlier sympathetic folly now giving [Gilbert]305-gilbert a most suggestive and intensely troubled look , which said : Are [we]1774-we here to discuss the folly of [my]0-i original , if foolish , good intentions , or the present crisis ? [The little fool]1777-the little fool ! But it served [her]238-sondra right . [She]238-sondra would get [her]238-sondra share of this now . Only it would cause [him]305-gilbert and [[his]305-gilbert father]1778-his father and all of [them]1779-them infinite trouble also . Yet [Samuel Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths , on [his]216-samuel griffiths part , going back in [his]216-samuel griffiths mind to all that had occurred since [Clyde]197-clyde had arrived in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus .

[His]216-samuel griffiths being left to work in [that basement]1783-that basement at first and ignored by [the family]964-the family . Left to [his]216-samuel griffiths own devices for fully eight months . Might not that have been at least a contributing cause to all this horror ? And then being put over [all those girls]1785-all those girls ! Was not that a mistake ? [He]216-samuel griffiths could see all this now clearly , although by no means condoning [Clyde]197-clyde 's deed in any way — far from it . The wretchedness of such a mind as that — the ungoverned and carnal desires ! The uncontrollable brutality of seducing [that girl]4343-that girl and then because of [Sondra]238-sondra — [the pleasant , agreeable little Sondra]1787-the pleasant , agreeable little sondra — plotting to get rid of [her]238-sondra ! And now in [jail]990-jail , and offering no better explanation of all the amazing circumstances , as reported by [Smillie]308-smillie , than that [he]308-smillie had not intended to kill [her]238-sondra at all — had not even plotted to do so — that the wind had blown [his]308-smillie hat off ! How impossibly weak ! And with no suitable explanation for the two hats , or the missing suit , or of not going to the aid of [the drowning girl]1789-the drowning girl . And those unexplained marks on [her]238-sondra face . How strongly all these things pointed to [his]308-smillie guilt .

" For [God]246-god 's sake , "[305-gilbert] exclaimed [Gilbert]305-gilbert , " has n't [he]308-smillie anything better than that to offer , [the little fool]1777-the little fool ! "[305-gilbert] [And Smillie]308-smillie replied that that was all [he]305-gilbert could get [him]308-smillie to say , and that [Mr. Mason]209-mason was absolutely and quite dispassionately convinced of [his]308-smillie guilt . " Dreadful ! Dreadful ! "[216-samuel griffiths] put in [Samuel]216-samuel griffiths . " [I]216-samuel griffiths really ca n't grasp it yet . [I]216-samuel griffiths ca n't ! "[216-samuel griffiths] And then getting up and walking the floor in real and crushing distress and fear . [[His]308-smillie family]1790-his family ! [He]308-smillie clinched [his]308-smillie hands . [He]308-smillie knitted [his]308-smillie brows and tightened [his]308-smillie lips . And turning and slowly and heavily moving toward the rear staircase , while [Smillie]308-smillie , wide - eyed , gazed after [him]1791-him in awe . The power of [him]1791-him ! And next [Mr. Darrah Brookhart]307-brookhart , [a large , well - dressed , well - fed , ponderous and cautious corporation lawyer]1794-a large , well - dressed , well - fed , ponderous and cautious corporation lawyer , with one eye half concealed by a drooping lid and [his]307-brookhart stomach rather protuberant , giving [one]955-one the impression of being mentally if not exactly physically suspended , balloon - wise , in some highly rarefied atmosphere where [he]307-brookhart was moved easily hither and yon by the lightest [breath of previous legal interpretations or decisions of any kind]1796-breath of previous legal interpretations or decisions of any kind . In the absence of additional facts , the guilt of [Clyde]197-clyde ( to [him]307-brookhart ) seemed obvious . Or , waiving that , as [he]307-brookhart saw it after carefully listening to [Smillie]308-smillie 's recounting of all the suspicious and incriminating circumstances , [he]307-brookhart would think it very difficult to construct an even partially satisfactory defense , unless there were some facts favoring [Clyde]197-clyde which had not thus far appeared . Those two hats , that bag — [his]197-clyde slipping away like that . Those letters . But [he]307-brookhart would prefer to read them . For upon the face of the data so far , unquestionably public sentiment would be all against [Clyde]197-clyde and in favor of [the dead girl]4430-the dead girl and [her]4430-the dead girl poverty and [[her]4430-the dead girl class]1798-her class , a situation which made a favorable verdict in [such a [backwoods county seat]1800-backwoods county seat as [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]1799-such a backwoods county seat as bridgeburg almost impossible . For [Clyde]197-clyde , although [himself]197-clyde poor , was [the nephew of [a rich man and hitherto in good standing in Lycurgus society]1802-a rich man and hitherto in good standing in lycurgus society]1801-the nephew of a rich man and hitherto in good standing in lycurgus society . That would most certainly tend to prejudice [country - born people]1803-country - born people against [him]197-clyde . It would probably be better to ask for a change of venue so as to nullify the force of such a prejudice .

On the other hand , without first sending [a trained cross - examiner]1804-a trained cross - examiner to [Clyde]197-clyde — [one , who being about to undertake the defense]1805-one , who being about to undertake the defense should be able to extract the facts from [him]197-clyde on the plea that on [his]197-clyde truthful answers depended [his]197-clyde life — [he]197-clyde would not be able to say whether there was any hope or not . In [[his]197-clyde office]530-his office was a certain [Mr. Catchuman]314-catchuman , [a very able man , who might be sent on such a mission and on whose final report one]1807-a very able man , who might be sent on such a mission and on whose final report one could base a reasonable opinion . However , there were now various other aspects of such a case as this which , in [his]197-clyde estimation , needed to be carefully looked into and decided upon . For , of course , as [Mr. Griffiths]197-clyde and [[his]197-clyde son]1713-his son so well knew , in [Utica]30-utica , [New York City]90-new york city , [Albany]28-albany ( and now that [he]197-clyde came to think of it , more particularly in [Albany]28-albany , where were [two brothers]1809-two brothers , [Canavan]315-canavan & [Canavan]315-canavan , [most able if dubious individuals]1810-most able if dubious individuals ) , there were [criminal lawyers deeply versed in the abstrusities and tricks of the criminal law]1811-criminal lawyers deeply versed in the abstrusities and tricks of the criminal law . And any of [them]1811-criminal lawyers deeply versed in the abstrusities and tricks of the criminal law — no doubt — for [a sufficient retainer]1812-a sufficient retainer , and irrespective of the primary look of a situation of this kind , might be induced to undertake such a defense . And , no doubt , via change of venue , motions , appeals , etc . , [they]1811-criminal lawyers deeply versed in the abstrusities and tricks of the criminal law might and no doubt would be able to delay and eventually effect an ultimate verdict of something less than death , if such were the wish of [the head of [this very important family]1814-this very important family]1813-the head of this very important family . On the other hand , there was the undeniable fact that such a hotly contested trial as this would most assuredly prove to be would result in an enormous amount of publicity , and did [Mr. Samuel Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths want that ? For again , under such circumstances , was it not likely to be said , if most unjustly , of course , that [he]216-samuel griffiths was using [his]216-samuel griffiths great wealth to frustrate justice ? [The public]1815-the public was so prejudiced against wealth in such cases . Yet , some sort of a defense on the part of [the Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths would certainly be expected by [the public]1815-the public , whether subsequently the same necessity for such defense was criticized by [them]1815-the public or not .

And in consequence , it was now necessary for [Mr. Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths and [[his]216-samuel griffiths son]1713-his son to decide how [they]1811-criminal lawyers deeply versed in the abstrusities and tricks of the criminal law would prefer to proceed — whether with [very distinguished criminal lawyers such as [the two [he]216-samuel griffiths had just named]1819-the two he had just named , or with [less forceful counsel]1820-less forceful counsel , or none]1818-very distinguished criminal lawyers such as the two he had just named , or with less forceful counsel , or none .
