And so , after three more hours of conference , it was finally decided by [Samuel]216-samuel griffiths [himself]216-samuel griffiths that at once [Mr. Brookhart]307-brookhart was to despatch [his]307-brookhart [Mr. Catchuman]314-catchuman to [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg to interview [Clyde]197-clyde , and thereafter , whatever [his]307-brookhart conclusions as to [his]197-clyde guilt or innocence , [he]307-brookhart was to select from the local array of legal talent — for the present , anyhow — [such a lawyer as would best represent [Clyde]197-clyde fairly]1824-such a lawyer as would best represent clyde fairly . Yet with no assurances of means or encouragement to do more than extract from [Clyde]197-clyde the true details of [his]197-clyde relationship to this charge . And those once ascertained to center upon such a defense as would most honestly tend to establish only such facts as were honestly favorable to [Clyde]197-clyde — in short , in no way , either by legal chicane or casuistry or trickery of any kind , to seek to establish a false innocence and so defeat the ends of justice .

[Mr. Catchuman]314-catchuman did not prove by any means to be the one to extract from [Clyde]197-clyde anything more than had either [Mason]209-mason or [Smillie]308-smillie . Although shrewd to a degree in piecing together out of the muddled statements of another such data as seemed most probable , still [he]314-catchuman was not so successful in the realm of the emotions , as was necessary in the case of [Clyde]197-clyde . [He]314-catchuman was too legal , chilling — unemotional . And in consequence , after grilling [Clyde]197-clyde for four long hours one hot July afternoon , [he]314-catchuman was eventually compelled to desist with the feeling that as [a plotter of crime]1825-a plotter of crime [Clyde]197-clyde was probably the most arresting example of feeble and blundering incapacity [he]197-clyde had ever met .

For since [Smillie]308-smillie 's departure [Mason]209-mason had proceeded to [the shores of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]1129-the shores of big bittern with [Clyde]197-clyde . And there discovered the tripod and camera . Also listened to more of [Clyde]197-clyde 's lies . And as [he]314-catchuman now explained to [Catchuman]314-catchuman that , while [Clyde]197-clyde denied owning a camera , nevertheless [he]197-clyde had proof that [he]197-clyde did own one and had taken it with [him]197-clyde when [he]197-clyde left [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus . Yet when confronted with this fact by [Catchuman]314-catchuman , as [the latter]760-the latter now noticed , [Clyde]197-clyde had nothing to say other than that [he]197-clyde had not taken a camera with [him]197-clyde and that the tripod found was not the one belonging to any camera of [his]197-clyde — a lie which so irritated [Catchuman]314-catchuman that [he]314-catchuman decided not to argue with [him]314-catchuman further .

At the same time , however , [Brookhart]307-brookhart having instructed [him]314-catchuman that , whatever [his]307-brookhart personal conclusions in regard to [Clyde]197-clyde , [a lawyer of sorts]1828-a lawyer of sorts was indispensable — the charity , if not the honor , of [the Griffiths]197-clyde being this much involved , [the western Griffiths]1829-the western griffiths , as [Brookhart]307-brookhart had already explained to [him]314-catchuman , having nothing and not being wanted in the case anyhow — [he]307-brookhart decided that [he]307-brookhart must find one before leaving . In consequence , and without any knowledge of the local political situation , [he]307-brookhart proceeded to [the office of [Ira Kellogg]316-ira kellogg]1830-the office of ira kellogg , [president of [the Cataraqui County National Bank]91-the cataraqui county national bank , who , although [Catchuman]314-catchuman did not know it , was high in [the councils of [the Democratic organization]1833-the democratic organization]1832-the councils of the democratic organization]1831-president of the cataraqui county national bank , who , although catchuman did not know it , was high in the councils of the democratic organization . And because of [his]316-ira kellogg religious and moral views , [this same Kellogg]316-ira kellogg was already highly incensed and irritated by the crime of which [Clyde]197-clyde was accused . On the other hand , however , because as [he]316-ira kellogg well knew this case was likely to pave the way for an additional Republican sweep at the approaching primaries , [he]316-ira kellogg was not blind to the fact that some reducing opposition to [Mason]209-mason might not be amiss . [Fate]317-fate seemed too obviously to be favoring the Republican machine in the person of and crime committed by [Clyde]197-clyde .

For since the discovery of this murder , [Mason]209-mason had been basking in such publicity and even nation - wide notoriety as had not befallen [any district attorney of [this region]538-this region]1834-any district attorney of this region in years and years . [Newspaper correspondents and reporters and illustrators from [such distant cities as [Buffalo]92-buffalo]1837-such distant cities as buffalo , [Rochester]93-rochester , [Chicago]43-chicago , [New York]63-new york and [Boston]64-boston]1836-newspaper correspondents and reporters and illustrators from such distant cities as buffalo , rochester , chicago , new york and boston , were already arriving as [everybody]1260-everybody knew or saw , to either interview or make sketches or take photos of [Clyde]197-clyde , [Mason]209-mason , [the surviving members of [the Alden family]1840-the alden family]1839-the surviving members of the alden family , et cetera , while locally [Mason]209-mason was the recipient of undiluted praise , even [the Democratic voters in [the county]499-the county]1841-the democratic voters in the county joining with [the Republicans]318-the republicans in assuring [each other]871-each other that [Mason]209-mason was all right , that [he]209-mason was handling [this young murderer]1844-this young murderer in the way that [he]209-mason deserved to be handled , and that neither the wealth of [the Griffiths]1291-the griffiths nor of [the family of [that rich girl whom [he]209-mason appeared to have been trying to capture]1847-that rich girl whom he appeared to have been trying to capture , was influencing [this young tribune of [the people]601-the people]1848-this young tribune of the people in the least]1846-the family of that rich girl whom he appeared to have been trying to capture , was influencing this young tribune of the people in the least . [He]209-mason was [a real attorney]1850-a real attorney . [He]209-mason had not " allowed any grass to grow under [his]209-mason feet , [you]4691-you bet . "[209-mason]

Indeed previous to [Catchuman]314-catchuman 's visit , [a coroner 's jury]1851-a coroner 's jury had been called , with [Mason]209-mason attending and directing even , the verdict being that [the dead girl]4430-the dead girl had come to [her]4430-the dead girl death through a plot devised and executed by [one [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde who was then and there in [the county jail of [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]1854-the county jail of bridgeburg and that [he]209-mason be held to await the verdict of [the County Grand Jury to whom [his]209-mason crime was soon to be presented]1855-the county grand jury to whom his crime was soon to be presented]1853-one clyde griffiths who was then and there in the county jail of bridgeburg and that he be held to await the verdict of the county grand jury to whom his crime was soon to be presented . And [Mason]209-mason , through an appeal to [the Governor]4626-the governor , as all now knew was planning to secure a special sitting of [the Supreme Court]1857-the supreme court , which would naturally involve an immediate session of [the County Grand Jury]1858-the county grand jury in order to hear the evidence and either indict or discharge [Clyde]197-clyde . And now , [Catchuman]314-catchuman arriving to inquire where [he]314-catchuman was likely to find [a local lawyer of real ability who could be trusted to erect some sort of a defense for [Clyde]197-clyde]1859-a local lawyer of real ability who could be trusted to erect some sort of a defense for clyde . And immediately as an offset to all this there popped into [Kellogg]316-ira kellogg 's mind the name and reputation of [one Hon . Alvin Belknap]323-belknap , of [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , of [this same city]1860-this same city — [an individual who had been twice [state senator]1731-state senator , three times [Democratic assemblyman from [this region]538-this region]1863-democratic assemblyman from this region , and more recently looked upon by [various Democratic politicians]1865-various democratic politicians as one who would be favored with higher honors as soon as it was possible to arrange an issue which would permit [the Democrats]321-the democrats to enter into [local office]1866-local office]1861-an individual who had been twice state senator , three times democratic assemblyman from this region , and more recently looked upon by various democratic politicians as one who would be favored with higher honors as soon as it was possible to arrange an issue which would permit the democrats to enter into local office . In fact , only three years before , in a contest with [Mason]209-mason for the district attorneyship , [this same Belknap]1867-this same belknap had run closer to victory than [any other candidate on the Democratic ticket]1868-any other candidate on the democratic ticket . Indeed , so rounded [a man]4220-a man was [he]1867-this same belknap politically that this year [he]1867-this same belknap had been slated for that very county judgeship nomination which [Mason]209-mason had in view . And but for this sudden and most amazing development in connection with [Clyde]197-clyde , it had been quite generally assumed that [Belknap]323-belknap , once nominated , would be elected . And although [Mr. Kellogg]322-mr. kellogg did not quite trouble to explain to [Catchuman]314-catchuman all the complicated details of this very interesting political situation , [he]322-mr. kellogg did explain that [Mr. Belknap]323-belknap was [a very exceptional man]1870-a very exceptional man , almost the ideal one , if one were looking for [an opponent to [Mason]209-mason]1871-an opponent to mason .

And with this slight introduction , [Kellogg]322-mr. kellogg now offered personally to conduct [Catchuman]314-catchuman to [Belknap]323-belknap and [[Jephson]320-jephson 's office]1872-jephson 's office , just across the way in [the Bowers Block]1873-the bowers block .

And then knocking at [Belknap]323-belknap 's door , [they]1874-they were admitted by [a brisk , medium - sized and most engaging - looking man of about forty - eight]1875-a brisk , medium - sized and most engaging - looking man of about forty - eight , whose gray - blue eyes at once fixed themselves in the mind of [Catchuman]314-catchuman as the psychic windows of [a decidedly shrewd if not altogether masterful and broad - gauge man]1876-a decidedly shrewd if not altogether masterful and broad - gauge man . For [Belknap]323-belknap was inclined to carry [himself]323-belknap with an air which all were inclined to respect . [He]323-belknap was [a college graduate]1877-a college graduate , and in [his]323-belknap youth because of [his]323-belknap looks , [his]323-belknap means , and [his]323-belknap local social position ( [[his]323-belknap father]1778-his father had been [a judge]1879-a judge as well as [a national senator]1880-a national senator from [here]4244-here ) , [he]323-belknap had seen so much of what might be called near - [city]1882-city life that all those gaucheries as well as sex - inhibitions and sex - longings which still so greatly troubled and motivated and even marked [a man like [Mason]209-mason]1883-a man like mason had long since been covered with an easy manner and social understanding which made [him]323-belknap fairly capable of grasping any reasonable moral or social complication which life was prepared to offer .

Indeed [he]323-belknap was one who naturally would approach a case such as [Clyde]197-clyde 's with less vehemence and fever than did [Mason]209-mason . For once , in [his]323-belknap twentieth year , [he]323-belknap [himself]323-belknap had been trapped between [two girls]1884-two girls , with one of whom [he]323-belknap was merely playing while being seriously in love with [the other]1885-the other . And having seduced [the first and being confronted with an engagement or flight]1886-the first and being confronted with an engagement or flight , [he]323-belknap had chosen flight . But not before laying the matter before [[his]323-belknap father]1778-his father , by whom [he]323-belknap was advised to take a vacation , during which time the services of [the family doctor]1888-the family doctor were engaged with the result that for a thousand dollars and expenses necessary to house [the pregnant girl]1889-the pregnant girl in [Utica]30-utica , [the father]4229-the father had finally extricated [[his]4229-the father son]1713-his son and made possible [his]323-belknap return , and eventual marriage to [the other girl]1892-the other girl .

And therefore , while by no means sympathizing with the more cruel and drastic phases of [Clyde]197-clyde 's attempt at escape — as so far charged ( never in all the years of [his]323-belknap law practice had [he]323-belknap been able to grasp the psychology of [a murderer]1310-a murderer ) still because of the rumored existence and love influence of [a rich girl whose name had not as yet been divulged]1894-a rich girl whose name had not as yet been divulged [he]323-belknap was inclined to suspect that [Clyde]197-clyde had been emotionally betrayed or bewitched . Was [he]323-belknap not poor and vain and ambitious ? [He]323-belknap had heard so : had even been thinking that [he]323-belknap — the local political situation being what it was might advantageously to [himself]323-belknap — and perhaps most disruptingly to the dreams of [Mr. Mason]209-mason be able to construct a defense — or at least a series of legal contentions and delays which might make it not so easy for [Mr. Mason]209-mason to walk away with [the county judgeship]593-the county judgeship as [he]209-mason imagined . Might it not , by brisk , legal moves now — and even in the face of this rising public sentiment , or because of it,—be possible to ask for a change of venue — or time to develop new evidence in which case a trial might not occur before [Mr. Mason]209-mason was out of office . [He]209-mason and [[his]209-mason young and somewhat new associate]1896-his young and somewhat new associate , [Mr. Reuben Jephson]320-jephson , of quite recently [the state of [Vermont]95-vermont]1897-the state of vermont , had been thinking of it .

And now [Mr. Catchuman]314-catchuman accompanied by [Mr. Kellogg]322-mr. kellogg . And thereupon a conference with [Mr. Catchuman]314-catchuman and [Mr. Kellogg]322-mr. kellogg , with [the latter]760-the latter arguing quite politically the wisdom of [his]209-mason undertaking such a defense . And [his]209-mason own interest in the case being what it was , [he]209-mason was not long in deciding , after a conference with [[his]209-mason younger associate]1899-his younger associate , that [he]209-mason would . In the long run it could not possibly injure [him]209-mason politically , however [the public]1815-the public might feel about it now .

And then [Catchuman]314-catchuman having handed over a retainer to [Belknap]323-belknap as well as a letter introducing [him]314-catchuman to [Clyde]197-clyde , [Belknap]323-belknap had [Jephson]320-jephson call up [Mason]209-mason to inform [him]209-mason that [Belknap]323-belknap & [Jephson]320-jephson , as [counsel for [Samuel Griffiths]216-samuel griffiths on behalf of [[his]323-belknap nephew]1902-his nephew]1901-counsel for samuel griffiths on behalf of his nephew , would require of [him]209-mason a detailed written report of all the charges as well as all the evidence thus far accumulated , the minutes of the autopsy and the report of [the coroner]602-the coroner 's inquest . Also information as to whether any appeal for a special term of [the Supreme Court]1857-the supreme court had as yet been acted upon , and if so what [judge]1905-judge had been named to sit , and when and where [the Grand Jury]1738-the grand jury would be gathered . Incidentally , [he]323-belknap said , [Messrs. Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , having heard that [Miss Alden]195-roberta 's body had been sent to [[her]195-roberta home]1907-her home for burial , would request at once a counsel 's agreement whereby it might be exhumed in order that [other doctors now to be called by the defense]1908-other doctors now to be called by the defense might be permitted to examine it — a proposition which [Mason]209-mason at once sought to oppose but finally agreed to rather than submit to an order from [a Supreme Court judge]1909-a supreme court judge .

These details having been settled , [Belknap]324-belknap announced that [he]324-belknap was going over to [the jail]1580-the jail to see [Clyde]197-clyde . It was late and [he]324-belknap had had no dinner , and might get none now , but [he]324-belknap wanted to have a " heart to heart "[314-catchuman] with [this youth]641-this youth , whom [Catchuman]314-catchuman informed [him]324-belknap [he]324-belknap would find very difficult . But [Belknap]324-belknap , buoyed up as [he]324-belknap was by [his]324-belknap opposition to [Mason]209-mason , [his]324-belknap conviction that [he]324-belknap was in a good mental state to understand [Clyde]197-clyde , was in a high degree of legal curiosity . The romance and drama of this crime ! What sort of [a girl]4540-a girl was [this [Sondra Finchley]238-sondra , of whom [he]324-belknap had already heard through secret channels]238-sondra ? And could [she]238-sondra by any chance be brought to [Clyde]197-clyde 's defense ? [He]324-belknap had already understood that [her]238-sondra name was not to be mentioned — high politics demanding this . [He]324-belknap was really most eager to talk to [this sly and ambitious and futile youth]1913-this sly and ambitious and futile youth .

However , on reaching [the jail]1580-the jail , and after showing [Sheriff Slack]287-slack a letter from [Catchuman]314-catchuman and asking as a special favor to [himself]287-slack that [he]287-slack be taken [upstairs]4415-upstairs to [some place near [[Clyde]197-clyde 's cell]1917-clyde 's cell]1916-some place near clyde 's cell in order that , unannounced , [he]287-slack might first observe [Clyde]197-clyde , [he]287-slack was quietly led to [the second floor]1918-the second floor and , the outside door leading to [the corridor which faced [[Clyde]197-clyde 's cell]1917-clyde 's cell]1919-the corridor which faced clyde 's cell being opened for [him]287-slack , allowed to enter there alone . And then walking to within a few feet of [[Clyde]197-clyde 's cell]1917-clyde 's cell [he]287-slack was able to view [him]197-clyde — at the moment lying face down on [his]197-clyde iron cot , [his]197-clyde arms above [his]197-clyde head , a tray of untouched food standing in the aperture , [his]197-clyde body sprawled and limp . For , since [Catchuman]314-catchuman 's departure , and [his]287-slack second failure to convince any one of [his]287-slack futile and meaningless lies , [he]287-slack was more despondent than ever . In fact , so low was [his]197-clyde condition that [he]197-clyde was actually crying , [his]197-clyde shoulders heaving above [his]197-clyde silent emotion . At sight of this , and remembering [his]287-slack own youthful escapades , [Belknap]324-belknap now felt intensely sorry for [him]197-clyde . [No soulless murderer]1922-no soulless murderer , as [he]324-belknap saw it , would cry .

Approaching [Clyde]197-clyde 's cell door , after a pause , [he]324-belknap began with : " Come , come , [Clyde]197-clyde ! This will never do . [You]197-clyde must n't give up like this . [Your]197-clyde case may n't be as hopeless as [you]197-clyde think . Would n't [you]197-clyde like to sit up and talk to [a lawyer fellow who thinks [he]4692-a lawyer fellow who thinks he might be able to do something for you might be able to do something for [you]197-clyde]4692-a lawyer fellow who thinks he might be able to do something for you ? [Belknap]324-belknap is [my]324-belknap name — [Alvin Belknap]323-belknap . [I]324-belknap live right here in [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg and [I]324-belknap have been sent over by [that other fellow who was here]4693-that other fellow who was here a while ago — [Catchuman]314-catchuman , was n't that [his]314-catchuman name ? [You]197-clyde did n't get along with [him]314-catchuman so very well , did [you]197-clyde ? Well , [I]324-belknap did n't either . [He]314-catchuman 's not [our]4694-we kind , [I]324-belknap guess . But here 's a letter from [him]314-catchuman authorizing [me]324-belknap to represent [you]197-clyde . Want to see it ? "[324-belknap] [He]1923-he poked it genially and authoritatively through the narrow bars toward which [Clyde]197-clyde , now curious and dubious , approached . For there was something so whole - hearted and unusual and seemingly sympathetic and understanding in [this man]749-this man 's voice that [Clyde]197-clyde took courage . And without hesitancy , therefore , [he]197-clyde took the letter and looked at it , then returned it with a smile .

" There , [I]324-belknap thought so , "[324-belknap] went on [Belknap]324-belknap , most convincingly and pleased with [his]324-belknap effect , which [he]324-belknap credited entirely to [his]324-belknap own magnetism and charm . " That 's better . [I]324-belknap know [we]4694-we 're going to get along . [I]324-belknap can feel it . [You]197-clyde are going to be able to talk to [me]324-belknap as easily and truthfully as [you]197-clyde would to [[your]197-clyde mother]4643-your mother . And without any fear that any word of anything [you]197-clyde ever tell [me]324-belknap is going to reach another ear , unless [you]197-clyde want it to , see ? For [I]324-belknap 'm going to be [[your]197-clyde lawyer]4696-your lawyer , [Clyde]197-clyde , if [you]197-clyde 'll let [me]324-belknap , and [you]197-clyde 're going to be [[my]324-belknap client]4697-my client , and [we]4694-we 're going to sit down together to - morrow , or whenever [you]197-clyde say so , and [you]197-clyde 're going to tell [me]324-belknap all [you]197-clyde think [I]324-belknap ought to know , and [I]324-belknap 'm going to tell [you]197-clyde what [I]324-belknap think [I]324-belknap ought to know , and whether [I]324-belknap 'm going to be able to help [you]197-clyde . And [I]324-belknap 'm going to prove to [you]197-clyde that in every way that [you]197-clyde help [me]324-belknap , [you]197-clyde 're helping [yourself]197-clyde , see ? And [I]324-belknap 'm going to do [my]324-belknap damnedest to get [you]197-clyde out of this . Now , how 's that , [Clyde]197-clyde ? "[324-belknap]

[He]1925-he smiled most encouragingly and sympathetically — even affectionately . And [Clyde]197-clyde , feeling for the first time since [his]197-clyde arrival [here]4244-here that [he]197-clyde had found [some one in whom [he]197-clyde could possibly confide without danger]1927-some one in whom he could possibly confide without danger , was already thinking it might be best if [he]197-clyde should tell [this man]749-this man all — everything — [he]197-clyde could not have said why , quite , but [he]197-clyde liked [him]749-this man . In a quick , if dim way [he]197-clyde felt that [this man]749-this man understood and might even sympathize with [him]197-clyde , if [he]197-clyde knew all or nearly all . And after [Belknap]324-belknap had detailed how eager [this enemy of [his]197-clyde — [Mason]209-mason]1930-this enemy of his — mason — was to convict [him]197-clyde , and how , if [he]197-clyde could but devise a reasonable defense , [he]197-clyde was sure [he]197-clyde could delay the case until [this man]749-this man was out of [office]1932-office , [Clyde]197-clyde announced that if [he]197-clyde would give [him]749-this man the night to think it all out , to - morrow or any time [he]197-clyde chose to come back , [he]197-clyde would tell [him]749-this man all .

And then , the next day [Belknap]324-belknap sitting on a stool and munching chocolate bars , listened while [Clyde]197-clyde before [him]324-belknap on [his]324-belknap iron cot , poured forth [his]324-belknap story — all the details of [his]324-belknap life since arriving at [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus — how and why [he]324-belknap had come [there]650-there , the incident of [the slain child]1934-the slain child in [Kansas City]45-kansas city , without , however , mention of the clipping which [he]324-belknap [himself]324-belknap had preserved and then forgotten ; [his]324-belknap meeting with [Roberta]195-roberta , and [his]324-belknap desire for [her]195-roberta ; [her]195-roberta pregnancy and how [he]324-belknap had sought to get [her]195-roberta out of it — on and on until , [she]195-roberta having threatened to expose [him]324-belknap , [he]324-belknap had at last , and in great distress and fright , found the item in The Times - Union and had sought to emulate that in action . But [he]324-belknap had never plotted it personally , as [Belknap]324-belknap was to understand . Nor had [he]324-belknap intentionally killed [her]195-roberta at the last . No , [he]324-belknap had not . [Mr. Belknap]323-belknap must believe that , whatever else [he]324-belknap thought . [He]324-belknap had never deliberately struck [her]195-roberta . No , no , no ! It had been an accident . There had been a camera , and the tripod reported to have been found by [Mason]209-mason was unquestionably [his]324-belknap tripod . Also , [he]324-belknap had hidden it under a log , after accidentally striking [Roberta]195-roberta with the camera and then seeing that sink under the waters , where no doubt it still was , and with pictures of [himself]324-belknap and [Roberta]195-roberta on the film it contained , if they were not dissolved by the water . But [he]324-belknap had not struck [her]195-roberta intentionally . No — [he]324-belknap had not . [She]195-roberta had approached and [he]324-belknap had struck , but not intentionally . [The boat]4231-the boat had upset . And then as nearly as [he]324-belknap could , [he]324-belknap described how before that [he]324-belknap had seemed to be in a trance almost , because having gone so far [he]324-belknap could go no farther .

But in the meantime , [Belknap]323-belknap , [himself]324-belknap finally wearied and confused by this strange story , the impossibility as [he]324-belknap now saw it of submitting to , let alone convincing , [any ordinary backwoods jury of [this region]538-this region]1936-any ordinary backwoods jury of this region , of the innocence of these dark and bitter plans and deeds , finally in great weariness and uncertainty and mental confusion , even , getting up and placing [his]324-belknap hands on [Clyde]197-clyde 's shoulders , saying : " Well , that 'll be enough of this for to - day , [Clyde]197-clyde , [I]324-belknap think . [I]324-belknap see how [you]197-clyde felt and how it all came about — also [I]324-belknap see how tired [you]197-clyde are , and [I]324-belknap 'm mighty glad [you]197-clyde 've been able to give [me]324-belknap the straight of this , because [I]324-belknap know how hard it 's been for [you]197-clyde to do it . But [I]324-belknap do n't want [you]197-clyde to talk any more now . There are going to be other days , and [I]324-belknap have a few things [I]324-belknap want to attend to before [I]324-belknap take up some of the minor phases of this with [you]197-clyde to - morrow or next day . Just [you]197-clyde sleep and rest for the present . [You]197-clyde 'll need all [you]197-clyde can get for the work [both of [us]4698-both of us]4698-both of us will have to do a little later . But just now , [you]197-clyde 're not to worry , because there 's no need of it , do [you]197-clyde see ? [I]324-belknap 'll get [you]197-clyde out of this — or [we]4698-both of us will — [[my]324-belknap partner]4699-my partner and [I.]324-belknap [I]324-belknap have [a partner that [I]324-belknap 'm going to bring around here]4700-a partner that i 'm going to bring around here presently . [You]197-clyde 'll like [him]4700-a partner that i 'm going to bring around here , too . But there are one or two things that [I]324-belknap want [you]197-clyde to think about and stick to — and one of these is that [you]197-clyde 're not to let [anybody]1268-anybody frighten [you]197-clyde into anything , because either [myself]324-belknap or [[my]324-belknap partner]4699-my partner will be around here once a day anyhow , and anything [you]197-clyde have to say or want to know [you]197-clyde can say or find out from [us]4698-both of us . Next [you]197-clyde 're not to talk to [anybody]1268-anybody — [Mason]209-mason , [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff , [these jailers]4705-these jailers , [no one]4176-no one — unless [I]324-belknap tell [you]197-clyde to . [No one]4176-no one , do [you]197-clyde hear ! And above all things , do n't cry any more . For if [you]197-clyde are as innocent as [an angel]4708-an angel , or as black as the devil [himself]4709-himself , the worst thing [you]197-clyde can do is to cry before [any one]4181-any one . [The public]1815-the public and [these jail officers]4712-these jail officers do n't understand that — [they]4712-these jail officers invariably look upon it as weakness or a confession of guilt . And [I]324-belknap do n't want [them]4712-these jail officers to feel any such thing about [you]197-clyde now , and especially when [I]324-belknap know that [you]197-clyde 're really not guilty . [I]324-belknap know that now . [I]324-belknap believe it . See ! So keep a stiff upper lip before [Mason]209-mason and [everybody]1260-everybody .[324-belknap]

" In fact , from now on [I]324-belknap want [you]197-clyde to try and laugh a little — or at any rate , smile and pass the time of day with [these fellows around here]4714-these fellows around here . There 's an old saying in law , [you]197-clyde know , that the consciousness of innocence makes [any man]4715-any man calm . Think and look innocent . Do n't sit and brood and look as though [you]197-clyde had lost [[your]197-clyde last friend]4716-your last friend , because [you]197-clyde have n't . [I]324-belknap 'm here , and so is [[my]324-belknap partner]4699-my partner , [Mr. Jephson]320-jephson . [I]324-belknap 'll bring [him]320-jephson around here in a day or two , and [you]197-clyde 're to look and act toward [him]320-jephson exactly as [you]197-clyde have toward [me]324-belknap . Trust [him]320-jephson , because in legal matters [he]320-jephson 's even smarter than [I]324-belknap am in some ways . And to - morrow [I]324-belknap 'm going to bring [you]197-clyde a couple of books and some magazines and papers , and [I]324-belknap want [you]197-clyde to read them or look at the pictures . [They]4718-they 'll help keep [your]197-clyde mind off [your]197-clyde troubles . "[324-belknap]

[Clyde]197-clyde achieved a rather feeble smile and nodded [his]197-clyde head .

" From now on , too,—I do n't know whether [you]197-clyde 're at all religious — but whether [you]197-clyde are or not , [they]4719-they hold services here in [the jail]1580-the jail on Sundays , and [I]197-clyde want [you]197-clyde to attend ['em]4721-'em regularly — that is , if [they]4719-they ask [you]197-clyde to . For this is a religious community and [I]197-clyde want [you]197-clyde to make as good an impression as [you]197-clyde can . Never mind what [people]1033-people say or how [they]1033-people look — [you]197-clyde do as [I]197-clyde tell [you]197-clyde . And if [this fellow Mason]4723-this fellow mason or [any of [those fellows around here]4725-those fellows around here]4724-any of those fellows around here get to pestering [you]197-clyde any more , send [me]197-clyde a note .[197-clyde]

" And now [I]197-clyde 'll be going , so give [me]197-clyde a cheerful smile as [I]197-clyde go out — and another one as [I]197-clyde come in . And do n't talk , see ? "[197-clyde]

Then shaking [Clyde]197-clyde briskly by the shoulders and slapping [him]197-clyde on the back , [he]197-clyde strode out , actually thinking to [himself]197-clyde : " But do [I]197-clyde really believe that [this fellow]4174-this fellow is as innocent as [he]4174-this fellow says ? Would it be possible for [a fellow]4727-a fellow to strike [a girl]4540-a girl like that and not know that [he]4174-this fellow was doing it intentionally ? And then swimming away afterwards , because , as [he]4174-this fellow says , if [he]4174-this fellow went near [her]4540-a girl [he]4174-this fellow thought [he]4174-this fellow might drown too . Bad . Bad ! What [twelve men]4729-twelve men are going to believe that ? And that bag , those two hats , that missing suit ! And yet [he]4174-this fellow swears [he]4174-this fellow did n't intentionally strike [her]4540-a girl . But what about all that planning — the intent — which is just as bad in the eyes of the law . Is [he]4174-this fellow telling the truth or is [he]4174-this fellow lying even now — perhaps trying to deceive [himself]4174-this fellow as well as [me]197-clyde ? And that camera — [we]4730-we ought to get hold of that before [Mason]209-mason finds it and introduces it . And that suit . [I]197-clyde ought to find that and mention it , maybe , so as to offset the look of its being hidden — say that [we]4730-we had it all the time — send it to [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus to be cleaned . But no , no — wait a minute — [I]197-clyde must think about that . "[197-clyde]

And so on , point by point , while deciding wearily that perhaps it would be better not to attempt to use [Clyde]197-clyde 's story at all , but rather to concoct some other story — this one changed or modified in some way which would make it appear less cruel or legally murderous .

[Mr. Reuben Jephson]320-jephson was decidedly different from [Belknap]323-belknap , [Catchuman]314-catchuman , [Mason]209-mason , [Smillie]308-smillie — in fact [any one , thus far , who had seen [Clyde]197-clyde or become legally interested in this case]1938-any one , thus far , who had seen clyde or become legally interested in this case . [He]320-jephson was young , tall , thin , rugged , brown , cool but not cold spiritually , and with a will and a determination of the tensile strength of steel . And with a mental and legal equipment which for shrewdness and self - interest was not unlike that of a lynx or a ferret . Those shrewd , steel , very light blue eyes in [his]320-jephson brown face . The force and curiosity of the long nose . The strength of the hands and the body . [He]320-jephson had lost no time , as soon as [he]320-jephson discovered there was a possibility of [their]1939-their ( [Belknap]323-belknap & [Jephson]320-jephson ) taking over the defense of [Clyde]197-clyde , in going over the minutes of [the coroner]602-the coroner 's inquest as well as [the doctors]1941-the doctors ' reports and the letters of [Roberta]195-roberta and [Sondra]238-sondra . And now being faced by [Belknap]323-belknap who was explaining that [Clyde]197-clyde did now actually admit to having plotted to kill [Roberta]195-roberta , although not having actually done so , since at the fatal moment , some cataleptic state of mind or remorse had intervened and caused [him]197-clyde to unintentionally strike [her]195-roberta — [he]197-clyde merely stared without the shadow of a smile or comment of any kind .

" But [he]197-clyde was n't in such a state when [he]197-clyde went out there with [her]195-roberta , though ? "[197-clyde]

" No . "[320-jephson]

" Nor when [he]197-clyde swam away afterwards ? "[197-clyde]

" No . "[320-jephson]

" Nor when [he]197-clyde went through [those woods]1203-those woods , or changed to another suit and hat , or hid that tripod ? "[197-clyde]

" No . "[320-jephson]

" Of course [you]320-jephson know , constructively , in the eyes of the law , if [we]4732-we use [his]197-clyde own story , [he]197-clyde 's just as guilty as though [he]197-clyde had struck [her]195-roberta , and [the judge]4625-the judge would have to so instruct . "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [I]320-jephson know . [I]320-jephson 've thought of all that . "[320-jephson]

" Well , then — "[197-clyde]

" Well , [I]1942-i 'll tell [you]320-jephson , [Jephson]320-jephson , it 's a tough case and no mistake . It looks to [me]1942-i now as though [Mason]209-mason has all the cards . If [we]4732-we can get [this chap]4734-this chap off , [we]4732-we can get [anybody]1268-anybody off . But as [I]1942-i see it , [I]1942-i 'm not so sure that [we]4732-we want to mention that cataleptic business yet — at least not unless [we]4732-we want to enter a plea of insanity or emotional insanity , or something like that — about like that Harry Thaw case , for instance . "[1942-i] [He]1942-i paused and scratched [his]1942-i slightly graying temple dubiously .

" [You]320-jephson think [he]1942-i 's guilty , of course ? "[320-jephson] interpolated [Jephson]320-jephson , dryly .

" Well , now , as astonishing as it may seem to [you]320-jephson , no . At least , [I]323-belknap 'm not positive that [I]323-belknap do . To tell [you]320-jephson the truth , this is one of the most puzzling cases [I]323-belknap have ever run up against . [This fellow]4174-this fellow is by no means as hard as [you]320-jephson think , or as cold — quite [a simple , affectionate chap]4737-a simple , affectionate chap , in a way , as [you]320-jephson 'll see for [yourself]320-jephson — [his]4174-this fellow manner , [I]323-belknap mean . [He]4174-this fellow 's only twenty - one or two . [They]1781-his parents run a mission of some kind out west — [Denver]96-denver , [I]323-belknap believe — and before that in [Kansas City]45-kansas city . [He]4174-this fellow has n't been [home]4141-home in four years . "[323-belknap]

" Well , [he]209-mason wo n't pull that one , "[320-jephson] replied [Jephson]320-jephson , [his]320-jephson hard , electric , blue eyes gleaming , " not if [I]320-jephson have to go to [Kansas City]45-kansas city to find out . "[320-jephson]

[Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson proceeded the next day to visit [Clyde]197-clyde in [jail]990-jail . [And Jephson]320-jephson , after interviewing [him]197-clyde and meditating once more on [his]197-clyde strange story , was even then not quite able to make up [his]197-clyde mind whether [Clyde]197-clyde was as innocent of intending to strike [Roberta]195-roberta as [he]197-clyde said , or not . Decidedly it would be more difficult for [a jury]4553-a jury than for [himself]197-clyde , even , to be convinced .

At the same time , there was that contention of [Belknap]323-belknap 's as to the possibility of [Clyde]197-clyde 's having been mentally upset or unbalanced at the time that [he]197-clyde accepted The Times - Union plot and proceeded to act on it . That might be true , of course , yet personally , to [Jephson]320-jephson at least , [Clyde]197-clyde appeared to be wise and sane enough now . As [Jephson]320-jephson saw [him]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde was harder and more cunning than [Belknap]323-belknap was willing to believe — a cunning , modified of course , by certain soft and winning social graces for which [one]955-one could hardly help liking [him]197-clyde . "[323-belknap]

" But the false registrations ! The two hats — the suit — [his]197-clyde bag ! "[323-belknap] insisted [Belknap]323-belknap staccatically , a tone which showed [Clyde]197-clyde how serious [Belknap]323-belknap considered [his]197-clyde predicament to be .

[You]197-clyde 're in [prison]4800-prison now , and [you]197-clyde ca n't be taken out without [the state]1663-the state 's consent , [you]197-clyde see . But [we]4802-we must get that suit . "[323-belknap] Then turning to [Belknap]323-belknap and lowering [his]323-belknap voice , [he]323-belknap added : " [We]4802-we want to get it and have it cleaned and submit it as having been sent away to be cleaned by [him]209-mason — not hidden , [you]197-clyde see . "[323-belknap]

" Yes , that 's so , "[323-belknap] commented [Belknap]323-belknap idly while [Clyde]197-clyde stood listening curiously and a little amazed by this frank program of trickery and deception on [his]197-clyde behalf .

" And now in regard to that camera that fell in [the lake]571-the lake — [we]4802-we have to try and find that , too . [I]323-belknap think maybe [Mason]209-mason may know about it or suspect that it 's there . At any rate it 's very important that [we]4802-we should find it before [he]209-mason does . [You]323-belknap think that about where that pole was that day [you]323-belknap were up there is where [the boat]4231-the boat was when it overturned ? "[323-belknap]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[323-belknap]

" Well , [we]4802-we must see if [we]4802-we can get that , "[323-belknap] [he]323-belknap continued , turning to [Belknap]323-belknap . " [We]4802-we do n't want that turning up in the trial , if [we]4802-we can help it . For without that , [they]4802-we 'll have to be swearing that [he]209-mason struck [her]4806-her with that tripod or something that [he]209-mason did n't , and that 's where [we]4802-we may trip 'em up . "[323-belknap]

" Yes , that 's true , too , "[323-belknap] replied [Belknap]323-belknap .

" And now in regard to the bag that [Mason]209-mason has . That 's another thing [I]323-belknap have n't seen yet , but [I]323-belknap will see it to - morrow . Did [you]323-belknap put that suit , as wet as it was , in the bag when [you]323-belknap came out of [the water]1009-the water ? "[323-belknap]

" No , [sir]4137-sir , [I]323-belknap wrung it out first . And then [I]323-belknap dried it as much as [I]323-belknap could . " But [you]323-belknap 're not sure ? "[323-belknap]

" Well , [I]323-belknap 'll see for [myself]323-belknap to - morrow . And now as to those marks on [her]4811-her face , [you]323-belknap have never admitted to [any one around here]4812-any one around here or anywhere that [you]323-belknap struck [her]4811-her in any way ? "[323-belknap]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[323-belknap]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[323-belknap]

" Well , then , this is the way it looks to [me]320-jephson , "[320-jephson] said [Jephson]320-jephson , again turning to [Belknap]323-belknap . [We]4817-we can try it , anyhow . "[323-belknap]

" Yes , [I]323-belknap think [Mason]209-mason would have a hard time proving that [they]4818-they were n't made that way , "[323-belknap] replied [Belknap]323-belknap .

" And as for that tripod , well , [we]4817-we 'd better exhume the body and make [our]4817-we own measurements , and measure the thickness of the edge of [that boat]645-that boat , so that it may not be so easy for [Mason]209-mason to make any use of the tripod now that [he]209-mason has it , after all . "[320-jephson]

[Mr. Jephson]320-jephson 's eyes were very small and very clear and very blue , as [he]320-jephson said this . [His]320-jephson head , as well as [his]320-jephson body , had a thin , ferrety look . And it seemed to [Clyde]197-clyde , who had been observing and listening to all this with awe , that [this younger man]1950-this younger man might be the one to aid [him]197-clyde . [He]197-clyde was so shrewd and practical , so very direct and chill and indifferent and yet confidence - inspiring , quite like an uncontrollable machine of a kind which generates power .

And when at last [these two]584-these two were ready to go , [he]197-clyde was sorry . For with [them]584-these two near [him]197-clyde , planning and plotting in regard to [himself]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde felt so much safer , stronger , more hopeful , more certain of being free , maybe , at some future date .

The result of all this , however , was that it was finally decided that perhaps the easiest and safest defense that could be made , assuming that [the Griffiths family of Lycurgus]1960-the griffiths family of lycurgus would submit to it , would be that of insanity or " brain storm"—a[314-catchuman] temporary aberration due to love and an illusion of grandeur aroused in [Clyde]197-clyde by [Sondra Finchley]238-sondra and the threatened disruption by [Roberta]195-roberta of all [his]197-clyde dreams and plans . But after consultation with [Catchuman]314-catchuman and [Darrah Brookhart]307-brookhart at [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , and these in turn conferring with [Samuel]216-samuel griffiths and [Gilbert Griffiths]305-gilbert , it was determined that this would not do . For to establish insanity or " brain storm "[1961-relatives] would require previous evidence or testimony to the effect that [Clyde]197-clyde was of none too sound mind , erratic [his]197-clyde whole life long , and with certain specific instances tending to demonstrate how really peculiar [he]197-clyde was — [relatives]1961-relatives ( among them [the Griffiths of [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus [themselves]1962-the griffiths of lycurgus themselves]1962-the griffiths of lycurgus themselves , perhaps ) , coming on to swear to it — a line of evidence , which , requiring as it would , outright lying and perjury on the part of [many]4434-many as well as reflecting on [the Griffiths]197-clyde ' blood and brain , was sufficient to alienate both [Samuel]216-samuel griffiths and [Gilbert]305-gilbert to the extent that [they]1962-the griffiths of lycurgus themselves would have none of it . And so [Brookhart]307-brookhart was compelled to assure [Belknap]323-belknap that this line of defense would have to be abandoned .

Such being the case , both [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson were once more compelled to sit down and consider . For any other defense which either could think of now seemed positively hopeless .

" [I]1964-the sturdy jephson want to tell [you]4823-you one thing ! "[1964-the sturdy jephson] observed [the sturdy Jephson]1964-the sturdy jephson , after thumbing through the letters of both [Roberta]195-roberta and [Sondra]238-sondra again . " These letters of [this Alden girl]4330-this alden girl are the toughest things [we]4825-we 're going to have to face . [They]4826-they 're likely to make [any jury]4770-any jury cry if [they]4826-they 're read right , and then to introduce those letters from [that other girl on top of these]4828-that other girl on top of these would be fatal . It will be better , [I]1964-the sturdy jephson think , if [we]4825-we do not mention [hers]4330-this alden girl at all , unless [he]197-clyde does . It will only make it look as though [he]197-clyde had killed [that Alden girl]4764-that alden girl to get rid of [her]4764-that alden girl . [Mason]209-mason could n't want anything better , as [I]1964-the sturdy jephson see it . "[1964-the sturdy jephson] And with this [Belknap]323-belknap agreed most heartily .

At the same time , some plan must be devised immediately . And so , out of these various conferences , it was finally deduced by [Jephson]320-jephson , who saw a great opportunity for [himself]320-jephson in this matter , that the safest possible defense that could be made , and one to which [Clyde]197-clyde 's own suspicious and most peculiar actions would most exactly fit , would be that [he]197-clyde had never contemplated murder . On the contrary , being a moral if not [a physical coward]1965-a physical coward , as [his]197-clyde own story seemed to suggest , and in terror of being exposed and driven out of [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus and of [the heart of [Sondra]238-sondra]1966-the heart of sondra , and never as yet having told [Roberta]195-roberta of [Sondra]238-sondra and thinking that knowledge of this great love for [her]238-sondra ( [Sondra]238-sondra ) might influence [Roberta]195-roberta to wish to be rid of [him]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde had hastily and without any worse plan in mind , decided to persuade [Roberta]195-roberta to accompany [him]197-clyde to [any near - by resort but not especially [Grass Lake]21-grass lake or [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]1967-any near - by resort but not especially grass lake or big bittern , in order to tell [her]238-sondra all this and so win [his]197-clyde freedom — yet not without offering to pay [her]238-sondra expenses as nearly as [he]197-clyde could during [her]238-sondra very trying period .

" All well and good , "[323-belknap] commented [Belknap]323-belknap . " But that involves [his]197-clyde refusing to marry [her]238-sondra , does n't it ? And what jury is going to sympathize with [him]197-clyde for that or believe that [he]197-clyde did n't want to kill [her]238-sondra ? "[323-belknap]

" Wait a minute , wait a minute , "[320-jephson] replied [Jephson]320-jephson , a little testily . " So far it does . Sure . But [you]323-belknap have n't heard [me]320-jephson to the end yet . [I]320-jephson said [I]320-jephson had a plan . "[320-jephson]

" All right , then what is it ? "[323-belknap] replied [Belknap]323-belknap most interested .

" Well , [I]323-belknap 'll tell [you]323-belknap — [my]323-belknap plan 's this — to leave all the facts just as they are , and just as [he]197-clyde tells them , and just as [Mason]209-mason has discussed them so far , except , of course , [his]197-clyde striking [her]4830-her — and then explain them — the letters , the wounds , the bag , the two hats , everything — not deny them in any way . "[323-belknap]

And here [he]323-belknap paused and ran [his]323-belknap long , thin , freckled hands eagerly through [his]323-belknap light hair and looked across the grass of [the public square]1968-the public square to [the jail where [Clyde]197-clyde was]1969-the jail where clyde was , then toward [Belknap]323-belknap again .

" All very good , but how ? "[323-belknap] queried [Belknap]323-belknap .

" There 's no other way , [I]320-jephson tell [you]323-belknap , "[320-jephson] went on [Jephson]320-jephson quite to [himself]320-jephson , and ignoring [his]320-jephson senior , " and [I]323-belknap think this will do it . "[323-belknap] [He]323-belknap turned to look out the window again , and began as though talking to [some one outside]1970-some one outside : " [He]197-clyde goes up there , [you]323-belknap see , because [he]197-clyde 's frightened and because [he]197-clyde has to do something or be exposed . "[323-belknap]

" Might ? Would ! "[320-jephson] replied [Jephson]320-jephson , slyly and calmly , [his]320-jephson harebell eyes showing only cold , eager , practical logic , no trace of emotion or even sympathy of any kind , really . " Well , while [he]197-clyde 's up there with [her]1970-some one outside under those conditions — so close to [her]1970-some one outside again , [you]323-belknap see "[320-jephson] ( and [his]320-jephson facial expression never altered so much as by a line ) " [he]197-clyde experiences a change of heart . " Yes , go on ! "[323-belknap] interrupted [Belknap]323-belknap , eagerly .

" Yes . "[323-belknap]

" [She]4872-her 's gone , "[323-belknap] concluded [Belknap]323-belknap , quietly . " [Drowned]325-drowned . [I]323-belknap get [you]320-jephson . "[323-belknap]

" And then , because of all those other suspicious circumstances and false registrations — and because now [she]4872-her 's gone and [he]197-clyde ca n't do anything more for [her]4872-her , anyhow — [[her]4872-her relatives]4886-her relatives might not want to know [her]4872-her condition , [you]320-jephson know — "[320-jephson]

" [I]323-belknap see . "[323-belknap]

" [He]197-clyde slips away , frightened , [a moral coward]4887-a moral coward , just as [we]4888-we 'll have to contend from the first , anxious to stand well with [[his]197-clyde uncle]821-his uncle and not lose [his]197-clyde place in [this world]4890-this world . Does n't that explain it ? "[320-jephson]

" About as well as anything could explain it , [Reuben]320-jephson , [I]1971-i think . In fact , [I]1971-i think it 's a plausible explanation and [I]1971-i congratulate [you]320-jephson . [I]1971-i do n't see how [any one]4181-any one could hope to find a better . "[1971-i] And very much cheered , [he]1971-i got up , and after eyeing [[his]1971-i long , thin associate]1972-his long , thin associate admiringly , added : " Fine ! "[1971-i] while [Jephson]320-jephson , [his]320-jephson blue eyes for all [the world]1694-the world like windless , still pools , looked steadily back .

" But of course [you]320-jephson know what that means ? "[320-jephson] [Jephson]320-jephson now added , calmly and softly .

" That [we]4888-we have to put [him]197-clyde on the witness stand ? Surely , surely . [I]1971-i see that well enough . But it 's [his]197-clyde only chance . "[1971-i]

" And [he]197-clyde wo n't strike [people]1033-people as [a very steady or convincing fellow]4893-a very steady or convincing fellow , [I]1971-i 'm afraid — too nervous and emotional . "[1971-i]

" Yes , [I]323-belknap know all that , "[323-belknap] replied [Belknap]323-belknap , quickly . " [He]197-clyde 's easily rattled . And [Mason]209-mason will go after [him]197-clyde like a wild bull . " If [he]197-clyde fails , then [he]197-clyde 's gone . If only [we]4888-we could do something to give [him]197-clyde courage — teach [him]197-clyde to act it out . "[320-jephson] [Jephson]320-jephson 's eyes seemed to be gazing directly before [him]320-jephson at the very courtroom scene in which [Clyde]197-clyde on [the stand]1974-the stand would have [Mason]209-mason before [him]320-jephson . "[320-jephson] [He]320-jephson weighed them up and down in [his]320-jephson hand . " Christ ! "[320-jephson] [he]320-jephson finally concluded , darkly . " What a case ! But [we]4888-we 're not licked yet , not by a darn sight ! Why , [we]4888-we have n't begun to fight yet . And [we]4888-we 'll get a lot of publicity , anyhow . Wish [me]320-jephson luck . "[320-jephson]

" Do [I]323-belknap ? "[323-belknap] was all [Belknap]323-belknap replied .

The struggle and excitement of a great murder trial ! [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , after consulting with [Brookhart]307-brookhart and [Catchuman]314-catchuman , learning that [they]1975-their considered [Jephson]320-jephson 's plan " perhaps the only way , "[323-belknap] but with as little reference to [the Griffiths]1291-the griffiths as possible .

And then at once , [Messrs. Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson issuing preliminary statements framed in such a manner as to show [their]1975-their faith in [Clyde]197-clyde , presenting [him]197-clyde as being , in reality , [a much maligned and entirely misunderstood youth , whose intentions and actions toward [Miss Alden]195-roberta were as different from those set forth by [Mason]209-mason as white from black]1977-a much maligned and entirely misunderstood youth , whose intentions and actions toward miss alden were as different from those set forth by mason as white from black . And intimating that the undue haste of [the district attorney in seeking a special term of the Supreme Court]1978-the district attorney in seeking a special term of the supreme court might possibly have a political rather than a purely legal meaning . Else why the hurry , especially in the face of an approaching county election ? Could there be any plan to use the results of such a trial as this to further [any particular person]1979-any particular person 's , or group of [persons]1980-persons ' , political ambitions ? [Messrs. Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson begged to hope not .

But regardless of such plans or the prejudices or the political aspirations of [any particular person or group]1981-any particular person or group , the defense in this instance did not propose to permit [a boy as innocent as [Clyde]197-clyde , trapped by circumstances — as [counsel for [the defense]1984-the defense]1983-counsel for the defense would be prepared to show]1982-a boy as innocent as clyde , trapped by circumstances — as counsel for the defense would be prepared to show — to be railroaded to the electric chair merely to achieve a victory for the Republican party in November . Furthermore , to combat these strange and yet false circumstances , the defense would require a considerable period of time to prepare [its]1984-the defense case . Therefore , it would be necessary for [them]1975-their to file a formal protest at [Albany]28-albany against [the district attorney]517-the district attorney 's request to [the governor]4626-the governor for a special term of [the Supreme Court]1857-the supreme court . There was no need for the same , since the regular term for the trial of such cases would fall in January , and the preparation of [their]1975-their case would require that much time .

But while this strong , if rather belated , reply was listened to with proper gravity by [the representatives of the various newspapers]1988-the representatives of the various newspapers , [Mason]209-mason vigorously pooh - poohed this " windy "[209-mason] assertion of political plotting , as well as the talk of [Clyde]197-clyde 's innocence . " What reason have [I]209-mason , [a representative of [all the people of [this county]600-this county]4896-all the people of this county]4895-a representative of all the people of this county , to railroad [this man]749-this man anywhere or make one single charge against [him]749-this man unless the charges make [themselves]1975-their ? Does n't the evidence itself show that [he]749-this man did kill [this girl]818-this girl ? And has [he]749-this man ever said or done one thing to clear up any of the suspicious circumstances ? No ! Silence or lies . And until these circumstances are disproved by [these very able gentlemen]4900-these very able gentlemen , [I]209-mason am going right ahead . [I]209-mason have all the evidence necessary to convict [this young criminal]4901-this young criminal now . And to delay it until January , when [I]209-mason shall be out of office , as [they]4900-these very able gentlemen know , and when [a new man]4902-a new man will have to go over all this evidence with which [I]209-mason have familiarized [myself]209-mason , is to entail great expense to [the county]499-the county . For [all the witnesses [I]209-mason have gotten together]4904-all the witnesses i have gotten together are right here now , easy to bring into [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg without any great expense to [the county]499-the county . But where will [they]4904-all the witnesses i have gotten together be next January or February , especially after [the defense]1984-the defense has done its best to scatter [them]4904-all the witnesses i have gotten together ? No , [sir]4137-sir ! [I]209-mason will not agree to it . But , if within ten days or two weeks from now even , [they]4900-these very able gentlemen can bring [me]209-mason something that will so much as make it look as though even some of the charges [I]209-mason have made are not true , [I]209-mason 'll be perfectly willing to go before [the presiding judge]4908-the presiding judge with [them]4900-these very able gentlemen , and if [they]4900-these very able gentlemen can show [him]4908-the presiding judge any evidence [they]4900-these very able gentlemen have or hope to have , or that there are [any distant known witnesses]4909-any distant known witnesses to be secured who can help prove [this fellow]4174-this fellow 's innocence , why , then , well and good . [I]209-mason 'll be willing to ask [the judge]4625-the judge to grant [them]4900-these very able gentlemen as much time as [he]4625-the judge may see fit , even if it throws the trial over until [I]209-mason am out of office . But if the trial comes up while [I]209-mason 'm [here]4244-here , as [I]209-mason honestly hope it will , [I]209-mason 'll prosecute it to the best of [my]209-mason ability , not because [I]209-mason 'm looking for an office of any kind but because [I]209-mason am now [the district attorney]517-the district attorney and it is [my]209-mason duty to do so . And as for [my]209-mason being in politics , well , [Mr. Belknap]323-belknap is in politics , is n't [he]323-belknap ? [He]323-belknap ran against [me]209-mason the last time , and [I]209-mason hear [he]323-belknap desires to run again . "[209-mason]

Accordingly [he]1989-he proceeded to [Albany]28-albany further to impress upon [the Governor]4626-the governor the very great need of an immediate special term of [the Court]1991-the court so that [Clyde]197-clyde might be indicted . And [the Governor]4626-the governor , hearing the personal arguments of both [Mason]209-mason and [Belknap]323-belknap , decided in favor of [Mason]209-mason , on the ground that the granting of a special term did not militate against any necessary delay of the trial of the case , since nothing which [the defense]1984-the defense as yet had to offer seemed to indicate that the calling of a special term was likely in any way to prevent it from obtaining as much time wherein to try the case as needed . Besides , it would be the business of [the Supreme Court justice appointed to consider such arguments]1994-the supreme court justice appointed to consider such arguments — not [himself]1994-the supreme court justice appointed to consider such arguments . And accordingly , a special term of [the Supreme Court]1857-the supreme court was ordered , with [one Justice Frederick Oberwaltzer of [the eleventh judicial district]1997-the eleventh judicial district]1996-one justice frederick oberwaltzer of the eleventh judicial district designated to preside . And when [Mason]209-mason appeared before [him]1996-one justice frederick oberwaltzer of the eleventh judicial district with the request that [he]209-mason fix the date of the Special Grand Jury by which [Clyde]197-clyde might be indicted , this was set for August fifth .

And then that body sitting , it was no least trouble for [Mason]209-mason to have [Clyde]197-clyde indicted .

And thereafter the best that [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson could do was to appear before [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , [a Democrat , who owed [his]326-justice oberwaltzer appointment to [a previous governor]1999-a previous governor]1998-a democrat , who owed his appointment to a previous governor , to argue for a change of venue , on the ground that by no possible stretch of the imagination could [any twelve men residing in [Cataraqui County]1-cataraqui county]2000-any twelve men residing in cataraqui county be found who , owing to the public and private statements of [Mason]209-mason , were not already vitally opposed to [Clyde]197-clyde and so convinced of [his]197-clyde guilt that before ever [such a jury]2001-such a jury could be addressed by a defense , [he]197-clyde would be convicted .

" But where are [you]209-mason going then ? "[326-justice oberwaltzer] inquired [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , who was impartial enough . " The same material has been published everywhere . "[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" But , [your]209-mason Honor , this crime which [the district attorney]517-the district attorney [here]4244-here has been so busy in magnifying — "[209-mason] ( a long and heated objection on the part of [Mason]209-mason ) .

" But [we]4916-we contend just the same , "[323-belknap] continued [Belknap]323-belknap , " that [the public]1815-the public has been unduly stirred and deluded . [You]209-mason ca n't get [twelve men]4729-twelve men now who will try [this man]749-this man fairly . "[323-belknap]

" What nonsense ! "[209-mason] exclaimed [Mason]209-mason , angrily . " [Mere twaddle]327-mere twaddle ! Why , the newspapers [themselves]4920-themselves have gathered and published more evidence than [I]209-mason have . It 's the publicly discovered facts in this case that have aroused prejudice , if any has been aroused . But no more than would be aroused anywhere , [I]209-mason maintain . Besides , if this case is to be transferred to [a distant county]4921-a distant county when [the majority of [the witnesses]4923-the witnesses]4922-the majority of the witnesses are right here , [this county]600-this county is going to be saddled with an enormous expense , which [it]600-this county can not afford and which the facts do not warrant . "[209-mason]

[Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , who was of a sober and moral turn , [a slow and meticulous man inclined to favor conservative procedure in all things]2002-a slow and meticulous man inclined to favor conservative procedure in all things , was inclined to agree . And after five days , in which [he]326-justice oberwaltzer did not more than muse idly upon the matter , [he]326-justice oberwaltzer decided to deny the motion . If [he]326-justice oberwaltzer were wrong , there was the Appellate Division to which [the defense]1984-the defense could resort . As for stays , having fixed the date of the trial for October fifteenth ( ample time , as [he]326-justice oberwaltzer judged , for [the defense]1984-the defense to prepare [its]1984-the defense case ) , [he]326-justice oberwaltzer adjourned for the remainder of the summer to [[his]326-justice oberwaltzer cottage on [Blue Mountain Lake]97-blue mountain lake]2005-his cottage on blue mountain lake , where both [the prosecution]2006-the prosecution and [the defense]1984-the defense , should any knotty or locally insoluble legal complication arise , would be able to find [him]326-justice oberwaltzer and have [his]326-justice oberwaltzer personal attention .

But with the entry of [the Messrs. Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson into the case , [Mason]209-mason found it advisable to redouble [his]209-mason efforts to make positive , in so far as it were possible , the conviction of [Clyde]197-clyde . [He]209-mason feared [the young Jephson]320-jephson as much as [he]209-mason did [Belknap]324-belknap . And for that reason , taking with [him]326-justice oberwaltzer [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh and [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , [he]326-justice oberwaltzer now revisited [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , where among other things [he]326-justice oberwaltzer was able to discover ( 1 ) where [Clyde]197-clyde had purchased the camera ; ( 2 ) that three days before [his]326-justice oberwaltzer departure for [Big Bittern]13-big bittern [he]326-justice oberwaltzer had said to [Mrs. Peyton]233-mrs. peyton that [he]326-justice oberwaltzer was thinking of taking [his]326-justice oberwaltzer camera with [him]326-justice oberwaltzer and that [he]326-justice oberwaltzer must get some films for it ; ( 3 ) that there was [a haberdasher by the name of [Orrin Short]328-orrin short who had known [Clyde]197-clyde well and that but four months before [Clyde]197-clyde had applied to [him]326-justice oberwaltzer for advice in connection with [[a factory hand]2009-a factory hand 's pregnant wife]2010-a factory hand 's pregnant wife]2008-a haberdasher by the name of orrin short who had known clyde well and that but four months before clyde had applied to him for advice in connection with a factory hand 's pregnant wife — also ( and this in great confidence to [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , who had unearthed [him]197-clyde ) that [he]211-burton burleigh had recommended to [Clyde]197-clyde a certain [Dr. Glenn]329-dr. glenn , near [Gloversville]98-gloversville ; ( 4 ) [Dr. Glenn]329-dr. glenn [himself]329-dr. glenn being sought and pictures of [Clyde]197-clyde and [Roberta]195-roberta being submitted , [he]326-justice oberwaltzer was able to identify [Roberta]195-roberta , although not [Clyde]197-clyde , and to describe the state of mind in which [she]195-roberta had approached [him]326-justice oberwaltzer , as well as the story [she]195-roberta had told — a story which in no way incriminated [Clyde]197-clyde or [herself]195-roberta , and which , therefore , [Mason]209-mason decided might best be ignored , for the present , anyhow .

And ( 5 ) , via these same enthusiastic efforts , there rose to the surface [the particular hat salesman in [Utica]30-utica]2011-the particular hat salesman in utica who had sold [Clyde]197-clyde the hat . For [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh being interviewed while in [Utica]30-utica , and [his]211-burton burleigh picture published along with one of [Clyde]197-clyde , [this salesman]2012-this salesman chanced to see it and recalling [him]326-justice oberwaltzer at once made haste to communicate with [Mason]209-mason , with the result that [his]326-justice oberwaltzer testimony , properly typewritten and sworn to , was carried away by [Mason]209-mason .

And , in addition , [the country girl who had been on the steamer " [Cygnus]99-cygnus "[2013-the country girl who had been on the steamer " cygnus " and who had noticed clyde] and who had noticed [Clyde]197-clyde]2013-the country girl who had been on the steamer " cygnus " and who had noticed clyde , wrote [Mason]209-mason that [she]2013-the country girl who had been on the steamer " cygnus " and who had noticed clyde remembered [him]197-clyde wearing a straw hat , also [his]197-clyde leaving [the boat]4231-the boat at [Sharon]25-sharon , a bit of evidence which most fully confirmed that of [the captain of [the boat]4231-the boat]2015-the captain of the boat and caused [Mason]209-mason to feel that [Providence]330-providence or [Fate]317-fate was working with [him]197-clyde . And last , but most important of all to [him]197-clyde , there came a communication from [a woman residing in [Bedford]100-bedford]2017-a woman residing in bedford , [Pennsylvania]101-pennsylvania , who announced that during the week of July third to tenth , [she]2017-a woman residing in bedford and [[her]2017-a woman residing in bedford husband]831-her husband had been camping on [the east shore of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]2019-the east shore of big bittern , near [the southern end of [the lake]571-the lake]2020-the southern end of the lake . And while rowing on [the lake]571-the lake on the afternoon of July eighth , at about six o'clock , [she]2017-a woman residing in bedford had heard a cry which sounded like that of [a woman]2023-a woman or [girl in distress — a plaintive , mournful cry]2024-girl in distress — a plaintive , mournful cry . It was very faint and had seemed to come from beyond [the island]2025-the island which was to the south and west of [the bay in which [they]2027-they were fishing]2026-the bay in which they were fishing .

[Mason]209-mason now proposed to remain absolutely silent regarding this information , and that about the camera and films and the data regarding [Clyde]197-clyde 's offense in [Kansas City]45-kansas city , until nearer the day of trial , or during the trial itself , when it would be impossible for [the defense]1984-the defense to attempt either to refute or ameliorate it in any way .

As for [Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , apart from drilling [Clyde]197-clyde in the matter of [his]197-clyde general denial based on [his]197-clyde change of heart once [he]197-clyde had arrived at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake , and the explanation of the two hats and the bag , [they]2027-they could not see that there was much to do . True , there was the suit thrown in [Fourth Lake]85-fourth lake near [the Cranstons ']1213-the cranstons ' , but after much trolling on the part of [a seemingly casual fisherman]2030-a seemingly casual fisherman , that was brought up , cleaned and pressed , and now hung in [a locked closet in [the Belknap and Jephson office]2032-the belknap and jephson office]2031-a locked closet in the belknap and jephson office . Also , there was the camera at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , dived for but never found by [them]2027-they — a circumstance which led [Jephson]320-jephson to conclude that [Mason]209-mason must have it , and so caused [him]320-jephson to decide that [he]320-jephson would refer to it at the earliest possible opportunity at the trial . But as for [Clyde]197-clyde striking [her]2033-her with it , even accidentally , well , it was decided at that time at least , to contend that [he]197-clyde had not — although after exhuming [Roberta]195-roberta 's body at [Biltz]14-biltz it had been found that the marks on [her]2033-her face , even at this date , did correspond in some degree to the size and shape of the camera .

For , in the first place , [they]2027-they were exceedingly dubious of [Clyde]197-clyde as [a witness]842-a witness . Would [he]197-clyde or would [he]197-clyde not , in telling of how it all happened , be sufficiently direct or forceful and sincere to convince [any jury]4770-any jury that [he]197-clyde had so struck [her]2033-her without intending to strike [her]2033-her ? For on that , marks or no marks , would depend whether [the jury]1953-the jury was going to believe [him]197-clyde . And if it did not believe that [he]197-clyde struck [her]2033-her accidentally , then a verdict of guilty , of course .

And so [they]2027-they prepared to await the coming of the trial , only working betimes and in so far as [they]2027-they dared , to obtain testimony or evidence as to [Clyde]197-clyde 's previous good character , but being blocked to a degree by the fact that in [Lycurgus]212-lycurgus , while pretending to be [a model youth]2037-a model youth outwardly , [he]197-clyde had privately been conducting [himself]197-clyde otherwise , and that in [Kansas City]45-kansas city [his]197-clyde first commercial efforts had resulted in such a scandal .

However , one of the most difficult matters in connection with [Clyde]197-clyde and [his]197-clyde incarceration here , as [Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson as well as [the prosecution]2006-the prosecution saw it , was the fact that thus far not [one single member of [his]197-clyde own or [[his]197-clyde uncle 's family]2040-his uncle 's family]2039-one single member of his own or his uncle 's family had come forward to champion [him]197-clyde . And to [no one]4176-no one save [Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson had [he]197-clyde admitted where [[his]197-clyde parents]1781-his parents were . Yet would it not be necessary , as both [Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson argued from time to time , if any case at all were to be made out for [him]197-clyde , to have [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother or [father]829-father , or at least [a sister]2045-a sister or [a brother]2046-a brother , come forward to say a good word for [him]197-clyde ? Otherwise , [Clyde]197-clyde might appear to be [a pariah]2047-a pariah , [one who had been from the first [a drifter]2049-a drifter and [a waster]2050-a waster and was now purposely being avoided by [all who knew [him]197-clyde]2051-all who knew him]2048-one who had been from the first a drifter and a waster and was now purposely being avoided by all who knew him .

For this reason , at [their]2052-their conference with [Darrah Brookhart]307-brookhart [they]2052-their had inquired after [[Clyde]197-clyde 's parents]2053-clyde 's parents and had learned that in so far as [the Griffiths of Lycurgus]212-lycurgus were concerned , there lay a deep objection to bringing on [any member of this western branch of [the family]964-the family]2054-any member of this western branch of the family . There was , as [he]307-brookhart explained , a great social gap between [them]2053-clyde 's parents , which it would not please [the Lycurgus Griffiths]331-lycurgus to have exploited [here]4244-here . Besides , who could say but that once [[Clyde]197-clyde 's parents]2053-clyde 's parents were notified or discovered by the yellow press , [they]2053-clyde 's parents might not lend [themselves]2053-clyde 's parents to exploitation . Both [Samuel]216-samuel griffiths and [Gilbert Griffiths]305-gilbert , as [Brookhart]307-brookhart now informed [Belknap]324-belknap , had suggested that it was best , if [Clyde]197-clyde did not object , to keeping [[his]197-clyde immediate relatives]2058-his immediate relatives in the background . In fact , on this , in some measure at least , was likely to depend the extent of [their]2053-clyde 's parents financial aid to [Clyde]197-clyde .

[Clyde]197-clyde was in accord with this wish of [the Griffiths]1291-the griffiths , although [no one who]2060-no one who talked with [him]197-clyde sufficiently or heard [him]197-clyde express how sorry [he]197-clyde was on [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother 's account that all this had happened , could doubt the quality of the blood and emotional tie that held [him]197-clyde and [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother together . The complete truth was that [his]197-clyde present attitude toward [her]688-his mother was a mixture of fear and shame because of the manner in which [she]688-his mother was likely to view [his]197-clyde predicament — [his]197-clyde moral if not [his]197-clyde social failure . Would [she]688-his mother be willing to believe the story prepared by [Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson as to [his]197-clyde change of heart ? But even apart from that , to have [her]688-his mother come [here]4244-here now and look at [him]197-clyde through these bars when [he]197-clyde was so disgraced — to be compelled to face [her]688-his mother and talk to [her]688-his mother day after day ! [Her]688-his mother clear , inquiring , tortured eyes ! [Her]688-his mother doubt as to [his]197-clyde innocence , since [he]197-clyde could feel that even [Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , in spite of all [their]2064-they plans for [him]197-clyde , were still a little dubious as to that unintentional blow of [his]197-clyde . [They]2064-they did not really believe it , and [they]2064-they might tell [her]688-his mother that . And would [his]197-clyde religious , [God - fearing , crime - abhorring mother]2065-god - fearing , crime - abhorring mother be more credulous than [they]2064-they ?

Being asked again what [he]197-clyde thought ought to be done about [[his]197-clyde parents]1781-his parents , [he]197-clyde replied that [he]197-clyde did not believe [he]197-clyde could face [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother yet — it would do no good and would only torture both .

And fortunately , as [he]197-clyde saw it , apparently no word of all that had befallen [him]197-clyde had yet reached [[his]197-clyde parents]1781-his parents in [Denver]96-denver . Because of [their]1781-his parents peculiar religious and moral beliefs , all copies of worldly and degenerate daily papers were consistently excluded from [[their]1781-his parents home and [Mission]102-mission]2069-their home and mission . And [the Lycurgus Griffiths]331-lycurgus had had no desire to inform [them]1781-his parents .

Yet one night , at about the time that [Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson were most seriously debating the absence of [[his]197-clyde parents]1781-his parents and what , if anything , should be done about it , [Esta]250-esta , who some time after [Clyde]197-clyde had arrived in [Lycurgus]331-lycurgus had married and was living in [the southeast portion of [Denver]96-denver]2071-the southeast portion of denver , chanced to read in The Rocky Mountain News — and this just subsequent to [Clyde]197-clyde 's indictment by [the Grand Jury at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]2072-the grand jury at bridgeburg :

" [BOY SLAYER OF WORKING GIRL]332-boy slayer of working girl INDICTED[197-clyde]

" [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , [N.
