" Subsequent to the indictment , [Griffiths]197-clyde , who in spite of almost overwhelming evidence , has persisted in asserting that the alleged crime was an accident , and who , accompanied by [[his]197-clyde counsel]4930-his counsel , [Alvin Belknap]323-belknap , and [Reuben Jephson]320-jephson , of [this city]4931-this city , was arraigned before Supreme Court [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , pleaded not guilty . " [Young Griffiths]333-young griffiths , who is only twenty - two years of age , and up to the day of [his]197-clyde arrest [a respected member of [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus smart society]4932-a respected member of lycurgus smart society , is alleged to have stunned and then drowned [[his]197-clyde working - girl sweetheart , whom [he]197-clyde had wronged and then planned to desert in favor of [a richer girl]4934-a richer girl]4933-his working - girl sweetheart , whom he had wronged and then planned to desert in favor of a richer girl . "[250-esta] [Esta]250-esta forthwith made a hurried departure for [[[her]250-esta mother]752-her mother 's home]2074-her mother 's home . Despite the directness and clarity of this [she]752-her mother was not willing to believe it was [Clyde]197-clyde . Still there was the damning force of geography and names — [the rich Lycurgus Griffiths]331-lycurgus , the absence of [[his]197-clyde own relatives]2075-his own relatives .

As quickly as [the local street car]2076-the local street car would carry [her]752-her mother , [she]752-her mother now presented [herself]752-her mother at [the combined lodging house]2077-the combined lodging house and mission known as [the " Star of Hope]4938-the " star of hope , "[197-clyde] in [Bildwell Street]106-bildwell street , which was scarcely better than that formerly maintained in [Kansas City]45-kansas city . For while [it]2078-it provided [a number of rooms for [wayfarers]2080-wayfarers]2079-a number of rooms for wayfarers at twenty - five cents a night , and was supposed to be self - supporting , it entailed much work with hardly any more profit . Besides , by now , both [Frank]249-frank and [Julia]251-julia , who long before this had become irked by the drab world in which [they]2081-themselves found [themselves]2081-themselves , had earnestly sought to free [themselves]2081-themselves of it , leaving the burden of the mission work on [[their]2081-themselves father]2082-their father and [mother]2083-mother . [Julia]251-julia , now nineteen , was cashiering for [a local downtown restaurant]2084-a local downtown restaurant , and [Frank]249-frank , nearing seventeen , had but recently found work in [a fruit and vegetable commission house]2085-a fruit and vegetable commission house . In fact , [the only child about [the place]4628-the place]2086-the only child about the place by day was [little Russell]334-russell , [the illegitimate son of [Esta]250-esta]2088-the illegitimate son of esta — now between three and four years of age , and most reservedly fictionalized by [[his]334-russell grandparents]2089-his grandparents as [an orphan whom [they]2089-his grandparents had adopted in [Kansas City]45-kansas city]2090-an orphan whom they had adopted in kansas city . [He]334-russell was [a dark - haired child]2091-a dark - haired child , in some ways resembling [Clyde]197-clyde , who , even at this early age , as [Clyde]197-clyde had been before [him]334-russell , was being instructed in those fundamental verities which had irritated [Clyde]197-clyde in [his]197-clyde own childhood .

At the time that [Esta]250-esta , now [a decidedly subdued and reserved wife]2092-a decidedly subdued and reserved wife , entered , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths was busy sweeping and dusting and making up beds . But on sight of [[her]335-mrs. griffiths daughter]672-her daughter at this unusual hour approaching , and with blanched cheeks signaling [her]672-her daughter to come inside the door of [a vacant room]2094-a vacant room , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , who , because of years of difficulties of various kinds , was more or less accustomed to scenes such as this , now paused in wonder , the swiftly beclouding mist of apprehension shining in [her]335-mrs. griffiths eyes . What new misery or ill was this ? For decidedly [Esta]250-esta 's weak gray eyes and manner indicated distress . And in [her]335-mrs. griffiths hand was folded a paper , which [she]335-mrs. griffiths opened and after giving [[her]335-mrs. griffiths mother]752-her mother a most solicitous look , pointed to the item , toward which [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths now directed [her]335-mrs. griffiths look . " [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , [nephew of [the wealthy collar manufacturer of [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus]4944-the wealthy collar manufacturer of lycurgus , [New York]63-new york]4943-nephew of the wealthy collar manufacturer of lycurgus , new york . "[197-clyde] [Clyde]197-clyde — [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son ! [She]335-mrs. griffiths paused , full of that intense misery and terror which no faith in the revealed and comforting verities of [God]246-god and mercy and salvation which [she]335-mrs. griffiths was always proclaiming , could for the moment fend against . [Merciful God]246-god ! Would [her]335-mrs. griffiths troubles never end ?

[She]335-mrs. griffiths turned , [her]335-mrs. griffiths big , work - worn hands trembling slightly , shaking the paper [she]335-mrs. griffiths held , while [Esta]250-esta , who sympathized greatly with [[her]250-esta mother]752-her mother these days because of all [she]250-esta had been compelled to endure , stood by . [She]250-esta looked so tired at times , and now to be racked by this ! " [Mamma]4945-mamma , [I]250-esta just ca n't believe it can be [Clyde]197-clyde , "[250-esta] was all [Esta]250-esta could say now . " It just ca n't be , can it ? "[250-esta]

But [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths merely continued to stare at that ominous headline , then swiftly ran [her]335-mrs. griffiths gray - blue eyes over [the room]936-the room . [Her]335-mrs. griffiths broad face was blanched and dignified by an enormous strain and an enormous pain . [[Her]335-mrs. griffiths erring , misguided , no doubt unfortunate , son]2119-her erring , misguided , no doubt unfortunate , son , with all [his]2119-her erring , misguided , no doubt unfortunate , son wild dreams of getting on and up , was in danger of death , of being electrocuted for a crime — for murder ! " [He]2119-her erring , misguided , no doubt unfortunate , son "[335-mrs. griffiths] ( indicating [Asa]335-mrs. griffiths ) " must not know yet , anyhow . [We]4946-we must wire first , or write . On the small dresser was a Gideon Bible , which , sitting on the edge of the commonplace iron bed , [she]335-mrs. griffiths now opened instinctively at Psalms 3 and 4 .

" [Lord]4947-lord , how are [they]4948-they increased that trouble . "[335-mrs. griffiths]

" Hear [me]335-mrs. griffiths , when [I]335-mrs. griffiths call , O God of [my]335-mrs. griffiths righteousness . "[335-mrs. griffiths]

And then reading on silently , even placidly apparently , through 6 , 8 , 10 , 13 , 23 , 91 , while [Esta]250-esta stood by in silent amazement and misery .

" Oh , [Mamma]304-mamma , [I]335-mrs. griffiths just ca n't believe it . Oh , this is too terrible ! "[335-mrs. griffiths] But [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths read on . It was as if , and in spite of all this , [she]335-mrs. griffiths had been able to retreat into some still , silent place , where , for the time being at least , [no evil human ill]2122-no evil human ill could reach [her]335-mrs. griffiths . Then at last , quite calmly closing the book , and rising , [she]335-mrs. griffiths went on :

" Now , [we]4949-we must think out what to say and who to send that telegram to — [I]335-mrs. griffiths mean to [Clyde]197-clyde , of course — at that place , wherever it is — [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , "[335-mrs. griffiths] [she]335-mrs. griffiths added , looking at the paper , and then interpolating from the Bible—"By terrible things in righteousness wilt [thou]2123-thou answer [us]4949-we , O [God]246-god ! And then , despite [her]2124-she sudden peace of the moment , [she]2124-she once more began wringing [her]2124-she large , rough hands . " Oh , it ca n't be true . Oh , dear , no ! [She]2124-she was so beside [herself]2124-she that [she]2124-she scarcely knew what [she]2124-she was saying . And [Esta]250-esta , at [her]2124-she side , was saying : " Yes , [Mamma]304-mamma ! "[2124-she] ( [She]2124-she was thinking of [[her]2124-she husband]831-her husband . ) " And after [Russell]334-russell , too . And [Clyde]197-clyde 's trouble there in [Kansas City]45-kansas city . [Poor Mamma]304-mamma . [She]304-mamma has so much trouble . "[2124-she]

Together , after a time , and avoiding [Asa]335-mrs. griffiths who was in [an adjoining room]2126-an adjoining room helping with the cleaning , [the two]933-the two made [their]933-the two way to [the general mission room below]2128-the general mission room below , where was silence and many placards which proclaimed the charity , the wisdom , and the sustaining righteousness of [God]246-god .

The telegram , worded in the spirit just described , was forthwith despatched care of [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , who immediately counseled [Clyde]197-clyde what to reply — that all was well with [him]197-clyde ; that [he]197-clyde had the best of advice and would need no financial aid . Also that until [[his]197-clyde lawyers]1736-his lawyers advised it , it would be best if [no member of [the family]964-the family]963-no member of the family troubled to appear , since everything that could possibly be done to aid [him]197-clyde was already being done . At the same time [they]933-the two wrote [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , assuring [her]335-mrs. griffiths of [their]933-the two interest in [Clyde]197-clyde and advising [her]335-mrs. griffiths to let matters rest as [they]933-the two were for the present .

Despite the fact that [the Griffiths]197-clyde were thus restrained from appearing in [the east]1130-the east , [neither Belknap]323-belknap nor [Jephson]320-jephson were averse to some news of the existence , whereabouts , faith and sympathy of [[Clyde]197-clyde 's most immediate relatives]2133-clyde 's most immediate relatives creeping into the newspapers , since [the latter]760-the latter were so persistent in referring to [his]197-clyde isolation . And in this connection [they]933-the two were aided by the fact that [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother 's telegram on being received in [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg was at once read by [individuals who were particularly interested in the case]2136-individuals who were particularly interested in the case and by [them]2136-individuals who were particularly interested in the case whispered to [the public]1815-the public and the press , with the result that in [Denver]96-denver [the family]964-the family was at once sought out and interviewed . And shortly after , there was circulated in all the papers [east and west]2139-east and west a more or less complete account of the present state of [[Clyde]197-clyde 's family]2140-clyde 's family , the nature of the mission conducted by [them]2140-clyde 's family , as well as [their]2140-clyde 's family narrow and highly individualistic religious beliefs and actions , even the statement that often in [his]197-clyde early youth [Clyde]197-clyde had been taken into [the streets]2141-the streets to sing and pray — a revelation which shocked [Lycurgus]331-lycurgus and [Twelfth Lake society]40-twelfth lake about as much as it did [him]197-clyde .

At the same time , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , being [an honest woman]2142-an honest woman and whole - heartedly sincere in [her]335-mrs. griffiths faith and in the good of [her]335-mrs. griffiths work , did not hesitate to relate to [[reporter]2143-reporter after reporter who called , all the details of the missionary work of [[her]335-mrs. griffiths husband]831-her husband and [herself]335-mrs. griffiths in [Denver]96-denver and elsewhere . Also that neither [Clyde]197-clyde nor [any of [the other children]2147-the other children]2146-any of the other children]2144-reporter after reporter who called , all the details of the missionary work of her husband and herself in denver and elsewhere . also that neither clyde nor any of the other children had ever enjoyed the opportunities that come to most . However , [[her]335-mrs. griffiths boy]2109-her boy , whatever the present charge might be , was not innately bad , and [she]335-mrs. griffiths could not believe that [he]197-clyde was guilty of any such crime . It was all an unfortunate and accidental combination of circumstances which [he]197-clyde would explain at the trial . However , whatever foolish thing [he]197-clyde might have done , it was all to be attributed to an unfortunate accident which broke up the mission work in [Kansas City]45-kansas city a few years before and compelled the removal of [the family]964-the family from [there]650-there to [Denver]96-denver , leaving [Clyde]197-clyde to make [his]197-clyde way alone . And it was because of advice from [her]335-mrs. griffiths that [he]197-clyde had written [[her]335-mrs. griffiths husband 's rich brother]2151-her husband 's rich brother in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , which led to [his]197-clyde going [there]650-there — a series of statements which caused [Clyde]197-clyde in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell to tingle with a kind of prideful misery and resentment and forced [him]197-clyde to write [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother and complain . Why need [she]335-mrs. griffiths always talk so much about the past and the work that [she]335-mrs. griffiths and [[his]197-clyde father]1778-his father were connected with , when [she]335-mrs. griffiths knew that [he]197-clyde had never liked it and resented going on [the streets]2141-the streets ? [Many people]2157-many people did n't see it as [she]335-mrs. griffiths and [[his]197-clyde father]1778-his father did , particularly [[his]197-clyde uncle]821-his uncle and [cousin]4790-cousin and [all those rich people [he]197-clyde had come to know , and who were able to make [their]2161-all those rich people he had come to know , and who were able to make their way in so different and much more brilliant fashion way in so different and much more brilliant fashion]2161-all those rich people he had come to know , and who were able to make their way in so different and much more brilliant fashion . And now , as [he]197-clyde said to [himself]197-clyde , [Sondra]238-sondra would most certainly read this — all that [he]197-clyde had hoped to conceal .

Yet even in the face of all this , because of so much sincerity and force in [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , [he]197-clyde could not help but think of [her]688-his mother with affection and respect , and because of [her]688-his mother sure and unfailing love for [him]197-clyde , with emotion . For in answer to [his]197-clyde letter [she]688-his mother wrote that [she]688-his mother was sorry if [she]688-his mother had hurt [his]197-clyde feelings or injured [him]197-clyde in any way . But must not the truth be shown always ? The ways of [God]246-god were for the best and surely no harm could spring from service in [His]197-clyde cause . [He]197-clyde must not ask [her]688-his mother to lie . But if [he]197-clyde said the word , [she]688-his mother would so gladly attempt to raise the necessary money and come to [his]197-clyde aid — sit in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell and plan with [him]197-clyde — holding [his]197-clyde hands — but as [Clyde]197-clyde so well knew and thought at this time and which caused [him]197-clyde to decide that [she]688-his mother must not come yet — demanding of [him]197-clyde the truth — with those clear , steady blue eyes of [hers]688-his mother looking into [his]197-clyde own . [He]197-clyde could not stand that now .

For , frowning directly before [him]197-clyde , like [a huge and basalt headland above a troubled and angry sea]2164-a huge and basalt headland above a troubled and angry sea , was the trial itself , with all that it implied — the fierce assault of [Mason]209-mason which [he]197-clyde could only confront , for the most part , with the lies framed for [him]197-clyde by [Jephson]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap . For , although [he]197-clyde was constantly seeking to salve [his]197-clyde conscience with the thought that at the last moment [he]197-clyde had not had the courage to strike [Roberta]195-roberta , nevertheless this other story was so terribly difficult for [him]197-clyde to present and defend — a fact which both [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson realized and which caused [the latter]760-the latter to appear most frequently at [Clyde]197-clyde 's cell door with the greeting : " Well , how 's tricks to - day ? "[760-the latter]

The peculiarly rusty and disheveled and indifferently tailored character of [Jephson]320-jephson 's suits ! The worn and disarranged effect of [his]197-clyde dark brown soft hat , pulled low over [his]197-clyde eyes ! [His]197-clyde long , bony , knotty hands , suggesting somehow an enormous tensile strength . And the hard , small blue eyes filled with a shrewd , determined cunning and courage , with which [he]197-clyde was seeking to inoculate [Clyde]197-clyde , and which somehow did inoculate [him]197-clyde !

" Any more [preachers]4959-preachers around to - day ? [Any more [country girls]4961-country girls or [[Mason]209-mason 's boys]4962-mason 's boys]4960-any more country girls or mason 's boys ? "[197-clyde] For during this time , because of the enormous interest aroused by the pitiable death of [Roberta]195-roberta , as well as the evidence of [[her]195-roberta rich and beautiful rival]2166-her rich and beautiful rival , [Clyde]197-clyde was being visited by [every type of shallow crime - or - sex - curious country bumpkin lawyer]2167-every type of shallow crime - or - sex - curious country bumpkin lawyer , [doctor]2168-doctor , [merchant]2169-merchant , [yokel evangelist]2170-yokel evangelist or [minister]2171-minister , [all friends or acquaintances of one or another of [the officials of [the city]965-the city]2173-the officials of the city , and who , standing before [his]197-clyde cell door betimes , and at the most unexpected moments , and after surveying [him]197-clyde with curious , or resentful , or horrified eyes]2172-all friends or acquaintances of one or another of the officials of the city , and who , standing before his cell door betimes , and at the most unexpected moments , and after surveying him with curious , or resentful , or horrified eyes , asked such questions as : " Do [you]197-clyde pray , [brother]4558-brother ? Do [you]197-clyde get right down on [your]197-clyde knees and pray ? "[197-clyde] ( [Clyde]197-clyde was reminded of [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother and [father]829-father at such times . ) Had [he]197-clyde made [his]197-clyde peace with [God]246-god ? Did [he]197-clyde actually deny that [he]197-clyde had killed [Roberta Alden]195-roberta ? In the case of [three country girls]2177-three country girls : " Would [you]197-clyde mind telling [us]4964-us the name of [the girl [you]197-clyde are supposed to be in love with]4965-the girl you are supposed to be in love with , and where [she]4965-the girl you are supposed to be in love with is now ? [We]4964-us wo n't tell [any one]4181-any one . Will [she]4965-the girl you are supposed to be in love with appear at the trial ? "[197-clyde] Questions which [Clyde]197-clyde could do no more than ignore , or if not , answer as equivocally or evasively or indifferently as possible . For although [he]197-clyde was inclined to resent [them]2178-them , still was [he]197-clyde not being constantly instructed by both [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson that for the good of [his]197-clyde own cause [he]197-clyde must try to appear genial and civil and optimistic ? Then there came also [newspaper men]2179-newspaper men , or [women]2180-women , accompanied by [artists or photographers]2181-artists or photographers , to interview and make studies of [him]197-clyde . But with these , for the most part and on the advice of [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson [he]197-clyde refused to communicate or said only what [he]197-clyde was told to say .

" [You]197-clyde can talk all [you]197-clyde want , "[320-jephson] suggested [Jephson]320-jephson , genially , " so long as [you]197-clyde do n't say anything . And the stiff upper lip , [you]197-clyde know . And the smile that wo n't come off , see ? Not failing to go over that list , are [you]197-clyde ? "[320-jephson] ( [He]320-jephson had provided [Clyde]197-clyde with a long list of possible questions which no doubt would be asked [him]197-clyde on the stand and which [he]197-clyde was to answer according to answers typewritten beneath them , or to suggest something better . [They]2182-they all related to the trip to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , [his]197-clyde reason for the extra hat , [his]197-clyde change of heart — why , when , where . ) " That 's [your]197-clyde litany , [you]197-clyde know . "[320-jephson] And then [he]320-jephson might light a cigarette without ever offering one to [Clyde]197-clyde , since for the sake of a reputation for sobriety [he]197-clyde was not to smoke [here]4244-here .

And for a time , after each visit , [Clyde]197-clyde finding [himself]197-clyde believing that [he]197-clyde could and would do exactly as [Jephson]320-jephson had said — walk briskly and smartly into [court]4347-court — bear up against every one , every eye , even that of [Mason]209-mason [himself]209-mason — forget that [he]197-clyde was afraid of [him]209-mason , even when on the witness stand — forget all the terror of those many facts in [Mason]209-mason 's possession , which [he]197-clyde was to explain with this list of answers — forget [Roberta]195-roberta and [her]195-roberta last cry , and all the heartache and misery that went with the loss of [Sondra]238-sondra and [[her]238-sondra bright world]2185-her bright world .

Yet , with the night having once more fallen , or the day dragging on with only [the lean and bearded Kraut]2186-the lean and bearded kraut or [the sly and evasive Sissel]2187-the sly and evasive sissel , or both , hanging about , or coming to the door to say , " Howdy ! "[197-clyde] or to discuss something that had occurred in [town]4153-town , or to play chess , or checkers , [Clyde]197-clyde growing more and more moody and deciding , maybe , that there was no real hope for [him]197-clyde after all . For how alone [he]197-clyde was , except for [[his]197-clyde attorneys]2189-his attorneys and [mother]2083-mother and [brother]4558-brother and [sisters]2192-sisters ! Never a word from [Sondra]238-sondra , of course . For along with [her]238-sondra recovery to some extent from [her]238-sondra original shock and horror , [she]238-sondra was now thinking somewhat differently of [him]197-clyde — that after all it was for love of [her]238-sondra , perhaps , that [he]197-clyde had slain [Roberta]195-roberta and made [himself]197-clyde [the pariah and victim that [he]197-clyde now was]2193-the pariah and victim that he now was . Yet , because of the immense prejudice and horror expressed by [the world]1694-the world , [she]238-sondra was by no means able to think of venturing to send [him]197-clyde a word . Was [he]197-clyde not [a murderer]1310-a murderer ? And in addition , [that miserable western family of [his]197-clyde]2196-that miserable western family of his , pictured as [street preachers]2197-street preachers , and [he]197-clyde , too,—or as [a singing and praying boy from a mission]2198-a singing and praying boy from a mission ! Yet occasionally returning in thought , and this quite in spite of [herself]238-sondra , to [his]197-clyde eager , unreasoning and seemingly consuming enthusiasm for [her]238-sondra . ( How deeply [he]197-clyde must have cared to venture upon so deadly a deed ! ) And hence wondering whether at some time , once this case was less violently before the public eye , it might not be possible to communicate with [him]197-clyde in some guarded and unsigned way , just to let [him]197-clyde know , perhaps , that because of [his]197-clyde great love for [her]238-sondra [she]238-sondra desired [him]197-clyde to know that [he]197-clyde was not entirely forgotten . Yet as instantly deciding , no , no — [[her]238-sondra parents]4219-her parents — if [they]4219-her parents should learn — or guess — or [the public]1815-the public , or [[her]238-sondra one - time associates]2201-her one - time associates . Not now , oh , not now at least . Maybe later if [he]197-clyde were set free — or — or — convicted — [she]238-sondra could n't tell . Yet suffering heartaches for the most part — as much as [she]238-sondra detested and abhorred the horrible crime by which [he]197-clyde had sought to win [her]238-sondra .

And in the interim , [Clyde]197-clyde in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell , walking to and fro , or looking out on [the dull square]2203-the dull square through the heavily barred windows , or reading and re - reading the newspapers , or nervously turning the pages of magazines or books furnished by [[his]197-clyde counsel]4930-his counsel , or playing chess or checkers , or eating [his]197-clyde meals , which , by special arrangement on the part of [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson ( made at the request of [[his]197-clyde uncle]821-his uncle ) , consisted of better dishes than were usually furnished to [the ordinary prisoner]2206-the ordinary prisoner .

Yet with the iterated and reiterated thought , based on the seemingly irreparable and irreconcilable loss of [Sondra]238-sondra , as to whether it was possible for [him]197-clyde to go on with this — make this , as [he]197-clyde at times saw it , almost useless fight .

At times , in the middle of the night or just before dawn , with all the prison silent — dreams — a ghastly picture of all that [he]197-clyde most feared and that dispelled every trace of courage and drove [him]197-clyde instantly to [his]197-clyde feet , [his]197-clyde heart pounding wildly , [his]197-clyde eyes strained , a cold damp upon [his]197-clyde face and hands . That chair , somewhere in [the State penitentiary]2207-the state penitentiary . [He]197-clyde had read of it — how [men]2208-men died in [it]2209-it . And then [he]197-clyde would walk up and down , thinking how , how , in case it did not come about as [Jephson]320-jephson felt so sure that it would — in case [he]197-clyde was convicted and a new trial refused — then , well — then , might [one]955-one be able to break out of such a jail as this , maybe , and run away ? These old brick walls . How thick were they ? But was it possible that with a hammer or a stone , or something that [some one]796-some one might bring [him]197-clyde — [[his]197-clyde brother]2212-his brother [Frank]249-frank , or [[his]197-clyde sister]2213-his sister [Julia]251-julia , or [Ratterer]277-ratterer , or [Hegglund]337-hegglund — if only [he]197-clyde could get in communication with [some one of [them]2215-them]2214-some one of them and get [him]2216-him or [her]2217-her to bring [him]197-clyde something of the kind — If only [he]197-clyde could get a saw , to saw those bars ! And then run , run , as [he]197-clyde should have in those woods up there that time ! But how ? And whither ?

October 15 — with gray clouds and a sharp , almost January wind that herded the fallen leaves into piles and then scurried them in crisp and windy gusts like flying birds here and there . And , in spite of the sense of struggle and tragedy in the minds of many , with an electric chair as the shadowy mental background to it all , a sense of holiday or festival , with [hundreds of [farmers]1566-farmers]2218-hundreds of farmers , [woodsmen]551-woodsmen , [traders]2221-traders , entering in [Fords]108-fords and Buicks — [farmer wives]2222-farmer wives and [husbands]2223-husbands — [daughters]2224-daughters and [sons]2225-sons — even [infants in arms]2226-infants in arms . And then idling about [the public square]1968-the public square long before the time for [court]4347-court to convene , or , as the hour neared , congregating before [the county jail]1553-the county jail in the hope of obtaining a glimpse of [Clyde]197-clyde , or before [the courthouse door nearest [the jail]1580-the jail]2230-the courthouse door nearest the jail , which was to be the one entrance to [the courtroom]2232-the courtroom for [the public]1815-the public and [Clyde]197-clyde , and from which position [they]1815-the public could see and assure entrance into [the courtroom itself]2234-the courtroom itself when the time came . And a flock of pigeons parading rather dismally along the cornices and gutters of [the upper floor and roof of [the ancient court]2236-the ancient court]2235-the upper floor and roof of the ancient court .

And with [Mason]209-mason and [[his]209-mason staff]2237-his staff — [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , [Zillah Saunders]184-zillah saunders , and [a young [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg law graduate by the name of [Manigault]338-manigault]2238-a young bridgeburg law graduate by the name of manigault — helping to arrange the order of evidence as well as direct or instruct [the various witnesses and venire - men who were already collecting in the antechamber of [the now almost nationally known attorney for [the people]601-the people]2240-the now almost nationally known attorney for the people]2239-the various witnesses and venire - men who were already collecting in the antechamber of the now almost nationally known attorney for the people . And with cries outside of : " [Peanuts]339-peanuts ! "[338-manigault] " [Popcorn]340-popcorn ! "[338-manigault] " Hot dogs ! "[338-manigault] " Get the story of [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , with all the letters of [Roberta Alden]195-roberta . Only twenty - five cents ! "[338-manigault] ( This being a set of duplicate copies of [Roberta]195-roberta 's letters which had been stolen from [[Mason]209-mason 's office]2242-mason 's office by [an intimate of [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh 's]2243-an intimate of burton burleigh 's and by [him]209-mason sold to [a penny - dreadful publisher of [Binghamton]109-binghamton]2244-a penny - dreadful publisher of binghamton , who immediately issued them in pamphlet form together with an outline of " the great plot "[195-roberta] and [Roberta]195-roberta 's and [Clyde]197-clyde 's pictures . )

And in the meantime , over in [the reception or conference room of [the jail]1580-the jail]2245-the reception or conference room of the jail , [Alvin Belknap]323-belknap and [Reuben Jephson]320-jephson , side by side with [Clyde]197-clyde , neatly arrayed in the very suit [he]197-clyde had sought to sink forever in [the waters of [Lower Twelfth Lake]110-lower twelfth lake]2247-the waters of lower twelfth lake . And with a new tie and shirt and shoes added in order to present [him]197-clyde in [his]197-clyde Lycurgus best . [Jephson]320-jephson , long and lean and shabbily dressed as usual , but with all of that iron and power that so impressed [Clyde]197-clyde in every line of [his]197-clyde figure and every movement or gesture of [his]197-clyde body . [Belknap]323-belknap — looking like [an Albany beau]2248-an albany beau — [the one on whom was to fall the burden of the opening presentation of the case]2249-the one on whom was to fall the burden of the opening presentation of the case as well as the cross - examining , now saying : " Now [you]197-clyde 're not going to get frightened or show any evidence of nervousness at anything that may be said or done at any time , are [you]197-clyde , [Clyde]197-clyde ? [We]4967-us 're to be with [you]197-clyde , [you]197-clyde know , all through the trial . [You]197-clyde sit right between [us]4967-us . And [you]197-clyde 're going to smile and look unconcerned or interested , just as [you]197-clyde wish , but never fearful — but not too bold or gay , [you]197-clyde know , so that [they]4968-they 'd feel that [you]197-clyde 're not taking this thing seriously . [You]197-clyde understand — just a pleasant , gentlemanly , and sympathetic manner all the time . And not frightened . For that will be certain to do [us]4967-us and [you]197-clyde great harm . Since [you]197-clyde 're innocent , [you]197-clyde have no real reason to be frightened — although [you]197-clyde 're sorry , of course . [You]197-clyde understand all that , [I]2249-the one on whom was to fall the burden of the opening presentation of the case know , by now . "[2249-the one on whom was to fall the burden of the opening presentation of the case]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , [I]197-clyde understand , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde . " [I]197-clyde will do just as [you]4137-sir say . Besides , [I]197-clyde never struck [her]4970-her intentionally , and that 's the truth . So why should [I]197-clyde be afraid ? "[197-clyde] And here [he]197-clyde looked at [Jephson]320-jephson , on whom , for psychic reasons , [he]197-clyde depended most . In fact the words [he]197-clyde had just spoken were the very words which [Jephson]320-jephson had so drilled into [him]197-clyde during the two months just past . And catching the look , [Jephson]320-jephson now drew closer and fixing [Clyde]197-clyde with [his]320-jephson gimlet and yet encouraging and sustaining blue eyes , began :

" [You]197-clyde 're not guilty ! [You]197-clyde 're not guilty , [Clyde]197-clyde , see ? [You]197-clyde understand that fully by now , and [you]197-clyde must always believe and remember that , because it 's true . [You]197-clyde did n't intend to strike [her]4970-her , do [you]197-clyde hear ? [You]197-clyde swear to that . [You]197-clyde have sworn it to [me]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap here , and [we]4971-we believe [you]197-clyde . Now , it does n't make the least bit of difference that because of the circumstances surrounding all this [we]4971-we are not going to be able to make [the average jury]4972-the average jury see this or believe it just as [you]197-clyde tell it . That 's neither here nor there . [I]320-jephson 've told [you]197-clyde that before . [You]197-clyde know what the truth is — and so do [we]4971-we . But , in order to get justice for [you]197-clyde , [we]4971-we 've had to get up something else — a dummy or substitute for the real fact , which is that [you]197-clyde did n't strike [her]4970-her intentionally , but which [we]4971-we can not hope to make [them]4972-the average jury see without disguising it in some way . [You]197-clyde get that , do n't [you]197-clyde ? "[320-jephson]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , always over - awed and intrigued by [this man]749-this man .

" And for that reason , as [I]749-this man 've so often told [you]197-clyde , [we]4971-we 've invented this other story about a change of heart . It 's not quite true as to time , but it is true that [you]197-clyde did experience a change of heart there in [the boat]4231-the boat . And that 's [our]4971-we justification . But [they]4972-the average jury 'd never believe that under all of the peculiar circumstances , so [we]4971-we 're merely going to move that change of heart up a little , see ? Make it before [you]197-clyde ever went into [that boat]645-that boat at all . And while [we]4971-we know it is n't true that way , still neither is the charge that [you]197-clyde intentionally struck [her]4976-her true , and [they]4972-the average jury 're not going to electrocute [you]197-clyde for something that is n't true — not with [my]749-this man consent , at least . "[749-this man] [He]749-this man looked into [Clyde]197-clyde 's eyes for a moment more , and then added : " It 's this way , [Clyde]197-clyde . It 's like having to pay for potatoes , or for suits of clothes , with corn or beans instead of money , when [you]197-clyde have money to pay with but when , because of the crazy notions on the part of [some one]796-some one , [they]4972-the average jury wo n't believe that the money [you]197-clyde have is genuine . So [you]197-clyde 've got to use the potatoes or beans . And beans is what [we]4971-we 're going to give ['em]4978-'em . But the justification is that [you]197-clyde 're not guilty . [You]197-clyde 're not guilty . [You]197-clyde 've sworn to [me]749-this man that [you]197-clyde did n't intend to strike [her]4979-her there at the last , whatever [you]197-clyde might have been provoked to do at first . And that 's enough for [me]749-this man . [You]197-clyde 're not guilty . "[749-this man]

And here , firmly and convincingly , which was the illusion in regard to [his]749-this man own attitude which [he]749-this man was determined to convey to [Clyde]197-clyde , [he]749-this man laid hold of [his]749-this man coat lapels , and after looking fixedly into [his]197-clyde somewhat strained and now nervous brown eyes , added : " And now , whenever [you]197-clyde get to feeling weak or nervous , or if , when [you]197-clyde go on the stand , [you]197-clyde think [Mason]209-mason is getting the best of [you]197-clyde , [I]749-this man want [you]197-clyde to remember this — just say to yourself—'I'm not guilty ! [I]749-this man 'm not guilty ! And [they]4980-they ca n't fairly convict [me]749-this man unless [I]749-this man really am . ' And if that do n't pull [you]197-clyde together , look at [me]749-this man . [I]749-this man 'll be right there . All [you]197-clyde have to do , if [you]197-clyde feel [yourself]197-clyde rattled , is to look at [me]749-this man — right into [my]749-this man eyes , just as [I]749-this man 'm looking at [you]197-clyde now — and then [you]197-clyde 'll know that [I]749-this man 'm wanting [you]197-clyde to brace up and do what [I]749-this man 'm telling [you]197-clyde to do now — swear to the things that [we]4981-we are asking [you]197-clyde to swear to , however they may look like lies , and however [you]197-clyde may feel about them . And now that 's all . "[749-this man]

And here [he]2251-he slapped [him]2251-he genially and heartily on the back , while [Clyde]197-clyde , strangely heartened , felt , for the time being at least , that certainly [he]197-clyde could do as [he]197-clyde was told , and would .

In the meantime , [Clyde]197-clyde , in spite of both [Belknap]342-belknap 's and [Jephson]320-jephson 's preliminary precautions , was already feeling stiff and chill and bloodless . For , decidedly , as [he]197-clyde could feel , [this audience]2303-this audience was inimical . And again , [all those people of [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus and [Twelfth Lake]40-twelfth lake]2310-all those people of lycurgus and twelfth lake , [no one of whom]2311-no one of whom had troubled to communicate with [him]197-clyde in any way , assuming [him]197-clyde to be absolutely guilty , of course — were any of those here ? And after all [his]197-clyde bluffing about [his]197-clyde rich connections here and in [the west]788-the west . For now , of course , [they]2316-they would believe [him]197-clyde as terrible as [his]197-clyde original plot , without knowing or caring about [his]197-clyde side of the story — [his]197-clyde moods and fears — that predicament that [he]197-clyde was in with [Roberta]195-roberta — [his]197-clyde love for [Sondra]238-sondra and all that [she]195-roberta had meant to [him]197-clyde . And again , this side of that third window from the front , but beyond [that dreaded group of [the Aldens]217-the aldens]2343-that dreaded group of the aldens , [that very large and whiskered man who looked something like an old - time Quaker turned bandit]2344-that very large and whiskered man who looked something like an old - time quaker turned bandit — [Heit]2345-heit was [his]2345-heit name . " No doubt many of [you]5016-you have been wearied , as well as puzzled , at times during the past week , "[197-clyde] [he]197-clyde began , " by the exceeding care with which [the lawyers in this case]4935-the lawyers in this case have passed upon the panels from which [you]5016-you [twelve men]4729-twelve men have been chosen . For [my]197-clyde part , the care which [I]197-clyde have exercised , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , has been directed by but one motive — that [the state]1663-the state shall have justice done . No malice , no pre - conceived notions of any kind . So late as July 9th last [I]197-clyde personally was not even aware of the existence of [this defendant]5022-this defendant , nor of [[his]5022-this defendant victim]5023-his victim , nor of the crime with which [he]5022-this defendant is now charged . " But , however that may be , let [us]5028-us proceed to the facts . There are [two women in this action]5029-two women in this action . [One]955-one is dead . [The other]1885-the other "[2380-he] ( and [he]2380-he now turned toward where [Clyde]197-clyde sat , and here [he]2380-he pointed a finger in the direction of [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson ) , " by agreement between [the prosecution]2006-the prosecution and [the defense]1984-the defense is to be nameless here , since no good can come from inflicting unnecessary injury . " There was a rule of [the Griffiths Company]5094-the griffiths company , as [we]5095-we will later show in this trial , which explains much — and that was that [no superior officer]5096-no superior officer or head of [any department]5097-any department was permitted to have anything to do with [any girls working under [him]2406-he , or for [the factory]4260-the factory , in or out of [the factory]4260-the factory]5098-any girls working under him , or for the factory , in or out of the factory . " [Gentlemen of the jury]5015-gentlemen of the jury , "[2407-him] and here [his]2407-him voice took on an almost reverential tone , " [Roberta Alden]195-roberta loved [this defendant]5022-this defendant with all the strength of [her]195-roberta soul . [She]195-roberta loved [him]2407-him with that love which is the crowning mystery of the human brain and the human heart , that transcends in its strength and its weakness all fear of shame or punishment from even the immortal throne above . [She]195-roberta was [a true and human and decent and kindly girl]5112-a true and human and decent and kindly girl — [a passionate and loving girl]5113-a passionate and loving girl . And [she]195-roberta loved as only [a generous and trusting and self - sacrificing soul]5114-a generous and trusting and self - sacrificing soul can love . And loving so , in the end [she]195-roberta gave to [him]2407-him all that [any woman]5115-any woman can give [the man]504-the man [she]195-roberta loves .[2407-him]

" [Friends]924-friends , this thing has happened millions of times in [this world of [ours]5119-ours]5118-this world of ours , and it will happen millions and millions of times in the days to come . It is not new and it will never be old .[2406-he]

" But in January or February last , [this girl]818-this girl , who is now dead in [her]195-roberta grave , was compelled to come to [this defendant]5022-this defendant , [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , and tell [him]197-clyde that [she]818-this girl was about to become [a mother]5122-a mother . [We]5119-ours shall prove to [you]924-friends that then and later [she]818-this girl begged [him]197-clyde to go away with [her]818-this girl and make [her]818-this girl [[his]197-clyde wife]494-his wife .[2407-him]

" But did [he]197-clyde ? Would [he]197-clyde ? Oh , no ! For by that time a change had come over the dreams and the affections of [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde . [He]197-clyde had had time to discover that the name of [Griffiths]197-clyde in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus was one that would open the doors of [Lycurgus exclusive circles]5124-lycurgus exclusive circles — that [the man who was [no one in [Kansas City]45-kansas city or [Chicago]43-chicago]5126-no one in kansas city or chicago]5125-the man who was no one in kansas city or chicago — was [very much of [a person here]5128-a person here , and that it would bring [him]197-clyde in contact with [girls of education and means]5129-girls of education and means , [girls who moved far from the sphere to which [Roberta Alden]195-roberta belonged]5130-girls who moved far from the sphere to which roberta alden belonged]5127-very much of a person here , and that it would bring him in contact with girls of education and means , girls who moved far from the sphere to which roberta alden belonged . "[2408-he] Here [he]2408-he paused , but only for a moment , then went on :

" But at no point have [I]2408-he been able to find the least modification or cessation of any of these social activities on [his]197-clyde part which so entranced [him]197-clyde . On the contrary , from January to July fifth last , and after — yes , even after [she]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position was finally compelled to say to [him]197-clyde that unless [he]197-clyde could take [her]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position away and marry [her]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position , [she]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position would have to appeal to the sense of justice in [the community in which [they]5135-they moved]5134-the community in which they moved , and after [she]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position was cold and dead under [the waters of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]5136-the waters of big bittern — dances , lawn fetes , automobile parties , dinners , gay trips to [Twelfth Lake]40-twelfth lake and [Bear Lake]50-bear lake , and without a thought , seemingly , that [her]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position great moral and social need should modify [his]197-clyde conduct in any way . "[2408-he]

And here [he]2408-he paused and gazed in the direction of [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , who in turn , were not sufficiently disturbed or concerned to do more than smile , first at [him]2408-he and then at [each other]871-each other , although [Clyde]197-clyde , terrorized by the force and the vehemence of it all , was chiefly concerned to note how much of exaggeration and unfairness was in all this .

But even as [he]2408-he was thinking so , [Mason]209-mason was continuing with : " But by this time , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , as [I]209-mason have indicated , [Roberta Alden]195-roberta had become insistent that [Griffiths]197-clyde make [her]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position [[his]197-clyde wife]494-his wife . And this [he]197-clyde promised to do . Yet , as all the evidence here will show , [he]197-clyde never intended to do anything of the kind . " Eventually , and solely because there was no other way out , [he]197-clyde permitted [her]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position to come to [him]197-clyde — on July sixth last — exactly two days before [her]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position death . " But did [he]197-clyde even do that ? Never by letter ! Never ! Oh , no , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , oh , no ! And these so few and brief that [she]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position [herself]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position complained bitterly of [his]197-clyde lack of interest and consideration for [her]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position at this time . " But did [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde want [the world]1694-the world to know how [he]197-clyde had treated [her]5131-one girl to whom , because of her beauty , wealth , position ? Of course not ! And there and then began to form in [his]197-clyde mind a plan by which [he]197-clyde could escape exposure and seal [Roberta Alden]195-roberta 's lips forever . And then [he]209-mason announced :

" Do n't forget , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , that although [he]209-mason had previously indicated to [Roberta]195-roberta that this was to be [their]5160-they wedding journey , [he]209-mason did not want [anybody]1268-anybody to know that [he]209-mason was with [[his]209-mason prospective bride]5162-his prospective bride — no , not even after [they]5160-they had reached [Big Bittern]13-big bittern . Did it ? [I]209-mason will show [you]4570-gentlemen the registers of [the two hotels in which [they]5160-they stayed]5164-the two hotels in which they stayed , and where , because of [their]5160-they assumed approaching marriage , [they]5160-they occupied [a single room]5165-a single room together . And so [you]4570-gentlemen have the astounding and bitter spectacle , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , of [a supposedly innocent and highly misunderstood young man]5169-a supposedly innocent and highly misunderstood young man dragging [this weary and heart - sick girl]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl from place to place , in order to find [a lake]5171-a lake deserted enough in which to drown [her]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl . And with [her]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl but four months from motherhood ![209-mason]

" And then , having arrived at last at [one lake]5172-one lake lonely enough , putting [her]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl in [a boat]535-a boat and taking [her]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl out from [the inn where [he]209-mason had again falsely registered as [Mr. Clifford Golden]298-mr. clifford golden and [wife]586-wife]5174-the inn where he had again falsely registered as mr. clifford golden and wife , to [her]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl death . [The poor little thing]5176-the poor little thing imagined that [she]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl was going for a brief outing before that marriage of which [he]209-mason talked and which was to seal and sanctify it . To seal and sanctify it ! To seal and sanctify , as closing waters seal and sanctify , but in no other way — no other way . And with [him]209-mason walking , whole and sly — as a wolf from its kill — to freedom , to marriage , to social and material and affectionate bliss and superiority and ease , while [she]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl slept still and nameless in [her]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl watery grave .[209-mason]

" But , oh , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , the ways of nature , or of [God]246-god , and the Providence that shapes [our]5178-our ends , rough - hew [them]5179-them how [we]5178-our may ! It is man who proposes , but [God]246-god — [God]246-god — who disposes ![209-mason]

" [The defendant]4999-the defendant is still wondering , [I]209-mason am sure , as to how [I]209-mason know that [she]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl thought [she]5170-this weary and heart - sick girl was still going to be married after leaving [the inn]503-the inn at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern . But how shrewd and deep must be that mind that would foresee and forestall all the accidents and chances of life . For , as [he]197-clyde sits there now , secure in the faith that [his]197-clyde counsel may be able to extract [him]197-clyde safely from this "[209-mason] ( and at this [Clyde]197-clyde sat bolt upright , [his]197-clyde hair tingling , and [his]197-clyde hands concealed beneath the table , trembling slightly ) , " [he]197-clyde does not know that [that girl]4343-that girl , while in [[her]4343-that girl room in [the Grass Lake Inn]5184-the grass lake inn]5183-her room in the grass lake inn , had written [[her]4343-that girl mother]752-her mother a letter , which [she]4343-that girl had not had time to mail , and which was in the pocket of [her]4343-that girl coat left behind because of the heat of the day , and because [she]4343-that girl imagined [she]4343-that girl was coming back , of course . And which is here now upon this table . "[209-mason]

At this [Clyde]197-clyde 's teeth fairly chattered . [He]197-clyde shook as with a chill . To be sure , [she]2414-she had left [her]2414-she coat behind ! And [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson also sat up , wondering what this could be . How fatally , if at all , could it mar or make impossible the plan of defense which [they]2415-they had evolved ? [They]2415-they could only wait and see .

" But in that letter , "[209-mason] went on [Mason]209-mason , " [she]2414-she tells why [she]2414-she was up there — to be married , no less "[209-mason] ( and at this point [Jephson]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap , as well as [Clyde]197-clyde , heaved an enormous sigh of relief — it was directly in the field of [their]2415-they plan ) " and within a day or two , "[209-mason] continued [Mason]209-mason , thinking still that [he]209-mason was literally riddling [Clyde]197-clyde with fear . " But [Griffiths]197-clyde , or [Graham]297-mr. carl graham , of [Albany]28-albany , or [Syracuse]119-syracuse , or anywhere , knew better . [He]197-clyde knew [he]197-clyde was not coming back . And [he]197-clyde took all of [his]197-clyde belongings with [him]197-clyde in [that boat]645-that boat . And all afternoon long , from noon until evening , [he]197-clyde searched for [a spot on [that lonely lake]5188-that lonely lake]5187-a spot on that lonely lake — [a spot not easily observed from any point of [the shore]992-the shore]5189-a spot not easily observed from any point of the shore , as [we]5191-we will show . And as evening fell , [he]197-clyde found it . And walking south through [the woods]632-the woods afterwards , with a new straw hat upon [his]197-clyde head , a clean , dry bag in [his]197-clyde hand , [he]197-clyde imagined [himself]197-clyde to be secure . [Clifford Golden]298-mr. clifford golden was no more — [Carl Graham]297-mr. carl graham was no more — drowned — at [the bottom of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]5193-the bottom of big bittern , along with [Roberta Alden]195-roberta . But [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde was alive and free , and on [his]197-clyde way to [Twelfth Lake]40-twelfth lake , to [the society [he]197-clyde so loved]5194-the society he so loved .[209-mason]

" [Gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde killed [Roberta Alden]195-roberta before [he]197-clyde put [her]195-roberta in [that lake]4165-that lake . [He]197-clyde beat [her]195-roberta on the head and face , and [he]197-clyde believed no eye saw [him]197-clyde . But , as [her]195-roberta last death cry rang out over [the water of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]5197-the water of big bittern , there was [a witness]842-a witness , and before the prosecution has closed [its]5199-its case , [that witness]5200-that witness will be here to tell [you]5201-you the story . "[209-mason]

[Mason]209-mason had [no eye witness]2416-no eye witness , but [he]209-mason could not resist this opportunity to throw so disrupting a thought into [the opposition camp]2417-the opposition camp .

And decidedly , the result was all that [he]209-mason expected , and more . For [Clyde , who up to this time and particularly since the thunderbolt of the letter]2418-clyde , who up to this time and particularly since the thunderbolt of the letter , had been seeking to face it all with an imperturbable look of patient innocence , now stiffened and then wilted . [A witness]842-a witness ! And here to testify ! [God]246-god ! Then [he]209-mason , whoever [he]209-mason was , lurking on [the lone shore of [the lake]571-the lake]2420-the lone shore of the lake , had seen the unintended blow , had heard [her]2422-her cries — had seen that [he]209-mason had not sought to aid [her]2422-her ! Had seen [him]209-mason swim to [shore]1422-shore and steal away — maybe had watched [him]209-mason in [the woods]632-the woods as [he]209-mason changed [his]209-mason clothes . God ! [His]209-mason hands now gripped the sides of the chair , and [his]209-mason head went back with a jerk as if from a powerful blow , for that meant death — [his]209-mason sure execution . [God]246-god ! No hope now ! [His]209-mason head dropped and [he]209-mason looked as though [he]209-mason might lapse into a state of coma .

As to [Belknap]323-belknap , [Mason]209-mason 's revelation at first caused [him]209-mason to drop the pencil with which [he]209-mason was making notes , then next to stare in a puzzled and dumbfounded way , since [they]2425-them had no evidence wherewith to forefend against such a smash as this — But as instantly recalling how completely off [his]209-mason guard [he]209-mason must look , recovering . Could it be that [Clyde]197-clyde might have been lying to [them]2425-them , after all — that [he]197-clyde had killed [her]2426-her intentionally , and before [this unseen witness]2427-this unseen witness ? If so it might be necessary for [them]2425-them to withdraw from such a hopeless and unpopular case , after all .

As for [Jephson]320-jephson , [he]320-jephson was for the moment stunned and flattened . And through [his]320-jephson stern and not easily shakable brain raced such thoughts as — was there really a witness?—has [Clyde]197-clyde lied?—then the die was cast , for had [he]197-clyde not already admitted to [them]2425-them that [he]197-clyde had struck [Roberta]195-roberta , and [the witness]2428-the witness must have seen that ? And so the end of any plea of a change of heart . Who would believe that , after such testimony as this ?

But because of the sheer contentiousness and determination of [his]320-jephson nature , [he]320-jephson would not permit [himself]320-jephson to be completely baffled by this smashing announcement . Instead [he]320-jephson turned , and after surveying the flustered and yet self - chastising [Belknap]323-belknap and [Clyde]197-clyde , commented : " [I]320-jephson do n't believe it . [He]197-clyde 's lying , [I]320-jephson think , or bluffing . At any rate , [we]5202-we 'll wait and see . It 's a long time between now and [our]5202-we side of the story . Look at [all those witnesses there]5203-all those witnesses there . And [we]5202-we can cross - question [them]2425-them by the week , if [we]5202-we want to — until [he]197-clyde 's out of [office]1932-office . Plenty of time to do a lot of things — find out about [this witness]5205-this witness in the meantime . And besides , there 's suicide , or there 's the actual thing that happened . [We]5202-we can let [Clyde]197-clyde swear to what did happen — a cataleptic trance — no courage to do it . It 's not likely [anybody]1268-anybody can see that at five hundred feet . "[320-jephson] And [he]320-jephson smiled grimly . At almost the same time [he]320-jephson added , but not for [Clyde]197-clyde 's ears : " [We]5202-we might be able to get [him]197-clyde off with twenty years at the worst , do n't [you]197-clyde think ? "[320-jephson]

And then [witnesses]1767-witnesses , [witnesses]1767-witnesses , [witnesses]1767-witnesses — to the number of [one hundred and twenty - seven]2432-one hundred and twenty - seven . And [their]1767-witnesses testimony , particularly that of [the doctors]1941-the doctors , [three guides]2434-three guides , [the woman who heard [Roberta]195-roberta 's last cry]2435-the woman who heard roberta 's last cry , all repeatedly objected to by [Jephson]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap , for upon such weakness and demonstrable error as [they]1767-witnesses could point out depended the plausibility of [Clyde]197-clyde 's daring defense . And all of this carrying the case well into November , and after [Mason]209-mason had been overwhelmingly elected to the judgeship which [he]209-mason had so craved . And because of the very vigor and strife of the trial , [the general public]2436-the general public from coast to coast taking more and more interest . And obviously , as the days passed and [the newspaper writers at the trial]2437-the newspaper writers at the trial saw it , [Clyde]197-clyde was guilty . Yet [he]197-clyde , because of the repeated commands of [Jephson]320-jephson , facing each witness who assailed [him]197-clyde with calm and even daring .

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . ' [Bobbie]195-roberta ' was what [we]5214-we sometimes called [her]2442-his former sweetheart around [there]650-there — just [Bobbie]195-roberta . "[209-mason]

And [Clyde]197-clyde listening intently and enduring without flinching the stern and accusing stare of [this brooding Priam of [the farm]2441-the farm]2440-this brooding priam of the farm , wondering at the revelation of [[his]4339-the old man former sweetheart]2442-his former sweetheart 's pet name . [He]4339-the old man had nicknamed [her]2442-his former sweetheart " [Bert]202-bert "[2442-his former sweetheart] ; [she]2442-his former sweetheart had never told [him]4339-the old man that at [home]4141-home [she]2442-his former sweetheart was called " [Bobbie]202-bert . "[2442-his former sweetheart]

And amid a fusillade of objections and arguments and rulings , [Alden]195-roberta continuing , under the leading of [Mason]209-mason , to recite how [she]2442-his former sweetheart had decided to go to [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , after receipt of a letter from [Grace Marr]349-grace marr , and stop with [Mr.]2444-mr. and [Mrs. Newton]348-mrs. george newton . And after securing work with [the Griffiths Company]5094-the griffiths company , how little [the family]964-the family had seen of [her]2442-his former sweetheart until June fifth last , when [she]2442-his former sweetheart had returned to [the farm]2441-the farm for a rest and in order to make some clothes .

" No announcement of any plans for marriage ? "[2442-his former sweetheart]

" None . "[2442-his former sweetheart]

But [she]2442-his former sweetheart had written a number of long letters — to whom [he]4339-the old man did not know at the time . And [she]2442-his former sweetheart had been depressed and sick . Twice [he]4339-the old man had seen [her]2442-his former sweetheart crying , although [he]4339-the old man said nothing , knowing that [she]2442-his former sweetheart did not want to be noticed . There had been a few telephone calls from [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , the last on July fourth or fifth , the day before [she]2442-his former sweetheart left , [he]4339-the old man was quite sure .

" And what did [she]2442-his former sweetheart have with [her]2442-his former sweetheart when [she]2442-his former sweetheart left ? "[2448-a deputy assistant district attorney]

" [Her]2442-his former sweetheart bag and [her]2442-his former sweetheart little trunk . "[2448-a deputy assistant district attorney]

" And would [you]4339-the old man recognize the bag that [she]2442-his former sweetheart carried , if [you]4339-the old man saw it ? "[2448-a deputy assistant district attorney]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[2448-a deputy assistant district attorney]

" Is this the bag ? "[2448-a deputy assistant district attorney] ( [A deputy assistant district attorney]2448-a deputy assistant district attorney carrying forward a bag and placing it on a small stand . )

And [Alden]195-roberta , after looking at it and wiping [his]4339-the old man eyes with the back of [his]4339-the old man hand , announcing : " Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[195-roberta]

And then most dramatically , as [Mason]209-mason intended in connection with every point in this trial , [a deputy assistant carrying in a small trunk]2449-a deputy assistant carrying in a small trunk , and [Titus Alden]182-titus and [[his]182-titus wife]494-his wife and [daughters]2224-daughters and [sons]2225-sons all crying at the sight of it . And after being identified by [him]182-titus as [Roberta]195-roberta 's , the bag and then the trunk were opened in turn . And the dresses made by [Roberta]195-roberta , some underclothing , shoes , hats , the toilet set given [her]195-roberta by [Clyde]197-clyde , pictures of [[her]195-roberta mother]752-her mother and [father]829-father and [sister]2455-sister and [brothers]2308-brothers , an old family cookbook , some spoons and forks and knives and salt and pepper sets — all given [her]195-roberta by [[her]195-roberta grandmother]2457-her grandmother and treasured by [her]195-roberta for [her]195-roberta married life — held up and identified in turn .

All this over [Belknap]323-belknap 's objection , and on [Mason]209-mason 's promise to " connect it up , "[209-mason] which , however , [he]209-mason was unable to do , and the evidence was accordingly ordered " struck out . "[323-belknap] But its pathetic significance by that time deeply impressed on the minds and hearts of [the jurymen]2458-the jurymen . And [Belknap]323-belknap 's criticism of [Mason]209-mason 's tactics merely resulting in [that gentleman]675-that gentleman bellowing , in an infuriated manner : " Who 's conducting this prosecution , anyhow ? "[675-that gentleman] To which [Belknap]323-belknap replied : " [The Republican candidate for [county judge in [this county]600-this county]5222-county judge in this county]5221-the republican candidate for county judge in this county , [I]323-belknap believe!"—thus[323-belknap] evoking a wave of laughter which caused [Mason]209-mason to fairly shout : " [Your]323-belknap Honor , [I]209-mason protest ! This is an unethical and illegal attempt to inject into this case a political issue which has nothing to do with it . It is slyly and maliciously intended to convey to [this jury]5224-this jury that because [I]209-mason am [the Republican nominee for judge of [the county]499-the county]5225-the republican nominee for judge of the county , it is impossible for [me]209-mason to properly and fairly conduct the prosecution of this case . And [I]209-mason now demand an apology , and will have it before [I]209-mason proceed one step further in this case . "[209-mason]

[Whereupon Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , feeling that a very serious breach of court etiquette had occurred , proceeded to summon [Belknap]323-belknap and [Mason]209-mason before [him]323-belknap , and after listening to placid and polite interpretations of what was meant , and what was not meant , finally ordered , on pain of contempt , that neither of [them]2460-them again refer to the political situation in any way .

Nevertheless , [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson congratulating [themselves]2460-them that in this fashion [their]2460-them mood in regard to [Mason]209-mason 's candidacy and [his]209-mason use of this case to further it had effectively gotten before [the jury]1953-the jury and [the court]1991-the court .

But [more and more witnesses]2463-more and more witnesses !

[Grace Marr]349-grace marr now taking the stand , and in a glib and voluble outpouring describing how and where [she]349-grace marr had first met [Roberta]195-roberta — how pure and clean and religious [a girl]4540-a girl [she]195-roberta was , but how after meeting [Clyde]197-clyde on [Crum Lake]112-crum lake a great change had come over [her]195-roberta . [She]195-roberta was more secretive and evasive and given to furnishing all sorts of false excuses for new and strange adventures — as , for instance , going out nights and staying late , and claiming to be places over Saturday and Sunday where [she]195-roberta wasn't — until finally , because of criticism which [she]195-roberta , [Grace Marr]349-grace marr , had ventured to make , [she]195-roberta had suddenly left , without giving any address . But there was [a man]4220-a man , and [that man]2466-that man was [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde . For having followed [Roberta]195-roberta to [[her]195-roberta room]1145-her room one evening in September or October of the year before , [she]195-roberta had observed [her]195-roberta and [Clyde]197-clyde in the distance , near [the Gilpin home]2468-the gilpin home . [They]2469-they were standing under some trees and [he]197-clyde had [his]197-clyde arm around [her]195-roberta .

And thereafter [Belknap]323-belknap , at [Jephson]320-jephson 's suggestion , taking [her]195-roberta and by the slyest type of questioning , trying to discover whether , before coming to [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , [Roberta]195-roberta was as religious and conventional as [Miss Marr]355-miss marr would have it . And next [the Newtons]353-the newtons swearing to much the same thing .

And thereafter seeming to live very much alone until finally [she]294-mrs. gilpin , feeling sorry for [her]294-mrs. gilpin , had suggested one type of contact and another , but [Roberta]195-roberta invariably refusing . But later , along in late November , although [she]294-mrs. gilpin had never had the heart to say anything about it to [her]294-mrs. gilpin because of [her]294-mrs. gilpin sweetness and general sobriety , [she]294-mrs. gilpin and [[her]294-mrs. gilpin two daughters]2477-her two daughters had become aware of the fact that occasionally , after eleven o'clock , it had seemed as though [Roberta]195-roberta must be entertaining [some one in [[her]195-roberta room]1145-her room]2478-some one in her room , but just whom [she]195-roberta could not say . And then [the elder daughter]2482-the elder daughter , [Stella]356-stella , testifying that during the latter part of October or the first of November , shortly after [Roberta]195-roberta had taken [the room]936-the room , [she]195-roberta had passed [her]195-roberta and [a man , whom [she]294-mrs. gilpin was now able to identify as [Clyde]197-clyde , standing less than a hundred feet from [the house]748-the house]2484-a man , whom she was now able to identify as clyde , standing less than a hundred feet from the house , and noticing that [they]2486-they were evidently quarreling [she]294-mrs. gilpin had paused to listen . "[195-roberta] And [he]197-clyde had finally turned upon [his]197-clyde heel , leaving [Roberta]195-roberta standing with outstretched arms as if imploring [him]197-clyde to return .
