And after [her]195-roberta the conductor of [the train]4140-the train that carried [them]2559-they to [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge . And after [him]197-clyde [the guide]544-the guide and [the driver of [the bus]506-the bus]2562-the driver of the bus , with [his]197-clyde story of [Clyde]197-clyde 's queer talk about [many people]2157-many people being over there and leaving [Roberta]195-roberta 's bag while [he]197-clyde took [his]197-clyde own , and saying [they]2559-they would be back .

And then , [the proprietor of [the Inn at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]627-the inn at big bittern]2565-the proprietor of the inn at big bittern ; [the boatkeeper]2567-the boatkeeper ; [the three men in [the woods]632-the woods]2568-the three men in the woods — [their]2568-the three men in the woods testimony very damaging to [Clyde]197-clyde 's case , since [they]2568-the three men in the woods pictured [his]197-clyde terror on encountering [them]2568-the three men in the woods . And then the story of the finding of [the boat]4231-the boat and [Roberta]195-roberta 's body , and the eventual arrival of [Heit]192-heit and [his]192-heit finding of the letter in [Roberta]195-roberta 's coat . A score of [witnesses]1767-witnesses testifying as to all this . And next [the boat captain]2572-the boat captain , [the farm girl]2573-the farm girl , [the Cranston chauffeur]2574-the cranston chauffeur , the arrival of [Clyde]197-clyde at [the Cranstons ']1213-the cranstons ' , and at last ( every step accounted for and sworn to ) [his]197-clyde arrival at [Bear Lake]50-bear lake , the pursuit and [his]197-clyde capture — to say nothing of the various phases of [his]197-clyde arrest — what [he]197-clyde said — this being most damaging indeed , since it painted [Clyde]197-clyde as false , evasive , and terrified .

But unquestionably , the severest and most damaging testimony related to the camera and the tripod — the circumstances surrounding the finding of [them]2576-them — and on the weight of [this Mason]2577-this mason was counting for a conviction . [His]197-clyde one aim first was to convict [Clyde]197-clyde of lying as to [his]197-clyde possession of either a tripod or a camera . And in order to do that [he]197-clyde first introduced [Earl Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , who swore that on a certain day , when [he]197-clyde , [Mason]209-mason and [Heit]192-heit and all [the others connected with the case]2578-the others connected with the case were taking [Clyde]197-clyde over [the area in which the crime had been committed]2579-the area in which the crime had been committed , [he]197-clyde and [a certain native]2580-a certain native , one [Bill Swartz]371-bill swartz , who was afterwards put on the stand , while poking about under [some fallen logs and bushes]2581-some fallen logs and bushes , had come across the tripod , hidden under a log . Also ( under the leadership of [Mason]209-mason , although over the objections of both [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , which were invariably overruled ) , [he]197-clyde proceeded to add that [Clyde]197-clyde , on being asked whether [he]197-clyde had a camera or [this tripod]2582-this tripod , had denied any knowledge of it , on hearing which [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson actually shouted [their]2583-their disapproval .

Immediately following , though eventually ordered stricken from the records by [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , there was introduced a paper signed by [Heit]192-heit , [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , [Slack]287-slack , [Kraut]290-kraut , [Swenk]284-swenk , [Sissel]283-sissel , [Bill Swartz]371-bill swartz , [Rufus Forster]372-rufus forster , [county surveyor]2584-county surveyor , and [Newcomb]181-earl newcomb , which set forth that [Clyde]197-clyde , on being shown [the tripod]2585-the tripod and asked whether [he]197-clyde had one , " vehemently and repeatedly denied that [he]197-clyde had . "[197-clyde] But in order to drive the import of [this home]2586-this home , [Mason]209-mason immediately adding : " Very well , [your]197-clyde Honor , but [I]209-mason have [other witnesses who will swear to everything that is in that paper and more]5229-other witnesses who will swear to everything that is in that paper and more , "[209-mason] and at once calling " [Joseph Frazer]373-joseph frazer ! [Joseph Frazer]373-joseph frazer ! "[209-mason] and then placing on the stand [a dealer in sporting goods , cameras , etc .]2587-a dealer in sporting goods , cameras , etc . , who proceeded to swear that some time between May fifteenth and June first , [the defendant]4999-the defendant , [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , whom [he]197-clyde knew by sight and name , had applied to [him]197-clyde for a camera of a certain size , with tripod attached , and that [the defendant]4999-the defendant had finally selected a Sank , 3½ by 5½ , for which [he]197-clyde had made arrangements to pay in installments . And after due examination and consulting certain stock numbers with which the camera and the tripod and [his]197-clyde own book were marked , [Mr. Frazer]374-mr. frazer identifying first the camera now shown [him]197-clyde , and immediately after that the yellow tripod as the one [he]197-clyde had sold [Clyde]197-clyde .

And [Clyde]197-clyde sitting up aghast . Then [they]2590-they had found the camera , as well as the tripod , after all . And after [he]197-clyde had protested so that [he]197-clyde had no camera with [him]197-clyde . What would [that jury]2591-that jury and [the judge]4625-the judge and [this audience]2303-this audience think of [his]197-clyde lying about that ? Would [they]2590-they be likely to believe [his]197-clyde story of a change of heart after this proof that [he]197-clyde had lied about a meaningless camera ? Better to have confessed in the first place .

But even as [he]197-clyde was so thinking [Mason]209-mason calling [Simeon Dodge]375-simeon dodge , [a young woodsman]2594-a young woodsman and driver , who testified that on Saturday , the sixteenth of July , accompanied by [John Pole]194-john pole , who had lifted [Roberta]195-roberta 's body out of the water , [he]375-simeon dodge had at the request of [the district attorney]517-the district attorney , repeatedly dived into the exact spot where [her]195-roberta body was found , and finally succeeded in bringing up a camera . And then the camera itself identified by [Dodge]375-simeon dodge .

Immediately after this all the testimony in regard to the hitherto as yet unmentioned films found in the camera at the time of [its]2596-its recovery , since developed , and now received in evidence , four views which showed [a person]1651-a person looking more like [Roberta]195-roberta than [any one else]4774-any one else , together with two , which clearly enough represented [Clyde]197-clyde . [Belknap]323-belknap was not able to refute or exclude [them]2599-them .

Then [Floyd Thurston]376-floyd thurston , [one of the guests at [the Cranston lodge at [Sharon]25-sharon]1072-the cranston lodge at sharon]2600-one of the guests at the cranston lodge at sharon on June eighteenth — the occasion of [Clyde]197-clyde 's first visit [there]650-there — placed on the stand to testify that on that occasion [Clyde]197-clyde had made a number of pictures with a camera about the size and description of the one shown [him]197-clyde , but failing to identify it as [the particular one]2603-the particular one , [his]197-clyde testimony being stricken out .

After [him]197-clyde again , [Edna Patterson]377-edna patterson , [a chambermaid in [the Grass Lake Inn]5184-the grass lake inn]2604-a chambermaid in the grass lake inn , who , as [she]377-edna patterson swore , on entering [the room which [Clyde]197-clyde and [Roberta]195-roberta occupied on the night of July seventh]2606-the room which clyde and roberta occupied on the night of july seventh , had seen [Clyde]197-clyde with a camera in [his]197-clyde hand , which was of the size and color , as far as [she]377-edna patterson could recall , of the one then and there before [her]377-edna patterson . [She]377-edna patterson had also at the same time seen a tripod . And [Clyde]197-clyde , in [his]197-clyde curious and meditative and half - hypnotized state , recalling well enough the entrance of [this girl]818-this girl into [that room]2608-that room and marveling and suffering because of the unbreakable chain of facts that could thus be built up by [witnesses from such varying and unconnected and unexpected places , and so long after , too]2609-witnesses from such varying and unconnected and unexpected places , and so long after , too .

After [her]377-edna patterson , but on different days , and with [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson contending every inch of the way as to the admissibility of all this , the testimony of [the five doctors whom [Mason]209-mason had called in at the time [Roberta]195-roberta 's body]2610-the five doctors whom mason had called in at the time roberta 's body was first brought to [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , and who in turn swore that the wounds , both on the face and head , were sufficient , considering [Roberta]195-roberta 's physical condition , to stun [her]195-roberta . And because of the condition of [the dead girl]4430-the dead girl 's lungs , which had been tested by attempting to float them in water , averring that at the time [her]195-roberta body had first entered [the water]1009-the water , [she]195-roberta must have been still alive , although not necessarily conscious . But as to the nature of the instrument used to make these wounds , [they]2613-they would not venture to guess , other than to say it must have been blunt . And no grilling on the part of either [Belknap]323-belknap or [Jephson]320-jephson could bring [them]2613-they to admit that the blows could have been of such a light character as not to stun or render unconscious . The chief injury appeared to be on the top of the skull , deep enough to have caused a blood clot , photographs of all of which were put in evidence .

At this psychological point , when [both audience]2614-both audience and [jury]2615-jury were most painfully and effectively stirred , a number of photographs of [Roberta]195-roberta 's face , made at the time that [Heit]192-heit , [the doctors]1941-the doctors and [the Lutz Brothers]220-the lutz brothers had [her]195-roberta in charge , were introduced . Then the dimensions of the bruises on the right side of [her]195-roberta face were shown to correspond exactly in size with two sides of the camera . Immediately after that , [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , placed on the stand to swear how [he]211-burton burleigh had discovered the two strands of hair which corresponded with the hair on [Roberta]195-roberta 's head — or so [Mason]209-mason tried to show — caught between the lens and the lid . And then , after hours and hours , [Belknap]323-belknap , infuriated and yet made nervous by this type of evidence and seeking to riddle it with sarcasm , finally pulling a light hair out of [his]323-belknap head and then asking [the jurors]2617-the jurors and [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh if [they]2613-they could venture to tell whether one single hair from [any one]4181-any one 's head could be an indication of the general color of [a person]1651-a person 's hair , and if not , whether [they]2613-they were ready to believe that this particular hair was from [Roberta]195-roberta 's head or not .

[Mason]209-mason then calling a [Mrs. Rutger Donahue]378-mrs. donahue , who proceeded , in the calmest and most placid fashion , to tell how on the evening of July eighth last , between five - thirty and six , [she]378-mrs. donahue and [[her]378-mrs. donahue husband]831-her husband immediately after setting up [a tent above [Moon Cove]18-moon cove]2621-a tent above moon cove , had started out to row and fish , when being about [a half - mile off shore]2622-a half - mile off shore and perhaps a quarter of a mile above [the woods]632-the woods or [northern fringe of land which enclosed [Moon Cove]18-moon cove]2624-northern fringe of land which enclosed moon cove , [she]378-mrs. donahue had heard a cry .

" Between half past five and six in the afternoon , [you]209-mason say ? "[323-belknap]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[323-belknap]

" And on what date again ? "[323-belknap]

" July eighth . "[323-belknap]

" And where were [you]209-mason exactly at that time ? "[323-belknap]

" [We]5231-we were — "[323-belknap]

" Not ' [we]5231-we . ' Where were [you]209-mason personally ? "[323-belknap]

" [I]323-belknap was crossing what [I]323-belknap have since learned was [South Bay]127-south bay in [a row - boat]5232-a row - boat with [[my]323-belknap husband]5233-my husband . "[323-belknap]

" Yes . Now tell what happened next . "[323-belknap]

" When [we]5231-we reached [the middle of [the bay]5235-the bay]5234-the middle of the bay [I]323-belknap heard a cry . "[323-belknap]

" What was it like ? "[323-belknap]

" It was penetrating — like the cry of [some one in pain — or in danger]5236-some one in pain — or in danger . It was sharp — a haunting cry . "[323-belknap]

Here a motion to " strike out , "[323-belknap] with the result that the last phrase was so ordered stricken out .

" Where did it come from ? "[323-belknap]

" From a distance . From within or beyond [the woods]632-the woods . "[323-belknap]

" Did [you]209-mason know at the time that there was [another bay or [cove there]5239-cove there]5238-another bay or cove there — below [that strip of woods]5240-that strip of woods ? "[323-belknap]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[323-belknap]

" Well , what did [you]209-mason think then — that it might have come from within [the woods below where [you]209-mason were]5242-the woods below where you were ? "[323-belknap]

( Objected to — and objection sustained . )

" And now tell [us]5231-we , was it [a man]4220-a man 's or [a woman]2023-a woman 's cry ? What kind of a cry was it ? "[323-belknap]

" It was [a woman]2023-a woman 's cry , and something like ' Oh , oh ! ' or ' Oh , [my]323-belknap ! ' — very piercing and clear , but distant , of course . A double scream such as one might make when in pain . "[323-belknap]

" [You]209-mason are sure [you]209-mason could not be mistaken as to the kind of a cry it was — male or female . "[323-belknap]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . [I]323-belknap am positive . It was [a woman]2023-a woman 's . It was pitched too high for [a man]4220-a man 's voice or [a boy]617-a boy 's . It could not have been anything but [a woman]2023-a woman 's . "[323-belknap]

" [I]323-belknap see . And now tell [us]5231-we , [Mrs. Donahue]378-mrs. donahue — [you]209-mason see this dot on the map showing where the body of [Roberta Alden]195-roberta was found ? "[323-belknap]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[323-belknap]

" And [you]209-mason see this other dot , over those trees , showing approximately where [[your]209-mason boat]4383-your boat was ? "[323-belknap]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[323-belknap]

" Do [you]209-mason think that voice came from where this dot in [Moon Cove]18-moon cove is ? "[323-belknap]

( Objected to . Sustained . )

" And was that cry repeated ? "[323-belknap]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . [I]323-belknap waited , and [I]323-belknap called [[my]323-belknap husband]5233-my husband 's attention to it , too , and [we]2628-they waited , but did n't hear it again . "[323-belknap]

Then [Belknap]323-belknap , eager to prove that it might have been a terrified and yet not a pained or injured cry , taking [her]2625-she and going all over [the ground]2626-the ground again , and finding that neither [she]2625-she nor [[her]2625-she husband]831-her husband , who was also put on the stand , could be shaken in any way . Neither , [they]2628-they insisted , could the deep and sad effect of [this woman]4170-this woman 's voice be eradicated from [their]2628-they minds . It had haunted both , and once in [[their]2628-they camp]2630-their camp again [they]2628-they had talked about it . Because it was dusk [he]831-her husband did not wish to go seeking after the spot from which it came ; because [she]2625-she felt that [some woman]2631-some woman or [girl]2632-girl might have been slain in [those woods]1203-those woods , [she]2625-she did not want to stay any longer , and the next morning early [they]2628-they had moved on to [another lake]2634-another lake .

[Thomas Barrett]379-tom , [another Adirondack guide]2635-another adirondack guide , connected with [a camp at [Dam 's Lake]128-dam 's lake]2636-a camp at dam 's lake , swore that at the time referred to by [Mrs. Donahue]378-mrs. donahue , [he]379-tom was walking along [the shore]992-the shore toward [Big Bittern Inn]129-big bittern inn and had seen not only [a man]4220-a man and woman off [shore]1422-shore in about the position described , but farther back , toward [the south shore of [this bay]2641-this bay]2640-the south shore of this bay , had noted [the tent of [these campers]2643-these campers]2642-the tent of these campers . Also that from [no point outside [Moon Cove]18-moon cove]2644-no point outside moon cove , unless near the entrance , could one observe [any boat within [the cove]2646-the cove]2645-any boat within the cove . The entrance was narrow and any view from [the lake]571-the lake proper completely blocked . And there were [other witnesses]2648-other witnesses to prove this .

At this psychological moment , as the afternoon sun was already beginning to wane in [the tall , narrow courtroom]2649-the tall , narrow courtroom , and as carefully planned by [him]379-tom beforehand , [Mason]209-mason 's reading all of [Roberta]195-roberta 's letters , one by one , in a most simple and nondeclamatory fashion , yet with all the sympathy and emotion which [their]2650-their first perusal had stirred in [him]209-mason . [They]2650-their had made [him]209-mason cry .

[He]209-mason began with letter number one , dated June eighth , only three days after [her]195-roberta departure from [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , and on through [them]2650-their all down to letters fourteen , fifteen , sixteen and seventeen , in which , in piecemeal or by important references here and there , [she]195-roberta related [her]195-roberta whole contact with [Clyde]197-clyde down to [his]209-mason plan to come for [her]195-roberta in three weeks , then in a month , then on July eighth or ninth , and then the sudden threat from [her]195-roberta which precipitated [his]209-mason sudden decision to meet [her]195-roberta at [Fonda]118-fonda . And as [Mason]209-mason read [them]2650-their , all most movingly , the moist eyes and the handkerchiefs and the coughs in [the audience]2651-the audience and among [the jurors]2617-the jurors attested [their]2650-their import :

" [You]209-mason said [I]2651-the audience was not to worry or think so much about how [I]2651-the audience feel , and have a good time . That 's all right for [you]209-mason to say , when [you]209-mason 're in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus and surrounded by [[your]209-mason friends]5256-your friends and invited everywhere . It 's hard for [me]2651-the audience to talk over there at [Wilcox 's]214-mr. wilcox with [somebody]1593-somebody always in earshot and with [you]209-mason constantly reminding [me]2651-the audience that [I]2651-the audience must n't say this or that . But [I]2651-the audience had so much to ask and no chance there . And all that [you]209-mason would say was that everything was all right . But [you]209-mason did n't say positively that [you]209-mason were coming on the 27th , that because of something [I]2651-the audience could n't quite make out — there was so much buzzing on the wire — [you]209-mason might not be able to start until later . But that ca n't be , [Clyde]197-clyde . [[My]2651-the audience parents]5258-my parents are leaving for [Hamilton]131-hamilton where [[my]2651-the audience uncle]5259-my uncle lives on the third . And [Tom]379-tom and [Emily]347-emily are going to [[my]2651-the audience sister]5260-my sister 's on the same day . But [I]2651-the audience ca n't and wo n't go [there]650-there again . [I]2651-the audience ca n't stay [here]4244-here all alone . So [you]209-mason must , [you]209-mason really must come , as [you]209-mason agreed . [I]2651-the audience ca n't wait any longer than that , [Clyde]197-clyde , in the condition that [I]2651-the audience 'm in , and so [you]209-mason just must come and take [me]2651-the audience away . Oh , please , please , [I]2651-the audience beg of [you]209-mason , not to torture [me]2651-the audience with any more delays now . "[2651-the audience] And again :

" [Clyde]197-clyde , [I]2651-the audience came [home]4141-home because [I]2651-the audience thought [I]2651-the audience could trust [you]197-clyde . [You]209-mason told [me]2651-the audience so solemnly before [I]2651-the audience left that if [I]2651-the audience would , [you]197-clyde would come and get [me]2651-the audience in three weeks at the most — that it would not take [you]197-clyde longer than that to get ready , have enough money for the time [we]5264-we would be together , or until [you]197-clyde could get something to do somewhere else . But yesterday , although the third of July will be nearly a month since [I]2651-the audience left , [you]197-clyde were not at all sure at first that [you]197-clyde could come by then , and when as [I]2651-the audience told [you]197-clyde [[my]2651-the audience parents]5258-my parents are surely leaving for [Hamilton]131-hamilton to be gone for ten days . Of course , afterwards , [you]197-clyde said [you]197-clyde would come , but [you]197-clyde said it as though [you]197-clyde were just trying to quiet [me]2651-the audience . It has been troubling [me]2651-the audience awfully ever since .[2651-the audience]

" For [I]2651-the audience tell [you]197-clyde , [Clyde]197-clyde , [I]2651-the audience am sick , very . [I]2651-the audience feel faint nearly all the time . And besides , [I]2651-the audience am so worried as to what [I]2651-the audience shall do if [you]197-clyde do n't come that [I]2651-the audience am nearly out of [my]2651-the audience mind . "[2651-the audience]

" [Clyde]197-clyde , [I]2651-the audience know that [you]197-clyde do n't care for [me]2651-the audience any more like [you]197-clyde did and that [you]197-clyde are wishing things could be different . And yet , what am [I]2651-the audience to do ? [I]2651-the audience know [you]197-clyde 'll say that it has all been as much [my]2651-the audience fault as [yours]197-clyde . And [the world]1694-the world , if it knew , might think so , too . But how often did [I]2651-the audience beg [you]197-clyde not to make [me]2651-the audience do what [I]2651-the audience did not want to do , and which [I]2651-the audience was afraid even then [I]2651-the audience would regret , although [I]2651-the audience loved [you]197-clyde too much to let [you]197-clyde go , if [you]197-clyde still insisted on having [your]197-clyde way . "[2651-the audience]

" [Clyde]197-clyde , if [I]2651-the audience could only die . That would solve all this . And [I]2651-the audience have prayed and prayed that [I]2651-the audience would lately , yes [I]2651-the audience have . For life does not mean as much to [me]2651-the audience now as when [I]2651-the audience first met [you]197-clyde and [you]197-clyde loved [me]2651-the audience . Oh , those happy days ! If only things were different . If only [I]2651-the audience were out of [your]197-clyde way . It would all be so much better for [me]2651-the audience and for [all of [us]5267-all of us]5267-all of us . But [I]2651-the audience ca n't now , [Clyde]197-clyde , without a penny and no way to save the name of [[our]5267-all of us child]5268-our child , except this . Yet if it were n't for the terrible pain and disgrace it would bring to [[my]2651-the audience mother]4154-my mother and [father]829-father and all [[my]2651-the audience family]5271-my family , [I]2651-the audience would be willing to end it all in another way . [I]2651-the audience truly would . "[2651-the audience] And again :

" Oh , [Clyde]197-clyde , [Clyde]197-clyde , life is so different to - day to what it was last year . Think — then [we]5267-all of us were going to [Crum]132-crum and [those other lakes over near [Fonda]118-fonda and [Gloversville]98-gloversville and [Little Falls]133-little falls]5272-those other lakes over near fonda and gloversville and little falls , but now — now . Only just now [some boy]5273-some boy and [girl friends of [Tom]379-tom 's and [Emily]347-emily 's]5274-girl friends of tom 's and emily 's came by to get [them]5273-some boy to go after strawberries , and when [I]2651-the audience saw [them]5273-some boy go and knew [I]2651-the audience could n't , and that [I]2651-the audience could n't be like that any more ever , [I]2651-the audience cried and cried , ever so long . "[2651-the audience] And finally :

" [I]2651-the audience have been bidding good - by to some places to - day . There are so many nooks , [dear]1259-dear , and all of them so dear to [me]2651-the audience . [I]2651-the audience have lived [here]4244-here all [my]2651-the audience life , [you]1259-dear know . First , there was [the springhouse with [its]5277-the springhouse with its great masses of green moss great masses of green moss]5277-the springhouse with its great masses of green moss , and in passing [it]5277-the springhouse with its great masses of green moss [I]2651-the audience said good - by to [it]5277-the springhouse with its great masses of green moss , for [I]2651-the audience wo n't be coming to [it]5277-the springhouse with its great masses of green moss soon again — maybe never . And then the old apple tree where [we]5278-we had [our]5278-we playhouse years ago — [Emily]347-emily and [Tom]379-tom and [Gifford]380-gifford and [I.]2651-the audience Then the ' Believe , ' [a cute little house in [the orchard]5280-the orchard where [we]5278-we sometimes played]5279-a cute little house in the orchard where we sometimes played .[2651-the audience]

" Oh , [Clyde]197-clyde , [you]1259-dear ca n't realize what all this means to [me]2651-the audience , [I]2651-the audience feel as though [I]2651-the audience shall never see [[my]2651-the audience home]5281-my home again after [I]2651-the audience leave [here]4244-here this time . [She]4945-mamma has had trouble enough , and [I]2651-the audience could n't break [her]4945-mamma heart like that . No , if [I]2651-the audience go away and come back some time , either married or dead — it does n't make so much difference now — [she]4945-mamma will never know , and [I]2651-the audience will not have caused [her]4945-mamma any pain , and that means so much more than life itself to [me]2651-the audience . " [Your]197-clyde sorrowful ,[2651-the audience]

" [ROBERTA]195-roberta . "[2651-the audience] And at points in the reading , [Mason]209-mason [himself]209-mason crying , and at [their]2653-their conclusion turning , weary and yet triumphant , a most complete and indestructible case , as [he]209-mason saw it , having been presented , and exclaiming : " [The People]601-the people rest . "[209-mason] And at that moment , [Mrs. Alden]187-mrs. alden , in court with [[her]187-mrs. alden husband]831-her husband and [Emily]347-emily , and overwrought , not only by the long strain of the trial but this particular evidence , uttering a whimpering yet clear cry and then falling forward in a faint . And [Clyde]197-clyde , in [his]197-clyde own overwrought condition , hearing [her]187-mrs. alden cry and seeing [her]187-mrs. alden fall , jumping up — the restraining hand of [Jephson]320-jephson instantly upon [him]197-clyde , while [bailiffs]2655-bailiffs and [others]1118-others assisted [her]187-mrs. alden and [Titus]182-titus who was beside [her]187-mrs. alden from [the courtroom]2232-the courtroom . And [the audience]2651-the audience almost , if not quite , as moved and incensed against [Clyde]197-clyde by that development as though , then and there , [he]197-clyde had committed some additional crime .

But then , that excitement having passed and it being quite dark , and the hands of the court clock pointing to five , and [all the court weary]2659-all the court weary , [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer signifying [his]326-justice oberwaltzer intention of adjourning for the night .

And at once all [the newspaper men]2660-the newspaper men and [feature writers]2661-feature writers and [artists]2257-artists rising and whispering to [each other]871-each other that on the morrow the defense would start , and wondering as to who and where [the witnesses]4923-the witnesses were , also whether [Clyde]197-clyde would be permitted to go on the stand in [his]197-clyde own defense in the face of this amazing mass of evidence against [him]197-clyde , or whether [[his]197-clyde lawyers]1736-his lawyers would content [themselves]1736-his lawyers with some specious argument as to mental and moral weakness which might end in [prison]4800-prison for life — not less .

And [Clyde]197-clyde , hissed and cursed as [he]197-clyde left [the court]1991-the court , wondering if on the morrow , and as [they]2668-they had planned this long time since , [he]197-clyde would have the courage to rise and go on the stand — wondering if there was not some way , in case [no one]4176-no one was looking ( [he]197-clyde was not handcuffed as [he]197-clyde went to and from [the jail]1580-the jail ) maybe to - morrow night when all were rising , [the crowds]2671-the crowds moving and [these deputies]2672-these deputies coming toward [him]197-clyde — if — well , if [he]197-clyde could only run , or walk easily and quietly and yet , quickly and seemingly unintentionally , to that stair and then down and out — to — well — to wherever it went — that small side door to the main stairs which before this [he]197-clyde had seen from [the jail]1580-the jail ! If [he]197-clyde could only get to [some woods]2674-some woods somewhere , and then walk and walk , or run and run , maybe , without stopping , and without eating , for days maybe , until , well , until [he]197-clyde had gotten away — anywhere . It was a chance , of course . [He]197-clyde might be shot , or tracked with dogs and [men]2208-men , but still it was a chance , was n't it ?

For this way [he]197-clyde had no chance at all . [No one]4176-no one anywhere , after all this , was going to believe [him]197-clyde not guilty . And [he]197-clyde did not want to die that way . No , no , not that way !

And so another miserable , black and weary night . And then another miserable gray and wintry morning .

By eight o'clock the next morning the great city papers were on the stands with the sprawling headlines , which informed [every one]2317-every one in no uncertain terms :

" PROSECUTION IN [GRIFFITHS]197-clyde ' CASE CLOSES WITH IMPRESSIVE DELUGE OF TESTIMONY . "[323-belknap]

" MOTIVE AS WELL AS METHOD HAMMERED HOME . "[323-belknap]

" [DESTRUCTIVE MARKS ON FACE]381-destructive marks on face AND HEAD SHOWN TO CORRESPOND WITH ONE SIDE OF CAMERA . "[323-belknap]

" [MOTHER OF DEAD GIRL]276-mother FAINTS AT CLOSE OF DRAMATIC READING OF [HER]276-mother LETTERS . "[323-belknap] And the architectonic way in which [Mason]209-mason had built [his]209-mason case , together with [his]209-mason striking and dramatic presentation of it , was sufficient to stir in [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , as well as [Clyde]197-clyde , the momentary conviction that [they]2678-they had been completely routed — that by no conceivable device could [they]2678-they possibly convince [this jury]5224-this jury now that [Clyde]197-clyde was not [a quadruple - dyed villain]2680-a quadruple - dyed villain .

And all congratulating [Mason]209-mason on the masterly way [he]209-mason had presented [his]209-mason case . And [Clyde]197-clyde , greatly reduced and saddened by the realization that [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother would be reading all that had transpired the day before . [He]197-clyde must ask [Jephson]320-jephson to please wire [her]688-his mother so that [she]688-his mother would not believe it . And [Frank]369-frank w. schaefer and [Julia]251-julia and [Esta]250-esta . That was what [a family with money]2682-a family with money could do for [you]2683-you . And on this very day [his]197-clyde defense would begin and [he]197-clyde would have to go forward as [the only witness of any import]2684-the only witness of any import . Yet asking [himself]197-clyde , how could [he]197-clyde ? [The crowd]1585-the crowd . [Its]1585-the crowd temper . The nervous strain of [its]1585-the crowd unbelief and hatred by now . Yet in the face of all this , and after an hour spent with [Jephson]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell , finding [himself]197-clyde back in [the courtroom]2232-the courtroom , under the persistent gaze of [this nondescript jury]2689-this nondescript jury and [the tensely interested audience]2690-the tensely interested audience . And now [Belknap]323-belknap rising before [the jury]1953-the jury and after solemnly contemplating each one of [them]1953-the jury , beginning :

" [Gentlemen]4570-gentlemen — somewhat over three weeks ago [you]4570-gentlemen were told by [the district attorney]517-the district attorney that because of the evidence [he]197-clyde was about to present [he]197-clyde would insist that [[you]4570-gentlemen [jurors]5289-jurors]5288-you jurors must find [the prisoner at the bar]5045-the prisoner at the bar guilty of the crime of which [he]197-clyde stands indicted . It has been a long and tedious procedure since then . [The foolish and inexperienced]5291-the foolish and inexperienced , yet in every case innocent and unintentional , acts of [a boy of fifteen or sixteen]5292-a boy of fifteen or sixteen have been gone into before [you]4570-gentlemen gentlemen as though they were the deeds of [a hardened criminal]5293-a hardened criminal , and plainly with the intention of prejudicing [you]4570-gentlemen against [this defendant]5022-this defendant , who , with the exception of one misinterpreted accident in [Kansas City]45-kansas city — the most brutally and savagely misinterpreted accident it has ever been [my]323-belknap professional misfortune to encounter — can be said to have lived as clean and energetic and blameless and innocent a life as [any boy of [his]197-clyde years anywhere]5295-any boy of his years anywhere . [You]4570-gentlemen have heard [him]197-clyde called [a man]4220-a man — [a bearded man]5080-a bearded man — [a criminal]5298-a criminal and [a crime - soaked product of the darkest vomiting of Hell]5299-a crime - soaked product of the darkest vomiting of hell . And yet [he]197-clyde is but twenty - one . And there [he]197-clyde sits . And [I]323-belknap venture to say that if by some magic of the spoken word [I]323-belknap could at this moment strip from [your]4570-gentlemen eye the substance of all the cruel thoughts and emotions which have been attributed to [him]197-clyde by a clamorous and mistaken and [I]323-belknap might say ( if [I]323-belknap had not been warned not to do so ) , politically biased prosecution , [you]4570-gentlemen could no more see [him]197-clyde in the light that [you]4570-gentlemen do than [you]4570-gentlemen could rise out of that box and fly through those windows .[323-belknap]

" [Gentlemen of the jury]5015-gentlemen of the jury , [I]2692-his have no doubt that [you]4570-gentlemen , as well as [the district attorney]517-the district attorney and even [the audience]2651-the audience , have wondered how under the downpour of such linked and at times almost venomous testimony , [I]2692-his or [[my]2692-his colleague]5303-my colleague or [this defendant]5022-this defendant could have remained as calm and collected as [we]5305-we have . "[2692-his] ( And here [he]2692-his waved with grave ceremoniousness in the direction of [[his]2692-his partner]2693-his partner , who was still waiting [his]2692-his own hour . ) " Yet , as [you]4570-gentlemen have seen , [we]5305-we have not only maintained but enjoyed the serenity of those who not only feel but know that [they]5306-they have the right and just end of any legal contest . [You]4570-gentlemen recall , of course , the words of [the Avon bard—'Thrice]5307-the avon bard—'thrice armed is [he]2692-his who hath [his]2692-his quarrel just . '[2692-his]

" In fact , [we]5305-we know , as [the prosecution]2006-the prosecution in this case unfortunately does not , the peculiarly strange and unexpected circumstances by which this dramatic and most unfortunate death came about . And before [we]5305-we are through [you]4570-gentlemen shall see for [yourselves]4570-gentlemen . In the meantime , let [me]323-belknap tell [you]4570-gentlemen , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , that since this case opened [I]323-belknap have believed that even apart from the light [we]5305-we propose to throw on this disheartening tragedy , [[you]4570-gentlemen gentlemen]5310-you gentlemen are not at all sure that a brutal or bestial crime can be laid upon the shoulders of [this defendant]5022-this defendant . [You]4570-gentlemen can not be ! For after all , love is love , and the ways of passion and the destroying emotion of love in either sex are not those of [the ordinary criminal]5312-the ordinary criminal . Only remember , [we]5305-we were once [all boys]5313-all boys . And those of [you]4570-gentlemen who are [grown women]5314-grown women were [girls]1319-girls , and know well — oh , how very well — the fevers and aches of youth that have nothing to do with a later practical life . ' Judge not , lest [ye]4570-gentlemen be judged and with whatsoever measure [ye]4570-gentlemen mete , it will be measured unto [ye]4570-gentlemen again . '[323-belknap]

" [We]5305-we admit the existence and charm and potent love spell of [the mysterious Miss X]354-miss x and [her]354-miss x letters , which [we]5305-we have not been able to introduce here , and their effect on [this defendant]5022-this defendant . And , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , as [[your]4570-gentlemen own county district attorney]5323-your own county district attorney has told [you]4570-gentlemen , [Roberta Alden]195-roberta loved [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde . " But , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , [I]323-belknap am not going to dwell on that phase of the question so much as on this explanation which [we]5329-we are about to offer . Why did [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde go to [Fonda]118-fonda , or to [Utica]30-utica , or to [Grass Lake]21-grass lake , or to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , at all ? Do [you]4570-gentlemen think [we]5329-we have any reason for or any desire to deny or discolor in any way the fact of [his]197-clyde having done so , or with [Roberta Alden]195-roberta either ? Or why , after the suddenness and seeming strangeness and mystery of [her]195-roberta death , [he]197-clyde should have chosen to walk away as [he]197-clyde did ? If [you]4570-gentlemen seriously think so for one fraction of a moment , [you]4570-gentlemen are [the most hopelessly deluded and mistaken dozen jurymen]5330-the most hopelessly deluded and mistaken dozen jurymen it has been [our]5329-we privilege to argue before in all [our]5329-we twenty - seven years ' contact with [juries]5331-juries .[323-belknap]

" [Gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , [I]2694-he have said to [you]4570-gentlemen that [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde is not guilty , and [he]197-clyde is not . [You]4570-gentlemen may think , perhaps , that [we]5329-we [ourselves]5329-we must be believing in [his]197-clyde guilt . But [you]4570-gentlemen are wrong . The peculiarity , the strangeness of life , is such that oftentimes [a man]4220-a man may be accused of something that [he]4220-a man did not do and yet every circumstance surrounding [him]4220-a man at the time seem to indicate that [he]4220-a man did do it . There have been many very pathetic and very terrible instances of miscarriages of justice through circumstantial evidence alone . Be sure ! Oh , be very sure that no such mistaken judgment based on any local or religious or moral theory of conduct or bias , because of presumed irrefutable evidence , is permitted to prejudice [you]4570-gentlemen , so that without meaning to , and with the best and highest - minded intentions , [you]4570-gentlemen [yourselves]4570-gentlemen see a crime , or the intention to commit a crime , when no such crime or any such intention ever truly or legally existed or lodged in the mind or acts of [this defendant]5022-this defendant . Oh , be sure ! Be very , very sure ! "[2694-he]

And here [he]2694-he paused to rest and seemed to give [himself]2694-he over to deep and even melancholy thought , while [Clyde]197-clyde , heartened by this shrewd and defiant beginning was inclined to take more courage . But now [Belknap]323-belknap was talking again , and [he]2694-he must listen — not lose a word of all this that was so heartening .

" When [Roberta Alden]195-roberta 's body was taken out of the water at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , it was examined by [a physician]5336-a physician . [He]197-clyde declared at the time that [the girl]4152-the girl had been drowned . " [You]4570-gentlemen were told by [the district attorney]517-the district attorney that [Roberta Alden]195-roberta and [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde were engaged to be married and that [she]195-roberta left [[her]195-roberta home at [Biltz]14-biltz]5340-her home at biltz and went forth with [him]197-clyde on July sixth last on [her]195-roberta wedding journey . Now , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , it is so easy to slightly distort a certain set of circumstances . ' Were engaged to be married ' was how [the district attorney]517-the district attorney emphasized the incidents leading up to the departure on July sixth . As a matter of fact , not one iota of any direct evidence exists which shows that [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde was ever formally engaged to [Roberta Alden]195-roberta , or that , except for some passages in [her]195-roberta letters , [he]197-clyde agreed to marry [her]195-roberta . And those passages , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , plainly indicate that it was only under the stress of moral and material worry , due to [her]195-roberta condition — for which [he]197-clyde was responsible , of course , but which , nevertheless , was with the consent of both — [a boy of twenty - one]5344-a boy of twenty - one and [a girl of twenty - three]5345-a girl of twenty - three — that [he]197-clyde agreed to marry [her]195-roberta . Is that , [I]2695-i ask [you]4570-gentlemen , an open and proper engagement — the kind of an engagement [you]4570-gentlemen think of when [you]4570-gentlemen think of one at all ? Mind [you]4570-gentlemen , [I]2695-i am not seeking to flout or belittle or reflect in any way on [this poor , dead girl]5346-this poor , dead girl . [I]2695-i am simply stating , as a matter of fact and of law , that [this boy]4688-this boy was not formally engaged to [this dead girl]5090-this dead girl . [He]4688-this boy had not given [her]195-roberta [his]4688-this boy word beforehand that [he]4688-this boy would marry [her]195-roberta ... Never ! There is no proof . [You]4570-gentlemen must give [him]4688-this boy the benefit of that . And only because of [her]195-roberta condition , for which [we]5349-we admit [he]4688-this boy was responsible , [he]4688-this boy came forward with an agreement to marry [her]195-roberta , in case ... in case "[2695-i] ( and here [he]2695-i paused and rested on the phrase ) , " [she]195-roberta was not willing to release [him]4688-this boy . And since [she]195-roberta was not willing to release [him]4688-this boy , as [her]195-roberta various letters read here show , that agreement , on pain of a public exposure in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , becomes , in the eyes and words of [the district attorney]517-the district attorney , an engagement , and not only that but a sacred engagement which [no one]4176-no one but [a scoundrel]5352-a scoundrel and [a thief]5353-a thief and [a murderer]1310-a murderer would attempt to sever ! But , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , many engagements , more open and sacred in the eyes of the law and of religion , have been broken . Thousands of [men]2208-men and [thousands of women]5357-thousands of women have seen [their]5357-thousands of women hearts change , [their]5357-thousands of women vows and faith and trust flouted , and have even carried [their]5357-thousands of women wounds into the secret places of [their]5357-thousands of women souls , or gone forth , and gladly , to death at [their]5357-thousands of women own hands because of [them]5357-thousands of women . As [the district attorney]517-the district attorney said in [his]517-the district attorney address , it is not new and it will never be old . Never ![2695-i]

" But it is such a case as this last , [I]323-belknap warn [you]4570-gentlemen , that [you]4570-gentlemen are now contemplating and are about to pass upon — [a girl who is [the victim of such a change of mood]5360-the victim of such a change of mood]5359-a girl who is the victim of such a change of mood . But that is not a legal , however great a moral or social crime it may be . And it is only a curious and almost unbelievably tight and yet utterly misleading set of circumstances in connection with the death of [this girl]818-this girl that chances to bring [this defendant]5022-this defendant before [you]4570-gentlemen at this time . [I]323-belknap swear it . [I]323-belknap truly know it to be so . And it can and will be fully explained to [your]4570-gentlemen entire satisfaction before this case is closed .[323-belknap]

" However , in connection with this last statement , there is another which must be made as a preface to all that is to follow .[2695-i]

" [Gentlemen of the jury]5015-gentlemen of the jury , [the individual who is on trial here]5364-the individual who is on trial here for [his]5364-the individual who is on trial here life is a mental as well as [a moral coward — no more and no less]5365-a moral coward — no more and no less — not [a downright , hardhearted criminal]5366-a downright , hardhearted criminal by any means . Not unlike [many men in critical situations]5367-many men in critical situations , [he]5364-the individual who is on trial here is [a victim of a mental and moral fear complex]5368-a victim of a mental and moral fear complex . Why , [no one as yet]5369-no one as yet has been quite able to explain . [We]5370-we all have one secret bugbear or fear . And it is these two qualities , and no others , that have placed [him]5364-the individual who is on trial here in the dangerous position in which [he]5364-the individual who is on trial here now finds [himself]5364-the individual who is on trial here . It was cowardice , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen — fear of a rule of the factory of which [[his]5364-the individual who is on trial here uncle]821-his uncle is [the owner]2500-the owner , as well as fear of [his]5364-the individual who is on trial here own word given to [the officials above [him]5364-the individual who is on trial here]5374-the officials above him , that caused [him]5364-the individual who is on trial here first to conceal the fact that [he]5364-the individual who is on trial here was interested in [the pretty country girl who had come to work for [him]5364-the individual who is on trial here]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him . And later , to conceal the fact that [he]5364-the individual who is on trial here was going with [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him .[323-belknap]

" Yet no statutory crime of any kind there . [You]4570-gentlemen could not possibly try [a man]4220-a man for that , whatever privately [you]4570-gentlemen might think . And it was cowardice , mental and moral , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , which prevented [him]5364-the individual who is on trial here , after [he]5364-the individual who is on trial here became convinced that [he]5364-the individual who is on trial here could no longer endure a relationship which had once seemed so beautiful , from saying outright that [he]5364-the individual who is on trial here could not , and would not continue with [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him , let alone marry [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him . Yet , will [you]4570-gentlemen slay [a man]4220-a man because [he]4220-a man is [the victim of fear]5379-the victim of fear ? And again , after all , if [a man]4220-a man has once and truly decided that [he]4220-a man can not and will not endure [a given woman]5381-a given woman , or [a woman]2023-a woman [a man]4220-a man — that to live with [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him could only prove torturesome — what would [you]4570-gentlemen have [that person]5384-that person do ? Marry [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him ? To what end ? That [they]5385-they may hate and despise and torture [each other]871-each other forever after ? Can [you]4570-gentlemen truly say that [you]4570-gentlemen agree with that as a rule , or a method , or a law ? Yet , as the defense sees it , a truly intelligent and fair enough thing , under the circumstances , was done in this instance . An offer , but without marriage — and alas , without avail — was made . A suggestion for a separate life , with [him]5364-the individual who is on trial here working to support [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him while [she]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him dwelt elsewhere . [Her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him own letters , read only yesterday in [this court]4996-this court , indicate something of the kind . But the oh , so often tragic insistence upon what in so many cases were best left undone ! And then that last , long , argumentative trip to [Utica]30-utica , [Grass Lake]21-grass lake , and [Big Bittern]13-big bittern . And all to no purpose . Yet with no intention to kill or betray unto death . Not the slightest . And [we]5388-we will show [you]4570-gentlemen why .[2695-i]

" [Gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , once more [I]323-belknap insist that it was cowardice , mental and moral , and not any plot or plan for any crime of any kind , that made [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde travel with [Roberta Alden]195-roberta under various aliases to [all the places [I]323-belknap have just mentioned]5390-all the places i have just mentioned — that made [him]197-clyde write ' [Mr.]5391-mr. and [Mrs. Carl Graham]199-carl graham , ' ' [Mr.]5392-mr. and [Mrs. Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden ' — mental and moral fear of the great social mistake as well as sin that [he]197-clyde had committed in pursuing and eventually allowing [himself]197-clyde to fail into this unhallowed relationship with [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him — mental and moral fear or cowardice of what was to follow .[323-belknap]

" And again , it was mental and moral cowardice that prevented [him]197-clyde there at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , once [the waters of [the lake]571-the lake]1313-the waters of the lake had so accidentally closed over [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him , from returning to [Big Bittern Inn]129-big bittern inn and making public [her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him death . Mental and Moral Cowardice — and nothing more and nothing less . [He]197-clyde was thinking of [[his]197-clyde wealthy relatives]5395-his wealthy relatives in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , [their]5395-his wealthy relatives rule which [his]197-clyde presence here on [the lake]571-the lake with [this girl]818-this girl would show to have been broken — of the suffering and shame and rage of [[her]5375-the pretty country girl who had come to work for him parents]4219-her parents . And besides , there was [Miss X]354-miss x — [the brightest star in the brightest constellation of all [his]197-clyde dreams]5399-the brightest star in the brightest constellation of all his dreams .[2695-i]

" [We]5400-we admit all that , and [we]5400-we are completely willing to concede that [he]197-clyde was , or must have been , thinking of all these things . The prosecution charges , and [we]5400-we admit that such is the fact , that [he]197-clyde had been so completely ensnared by [this Miss X]354-miss x , and [she]354-miss x by [him]197-clyde , that [he]197-clyde was willing and eager to forsake [this first love who had given [herself]354-miss x to [him]197-clyde]5401-this first love who had given herself to him , for one who , because of [her]354-miss x beauty and [her]354-miss x wealth , seemed so much more desirable — even as to [Roberta Alden]195-roberta [he]197-clyde seemed more desirable than [others]1118-others . And if [she]354-miss x erred as to [him]197-clyde — as plainly [she]354-miss x did — might not — might not [he]197-clyde have erred eventually in [his]197-clyde infatuated following of one who in the ultimate — who can say ? — might not have cared so much for [him]197-clyde . At any rate , one of [his]197-clyde strongest fear thoughts at this time , as [he]197-clyde [himself]197-clyde has confessed to [us]5403-us , [his]197-clyde counsel , was that if [this Miss X]354-miss x learned that [he]197-clyde had been up there with [this other girl of whom [she]354-miss x had not even so much as heard]5404-this other girl of whom she had not even so much as heard , well then , it would mean the end of [her]354-miss x regard for [him]197-clyde .[323-belknap]

" [I]2695-i know that as [you]5405-you gentlemen view such things , such conduct has no excuse for being . [One]955-one may be the victim of an internal conflict between two illicit moods , yet nevertheless , as the law and [the church]5407-the church see it , guilty of sin and crime . But the truth , none - the - less , is that [they]5408-they do exist in the human heart , law or no law , religion or no religion , and in scores of cases they motivate the actions of [the victims]5409-the victims . And [we]5403-us admit that [they]5408-they motivated the actions of [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde .[2695-i]

" But did [he]197-clyde kill [Roberta Alden]195-roberta ?[323-belknap]

" No ![2695-i]

" And again , no ![323-belknap]

" Or did [he]197-clyde plot in any way , half - heartedly or otherwise , to drag [her]195-roberta up there under the guise of various aliases and then , because [she]195-roberta would not set [him]197-clyde free , drown [her]195-roberta ? Ridiculous ! Impossible ! Insane ! [His]197-clyde plan was completely and entirely different .[2695-i]

" But , [gentlemen]4570-gentlemen , "[2696-he] and here [he]2696-he suddenly paused as though a new or overlooked thought had just come to [him]2696-he , " perhaps [you]4570-gentlemen would be better satisfied with [my]2696-he argument and the final judgment [you]4570-gentlemen are to render if [you]4570-gentlemen were to have the testimony of [one eye - witness]5411-one eye - witness at least of [Roberta Alden]195-roberta 's death — [one who , instead of just hearing a voice]5412-one who , instead of just hearing a voice , was actually present , and who saw and hence knows how [she]195-roberta met [her]195-roberta death . "[2696-he]

[He]2696-he now looked at [Jephson]320-jephson as much as to say : Now , [Reuben]320-jephson , at last , here [we]2697-we are ! And [Reuben]320-jephson , turning to [Clyde]197-clyde , easily and yet with iron in [his]320-jephson every motion , whispered : " Well , here [we]2697-we are , [Clyde]197-clyde , it 's up to [you]197-clyde now . Only [I]320-jephson 'm going along with [you]197-clyde , see ? [I]320-jephson 've decided to examine [you]197-clyde [myself]320-jephson . [I]320-jephson 've drilled and drilled [you]197-clyde , and [I]320-jephson guess [you]197-clyde wo n't have any trouble in telling [me]320-jephson , will [you]197-clyde ? "[320-jephson] [He]320-jephson beamed on [Clyde]197-clyde genially and encouragingly , and [Clyde]197-clyde , because of [Belknap]323-belknap 's strong plea as well as this newest and best development in connection with [Jephson]320-jephson , now stood up and with almost a jaunty air , and one out of all proportion to [his]197-clyde mood of but four hours before , now whispered : " Gee ! [I]197-clyde 'm glad [you]197-clyde 're going to do it . [I]197-clyde 'll be all right now , [I]197-clyde think . "[197-clyde]

But in the meantime [the audience]2651-the audience , hearing that [an actual eye - witness]2699-an actual eye - witness was to be produced , and not by [the prosecution]2006-the prosecution but [the defense]1984-the defense , was at once upon [its]2651-the audience feet , craning and stirring . And [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , irritated to an exceptional degree by the informality characteristic of this trial , was now rapping with [his]326-justice oberwaltzer gavel while [[his]326-justice oberwaltzer clerk]2702-his clerk cried loudly : " Order ! Order ! Unless [everybody]1260-everybody is seated , [all spectators]5414-all spectators will be dismissed ! [The deputies]5415-the deputies will please see that [all]5416-all are seated . "[2702-his clerk] And then a hushed and strained silence falling as [Belknap]323-belknap called : " [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , take [the witness]2428-the witness chair . "[323-belknap] And [the audience]2651-the audience — seeing to [its]2651-the audience astonishment , [Clyde]197-clyde , accompanied by [Reuben Jephson]320-jephson , making [his]197-clyde way forward — straining and whispering in spite of all the gruff commands of [the judge]4625-the judge and [the bailiffs]2705-the bailiffs . And even [Belknap]323-belknap , as [he]323-belknap saw [Jephson]320-jephson approaching , being a little astonished , since it was [he]320-jephson who according to the original plan was to have led [Clyde]197-clyde through [his]197-clyde testimony . But now [Jephson]320-jephson drawing near to [him]197-clyde as [Clyde]197-clyde was being seated and sworn , merely whispered : " Leave [him]197-clyde to [me]320-jephson , [Alvin]323-belknap , [I]320-jephson think it 's best . [He]197-clyde looks a little too strained and shaky to suit [me]320-jephson , but [I]320-jephson feel sure [I]320-jephson can pull [him]197-clyde through . "[320-jephson]

And then [the audience]2651-the audience noting the change and whispering in regard to it . And [Clyde]197-clyde , [his]197-clyde large nervous eyes turning here and there , thinking : Well , [I]0-i 'm on [the witness]2428-the witness stand at last . And now [everybody]1260-everybody 's watching [me]0-i , of course . [I]0-i must look very calm , like [I]0-i did n't care so very much , because [I]0-i did n't really kill [her]2709-her . That 's right , [I]0-i did n't . Yet [his]197-clyde skin blue and the lids of [his]197-clyde eyes red and puffy and [his]197-clyde hands trembling slightly in spite of [himself]197-clyde . And [Jephson]320-jephson , [his]320-jephson long , tensile and dynamic body like that of a swaying birch , turning toward [him]197-clyde and looking fixedly into [Clyde]197-clyde 's brown eyes with [his]320-jephson blue ones , beginning :

" Now , [Clyde]197-clyde , the first thing [we]5418-we want to do is make sure that [the jury and every one else]5419-the jury and every one else hears [our]5418-we questions and answers . And next , when [you]197-clyde 're all set , [you]197-clyde 're going to begin with [your]197-clyde life as [you]197-clyde remember it — where [you]197-clyde were born , where [you]197-clyde came from , what [[your]197-clyde father]5420-your father did and [[your]197-clyde mother]4643-your mother , too , and finally , what [you]197-clyde did and why , from the time [you]197-clyde went to work until now . [I]320-jephson may interrupt [you]197-clyde with a few questions now and then , but in the main [I]320-jephson 'm going to let [you]197-clyde tell it , because [I]320-jephson know [you]197-clyde can tell it better than [any one]4181-any one . "[320-jephson] Yet in order to reassure [Clyde]197-clyde and to make [him]197-clyde know each moment that [he]197-clyde was there — a wall , a bulwark , between [him]197-clyde and [the eager , straining , unbelieving and hating crowd]2710-the eager , straining , unbelieving and hating crowd — [he]197-clyde now drew nearer , at times so close as to put [one foot on the witness stand]2711-one foot on the witness stand , or if not that to lean forward and lay a hand on the arm of the chair in which [Clyde]197-clyde sat . And all the while saying , " Yay - uss — Yay - uss . "[197-clyde] " And then what ? "[197-clyde] " And then ? "[197-clyde] And invariably at the strong and tonic or protective sound of [his]197-clyde voice [Clyde]197-clyde stirring as with a bolstering force and finding [himself]197-clyde able , and without shaking or quavering , to tell the short but straitened story of [his]197-clyde youth .

" [I]197-clyde was born in [Grand Rapids]115-grand rapids , [Michigan]116-michigan . [[My]197-clyde parents]5258-my parents were conducting a mission [there]650-there at that time and used to hold open air meetings ... "[197-clyde]

[Clyde]197-clyde 's testimony proceeded to the point where [the family]964-the family had removed from [Quincy]134-quincy , [Illinois]135-illinois ( [a place resorted to on account of some Salvation Army work offered [[his]197-clyde father]1778-his father and [mother]2083-mother ) , to [Kansas City]45-kansas city , where from [his]197-clyde twelfth to [his]197-clyde fifteenth year [he]197-clyde had browsed about trying to find something to do while still resenting the combination of school and religious work expected of [him]197-clyde]2713-a place resorted to on account of some salvation army work offered his father and mother ) , to kansas city , where from his twelfth to his fifteenth year he had browsed about trying to find something to do while still resenting the combination of school and religious work expected of him .

" Were [you]197-clyde up with [your]197-clyde classes in [the public schools]5425-the public schools ? "[197-clyde]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . [We]964-the family had moved too much . "[197-clyde]

" In what grade were [you]197-clyde when [you]197-clyde were twelve years old ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , [I]197-clyde should have been in the seventh but [I]197-clyde was only in the sixth . That 's why [I]197-clyde did n't like it . "[197-clyde]

" And how about the religious work of [[your]197-clyde parents]5427-your parents ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , it was all right — only [I]197-clyde never did like going out nights on [the street corners]5428-the street corners . "[197-clyde]

And so on , through five - and - ten cent store , soda and newspaper carrier jobs , until at last [he]197-clyde was a bell - hop at [the Green - Davidson]5073-the green - davidson , [the finest hotel in [Kansas City]45-kansas city]2717-the finest hotel in kansas city , as [he]197-clyde informed [them]2718-them .

" But now , [Clyde]197-clyde , "[320-jephson] proceeded [Jephson]320-jephson who , fearful lest [Mason]209-mason on the cross - examination and in connection with [Clyde]197-clyde 's credibility as [a witness]842-a witness should delve into the matter of [the wrecked car]2720-the wrecked car and [the slain child in [Kansas City]45-kansas city]2721-the slain child in kansas city and so mar the effect of the story [he]197-clyde was now about to tell , was determined to be beforehand in this . And so now [he]197-clyde continued :

" And how long did [you]209-mason work [there]650-there ? "[197-clyde]

" A little over a year . "[197-clyde]

" And why did [you]209-mason leave ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , it was on account of an accident . "[197-clyde]

" What kind of an accident ? "[197-clyde]

" Objection sustained , "[326-justice oberwaltzer] ruled [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , although at the time in [Jephson]320-jephson 's pocket was a letter from [Francis X. Squires]383-francis x. squires , formerly captain of [the bell - hops of [the Green - Davidson]5073-the green - davidson]140-the bell - hops of the green - davidson at the time [Clyde]197-clyde was [there]650-there , in which [he]383-francis x. squires explained that apart from the one incident in connection with [the purloined automobile]2732-the purloined automobile , [he]383-francis x. squires knew nothing derogatory to [Clyde]197-clyde ; and that always previously , [he]383-francis x. squires had found [him]197-clyde prompt , honest , willing , alert and well - mannered . Also that at the time the accident occurred , [he]383-francis x. squires [himself]383-francis x. squires had been satisfied that [Clyde]197-clyde could have been little else than one of [those led]2733-those led and that if [he]197-clyde had returned and properly explained matters [he]197-clyde would have been reinstated . It was irrelevant .

Thereafter followed [Clyde]197-clyde 's story of how , having fled from the difficulties threatening [him]197-clyde in [Kansas City]45-kansas city and having wandered here and there for two years , [he]197-clyde had finally obtained a place in [Chicago]43-chicago as [a driver]5462-a driver and later as [a bell - boy]4745-a bell - boy at [the Union League]2736-the union league , and also how while still employed at the first of these places [he]197-clyde had written [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother and later at [her]688-his mother request was about to write [[his]197-clyde uncle]821-his uncle , when , accidentally meeting [him]197-clyde at [the Union League]2736-the union league , [he]197-clyde was invited by [him]197-clyde to come to [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus . And thereupon , in [their]2740-their natural order , followed all of the details , of how [he]197-clyde had gone to work , been promoted and instructed by [[his]197-clyde cousin]2741-his cousin and [the foreman]2742-the foreman as to the various rules , and then later how [he]197-clyde had met [Roberta]195-roberta and still later [Miss X.]384-miss x. But in between came all the details as to how and why [he]197-clyde had courted [Roberta Alden]195-roberta , and how and why , having once secured [her]195-roberta love [he]197-clyde felt and thought [himself]197-clyde content — but how the arrival of [Miss X]354-miss x , and [her]354-miss x overpowering fascination for [him]197-clyde , had served completely to change all [his]197-clyde notions in regard to [Roberta]195-roberta , and although [he]197-clyde still admired [her]195-roberta , caused [him]197-clyde to feel that never again as before could [he]197-clyde desire to marry [her]195-roberta .

But [Jephson]320-jephson , anxious to divert the attention of [the jury]1953-the jury from the fact that [Clyde]197-clyde was so very fickle — a fact too trying to be so speedily introduced into the case — at once interposed with :

" [Clyde]197-clyde ! [You]197-clyde really loved [Roberta Alden]195-roberta at first , did n't [you]197-clyde ? "[320-jephson]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[320-jephson]

" Well , then , [you]197-clyde must have known , or at least [you]197-clyde gathered from [her]195-roberta actions , from the first , did n't [you]197-clyde , that [she]195-roberta was [a perfectly good and innocent and religious girl]5467-a perfectly good and innocent and religious girl . "[320-jephson]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , that 's how [I]197-clyde felt about [her]195-roberta , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , repeating what [he]197-clyde had been told to say .

" Well , then , just roughly now , without going into detail , do [you]197-clyde suppose [you]197-clyde could explain to [yourself]197-clyde and [this jury]5224-this jury how and why and where and when those changes came about which led to that relationship which [[we]5470-we all of [us]5470-we]5471-we all of us "[197-clyde] ( and here [he]197-clyde looked boldly and wisely and coldly out over [the audience]2651-the audience and then afterwards upon [the jurors]2617-the jurors ) " deplore . How was it , if [you]197-clyde thought so highly of [her]195-roberta at first that [you]197-clyde could so soon afterwards descend to this evil relationship ? Did n't [you]197-clyde know that [all men]5472-all men , and [all women]5473-all women also , view it as wrong , and outside of marriage unforgivable — a statutory crime ? "[197-clyde]

The boldness and ironic sting of this was sufficient to cause at first a hush , later a slight nervous tremor on the part of [the audience]2651-the audience which , [Mason]209-mason as well as [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer noting , caused [both]2747-both to frown apprehensively . Why , [this brazen young cynic]2748-this brazen young cynic ! How dared [he]197-clyde , via innuendo and in the guise of serious questioning , intrude such a thought as this , which by implication at least picked at the very foundations of society — religious and moral ! At the same time there [he]197-clyde was , standing boldly and leoninely , the while [Clyde]197-clyde replied :

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , [I]197-clyde suppose [I]197-clyde did — certainly — but [I]197-clyde did n't try to seduce [her]195-roberta at first or at any time , really . [I]197-clyde was in love with [her]195-roberta . "[197-clyde]

" [You]197-clyde were in love with [her]195-roberta ? "[2750-i]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Very much ? "[2750-i]

" Very much . "[197-clyde]

" And was [she]195-roberta as much in love with [you]197-clyde at that time ? "[2750-i]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , [she]195-roberta was . "[197-clyde]

" From the very first ? "[2750-i]

" From the very first . "[197-clyde]

" [She]195-roberta told [you]197-clyde so ? "[2750-i]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" At the time [she]195-roberta left [the Newtons]353-the newtons — [you]4137-sir have heard all the testimony here in regard to that — did [you]4137-sir induce or seek to induce [her]195-roberta in any way , by any trick or agreement , to leave [there]650-there ? "[2750-i]

" No , [sir]4137-sir , [I]197-clyde did n't . [She]195-roberta wanted to leave [there]650-there of [her]195-roberta own accord . [She]195-roberta wanted [me]197-clyde to help [her]195-roberta find [a place]5481-a place . "[197-clyde]

" And just why ? "[2750-i]

" And did [you]197-clyde tell [her]195-roberta about [the room [she]195-roberta took at [the Gilpins ']5487-the gilpins ']5486-the room she took at the gilpins ' ? "[2750-i]

" No , [sir]4137-sir , [I]197-clyde did n't . [I]197-clyde never told [her]195-roberta about [any room]5489-any room . [She]195-roberta found it [herself]195-roberta . "[197-clyde] ( This was the exact answer [he]2749-he had memorized . )

" But why did n't [you]197-clyde help [her]195-roberta ? "[2750-i]

" Because [I]2750-i was busy , days and most evenings . And besides [I]2750-i thought [she]195-roberta knew better what [she]195-roberta wanted than [I]2750-i did — the kind of [people and all]5490-people and all . "[2750-i]

" Did [you]197-clyde personally ever see [the Gilpin place]5491-the gilpin place before [she]195-roberta went [there]650-there ? "[2750-i]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[2750-i]

" No , [sir]4137-sir , [I]2750-i never did . "[2750-i]

" Never insisted , for instance , that [she]195-roberta take a certain type of room which [you]197-clyde could slip in and out of at night or by day without being seen ? "[2750-i]

" [I]2750-i never did . Besides , [no one]4176-no one could very well slip in or out of [that house]5498-that house without being seen . "[2750-i]

" And why not ? "[2750-i]

" Because the door to [[her]195-roberta room]1145-her room was right next to the door to the general front entrance where [everybody]1260-everybody went in and out and [anybody that was around]5501-anybody that was around could see . "[2750-i] That was another answer [he]2750-i had memorized .

" But [you]197-clyde slipped in and out , did n't [you]197-clyde ? "[2750-i]

" On account of that factory rule ? "[2750-i]

"[2750-i]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . [I]760-the latter had not . "[760-the latter]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , they were . "[760-the latter]

And as [Clyde]197-clyde said that , [he]197-clyde was thinking back and it seemed to [him]197-clyde that what [he]197-clyde had just said was really true . " And what , if any , were [your]760-the latter plans for [your]760-the latter future with [Miss Alden]195-roberta — before [you]760-the latter met [this Miss X]354-miss x ? [You]760-the latter must have thought at times of that , did n't [you]760-the latter ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , not exactly , "[197-clyde] ( and as [he]197-clyde said this [he]197-clyde licked [his]197-clyde lips in sheer nervousness ) . "[197-clyde]

" [You]760-the latter just drifted because nothing had happened as yet and [you]760-the latter did n't suppose anything would . Is that the way ? "[197-clyde]

" And what was it that [you]760-the latter thought ? Can [you]760-the latter recollect ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , that was before that . "[197-clyde]

( " Beautifully done ! "[209-mason] observed [Mason]209-mason , sarcastically , under [his]209-mason breath to [State Senator Redmond]385-redmond . " Excellent stage play , "[385-redmond] replied [Redmond]385-redmond in a stage whisper . )

" But did [you]760-the latter ever tell [her]195-roberta in so many words ? "[320-jephson] continued [Jephson]320-jephson .

( " Well staged ! "[209-mason] murmured [Mason]209-mason , softly and cynically . " Pretty shrewd — pretty shrewd ! "[385-redmond] commented [Redmond]385-redmond , lightly . )

" But , tell [me]320-jephson , "[320-jephson] went on [Jephson]320-jephson , softly and coldly , " feeling as [you]197-clyde did about [Miss Alden]195-roberta , how was it that upon meeting [this Miss X]354-miss x , [you]197-clyde could change so quickly ? " [I]197-clyde did continue to care for [her]354-miss x some — quite a lot , really . " Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" And then ? "[320-jephson]

" Well — and then — [I]197-clyde just could n't care for [Miss Alden]195-roberta so much any more . "[197-clyde] A thin film of moisture covered [Clyde]197-clyde 's forehead and cheeks as [he]197-clyde spoke .

" [I]320-jephson see ! [I]320-jephson see ! "[320-jephson] went on [Jephson]320-jephson , oratorically and loudly , having [the jury and audience]2752-the jury and audience in mind . " A case of the Arabian Nights , of [the enscorcelled and the enscorcellor]5537-the enscorcelled and the enscorcellor . "[320-jephson]

" [I]197-clyde do n't think [I]197-clyde know what [you]320-jephson mean , "[197-clyde] said [Clyde]197-clyde .

"[320-jephson]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , quite innocently , concluding rightly that this was mere show of rhetoric on [Jephson]320-jephson 's part .

" But what [I]320-jephson want to know is — how was it that loving [Miss Alden]195-roberta as much as [you]320-jephson say [you]320-jephson did — and having reached that relationship which should have been sanctified by marriage — how was it that [you]320-jephson could have felt so little bound or obligated to [her]195-roberta as to entertain the idea of casting [her]195-roberta over for [this Miss X]354-miss x ? Now just how was that ? [I]320-jephson would like to know , and so would [this jury]5224-this jury , [I]320-jephson am sure . Where was [your]320-jephson sense of gratitude ? [Your]320-jephson sense of moral obligation ? Do [you]320-jephson mean to say that [you]320-jephson have none ? [We]5543-we want to know . "[320-jephson]

This was really cross - examination — an attack on [[his]320-jephson own witness]2753-his own witness . Yet [Jephson]320-jephson was within [his]320-jephson rights and [Mason]209-mason did not interfere .

" Well ... "[197-clyde] and here [Clyde]197-clyde hesitated and stumbled , quite as if [he]197-clyde had not been instructed as to all this beforehand , and seemed to and did truly finger about in [his]197-clyde own mind or reason for some thought that would help [him]197-clyde to explain all this . For although it was true that [he]197-clyde had memorized the answer , now that [he]197-clyde was confronted by the actual question here in [court]4347-court , as well as the old problem that had so confused and troubled [him]197-clyde in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , [he]197-clyde could scarcely think clearly of all [he]197-clyde had been told to say , but instead twisted and turned , and finally came out with :

" The fact is , [I]197-clyde did n't think about those things at all very much . [I]197-clyde could n't after [I]197-clyde saw [her]5544-her . [I]197-clyde tried to at times , but [I]197-clyde could n't . [I]197-clyde only wanted [her]5544-her and [I]197-clyde did n't want [Miss Alden]195-roberta any more . [I]197-clyde knew [I]197-clyde was n't doing right — exactly — and [I]197-clyde felt sorry for [Roberta]195-roberta — but just the same [I]197-clyde did n't seem able to do anything much about it . [I]197-clyde could only think of [Miss X]354-miss x and [I]197-clyde could n't think of [Roberta]195-roberta as [I]197-clyde had before no matter how hard [I]197-clyde tried . "[197-clyde]

" Do [you]197-clyde mean to say that [you]197-clyde did n't suffer in [your]197-clyde own conscience on account of this ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , [I]197-clyde suffered , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde . " [I]197-clyde knew [I]197-clyde was n't doing right , and it made [me]197-clyde worry a lot about [her]354-miss x and [myself]197-clyde , but just the same [I]197-clyde did n't seem to be able to do any better . "[197-clyde] ( [He]197-clyde was repeating words that [Jephson]320-jephson had written out for [him]197-clyde , although at the time [he]197-clyde first read them [he]197-clyde felt them to be fairly true . [He]197-clyde had suffered some . )

" And then ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , then [she]354-miss x began to complain because [I]197-clyde did n't go round to see [her]354-miss x as much as before . "[197-clyde]

" In other words , [you]197-clyde began to neglect [her]354-miss x . "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , some — but not entirely — no , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Well , when [you]197-clyde found [you]197-clyde were so infatuated with [this Miss X]354-miss x , what did [you]197-clyde do ? " [I]197-clyde thought so , anyhow , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde .

" And then what ? "[320-jephson]

" Well , even if [I]320-jephson had wanted to go away with [her]195-roberta and marry [her]195-roberta , [I]320-jephson did n't have enough money to do that and [she]195-roberta did n't either . [I]320-jephson would have had to give up [[my]320-jephson place]5619-my place and gone and found another somewhere before [I]320-jephson could let [her]195-roberta come . " How about hotel work ? Could n't [you]197-clyde have gone back to that ? "[320-jephson]

" Well , maybe — if [I]320-jephson had an introduction of some kind . But [I]320-jephson did n't want to go back to that . "[320-jephson]

" And why not ? "[320-jephson]

" Well , [I]320-jephson did n't like it so much any more — not that kind of life . "[320-jephson]

" But [you]197-clyde did n't mean that [you]197-clyde did n't want to do anything at all , did [you]197-clyde ? That was n't [your]197-clyde attitude , was it ? "[320-jephson]

" Oh , no , [sir]4137-sir . That was n't it . "[320-jephson]

" But not marry [her]195-roberta ? "[320-jephson]

" No , [sir]4137-sir , [I]320-jephson did n't feel that [I]320-jephson could do that then . "[320-jephson]

" [I]320-jephson see . Then and there ? "[320-jephson]
