" But [you]320-jephson know , "[320-jephson] proceeded [Jephson]320-jephson , most suavely and diplomatically at this point , " there are various references in these letters here which [Miss Alden]195-roberta wrote you"—and[320-jephson] [he]320-jephson reached over and from [the district attorney]517-the district attorney 's table picked up the original letters of [Roberta]195-roberta and weighed them solemnly in [his]320-jephson hand—"to a plan which [you]320-jephson two had in connection with this trip — or at least that [she]195-roberta seemed to think [you]320-jephson had . "[320-jephson]

" And what was that ? "[323-belknap]

"[320-jephson]

" Well , [I]197-clyde know [I]197-clyde never agreed to [her]195-roberta plan — exactly . "[197-clyde]

" And if [she]195-roberta still would n't ? "[320-jephson]

" Well , then [I]197-clyde thought [I]197-clyde might run away , but [I]197-clyde did n't like to think about that very much . "[197-clyde]

" [You]197-clyde know , [Clyde]197-clyde , of course , that [some here]5637-some here are of the opinion that there was a plot on [your]197-clyde part which originated in [your]197-clyde mind about this time to conceal [your]197-clyde identity and [hers]195-roberta and lure [her]195-roberta up there to one of [those lone lakes in [the Adirondacks]105-the adirondacks]5638-those lone lakes in the adirondacks and slay [her]195-roberta or drown [her]195-roberta in cold blood , in order that [you]197-clyde might be free to marry [this Miss X.]384-miss x. Any truth in that ? Tell [this jury]5224-this jury — yes or no — which is it ? "[320-jephson]

" No ! No ! [I]197-clyde never did plot to kill [her]195-roberta , or [any one]4181-any one , "[197-clyde] protested [Clyde]197-clyde , quite dramatically , and clutching at the arms of [his]197-clyde chair and seeking to be as emphatic as possible , since [he]197-clyde had been instructed so to do . At the same time [he]197-clyde arose in [his]197-clyde seat and sought to look stern and convincing , although in [his]197-clyde heart and mind was the crying knowledge that [he]197-clyde had so plotted , and this it was that most weakened [him]197-clyde at this moment — most painfully and horribly weakened [him]197-clyde . The eyes of [all these people]2771-all these people . The eyes of [the judge and jury]2772-the judge and jury and [Mason]209-mason and all [the men and women of the press]2773-the men and women of the press . And once more [his]197-clyde brow was wet and cold and [he]197-clyde licked [his]197-clyde thin lips nervously and swallowed with difficulty because [his]197-clyde throat was dry .

And then it was that piecemeal , and beginning with the series of letters written by [Roberta]195-roberta to [Clyde]197-clyde after [she]195-roberta reached [[her]195-roberta home]1907-her home and ending with [the one]1121-the one demanding that [he]197-clyde come for [her]195-roberta or [she]195-roberta would return to [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus and expose [him]197-clyde , [Jephson]320-jephson took up the various phases of the " alleged "[320-jephson] plot and crime , and now did [his]320-jephson best to minimize and finally dispel all that had been testified to so far .

[Clyde]197-clyde 's suspicious actions in not writing [Roberta]195-roberta . Well , [he]197-clyde was afraid of complications in connection with [[his]197-clyde relatives]2776-his relatives , [his]197-clyde work , everything . And the same with [his]197-clyde arranging to meet [her]195-roberta in [Fonda]118-fonda . [He]197-clyde had no plan as to any trip with [her]195-roberta anywhere in particular at the time . [He]197-clyde only thought vaguely of meeting [her]195-roberta somewhere — anywhere — and possibly persuading [her]195-roberta to leave [him]197-clyde . But [July]387-july arriving and [his]197-clyde plan still so indefinite , the first thing that occurred to [him]197-clyde was that [they]2777-they might go off to [some inexpensive resort]2778-some inexpensive resort somewhere . It was [Roberta]195-roberta who in [Utica]30-utica had suggested some of [the lakes north of [there]650-there]2779-the lakes north of there . It was there in [the hotel]2781-the hotel , not at [the railway station]1089-the railway station , that [he]197-clyde had secured some maps and folders — a fatal contention in one sense , for [Mason]209-mason had one folder with a Lycurgus House stamp on the cover , which [Clyde]197-clyde had not noticed at the time . And as [he]197-clyde was so testifying , [Mason]209-mason was thinking of this . In regard to leaving [Lycurgus]331-lycurgus by [a back street]2405-a back street — well , there had been a desire to conceal [his]197-clyde departure with [Roberta]195-roberta , of course , but only to protect [her]195-roberta name and [his]197-clyde from notoriety . And so with the riding in [separate cars]2784-separate cars , registering as [Mr.]2785-mr. and [Mrs. Clifford Golden]198-clifford golden , and so on indefinitely throughout the entire list of shifty concealments and evasions . In regard to the two hats , well , the one hat was soiled and seeing one that [he]197-clyde liked [he]197-clyde bought it . Then when [he]197-clyde lost the hat in the accident [he]197-clyde naturally put on the other . To be sure , [he]197-clyde had owned and carried a camera , and it was true that [he]197-clyde had it at [[the Cranstons]245-the cranstons ']1213-the cranstons ' on [his]197-clyde first visit [there]650-there on the eighteenth of June . The only reason [he]197-clyde denied having it at first was because [he]197-clyde was afraid of being identified with this purely accidental death of [Roberta]195-roberta in a way that would be difficult to explain . [He]197-clyde had been falsely charged with [her]195-roberta murder immediately upon [his]197-clyde arrest in [the woods]632-the woods , and [he]197-clyde was fearful of [his]197-clyde entire connection with this ill - fated trip , and not having [any lawyer]2789-any lawyer or [any one]4181-any one to say a word for [him]197-clyde , [he]197-clyde thought it best to say nothing and so for the time being had denied everything , although at once on being provided counsel [he]197-clyde had confided to [[his]197-clyde attorneys]2189-his attorneys the true facts of the case .

And so , too , with the missing suit , which because it was wet and muddy [he]197-clyde had done up in a bundle in [the woods]632-the woods and after reaching [the Cranstons ']1213-the cranstons ' had deposited it behind some stones there , intending to return and secure it and have [it]2794-it dry - cleaned . But on being introduced to [Mr. Belknap]323-belknap and [Mr. Jephson]320-jephson [he]197-clyde had at once told both and [they]2795-they had secured it and had it cleaned for [him]197-clyde .

" But now , [Clyde]197-clyde , in regard to [your]197-clyde plans and [your]197-clyde being out on [that lake]4165-that lake in the first place — let ['s]5642-'s hear about that now . "[197-clyde]

And then — quite as [Jephson]320-jephson had outlined it to [Belknap]323-belknap , came the story of how [he]197-clyde and [Roberta]195-roberta had reached [Utica]30-utica and afterwards [Grass Lake]21-grass lake . And yet no plan . [He]197-clyde intended , if worst came to worst , to tell [her]195-roberta of [his]197-clyde great love for [Miss X]354-miss x and appeal to [her]195-roberta sympathy and understanding to set [him]197-clyde free at the same time that [he]197-clyde offered to do anything that [he]197-clyde could for [her]195-roberta . " But when [I]197-clyde saw [her]195-roberta at [Fonda]118-fonda , and later in [Utica]30-utica , looking as tired and worried as [she]195-roberta was , "[197-clyde] and here [Clyde]197-clyde was endeavoring to give the ring of sincerity to words carefully supplied [him]197-clyde , " and sort of helpless , [I]197-clyde began to feel sorry for [her]195-roberta again . "[197-clyde]

" Yes , and then what ? "[197-clyde]

" [Which lake]5665-which lake , [Clyde]197-clyde ? "[197-clyde]

" Why , [Grass Lake]21-grass lake . [We]5661-we went out for a row after [we]5661-we got [there]650-there . "[197-clyde]

" Right away ? In the afternoon ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . [She]586-wife wanted to go . And then while [we]5661-we were out there rowing around — "[2797-you] ( [He]2797-you paused . )

" [She]586-wife got to crying again , and [she]586-wife seemed so much up against it and looked so sick and so worried that [I]197-clyde decided that after all [she]586-wife was right and [I]197-clyde was wrong — that it would n't be right , on account of [the baby]5615-the baby and all , not to marry [her]586-wife , and so [I]197-clyde thought [I]197-clyde had better do it . "[197-clyde]

" [I]197-clyde see . A change of heart . And did [you]2797-you tell [her]586-wife that then and there ? "[197-clyde]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" And why not ? Were n't [you]2797-you satisfied with the trouble [you]2797-you had caused [her]586-wife so far ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . But [you]4137-sir see just as [I]197-clyde was going to talk to [her]586-wife at that time [I]197-clyde got to thinking of all the things [I]197-clyde had been thinking before [I]197-clyde came up . "[197-clyde]

" What , for instance ? "[197-clyde]

" Why , [Miss X]354-miss x and [my]197-clyde life in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , and what [we]5671-we 'd be up against in case [we]5671-we did go away this way . "[197-clyde]

" Yes . "[197-clyde]

" And ... well ... and then [I]197-clyde could n't just tell [her]586-wife then — not that day , anyhow . "[197-clyde]

" Well , when did [you]2797-you tell [her]586-wife then ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , [I]197-clyde told [her]586-wife not to cry any more — that [I]197-clyde thought maybe it would be all right if [she]586-wife gave [me]197-clyde twenty - four hours more to think things all out — that maybe [we]5671-we 'd be able to settle on something . "[197-clyde]

" And then ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , then [she]586-wife said after a while that [she]586-wife did n't care for [Grass Lake]21-grass lake . [She]586-wife wished [we]5671-we would go away from [there]650-there . "[197-clyde]

" [She]586-wife did ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes . And then [we]5671-we got out the maps again and [I]197-clyde asked [a fellow at [the hotel]2781-the hotel]5673-a fellow at the hotel [there]650-there if [he]5673-a fellow at the hotel knew about [the lakes up there]5676-the lakes up there . And [he]5673-a fellow at the hotel said of [all [the lakes around there]5678-the lakes around there [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]5677-all the lakes around there big bittern was the most beautiful . [I]197-clyde had seen it once , and [I]197-clyde told [Roberta]195-roberta about it and what [the man]504-the man said , and then [she]195-roberta asked why did n't [we]5671-we go there . "[197-clyde]

" And is that why [you]197-clyde went [there]650-there ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir "[197-clyde]

" No other reason ? "[197-clyde]

" No , [sir]4137-sir — none — except that it was back , or [south]5683-south , and [we]5671-we were going that way anyhow . "[197-clyde]

" [I]197-clyde see . And that was Thursday , July eighth ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Well , now , [Clyde]197-clyde , as [you]197-clyde have seen , it has been charged here that [you]197-clyde took [Miss Alden]195-roberta to and out on [that lake]4165-that lake with the sole and premeditated intent of killing [her]195-roberta — murdering [her]195-roberta — finding [some unobserved and quiet spot]5686-some unobserved and quiet spot and then first striking [her]195-roberta with [your]197-clyde camera , or an oar , or club , or stone maybe , and then drowning [her]195-roberta . Now , what have [you]197-clyde to say to that ? Is that true , or is n't it ? "[197-clyde]

" No , [sir]4137-sir ! It 's not true ! "[197-clyde] returned [Clyde]197-clyde , clearly and emphatically . " [I]197-clyde never went [there]650-there of [my]197-clyde own accord in the first place , and [I]197-clyde only went [there]650-there because [she]195-roberta did n't like [Grass Lake]21-grass lake . "[197-clyde] And here , because [he]197-clyde had been sinking down in [his]197-clyde chair , [he]197-clyde pulled [himself]197-clyde up and looked at [the jury]1953-the jury and [the audience]2651-the audience with what measure of strength and conviction [he]197-clyde could summon — as previously [he]197-clyde had been told to do . At the same time [he]197-clyde added : " And [I]197-clyde wanted to please [her]195-roberta in any way that [I]197-clyde could so that [she]195-roberta might be a little more cheerful . "[197-clyde]

" Were [you]197-clyde still as sorry for [her]195-roberta on this Thursday as [you]197-clyde had been the day before ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir — more , [I]197-clyde think . "[197-clyde]

" And had [you]197-clyde definitely made up [your]197-clyde mind by then as to what [you]197-clyde wanted to do ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Well , and just what was that ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , [I]197-clyde had decided to play as fair as [I]197-clyde could . [I]197-clyde had been thinking about it all night , and [I]197-clyde realized how badly [she]195-roberta would feel and [I]197-clyde too if [I]197-clyde did n't do the right thing by [her]195-roberta — because [she]195-roberta had said three or four times that if [I]197-clyde did n't [she]195-roberta would kill [herself]195-roberta . And [I]197-clyde had made up [my]197-clyde mind that morning that whatever else happened that day , [I]197-clyde was going to straighten the whole thing out . "[197-clyde]

" This was at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake . [You]197-clyde were still in [the hotel]2781-the hotel on Thursday morning ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" And [you]197-clyde were going to tell [her]195-roberta just what ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , that [I]197-clyde knew that [I]197-clyde had n't treated [her]195-roberta quite right and that [I]197-clyde was sorry — besides , that [her]195-roberta offer was fair enough , and that if after what [I]197-clyde was going to tell [her]195-roberta [she]195-roberta still wanted [me]197-clyde , [I]197-clyde would go away with [her]195-roberta and marry [her]195-roberta . But that [I]197-clyde had to tell [her]195-roberta first the real reason for [my]197-clyde changing as [I]197-clyde had — that [I]197-clyde had been and still was in love with [another girl]2321-another girl and that [I]197-clyde could n't help it — that probably whether [I]197-clyde married [her]195-roberta or not — "[197-clyde]

" [Miss Alden]195-roberta [you]197-clyde mean ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir — that [I]197-clyde would always go on loving [this other girl]4753-this other girl , because [I]197-clyde just could n't get [her]195-roberta out of [my]197-clyde mind . That was all . "[197-clyde]

" But what about [Miss X]354-miss x ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , [I]197-clyde had thought about [her]354-miss x too , but [I]197-clyde thought [she]354-miss x was better off and could stand it easier . "[197-clyde]

" Had [you]197-clyde decided just where [you]197-clyde would marry [her]354-miss x ? "[197-clyde]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . But [I]197-clyde knew there were [plenty of towns below [Big Bittern]13-big bittern and [Grass Lake]21-grass lake]5700-plenty of towns below big bittern and grass lake . "[197-clyde]

" But were [you]197-clyde going to do that without one single word to [Miss X]354-miss x beforehand ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , no , [sir]4137-sir — not exactly . [I]197-clyde figured that if [Roberta]195-roberta would n't let [me]197-clyde off but did n't mind [my]197-clyde leaving [her]354-miss x for a few days , [I]197-clyde would go down to where [Miss X]354-miss x lived and tell [her]354-miss x , and then come back . But if [she]354-miss x objected to that , why then [I]197-clyde was going to write [Miss X]354-miss x a letter and explain how it was and then go on and get married to [Roberta]195-roberta . "[197-clyde]

" [I]197-clyde see . But , [Clyde]197-clyde , among other bits of testimony here , there was that letter found in [Miss Alden]195-roberta 's coat pocket — the one written on [Grass Lake Inn stationery]23-grass lake inn and addressed to [[her]195-roberta mother]752-her mother , in which [she]195-roberta told [her]752-her mother that [she]195-roberta was about to be married . " No , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Oh , [I]320-jephson see . So that 's it , "[320-jephson] smiled [Jephson]320-jephson , as though greatly relieved . ( And [Mason]209-mason and [Newcomb]181-earl newcomb and [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh and [State]2800-state [Senator Redmond]385-redmond all listening with the profoundest attention , now exclaimed , sotto voce and almost in unison : " Of all the bunk ! "[197-clyde] )

" Well , now [we]5704-us come to the trip itself . [You]197-clyde have heard the testimony here and the dark motive and plotting that has been attributed to every move in connection with it . Now [I]197-clyde want [you]197-clyde to tell it in [your]197-clyde own way . It has been testified here that [you]197-clyde took both bags — [yours]197-clyde and [hers]195-roberta — up there with [you]197-clyde but that [you]197-clyde left [hers]195-roberta at [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge when [you]197-clyde got [there]650-there and took [your]197-clyde own out on [the lake]571-the lake in [that boat]645-that boat with [you]197-clyde . Now just why did [you]197-clyde do that ? Please speak so that [all of [the jurymen]2458-the jurymen]5708-all of the jurymen can hear [you]197-clyde . "[197-clyde]

" Well , the reason for that was , "[197-clyde] and here once more [his]2801-his throat became so dry that [he]2801-his could scarcely speak , " [we]5710-we did n't know whether [we]5710-we could get any lunch at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , so [we]5710-we decided to take some things along with [us]5710-we from [Grass Lake]21-grass lake . [Her]195-roberta bag was packed full of things , but there was room in mine . Besides , it had [my]197-clyde camera with the tripod outside . So [I]197-clyde decided to leave hers and take [mine]197-clyde . "[197-clyde]

" [You]197-clyde decided ? "[197-clyde]

" Well , [I]197-clyde asked [her]195-roberta what [she]195-roberta thought and [she]195-roberta said [she]195-roberta thought that was best . "[197-clyde]

" Where was it [you]197-clyde asked [her]195-roberta that ? "[197-clyde]

" On [the train]4140-the train coming down . "[197-clyde]

" And did [you]197-clyde know then that [you]197-clyde were coming back to [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge after going out on [the lake]571-the lake ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , [I]197-clyde did . [We]5714-we had to . There was [no other road]5715-no other road . [They]5716-they told [us]5714-we that at [Grass Lake]21-grass lake . "[197-clyde]

" And in riding over to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern — do [you]197-clyde recall the testimony of [the driver who drove [you]197-clyde over]5717-the driver who drove you over — that [you]197-clyde were ' very nervous ' and that [you]197-clyde asked [him]5717-the driver who drove you over whether there were [many people over that that day]5718-many people over that that day ? "[197-clyde]

" [I]197-clyde recall it , yes , [sir]4137-sir , but [I]197-clyde was n't nervous at all . [I]197-clyde may have asked about [the people]601-the people , but [I]197-clyde ca n't see anything wrong with that . It seems to [me]197-clyde that [any one]4181-any one might ask that . "[197-clyde]

" And so it seems to [me]320-jephson , "[320-jephson] echoed [Jephson]320-jephson . " Then what happened after [you]197-clyde registered at [Big Bittern Inn]129-big bittern inn and got into [that boat]645-that boat and went out on [the lake]571-the lake with [Miss Alden]195-roberta ? Were [you]197-clyde or [she]5724-she especially preoccupied or nervous or in any state different from that of [any ordinary person who goes out on [a lake]5171-a lake to row]5725-any ordinary person who goes out on a lake to row ? Were [you]197-clyde particularly happy or particularly gloomy , or what ? "[320-jephson]

" Well , [I]197-clyde do n't think [I]197-clyde was especially gloomy — no , [sir]4137-sir . [I]197-clyde was thinking of all [I]197-clyde was going to tell [her]195-roberta , of course , and of what was before [me]197-clyde either way [she]195-roberta decided . [I]197-clyde was n't exactly gay , [I]197-clyde guess , but [I]197-clyde thought it would be all right whichever way things went . [I]197-clyde had decided that [I]197-clyde was willing to marry [her]195-roberta . "[197-clyde]

" And how about [her]195-roberta ? Was [she]195-roberta quite cheerful ? "[320-jephson]

" Well — yes , [sir]4137-sir . [She]195-roberta seemed to feel much happier for some reason . "[197-clyde]

" And what did [you]4137-sir talk about ? "[320-jephson]

" Oh , about [the lake]571-the lake first — how beautiful it was and where [we]5730-we would have [our]5730-we lunch when [we]5730-we were ready for it . And then [we]5730-we rowed along [the west shore]5731-the west shore looking for water lilies . [She]195-roberta was so happy that [I]197-clyde hated to bring up anything just then , and so [we]5730-we just kept on rowing until about two , when [we]5730-we stopped for lunch . "[197-clyde]

" Just where was that ? Just get up and trace on the map with that pointer there just where [you]4137-sir did go and how long [you]4137-sir stopped and for what . "[320-jephson]

And so [Clyde]197-clyde , pointer in hand and standing before the large map of [the lake]571-the lake and region which particularly concerned this tragedy , now tracing in detail the long row along [the shore]992-the shore , a group of trees , which , after having lunch , [they]2804-they had rowed to see — a beautiful bed of water lilies which [they]2804-they had lingered over — each point at which [they]2804-they had stopped , until reaching [Moon Cove]18-moon cove at about five in the afternoon , [they]2804-they had been so entranced by [its]18-moon cove beauty that [they]2804-they had merely sat and gazed , as [he]197-clyde said . Afterwards , in order that [he]197-clyde might take some pictures , [they]2804-they had gone ashore in [the woods nearby]2805-the woods nearby — [he]197-clyde all the while preparing [himself]197-clyde to tell [Roberta]195-roberta of [Miss X]354-miss x and ask [her]195-roberta for [her]195-roberta final decision . And then having left the bag on [shore]1422-shore for a few moments while [they]2804-they rowed out and took some snapshots in [the boat]4231-the boat , [they]2804-they had drifted in the calm of [the water]1009-the water and the stillness and beauty until finally [he]197-clyde had gathered sufficient courage to tell [her]195-roberta what was in [his]197-clyde heart . And at first , as [he]197-clyde now said , [Roberta]195-roberta seemed greatly startled and depressed and began crying a little , saying that perhaps it was best for [her]195-roberta not to live any longer — [she]195-roberta felt so miserable . But , afterwards , when [he]197-clyde had impressed on [her]195-roberta the fact that [he]197-clyde was really sorry and perfectly willing to make amends , [she]195-roberta had suddenly changed and begun to grow more cheerful , and then of a sudden , in a burst of tenderness and gratefulness — [he]197-clyde could not say exactly — [she]195-roberta had jumped up and tried to come to [him]197-clyde . [Her]195-roberta arms were outstretched and [she]195-roberta moved as if to throw [herself]195-roberta at [his]197-clyde feet or into [his]197-clyde lap . But just then , [her]195-roberta foot , or [her]195-roberta dress , had caught and [she]195-roberta had stumbled . And [he]197-clyde — camera in hand—(a last minute decision or legal precaution on the part of [Jephson)—had]389-jephson)—had risen instinctively to try to catch [her]195-roberta and stop [her]195-roberta fall . Perhaps — [he]197-clyde would not be able to say here — [her]195-roberta face or hand had struck the camera . At any rate , the next moment , before [he]197-clyde quite understood how it all happened , and without time for thought or action on [his]197-clyde part or [hers]195-roberta , both were in the water and [the boat]4231-the boat , which had overturned , seemed to have struck [Roberta]195-roberta , for [she]195-roberta seemed to be stunned .

" [I]195-roberta called to [her]195-roberta to try to get to [the boat]4231-the boat — it was moving away — to take hold of it , but [she]195-roberta did n't seem to hear [me]195-roberta or understand what [I]195-roberta meant . [I]195-roberta was afraid to go too near [her]195-roberta at first because [she]195-roberta was striking out in every direction — and before [I]195-roberta could swim ten strokes forward [her]195-roberta head had gone down once and come up and then gone down again for a second time . By then [the boat]4231-the boat had floated all of thirty or forty feet away and [I]195-roberta knew that [I]195-roberta could n't get [her]195-roberta into that . And then [I]195-roberta decided that if [I]195-roberta wanted to save [myself]195-roberta [I]195-roberta had better swim [ashore]4876-ashore . "[195-roberta]

And once there , as [he]2810-he now narrated , it suddenly occurred to [him]2810-he how peculiar and suspicious were all the circumstances surrounding [his]2810-he present position . [He]2810-he suddenly realized , as [he]2810-he now said , how had the whole thing looked from the beginning . The false registering . The fact [his]2810-he bag was there — [hers]2811-her not . Besides , to return now meant that [he]2810-he would have to explain and it would become generally known — and everything connected with [his]2810-he life would go — [Miss X]354-miss x , [his]2810-he work , [his]2810-he social position — all — whereas , if [he]2810-he said nothing ( and here it was , and for the first time , as [he]2810-he now swore , that this thought occurred to [him]2810-he ) , it might be assumed that [he]2810-he too had drowned . In view of this fact and that any physical help [he]2810-he might now give [her]2811-her would not restore [her]2811-her to life , and that acknowledgment would mean only trouble for [him]2810-he and shame for [her]2811-her , [he]2810-he decided to say nothing . And so , to remove all traces , [he]2810-he had taken off [his]2810-he clothes and wrung them out and wrapped them for packing as best [he]2810-he could . Next , having left the tripod on [shore]1422-shore with [his]2810-he bag , [he]2810-he decided to hide that , and did . [His]2810-he first straw hat , the one without the lining ( but about which absent lining [he]2810-he now declared [he]2810-he knew nothing ) , had been lost with the overturning of [the boat]4231-the boat , and so now [he]2810-he had put on the extra one [he]2810-he had with [him]2810-he , although [he]2810-he also had a cap which [he]2810-he might have worn . ( [He]2810-he usually carried an extra hat on a trip because so often , it seemed , something happened to one . ) Then [he]2810-he had ventured to walk south through [the woods]632-the woods toward [a railroad which [he]2810-he thought cut through [the woods in that direction]2816-the woods in that direction]2815-a railroad which he thought cut through the woods in that direction . [He]2810-he had not known of any [automobile road]2817-automobile road through there then , and as for making for [the Cranstons]245-the cranstons so directly , [he]2810-he confessed quite simply that [he]2810-he would naturally have gone [there]650-there . [They]2819-they were [[his]2810-he friends]599-his friends and [he]2810-he wanted to get off somewhere where [he]2810-he could think about this terrible thing that had descended upon [him]2810-he so suddenly out of a clear sky .

And then having testified to so much — and no more appearing to occur either to [Jephson]320-jephson or [himself]2810-he — [the former]2329-the former after a pause now turned and said , most distinctly and yet somehow quietly :

" Now , [Clyde]197-clyde , [you]197-clyde have taken a solemn oath before [this jury]5224-this jury , [this judge]5736-this judge , all [these people]2355-these people here , and above all [[your]197-clyde God]5738-your god , to tell the truth , the whole truth , and nothing but the truth . [You]197-clyde realize what that means , do n't [you]197-clyde ? "[2329-the former]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , [I]2329-the former do . "[2329-the former]

" [You]197-clyde swear before [God]246-god that [you]197-clyde did not strike [Roberta Alden]195-roberta in [that boat]645-that boat ? "[2329-the former]

" [I]2329-the former swear . [I]2329-the former did not . "[2329-the former]

" Or throw [her]195-roberta into [the lake]571-the lake ? "[2329-the former]

" [I]2329-the former swear it . [I]2329-the former did not . "[2329-the former]

" Or willfully or willingly in any way attempt to upset [that boat]645-that boat or in any other fashion bring about the death that [she]195-roberta suffered ? "[2329-the former]

" [I]197-clyde swear it ! "[197-clyde] cried [Clyde]197-clyde , emphatically and emotionally .

" [You]197-clyde swear that it was an accident — unpremeditated and undesigned by [you]197-clyde ? "[197-clyde]

" [I]197-clyde do , "[197-clyde] lied [Clyde]197-clyde , who felt that in fighting for [his]197-clyde life [he]197-clyde was telling a part of the truth , for that accident was unpremeditated and undesigned . It had not been as [he]197-clyde had planned and [he]197-clyde could swear to that .

And then [Jephson]320-jephson , running one of [his]320-jephson large strong hands over [his]320-jephson face and looking blandly and nonchalantly around upon [the court and jury]2822-the court and jury , the while [he]320-jephson compressed [his]320-jephson thin lips into a long and meaningful line , announced : " [The prosecution]2006-the prosecution may take [the witness]2428-the witness . "[320-jephson]

The mood of [Mason]209-mason throughout the entire direct examination was that of [a restless harrier anxious to be off at the heels of its prey]2823-a restless harrier anxious to be off at the heels of its prey — of a foxhound within the last leap of its kill . A keen and surging desire to shatter this testimony , to show it to be from start to finish the tissue of lies that in part at least it was , now animated [him]197-clyde . And no sooner had [Jephson]320-jephson concluded than [he]320-jephson leaped up and confronted [Clyde]197-clyde , who , seeing [him]320-jephson blazing with this desire to undo [him]320-jephson , felt as though [he]197-clyde was about to be physically attacked .

" [Griffiths]197-clyde , [you]197-clyde had that camera in [your]197-clyde hand at the time [she]5745-she came toward [you]197-clyde in [the boat]4231-the boat ? "[320-jephson]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[320-jephson]

" [She]5745-she stumbled and fell and [you]197-clyde accidentally struck [her]5745-she with it ? "[320-jephson]

" Yes . "[320-jephson]

" [I]320-jephson do n't suppose in [your]197-clyde truthful and honest way [you]197-clyde remember telling [me]320-jephson there in the woods on [the shore of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]5748-the shore of big bittern that [you]197-clyde never had a camera ? "[320-jephson]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir — [I]320-jephson remember that . "[320-jephson]

" And that was a lie , of course ? "[320-jephson]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[320-jephson]

" [I]320-jephson 'm not lying . [I]320-jephson 've explained why [I]320-jephson said that . "[320-jephson]

And had not [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh testified to having discovered a hair in the camera ? And how about the cry [that woman]2847-that woman had heard ? How about that ?

But with that particular incident [the court]1991-the court was adjourned for this day .

On the following morning at the sound of the gavel , there was [Mason]209-mason , as fresh and vigorous and vicious as ever . And [Clyde]197-clyde , after a miserable night in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell and much bolstering by [Jephson]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap , determined to be as cool and insistent and innocent - appearing as [he]197-clyde could be , but with no real heart for the job , so convinced was [he]197-clyde that local sentiment in its entirety was against [him]197-clyde — that [he]197-clyde was believed to be guilty . And with [Mason]209-mason beginning most savagely and bitterly :

" [You]197-clyde still insist that [you]197-clyde experienced a change of heart , do [you]197-clyde , [Griffiths]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir , [I]209-mason do . "[209-mason]

" Explained ! Explained ! "[209-mason] [Mason]209-mason was fairly beside [himself]209-mason with rage and [Clyde]197-clyde did not venture to comment as to that . [The judge]4625-the judge anticipated [Jephson]320-jephson 's objection to this and bellowed , " Objection sustained . "[4625-the judge] But [Mason]209-mason went right on . " [You]197-clyde could n't have been just a little careless , could [you]197-clyde , [Griffiths]197-clyde , in the handling of [the boat]4231-the boat and upset it [yourself]197-clyde , say ? "[209-mason] [He]209-mason drew near and leered .

" No , [sir]4137-sir , [I]197-clyde was n't careless . It was an accident that [I]197-clyde could n't avoid . "[197-clyde] [Clyde]197-clyde was quite cool , though pale and tired .

" An accident . Like that other accident out there in [Kansas City]45-kansas city , for instance . [You]197-clyde 're rather familiar with accidents of that kind , are n't [you]197-clyde , [Griffiths]197-clyde ? "[209-mason] queried [Mason]209-mason sneeringly and slowly .

" [I]197-clyde 've explained how that happened , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde nervously .

" [You]197-clyde 're rather familiar with accidents that result in death to [girls]1319-girls , are n't [you]197-clyde ? Do [you]197-clyde always run away when one of [them]1319-girls dies ? "[197-clyde]

" Object , "[323-belknap] yelled [Belknap]323-belknap , leaping to [his]323-belknap feet .

" Objection sustained , "[326-justice oberwaltzer] called [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer sharply . " There is nothing before [this court]4996-this court concerning any other accident . [The prosecution]2006-the prosecution will confine [itself]2006-the prosecution more closely to the case in hand . "[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" [Griffiths]197-clyde , "[209-mason] went on [Mason]209-mason , pleased with the way [he]209-mason had made a return to [Jephson]320-jephson for [his]209-mason apology for the [Kansas City]45-kansas city accident , " when [that boat]645-that boat upset after that accidental blow of [yours]197-clyde and [you]197-clyde and [Miss Alden]195-roberta fell into [the water]1009-the water — how far apart were [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" Well , [I]326-justice oberwaltzer did n't notice just then . "[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" Pretty close , were n't [you]197-clyde ? Not much more than a foot or two , surely — the way [you]197-clyde stood there in [the boat]4231-the boat ? "[209-mason]

" Well , [I]326-justice oberwaltzer did n't notice . Maybe that , yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" Close enough to have grabbed [her]195-roberta and hung on to [her]195-roberta if [you]197-clyde had wanted to , were n't [you]197-clyde ? That 's what [you]197-clyde jumped up for , was n't it , when [she]195-roberta started to fall out ? "[209-mason]

" Yes , that 's what [I]197-clyde jumped up for , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde heavily , " but [I]197-clyde was n't close enough to grab [her]195-roberta . [I]197-clyde know [I]197-clyde went right under , and when [I]197-clyde came up [she]195-roberta was some little distance away . "[197-clyde]

" Well , how far exactly ? As far as from here to this end of the jury box or that end , or half way , or what ? "[209-mason]

" Well , [I]197-clyde say [I]197-clyde did n't notice , quite . About as far from here to that end , [I]197-clyde guess , "[197-clyde] [he]197-clyde lied , stretching the distance by at least eight feet .

" Not really ! "[209-mason] exclaimed [Mason]209-mason , pretending to evince astonishment . " [This boat]1071-this boat here turns over , [you]197-clyde both fall in the water close together , and when [you]197-clyde come up [you]197-clyde and [she]195-roberta are nearly twenty feet apart . Do n't [you]197-clyde think [your]197-clyde memory is getting a little the best of [you]197-clyde there ? "[209-mason]

" Well , that 's the way it looked to [me]209-mason when [I]209-mason came up . "[209-mason]

" Well , now , after [that boat]645-that boat turned over and [you]197-clyde both came up , where were [you]197-clyde in relation to it ? Here is [the boat]4231-the boat now and where were [you]197-clyde out there in the audience , as to distance , [I]209-mason mean ? "[209-mason]

" Well , as [I]197-clyde say , [I]197-clyde did n't exactly notice when [I]197-clyde first came up , "[197-clyde] returned [Clyde]197-clyde , looking nervously and dubiously at the space before [him]197-clyde . Most certainly a trap was being prepared for [him]197-clyde . " About as far as from here to that railing beyond [your]197-clyde table , [I]209-mason guess . "[209-mason]

" About thirty to thirty - five feet then , "[209-mason] suggested [Mason]209-mason , slyly and hopefully .

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . About that maybe . [I]209-mason could n't be quite sure . "[209-mason]

" And now with [you]209-mason over there and [the boat]4231-the boat here , where was [Miss Alden]195-roberta at that time ? "[209-mason]

And [Clyde]197-clyde now sensed that [Mason]209-mason must have some geometric or mathematic scheme in mind whereby [he]209-mason proposed to establish [his]209-mason guilt . And at once [he]209-mason was on [his]209-mason guard , and looking in the direction of [Jephson]320-jephson . At the same time [he]209-mason could not see how [he]209-mason was to put [Roberta]195-roberta too far away either . [He]209-mason had said [she]195-roberta could n't swim . Would n't [she]195-roberta be nearer [the boat]4231-the boat than [he]209-mason was ? Most certainly . [He]209-mason leaped foolishly — wildly — at the thought that it might be best to say that [she]195-roberta was about half that distance — not more , very likely . And said so . And at once [Mason]209-mason proceeded with :

" Well , then [she]195-roberta was not more than fifteen feet or so from [you]209-mason or [the boat]4231-the boat . "[209-mason]

" No , [sir]4137-sir , maybe not . [I]209-mason guess not . "[209-mason]

" Well then , do [you]209-mason mean to say that [you]209-mason could n't have swum that little distance and buoyed [her]195-roberta up until [you]209-mason could reach the boat just fifteen feet beyond [her]195-roberta ? "[209-mason]

" Well , as [I]209-mason say , [I]209-mason was a little dazed when [I]209-mason came up and [she]195-roberta was striking about and screaming so . "[209-mason]

" But there was [that boat]645-that boat — not more than thirty - five feet away , according to [your]209-mason own story — and a mighty long way for [a boat]535-a boat to move in that time , [I]209-mason 'll say . And do [you]209-mason mean to say that when [you]209-mason could swim five hundred feet to [shore]1422-shore afterwards that [you]209-mason could n't have swum to [that boat]645-that boat and pushed it to [her]195-roberta in time for [her]195-roberta to save [herself]195-roberta ? [She]195-roberta was struggling to keep [herself]195-roberta up , was n't [she]195-roberta ? "[209-mason]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . But [I]197-clyde was rattled at first , "[197-clyde] pleaded [Clyde]197-clyde , gloomily , conscious of the eyes of [all the jurors]2853-all the jurors and [all the spectators]2854-all the spectators fixed upon [his]197-clyde face , " and ... and ... "[197-clyde] ( because of the general strain of the suspicion and incredulity now focused as a great force upon [him]197-clyde , [his]197-clyde nerve was all but failing [him]197-clyde , and [he]197-clyde was hesitating and stumbling) ... "I did n't think quite quick enough [I]197-clyde guess , what to do . Besides [I]197-clyde was afraid if [I]197-clyde went near [her]195-roberta ... "[197-clyde]

" [I]209-mason know . [A mental and moral coward]5846-a mental and moral coward , "[209-mason] sneered [Mason]209-mason . " Besides very slow to think when it 's to [your]209-mason advantage to be slow and swift when it 's to [your]209-mason advantage to be swift . Is that it ? "[209-mason]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Well , then , if it is n't , just tell [me]209-mason this , [Griffiths]197-clyde , why was it , after [you]209-mason got out of the water a few moments later [you]209-mason had sufficient presence of mind to stop and bury [that tripod]5848-that tripod before starting through [the woods]632-the woods , whereas , when it came to rescuing [her]195-roberta [you]209-mason got rattled and could n't do a thing ? How was it that [you]209-mason could get so calm and calculating the moment [you]209-mason set [your]209-mason foot on [land]5850-land ? What can [you]209-mason say to that ? "[209-mason]

" Well ... a ... [I]197-clyde told [you]197-clyde that afterwards [I]197-clyde realized that there was nothing else to do . "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [we]5851-we know all about that . But does n't it occur to [you]197-clyde that it takes a pretty cool head after so much panic in [the water]1009-the water to stop at a moment like that and take such a precaution as that — burying that tripod ? How was it that [you]197-clyde could think so well of that and not think anything about [the boat]4231-the boat a few moments before ? "[209-mason]

" Well ... but ... "[197-clyde]

" [You]197-clyde did n't want [her]195-roberta to live , in spite of [your]197-clyde alleged change of heart ! Is n't that it ? "[209-mason] yelled [Mason]209-mason . " Is n't that the black , sad truth ? [She]195-roberta was drowning , as [you]197-clyde wanted [her]195-roberta to drown , and [you]197-clyde just let [her]195-roberta drown ! Is n't that so ? "[209-mason]

[He]209-mason was fairly trembling as [he]209-mason shouted this , and [Clyde]197-clyde , [the actual boat before [him]209-mason]2855-the actual boat before him and [Roberta]195-roberta 's eyes and cries as [she]195-roberta sank coming back to [him]209-mason with all their pathetic and horrible force , now shrank and cowered in [his]209-mason seat — the closeness of [Mason]209-mason 's interpretation of what had really happened terrifying [him]209-mason . For never , even to [Jephson]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap , had [he]209-mason admitted that when [Roberta]195-roberta was in [the water]1009-the water [he]209-mason had not wished to save [her]195-roberta . Changelessly and secretively [he]209-mason insisted [he]209-mason had wanted to but that it had all happened so quickly , and [he]209-mason was so dazed and frightened by [her]195-roberta cries and movements , that [he]209-mason had not been able to do anything before [she]195-roberta was gone .

" [I]209-mason ... [I]209-mason wanted to save [her]195-roberta , "[209-mason] [he]209-mason mumbled , [his]209-mason face quite gray , " but ... but ... as [I]209-mason said , [I]209-mason was dazed ... and ... and ... "[209-mason]

" Do n't [you]209-mason know that [you]209-mason 're lying ! "[209-mason] shouted [Mason]209-mason , leaning still closer , [his]209-mason stout arms aloft , [his]209-mason disfigured face glowering and scowling like some avenging nemesis or fury of gargoyle design — " that [you]209-mason deliberately and with cold - hearted cunning allowed [that poor , tortured girl]5854-that poor , tortured girl to die there when [you]209-mason might have rescued [her]195-roberta as easily as [you]209-mason could have swum fifty of those five hundred feet [you]209-mason did swim in order to save [yourself]209-mason ? "[209-mason] For by now [he]209-mason was convinced that [he]209-mason knew just how [Clyde]197-clyde had actually slain [Roberta]195-roberta , something in [his]197-clyde manner and mood convincing [him]197-clyde , and [he]209-mason was determined to drag it out of [him]197-clyde if [he]209-mason could . And although [Belknap]323-belknap was instantly on [his]323-belknap feet with a protest that [[his]323-belknap client]2857-his client was being unfairly prejudiced in the eyes of [the jury]1953-the jury and that [he]323-belknap was really entitled to — and now demanded — a mistrial — which [complaint Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer eventually overruled — still [Clyde]197-clyde had time to reply , but most meekly and feebly : " No ! No ! [I]197-clyde did n't . [I]197-clyde wanted to save [her]195-roberta if [I]197-clyde could . "[197-clyde] Yet [his]209-mason whole manner , as [each and every juror]2859-each and every juror noted , was that of [one who was not really telling the truth]2860-one who was not really telling the truth , who was really all of the mental and moral coward that [Belknap]323-belknap had insisted [he]209-mason was — but worse yet , really guilty of [Roberta]195-roberta 's death . For after all , asked [each juror]2546-each juror of [himself]209-mason as [he]209-mason listened , why could n't [he]209-mason have saved [her]195-roberta if [he]209-mason was strong enough to swim to [shore]1422-shore afterwards — or at least have swum to and secured [the boat]4231-the boat and helped [her]195-roberta to take hold of it ?

" [She]195-roberta only weighed a hundred pounds , did n't [she]195-roberta ? "[209-mason] went on [Mason]209-mason feverishly .

" Yes , [I]209-mason think so . "[209-mason]

" And [you]209-mason — what did [you]209-mason weigh at the time ? "[1953-the jury]

" About a hundred and forty , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde .

" And [a hundred and forty pound man]5855-a hundred and forty pound man , "[209-mason] sneered [Mason]209-mason , turning to [the jury]1953-the jury , " is afraid to go near [a weak , sick , hundred - pound little girl who is drowning]5856-a weak , sick , hundred - pound little girl who is drowning , for fear [she]195-roberta will cling to [him]209-mason and drag [him]209-mason under ! And [a perfectly good boat]5857-a perfectly good boat , strong enough to hold three or four up , within fifteen or twenty feet ! How 's that ? "[209-mason]

And to emphasize it and let it sink in , [he]209-mason now paused , and took from [his]209-mason pocket a large white handkerchief , and after wiping [his]209-mason neck and face and wrists — since they were quite damp from [his]209-mason emotional and physical efforts — turned to [Burton Burleigh]211-burton burleigh and called : " [You]211-burton burleigh might as well have [this boat]1071-this boat taken out of [here]4244-here , [Burton]211-burton burleigh . [We]2865-the four deputies 're not going to need it for a little while anyhow . "[211-burton burleigh] And forthwith [the four deputies]2865-the four deputies carried it out .

And then , having recovered [his]209-mason poise , [he]209-mason once more turned to [Clyde]197-clyde and began with : " [Griffiths]197-clyde , [you]197-clyde knew the color and feel of [Roberta Alden]195-roberta 's hair pretty well , did n't [you]197-clyde ? [You]197-clyde were intimate enough with [her]195-roberta , were n't [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" [I]197-clyde know the color of it or [I]197-clyde think [I]197-clyde do , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde wincing — an anguished chill at the thought of it affecting [him]209-mason almost observably .

" And the feel of it , too , did n't [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason] persisted [Mason]209-mason . " In those very loving days of [yours]197-clyde before [Miss X]354-miss x came along — [you]197-clyde must have touched it often enough . "[209-mason]

" [I]197-clyde do n't know whether [I]197-clyde did or not , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , catching a glance from [Jephson]320-jephson .

" Well , roughly . [You]197-clyde must know whether it was coarse or fine — silky or coarse . [You]197-clyde know that , do n't [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" It was silky , yes . "[209-mason]

" Well , here 's a lock of it , "[209-mason] [he]209-mason now added more to torture [Clyde]197-clyde than anything else — to wear [him]197-clyde down nervously — and going to [his]209-mason table where was an envelope and from it extracting a long lock of light brown hair . " Do n't that look like [her]5860-her hair ? "[209-mason] And now [he]209-mason shoved it forward at [Clyde]197-clyde who shocked and troubled withdrew from it as from some unclean or dangerous thing — yet a moment after sought to recover [himself]209-mason — the watchful eyes of [the jury]1953-the jury having noted all . " Oh , do n't be afraid , "[209-mason] persisted [Mason]209-mason , sardonically . " It 's only [your]197-clyde dead love 's hair . "[209-mason]

And shocked by the comment — and noting the curious eyes of [the jury]1953-the jury , [Clyde]197-clyde took it in [his]197-clyde hand . " That looks and feels like [her]5860-her hair , does n't it ? "[209-mason] went on [Mason]209-mason .

" Well , it looks like it anyhow , "[197-clyde] returned [Clyde]197-clyde shakily .

" And now here , "[209-mason] continued [Mason]209-mason , stepping quickly to the table and returning with the camera in which between the lid and the taking mechanism were caught the two threads of [Roberta]195-roberta 's hair put there by [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , and then holding it out to [him]209-mason . " Just take this camera . It 's [yours]197-clyde even though [you]197-clyde did swear that it wasn't — and look at those two hairs there . See them ? "[209-mason] And [he]209-mason poked the camera at [Clyde]197-clyde as though [he]209-mason might strike [him]197-clyde with it . " [They]5861-they were caught in there — presumably — at the time [you]197-clyde struck [her]5860-her so lightly that it made all those wounds on [her]5860-her face . Ca n't [you]197-clyde tell [the jury]1953-the jury whether those hairs are hers or not ? "[209-mason]

" [I]197-clyde ca n't say , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde most weakly .

" What 's that ? Speak up . Do n't be so much of [a moral and mental coward]5452-a moral and mental coward . Are [they]2868-they or are [they]2868-they not ? "[209-mason]

" [I]197-clyde ca n't say , "[197-clyde] repeated [Clyde]197-clyde — but not even looking at [them]2868-they .

" Look at [them]2868-they . Look at [them]2868-they . Compare [them]2868-they with [these others]1155-these others . [We]5865-we know these are [hers]5860-her . And [you]197-clyde know that these in this camera are , do n't [you]197-clyde ? Do n't be so squeamish . [You]197-clyde 've often touched [her]5860-her hair in real life . [She]5860-her 's dead . [They]2868-they wo n't bite [you]197-clyde . Are these two hairs — or are [they]2868-they not — the same as these other hairs here — which [we]5865-we know are [hers]5860-her — the same color — same feel — all ? Look ! Answer ! Are [they]2868-they or are [they]2868-they not ? "[209-mason]

But [Clyde]197-clyde , under such pressure and in spite of [Belknap]323-belknap , being compelled to look and then feel them too . Yet cautiously replying , " [I]323-belknap would n't be able to say . [They]2868-they look and feel a little alike , but [I]323-belknap ca n't tell . "[323-belknap]

" Oh , ca n't [you]197-clyde ? And even when [you]197-clyde know that when [you]197-clyde struck [her]5860-her that brutal vicious blow with that camera — these two hairs caught there and held . "[323-belknap]

" But [I]197-clyde did n't strike [her]5860-her any vicious blow , "[197-clyde] insisted [Clyde]197-clyde , now observing [Jephson—"and]391-jephson—"and [I]197-clyde ca n't say . "[197-clyde] [He]197-clyde was saying to [himself]197-clyde that [he]197-clyde would not allow [himself]197-clyde to be bullied in this way by [this man]749-this man — yet , at the same time , feeling very weak and sick . And [Mason]209-mason , triumphant because of the psychologic effect , if nothing more , returning the camera and lock to the table and remarking , " Well , it 's been amply testified to that those two hairs were in that camera when found in [the water]1009-the water . And [you]197-clyde [yourself]197-clyde swear that it was last in [your]197-clyde hands before it reached [the water]1009-the water . "[209-mason]

[He]209-mason turned to think of something else — some new point with which to rack [Clyde]197-clyde and now began once more :

" [Griffiths]197-clyde , in regard to that trip south through [the woods]632-the woods , what time was it when [you]197-clyde got to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay ? "[209-mason]

" About four in the morning , [I]209-mason think — just before dawn . "[209-mason]

" And what did [you]197-clyde do between then and the time [that boat]645-that boat down there left ? "[209-mason]

" Oh , [I]209-mason walked around . "[209-mason]

" In [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay ? "[209-mason]

" No , [sir]4137-sir — just outside of it . "[209-mason]

" In [the woods]632-the woods , [I]209-mason suppose , waiting for [the town]483-the town to wake up so [you]197-clyde would n't look so much out of place . Was that it ? "[209-mason]

" Well , [I]209-mason waited until after the sun came up . Besides [I]209-mason was tired and [I]209-mason sat down and rested for a while . "[209-mason]

" Did [you]197-clyde sleep well and did [you]197-clyde have pleasant dreams ? "[209-mason]

" [I]209-mason was tired and [I]209-mason slept a little — yes . "[209-mason]

" And how was it [you]197-clyde knew so much about [the boat]4231-the boat and the time and all about [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay ? Had n't [you]197-clyde familiarized [yourself]197-clyde with this data beforehand ? "[209-mason]

" Well , [everybody]1260-everybody knows about [the boat from [Sharon]25-sharon to [Three Mile Bay around there]5876-three mile bay around there]5875-the boat from sharon to three mile bay around there . "[209-mason]

" Oh , do [they]1260-everybody ? Any other reason ? "[209-mason]

" Well , in looking for a place to get married , [both of [us]4698-both of us]4698-both of us saw it , "[197-clyde] returned [Clyde]197-clyde , shrewdly , " but [we]4698-both of us did n't see that [any train]5878-any train went to [it]2-three mile bay . Only to [Sharon]25-sharon . "[197-clyde]

" But [you]197-clyde did notice that it was [south of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]5879-south of big bittern ? "[209-mason]

" Why , yes — [I]197-clyde guess [I]197-clyde did , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde .

" And [that that road west of [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge]5880-that that road west of gun lodge led south toward [it]2-three mile bay around [the lower edge of [Big Bittern]13-big bittern]5881-the lower edge of big bittern ? "[209-mason]

" Well , [I]209-mason noticed after [I]209-mason got up [there]650-there that there was [a road]1385-a road of some kind or a trail anyhow — but [I]209-mason did n't think of it as [a regular road]5884-a regular road . "[209-mason]

" [I]209-mason see . How was it then that when [you]197-clyde met [those three men in [the woods]632-the woods]1604-those three men in the woods [you]197-clyde were able to ask [them]1604-those three men in the woods how far it was to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay ? "[209-mason]

" [I]197-clyde did n't ask ['em]5887-'em that , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , as [he]197-clyde had been instructed by [Jephson]320-jephson to say . " [I]197-clyde asked ['em]5887-'em if [they]1604-those three men in the woods knew [any road to [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay]5888-any road to three mile bay , and how far it was . [I]197-clyde did n't know whether that was [the road]1056-the road or not . "[197-clyde]

" Well , that was n't how [they]1604-those three men in the woods testified here . "[209-mason]

" Well , [I]197-clyde do n't care what [they]1604-those three men in the woods testified to , that 's what [I]197-clyde asked 'em just the same . "[197-clyde]

" It seems to [me]209-mason that according to [you]197-clyde all [the witnesses]4923-the witnesses are [liars]5891-liars and [you]197-clyde are [the only truthful one in the bunch]5892-the only truthful one in the bunch ... Isn't that it ? But , when [you]197-clyde reached [Three Mile Bay]2-three mile bay , did [you]197-clyde stop to eat ? [You]197-clyde must have been hungry , were n't [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" No , [I]197-clyde was n't hungry , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , simply .

" [You]197-clyde wanted to get away from [that place]655-that place as quickly as possible , was n't that it ? [You]197-clyde were afraid that [those three men]4204-those three men might go up to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern and having heard about [Miss Alden]195-roberta , tell about having seen [you]197-clyde — wasn't that it ? "[209-mason]

" No , that was n't it . But [I]209-mason did n't want to stay around there . [I]209-mason 've said why . "[209-mason]

" [I]209-mason see . But after [you]197-clyde got down to [Sharon]25-sharon where [you]197-clyde felt a little more safe — a little further away , [you]197-clyde did n't lose any time in eating , did [you]197-clyde ? It tasted pretty good all right down there , did n't it ? "[209-mason]

" Oh , [I]209-mason do n't know about that . [I]209-mason had a cup of coffee and a sandwich . "[209-mason]

" And a piece of pie , too , as [we]5895-we 've already proved here , "[209-mason] added [Mason]209-mason . " And after that [you]197-clyde joined [the crowd]1585-the crowd coming up from [the depot]4672-the depot as though [you]197-clyde had just come up from [Albany]28-albany , as [you]197-clyde afterwards told [everybody]1260-everybody . Was n't that it ? "[209-mason]

" Yes , that was it . "[209-mason]

" Well , now for [a really innocent man who only so recently experienced a kindly change of heart]5899-a really innocent man who only so recently experienced a kindly change of heart , do n't [you]197-clyde think [you]197-clyde were taking an awful lot of precaution ? " [I]197-clyde 've explained all that , "[197-clyde] persisted [Clyde]197-clyde .

[Mason]209-mason 's next tack was to hold [Clyde]197-clyde up to shame for having been willing , in the face of all [she]2870-she had done for [him]197-clyde , to register [Roberta]195-roberta in [three different hotel registers]2871-three different hotel registers as [the unhallowed consort of [presumably three different men]2873-presumably three different men]2872-the unhallowed consort of presumably three different men in three different days .

" Why did n't [you]197-clyde take [separate rooms]5900-separate rooms ? "[209-mason]

" Well , [she]2870-she did n't want it that way . [She]2870-she wanted to be with [me]209-mason . Besides [I]209-mason did n't have any too much money . "[209-mason]

" Even so , how could [you]197-clyde have so little respect for [her]2870-she there , and then be so deeply concerned about [her]2870-she reputation after [she]2870-she was dead that [you]197-clyde had to run away and keep the secret of [her]2870-she death all to [yourself]197-clyde , in order , as [you]197-clyde say , to protect [her]2870-she name and reputation ? "[209-mason]

" [Your]197-clyde Honor , "[323-belknap] interjected [Belknap]323-belknap , " this is n't a question . It 's an oration . "[323-belknap]

" [I]209-mason withdraw the question , "[209-mason] countered [Mason]209-mason , and then went on . " Do [you]197-clyde admit , by the way , that [you]197-clyde are [a mental and moral coward]5846-a mental and moral coward , [Griffiths]197-clyde — do [you]197-clyde ? "[209-mason]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . [I]209-mason do n't . "[209-mason]

" [You]197-clyde do not ? "[209-mason]

" No , [sir]4137-sir . "[209-mason]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . [I]209-mason suppose so . "[209-mason]

And [Mason]209-mason as well as [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson and [Clyde]197-clyde [himself]197-clyde now felt the strong public contempt and rage that the majority of those present had for [him]197-clyde from the start — now surging and shaking all . It filled [the room]936-the room . Yet before [him]197-clyde were all the hours [Mason]209-mason needed in which [he]209-mason could pick and choose at random from the mass of testimony as to just what [he]209-mason would quiz and bedevil and torture [Clyde]197-clyde with next . " [Griffiths]197-clyde , in [your]197-clyde testimony here yesterday , through which [you]197-clyde were being led by [[your]197-clyde counsel]5944-your counsel , [Mr. Jephson]320-jephson "[197-clyde] ( at this [Jephson]320-jephson bowed sardonically ) , " [you]197-clyde talked about that change of heart that [you]197-clyde experienced after [you]197-clyde encountered [Roberta Alden]195-roberta once more at [Fonda]118-fonda and [Utica]30-utica back there in July — just as [you]197-clyde were starting on this death trip . " And yet [you]197-clyde heard [Mrs. Gilpin]294-mrs. gilpin and [[her]294-mrs. gilpin husband]831-her husband testify here that night after night from December first on [Miss Alden]195-roberta was mostly always alone in [[her]195-roberta room]1145-her room and that [they]5958-them felt sorry for [her]195-roberta and thought it so unnatural and tried to get [her]195-roberta to join [them]5958-them , but [she]195-roberta would n't . " [I]197-clyde wanted [her]195-roberta to — yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" Yet continuing relations with [Miss Alden]195-roberta when [your]4137-sir other interests left [you]4137-sir any time . "[2880-you]

" Well ... yes , [sir]4137-sir , "[197-clyde] once more hesitated [Clyde]197-clyde , enormously troubled by the shabby picture of [his]197-clyde character which these disclosures seemed to conjure , yet somehow feeling that [he]197-clyde was not as bad , or at least had not intended to be , as all this made [him]197-clyde appear . [Other people]4559-other people did things like that too , did n't [they]4559-other people — [those young men in [Lycurgus society]2883-lycurgus society]2882-those young men in lycurgus society — or [they]4559-other people had talked as though [they]4559-other people did .

" Well , do n't [you]4137-sir think [[your]4137-sir learned counsel]5964-your learned counsel found a very mild term for [you]4137-sir when [they]5964-your learned counsel described [you]4137-sir as [a mental and moral coward]5846-a mental and moral coward ? "[209-mason] sneered [Mason]209-mason — and at the same time from the rear of [the long narrow courtroom]2884-the long narrow courtroom , a profound silence seeming to precede , accompany and follow it,—yet not without an immediate roar of protest from [Belknap]323-belknap , came the solemn , vengeful voice of [an irate woodsman]2885-an irate woodsman : " Why do n't [they]5964-your learned counsel kill [the God - damned bastard]5966-the god - damned bastard and be done with [him]5966-the god - damned bastard ? "[2885-an irate woodsman] — And at once [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer gaveling for order and ordering the arrest of [the offender]2886-the offender at the same time that [he]326-justice oberwaltzer ordered [all those not seated]2887-all those not seated driven from [the courtroom]2232-the courtroom — which was done . And then [the offender]2886-the offender arrested and ordered arraigned on the following morning . And after that , silence , with [Mason]209-mason once more resuming :

" [Griffiths]197-clyde , [you]197-clyde say when [you]197-clyde left [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus [you]197-clyde had no intention of marrying [Roberta Alden]195-roberta unless [you]197-clyde could not arrange in any other way . "[209-mason]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . That was [my]209-mason intention at that time . "[209-mason]

" And accordingly [you]197-clyde were fairly certain of coming back ? "[209-mason]

Not when [you]197-clyde were playing golf and tennis with [[your]197-clyde friends]5256-your friends the very next day after [her]195-roberta death ? Not when [you]197-clyde were buying and eating thirteen - dollar lunches ? Not when [you]197-clyde were with [Miss X]354-miss x again , and where [you]197-clyde [yourself]197-clyde testified that [you]197-clyde preferred to be ? "[209-mason]

[Mason]209-mason 's manner was snarling , punitive , sinister , bitterly sarcastic .

" Well , not just then , anyhow — no , [sir]4137-sir . "[209-mason]

" What do [you]197-clyde mean—'not just then ' ? Were n't [you]197-clyde where [you]197-clyde wanted to be ? "[209-mason]

" Well , in one way [I]197-clyde was — certainly , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , thinking of what [Sondra]238-sondra would think when [she]238-sondra read this , as unquestionably [she]238-sondra would . Quite everything of all this was being published in the papers every day . [He]197-clyde could not deny that [he]197-clyde was with [her]238-sondra and that [he]197-clyde wanted to be with [her]238-sondra . At the same time [he]197-clyde had not been happy . How miserably unhappy [he]197-clyde had been , enmeshed in that shameful and brutal plot ! But now [he]197-clyde must explain in some way so that [Sondra]238-sondra , when [she]238-sondra should read it , and [this jury]5224-this jury , would understand . And so now [he]197-clyde added , while [he]197-clyde swallowed with [his]197-clyde dry throat and licked [his]197-clyde lips with [his]197-clyde dry tongue : " But [I]197-clyde was sorry about [Miss Alden]195-roberta just the same . [I]197-clyde could n't be happy then — [I]197-clyde could n't be . [I]197-clyde was just trying to make [people]1033-people think that [I]197-clyde had n't had anything to do with [her]195-roberta going up there — that 's all . [I]197-clyde could n't see that there was any better way to do . [I]197-clyde did n't want to be arrested for what [I]197-clyde had n't done . "[197-clyde]

" Do n't [you]197-clyde know that is false ! Do n't [you]197-clyde know [you]197-clyde are lying ! "[209-mason] shouted [Mason]209-mason , as though to [the whole world]2907-the whole world , and the fire and the fury of [his]197-clyde unbelief and contempt was sufficient to convince [the jury]1953-the jury , as well as [the spectators]2909-the spectators , that [Clyde]197-clyde was the most unmitigated of [liars]5891-liars . " [You]197-clyde heard the testimony of [Rufus Martin]394-rufus martin , [the second cook up there at [Bear Lake]50-bear lake]6046-the second cook up there at bear lake ? "[197-clyde]

" Yes , [sir]4137-sir . "[197-clyde]

" [You]197-clyde heard [him]394-rufus martin swear that [he]394-rufus martin saw [you]197-clyde and [Miss X]354-miss x at [a certain point overlooking [Bear Lake]50-bear lake]6048-a certain point overlooking bear lake and that [she]354-miss x was in [your]197-clyde arms and that [you]197-clyde were kissing [her]354-miss x . " [Griffiths]197-clyde , only yesterday on the witness stand [you]197-clyde swore that [you]197-clyde personally had no plan to go to [Big Bittern]13-big bittern when [you]197-clyde left [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus . "[209-mason]

" [You]197-clyde suppose ! [You]197-clyde suppose ! Getting a little more cautious now that [we]6079-we 're getting down to something practical . " Yes , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , a little sullenly and bitterly after a time , so flayed and bruised was [he]197-clyde by [this man who was so determined to harry [him]197-clyde to [his]197-clyde grave]2916-this man who was so determined to harry him to his grave . [He]197-clyde fingered the map and pretended to look as directed , but was seeing only all that [he]197-clyde had seen long before there in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus , so shortly before [he]197-clyde departed for [Fonda]118-fonda to meet [Roberta]195-roberta . And now here it was being used against [him]197-clyde .

"[2917-he] As [he]2917-he said this , [Mason]209-mason paused and looked triumphantly about as much as to say : There , answer that if [you]2918-you can ! and [Clyde]197-clyde , shaken and stiff and breathless for the time being was compelled to wait at least fifteen seconds before [he]197-clyde was able sufficiently to control [his]197-clyde nerves and voice in order to reply : " Well , it musta been . " Very good . And when [they]2923-we had concluded — and much to the surprise of [the audience , which was expecting more and more attacks and exposures]2924-the audience , which was expecting more and more attacks and exposures , almost without cessation — [Mason]209-mason turned and explained : " That 's all . "[209-mason] And at once [many of [the spectators in the room]2926-the spectators in the room]2925-many of the spectators in the room beginning to whisper : " Trapped ! Trapped ! "[209-mason] And [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer at once announcing that because of the lateness of the hour , and in the face of a number of [additional witnesses for the defense]2927-additional witnesses for the defense , as well as a few in rebuttal for [the prosecution]2006-the prosecution , [he]326-justice oberwaltzer would prefer it if the work for the day ended here . And both [Belknap]323-belknap and [Mason]209-mason gladly agreeing . And [Clyde]197-clyde — the doors of [the courtroom]2232-the courtroom being stoutly locked until [he]197-clyde should be in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell across the way — being descended upon by [Kraut]290-kraut and [Sissel]283-sissel and by [them]2923-we led through and down the very door and stairs which for days [he]197-clyde had been looking at and pondering about . And once [he]197-clyde was gone , [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson looking at [each other]871-each other but not saying anything until once more safely locked in [[their]2932-their own office]2933-their own office , when [Belknap]323-belknap began with : " ... not carried off with enough of an air . "[323-belknap] And [Jephson]320-jephson , flinging [himself]320-jephson heavily into a chair , [his]320-jephson overcoat and hat still on , and saying : " No , that 's the real trouble , no doubt . "[320-jephson] And [Belknap]323-belknap adding : " Well , [I]323-belknap 'll do [my]323-belknap final best and damnedest in [my]323-belknap summing up , and that 's all [I]323-belknap can do . But in the meantime , [I]320-jephson think [I]320-jephson 'll go around to [the jail]1580-the jail and try and hearten ' [i]320-jephson m up a bit .
