"[320-jephson] And rising [he]320-jephson shoved [his]320-jephson hands in the side pockets of [his]320-jephson long coat and proceeded through the winter 's dark and cold of [the dreary town]2934-the dreary town to see [Clyde]197-clyde .

The remainder of the trial consisted of the testimony of [eleven witnesses]2935-eleven witnesses — four for [Mason]209-mason and seven for [Clyde]197-clyde . [One of [the latter]760-the latter]2936-one of the latter — [a Dr. A. K. Sword]2938-a dr. a. k. sword , of [Rehobeth]395-rehobeth — chancing to be at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern on the day that [Roberta]195-roberta 's body was returned to [the boat - house]563-the boat - house , now declared that [he]320-jephson had seen and examined [it]2940-it there and that the wounds , as they appeared then , did not seem to [him]320-jephson as other than such as might have been delivered by such a blow as [Clyde]197-clyde admitted to having struck accidentally , and that unquestionably [Miss Alden]195-roberta had been drowned while conscious — and not unconscious , as [the state]1663-the state would have [the jury]1953-the jury believe — a result which led [Mason]209-mason into an inquiry concerning [the gentleman]2943-the gentleman 's medical history , which , alas , was not as impressive as it might have been . [He]197-clyde had been graduated from [a second - rate medical school in [Oklahoma]150-oklahoma]2944-a second - rate medical school in oklahoma and had practised in [a small town]2945-a small town ever since . In addition to [him]197-clyde — and entirely apart from the crime with which [Clyde]197-clyde was charged — there was [Samuel Yearsley]396-samuel yearsley , [one of [the farmers from around [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge]2947-the farmers from around gun lodge , who , driving over [the road which [Roberta]195-roberta 's body had traveled in being removed from [Big Bittern]13-big bittern to [Gun Lodge]19-gun lodge]2948-the road which roberta 's body had traveled in being removed from big bittern to gun lodge]2946-one of the farmers from around gun lodge , who , driving over the road which roberta 's body had traveled in being removed from big bittern to gun lodge , now earnestly swore that [the road]1056-the road , as [he]396-samuel yearsley had noticed in driving over [it]1056-the road that same morning , was quite rough — making it possible for [Belknap]323-belknap , who was examining [him]396-samuel yearsley , to indicate that this was at least anapproximate cause of the extra - severity of the wounds upon [Roberta]195-roberta 's head and face . This bit of testimony was later contradicted , however , by [a rival witness for [Mason]209-mason]2950-a rival witness for mason — [the driver for [Lutz Brothers]220-the lutz brothers , no less , who as earnestly swore that [he]197-clyde found no ruts or rough places whatsoever in [the road]1056-the road]2951-the driver for lutz brothers , no less , who as earnestly swore that he found no ruts or rough places whatsoever in the road . And again there were [Liggett]358-liggett and [Whiggam]357-whiggam to say that in so far as [they]2953-they had been able to note or determine , [Clyde]197-clyde 's conduct in connection with [his]197-clyde technical efforts for [Griffiths & Company]76-griffiths & company had been attentive , faithful and valuable . [They]2953-they had seen no official harm in [him]197-clyde . And then [several other minor witnesses]2954-several other minor witnesses to say that in so far as [they]2953-they had been able to observe [his]197-clyde social comings and goings , [Clyde]197-clyde 's conduct was most circumspect , ceremonious and guarded . [He]197-clyde had done no ill that [they]2953-they knew of . But , alas , as [Mason]209-mason in cross - examining [them]2953-they was quick to point out , [they]2953-they had never heard of [Roberta Alden]195-roberta or [her]195-roberta trouble or even of [Clyde]197-clyde 's social relationship with [her]195-roberta .

Finally many small and dangerous and difficult points having been bridged or buttressed or fended against as well as each side could , it became [Belknap]323-belknap 's duty to say [his]323-belknap last word for [Clyde]197-clyde . And to this [he]323-belknap gave an entire day , most carefully , and in the spirit of [his]323-belknap opening address , retracing and emphasizing every point which tended to show how almost unconsciously , if not quite innocently , [Clyde]197-clyde had fallen into the relationship with [Roberta]195-roberta which had ended so disastrously for both . Mental and moral cowardice , as [he]323-belknap now reiterated , inflamed or at least operated on by various lacks in [Clyde]197-clyde 's early life , plus new opportunities such as previously had never appeared to be within [his]197-clyde grasp , had affected [his]197-clyde " perhaps too pliable and sensual and impractical and dreamy mind . "[197-clyde] No doubt [he]197-clyde had not been fair to [Miss Alden]195-roberta . No question as to that . [He]197-clyde had not . But on the other hand — and as had been most clearly shown by the confession which [the defense]1984-the defense had elicited — [he]197-clyde had not proved ultimately so cruel or vile as [the prosecution]2006-the prosecution would have [the public]1815-the public and [this honorable jury]2958-this honorable jury believe . [Many men]2959-many men were far more cruel in [their]2959-many men love life than [this young boy]2960-this young boy had ever dreamed of being , and of course [they]2959-many men were not necessarily hung for that . And in passing technically on whether [this boy]4688-this boy had actually committed the crime charged , it was incumbent upon [this jury]5224-this jury to see that no generous impulse relating to what [this poor girl]5155-this poor girl might have suffered in [her]5155-this poor girl love - relations with [this youth]641-this youth be permitted to sway [them]2959-many men to the belief or decision that for that [this youth]641-this youth had committed the crime specifically stated in the indictment . Who among [both sexes]2966-both sexes were not cruel at times in [their]2966-both sexes love life , [the one to the other]2967-the one to the other ?

And then a long and detailed indictment of the purely circumstantial nature of the evidence — [no single person]2968-no single person having seen or heard anything of the alleged crime itself , whereas [Clyde]197-clyde [himself]197-clyde had explained most clearly how [he]197-clyde came to find [himself]197-clyde in the peculiar situation in which [he]197-clyde did find [himself]197-clyde . And after that , a brushing aside of the incident of the folder , as well as [Clyde]197-clyde 's not remembering the price of [the boat]4231-the boat at [Big Bittern]13-big bittern , [his]197-clyde stopping to bury the tripod and [his]197-clyde being so near [Roberta]195-roberta and not aiding [her]195-roberta , as either being mere accidents of chance , or memory , or , in the case of [his]197-clyde failing to go to [her]195-roberta rescue , of [his]197-clyde being dazed , confused , frightened—"hesitating fatally but not criminally at the one time in [his]197-clyde life when [he]197-clyde should not have hesitated"—a[197-clyde] really strong if jesuitical plea which was not without its merits and its weight .

And then [Mason]209-mason , blazing with [his]209-mason conviction that [Clyde]197-clyde was [a murderer of the coldest and blackest type]2970-a murderer of the coldest and blackest type , and spending an entire day in riddling the " spider 's tissue of lies and unsupported statements "[209-mason] with which [the defense]1984-the defense was hoping to divert the minds of [the jury]1953-the jury from the unbroken and unbreakable chain of amply substantiated evidence wherewith [the prosecution]2006-the prosecution had proved [this " bearded man]6105-this " bearded man "[197-clyde] to be the " red - handed murderer "[2006-the prosecution] that [he]197-clyde was . And with hours spent in retracing the statements of [the various witnesses]2974-the various witnesses . And other hours in denouncing [Clyde]197-clyde , or re - telling the bitter miseries of [Roberta]195-roberta — so much so that [the jury]1953-the jury , as well as [the audience]2651-the audience , was once more on the verge of tears . And with [Clyde]197-clyde deciding in [his]197-clyde own mind as [he]197-clyde sat between [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , that [no jury such as this]2977-no jury such as this was likely to acquit [him]197-clyde in the face of evidence so artfully and movingly recapitulated .

And then [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer from [his]326-justice oberwaltzer high seat finally instructing [the jury]1953-the jury : " [Gentlemen]4570-gentlemen — all evidence is , in a strict sense , more or less circumstantial , whether consisting of facts which permit the inference of guilt or whether given by [an eyewitness]6107-an eyewitness . The testimony of [an eyewitness]6107-an eyewitness is , of course , based upon circumstances .[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" If any of the material facts of the case are at variance with the probability of guilt , it will be the duty of [[you]4570-gentlemen gentlemen]5310-you gentlemen to give [the defendant]4999-the defendant the benefit of the doubt raised .[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" And it must be remembered that evidence is not to be discredited or decried because it is circumstantial . It may often be more reliable evidence than direct evidence .[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" Much has been said here concerning motive and its importance in this case , but [you]4570-gentlemen are to remember that proof of motive is by no means indispensable or essential to conviction . While a motive may be shown as a circumstance to aid in fixing a crime , yet [the people]601-the people are not required to prove a motive .[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" If [the jury]1953-the jury finds that [Roberta Alden]195-roberta accidentally or involuntarily fell out of [the boat]4231-the boat and that [the defendant]4999-the defendant made no attempt to rescue [her]195-roberta , that does not make [the defendant]4999-the defendant guilty and [the jury]1953-the jury must find [the defendant]4999-the defendant ' not guilty . ' On the other hand , if [the jury]1953-the jury finds that [the defendant]4999-the defendant in any way , intentionally , there and then brought about or contributed to that fatal accident , either by a blow or otherwise , it must find [the defendant]4999-the defendant guilty .[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" While [I]326-justice oberwaltzer do not say that [you]4570-gentlemen must agree upon [your]4570-gentlemen verdict , [I]326-justice oberwaltzer would suggest that [you]4570-gentlemen ought not , any of [you]4570-gentlemen , place [your]4570-gentlemen minds in a position which will not yield if after careful deliberation [you]4570-gentlemen find [you]4570-gentlemen are wrong . "[326-justice oberwaltzer]

So , [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer — solemnly and didactically from [his]326-justice oberwaltzer high seat to [the jury]1953-the jury .

And then , that point having been reached , [the jury]1953-the jury rising and filing from [the room]936-the room at five in the afternoon . And [Clyde]197-clyde immediately thereafter being removed to [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell before [the audience proper]2983-the audience proper was allowed to leave [the building]2984-the building . There was constant fear on the part of [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff that [he]197-clyde might be attacked . And after that five long hours in which [he]197-clyde waited , walking to and fro , to and fro , in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell , or pretending to read or rest , the while [Kraut]290-kraut or [Sissel]283-sissel , tipped by [various representatives of the press]2987-various representatives of the press for information as to how [Clyde]197-clyde " took it "[290-kraut] at this time , slyly and silently remained as near as possible to watch .

And in the meantime [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer and [Mason]209-mason and [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , with [[their]2988-their attendants]2989-their attendants and [friends]924-friends , in [various rooms of [the Bridgeburg Central Hotel]2992-the bridgeburg central hotel]2991-various rooms of the bridgeburg central hotel , dining and then waiting impatiently , with the aid of a few drinks , for [the jury]1953-the jury to agree , and wishing and hoping that the verdict would be reached soon , whatever it might be .

And in the meantime [the twelve men]2994-the twelve men — [farmers]1566-farmers , [clerks]2996-clerks and [storekeepers]2997-storekeepers , re - canvassing for [their]2994-the twelve men own mental satisfaction the fine points made by [Mason]209-mason and [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson . Yet out of [the whole twelve but one man]2998-the whole twelve but one man — [Samuel Upham]398-samuel upham , [a druggist—(politically opposed to [Mason]209-mason and taken with the personality of Jephson)—sympathizing with [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson]2999-a druggist—(politically opposed to mason and taken with the personality of jephson)—sympathizing with belknap and jephson . And so pretending that [he]398-samuel upham had doubts as to the completeness of [Mason]209-mason 's proof until at last after five ballots were taken [he]398-samuel upham was threatened with exposure and the public rage and obloquy which was sure to follow in case [the jury]1953-the jury was hung . " [We]6121-we 'll fix [you]6122-you . [You]6122-you wo n't get by with this without [the public]1815-the public knowing exactly where [you]6122-you stand . "[326-justice oberwaltzer] [Whereupon]326-justice oberwaltzer , having a satisfactory drug business in [North Mansfield]151-north mansfield , [he]398-samuel upham at once decided that it was best to pocket this opposition to [Mason]209-mason and agree .

Then four hollow knocks on the door leading from [the jury room]3001-the jury room to [the courtroom]2232-the courtroom . It was [the foreman of the jury]2919-the foreman of the jury , [Foster Lund]399-foster lund , [a dealer in cement , lime and stone]3004-a dealer in cement , lime and stone . [His]399-foster lund great fist was knocking . And at that [the hundreds who had crowded into [the hot stuffy courtroom]3006-the hot stuffy courtroom after dinner though many had not even left]3005-the hundreds who had crowded into the hot stuffy courtroom after dinner though many had not even left — stirred from the half stupor into which [they]3005-the hundreds who had crowded into the hot stuffy courtroom after dinner though many had not even left had fallen . " What 's that ? What 's happened ? Is [the jury]1953-the jury ready to report ? What 's the verdict ? "[2208-men] And [men]2208-men and [women]2180-women and [children]1570-children starting up to draw nearer the excluding rail . And [the two deputies on guard before the jury door]3010-the two deputies on guard before the jury door beginning to call . " All right ! All right ! As soon as [the judge]4625-the judge comes . "[3011-other deputies] And then [other deputies]3011-other deputies hurrying to [the prison]3012-the prison over the way in order that [the sheriff]4144-the sheriff might be notified and [Clyde]197-clyde brought over — and to [the Bridgeburg Central Hotel]2992-the bridgeburg central hotel to summon [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer and [all the others]3015-all the others . And then [Clyde]197-clyde , in a half stupor or daze from sheer loneliness and killing suspense , being manacled to [Kraut]290-kraut and led over between [Slack]287-slack , [Sissel]283-sissel and [others]1118-others . And [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , [Mason]209-mason , [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson and [the entire company of newspaper writers]3017-the entire company of newspaper writers , [artists]2257-artists , [photographers]3019-photographers and [others]1118-others entering and taking the places that [they]3011-other deputies had occupied all these long weeks . And [Clyde]197-clyde winking and blinking as [he]197-clyde was seated behind [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson now — not with [them]3011-other deputies , for as stoutly manacled as [he]197-clyde was to [Kraut]290-kraut , [he]197-clyde was compelled to sit by [him]290-kraut . And then [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer on the bench and [the clerk]2301-the clerk in [his]326-justice oberwaltzer place , the jury room door being opened and [the twelve men filing solemnly]3022-the twelve men filing solemnly in — [quaint and varied figures in angular and for the most part much - worn suits of the ready - made variety]3023-quaint and varied figures in angular and for the most part much - worn suits of the ready - made variety . And as [they]3011-other deputies did so , seating [themselves]3011-other deputies in the jury box , only to rise again at the command of [the clerk]2301-the clerk , who began : " [Gentlemen of the jury]5015-gentlemen of the jury , have [you]5015-gentlemen of the jury agreed on a verdict?"—yet[2301-the clerk] without one of [them]3011-other deputies glancing in the direction of either [Belknap]323-belknap or [Jephson]320-jephson or [Clyde]197-clyde , which [Belknap]323-belknap at once interpreted as fatal .

" It 's all off , "[197-clyde] [he]197-clyde whispered to [Jephson]320-jephson . " Against [us]6127-we . [I]197-clyde can tell . "[197-clyde] And then [Lund]399-foster lund announcing : " [We]6127-we have . [We]6127-we find [the defendant]4999-the defendant guilty of murder in the first degree . "[399-foster lund] And [Clyde]197-clyde , entirely dazed and yet trying to keep [his]197-clyde poise and remain serene , gazing straight before [him]197-clyde toward the jury and beyond , and with scarcely a blink of the eye . For had [he]197-clyde not , in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell the night before , been told by [Jephson]320-jephson , who had found [him]197-clyde deeply depressed , that the verdict in this trial , assuming that it proved to be unfavorable , was of no consequence . The trial from start to finish had been unfair . Prejudice and bias had governed its every step . Such bullying and browbeating and innuendo as [Mason]209-mason had indulged in before [the jury]1953-the jury would never pass as fair or adequate in any higher court . And a new trial — on appeal — would certainly be granted — although by whom such an appeal was to be conducted [he]197-clyde was not now prepared to discuss .

And now , recalling that , [Clyde]197-clyde saying to [himself]197-clyde that it did not so much matter perhaps , after all . It could not , really — or could it ? Yet think what these words meant in case [he]197-clyde could not get a new trial ! Death ! That is what it would mean if this were final — and perhaps it was final . And then to sit in that chair [he]197-clyde had seen in [his]197-clyde mind 's eye for so long — these many days and nights when [he]197-clyde could not force [his]197-clyde mind to drive it away . Here it was again before [him]197-clyde — that dreadful , ghastly chair — only closer and larger than ever before — there in the very center of the space between [himself]197-clyde and [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer . [He]197-clyde could see it plainly now — squarish , heavy - armed , heavy - backed , some straps at the top and sides . God ! Supposing [no one]4176-no one would help [him]197-clyde now ! Even [the Griffiths]1291-the griffiths might not be willing to pay out any more money ! Think of that ! [The Court of Appeals to which [Jephson]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap had referred]3029-the court of appeals to which jephson and belknap had referred might not be willing to help [him]197-clyde either . And then these words would be final . [They]3030-they would ! [They]3030-they would ! [God]246-god ! [His]197-clyde jaws moved slightly , then set — because at the moment [he]197-clyde became conscious that they were moving . Besides , at that moment [Belknap]323-belknap was rising and asking for an individual poll of [the jury]1953-the jury , while [Jephson]320-jephson leaned over and whispered : " Do n't worry about it . It is n't final . [We]6129-we 'll get a reversal as sure as anything . "[320-jephson] Yet as [each of [the jurors]2617-the jurors]3032-each of the jurors was saying : " [Yes"—Clyde]400-yes"—clyde[3032-each of the jurors] was listening to [them]2617-the jurors , not to [Jephson]320-jephson . Why should [each one]3034-each one say that with so much emphasis ? Was there not one who felt that [he]197-clyde might not have done as [Mason]209-mason had said — struck [her]3035-her intentionally ? Was there [not one who even half - believed in that change of heart which [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson had insisted that [he]197-clyde had experienced]3036-not one who even half - believed in that change of heart which belknap and jephson had insisted that he had experienced ? [He]197-clyde looked at [them]2617-the jurors all — little and big . [They]2617-the jurors were like a blackish - brown group of wooden toys with creamish - brown or old ivory faces and hands . Then [he]197-clyde thought of [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother . [She]688-his mother would hear of this now , for here were [all these newspaper writers]3038-all these newspaper writers and [artists]2257-artists and [photographers]3019-photographers assembled to hear this . And what would [the Griffiths]1291-the griffiths — [[his]197-clyde uncle]821-his uncle and [Gilbert]359-gilbert — think now ? And [Sondra]238-sondra ! [Sondra]238-sondra ! Not a word from [her]688-his mother . And through all this [he]197-clyde had been openly testifying , as [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jcphson]401-jcphson had agreed that [he]197-clyde must do — to the compelling and directing power of [his]197-clyde passion for [her]688-his mother — the real reason for all this ! But not a word . And [she]688-his mother would not send [him]197-clyde any word now , of course — [she]688-his mother who had been going to marry [him]197-clyde and give [him]197-clyde everything !

But in the meantime [the crowd]1585-the crowd about [him]197-clyde silent although — or perhaps because — intensely satisfied . [The little devil]4678-the little devil had n't " gotten by . "[197-clyde] [He]197-clyde had n't fooled [the twelve sane men of [this county]600-this county]3045-the twelve sane men of this county with all that bunk about a change of heart . What rot ! While [Jephson]320-jephson sat and stared , and [Belknap]323-belknap , [his]323-belknap strong face written all over with contempt and defiance , making [his]323-belknap motions . And [Mason]209-mason and [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh and [Newcomb]181-earl newcomb and [Redmond]385-redmond thinly repressing [their]3047-their intense satisfaction behind masks preternaturally severe , the while [Belknap]323-belknap continued with a request that the sentence be put off until the following Friday — a week hence , when [he]197-clyde could more conveniently attend , but with [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer replying that [he]197-clyde thought not — unless some good reason could be shown . But on the morrow , if [counsel]3048-counsel desired , [he]197-clyde would listen to an argument . If it were satisfactory [he]197-clyde would delay sentence — otherwise , pronounce it the following Monday .

Yet , even so , [Clyde]197-clyde was not concerned with this argument at the moment . [He]197-clyde was thinking of [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother and what [she]688-his mother would think — feel . [He]197-clyde had been writing [her]688-his mother so regularly , insisting always that [he]197-clyde was innocent and that [she]688-his mother must not believe all , or even a part , of what [she]688-his mother read an the newspapers . [He]197-clyde was going to be acquitted sure . [He]197-clyde was going to go on the stand and testify for [himself]197-clyde . But now ... now ... oh , [he]197-clyde needed [her]688-his mother now — so much . Quite every one , as it seemed now , had forsaken [him]197-clyde . [He]197-clyde was terribly , terribly alone . And [he]197-clyde must send [her]688-his mother some word quickly . [He]197-clyde must . [He]197-clyde must . And then asking [Jephson]320-jephson for a piece of paper and a pencil , [he]197-clyde wrote : " [Mrs. Asa Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , care of Star of [Hope Mission]152-hope mission , [Denver]96-denver , [Colorado]153-colorado . [Dear mother]6130-dear mother — [I]197-clyde am convicted — [Clyde]197-clyde . "[197-clyde] And then handing that to [Jephson]320-jephson , [he]197-clyde asked [him]320-jephson , nervously and weakly , if [he]320-jephson would see that it was sent right away . " Right away , [son]6131-son , sure , "[320-jephson] replied [Jephson]320-jephson , touched by [his]320-jephson looks , and waving to [a press boy who was near]3050-a press boy who was near gave it to [him]320-jephson together with the money .

And then , while this was going on , all the public exits being locked until [Clyde]197-clyde , accompanied by [Sissel]283-sissel and [Kraut]290-kraut , had been ushered through [the familiar side entrance through which [he]197-clyde had hoped to escape]3051-the familiar side entrance through which he had hoped to escape . And while [all the press]3052-all the press and [the public]1815-the public and [the still - remaining jury]3054-the still - remaining jury gazing , for even yet [they]3055-they had not seen enough of [Clyde]197-clyde but must stare into [his]197-clyde face to see how [he]197-clyde was taking it . And because of the local feeling against [him]197-clyde , [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , at [Slack]287-slack 's request , holding [court]4347-court un - adjourned until word was brought that [Clyde]197-clyde was once more locked in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell , whereupon the doors were re - opened . And then [the crowd]1585-the crowd surging out but only to wait at [the courtroom]2232-the courtroom door in order to glimpse , as [he]197-clyde passed out , [Mason]209-mason , who now , of [all the figures in this case]3060-all the figures in this case , was [the true hero]3061-the true hero — [the nemesis of [Clyde]197-clyde]3062-the nemesis of clyde — [the avenger of [Roberta]195-roberta]3063-the avenger of roberta . That [he]209-mason not appearing at first but instead [Jephson]320-jephson and [Belknap]323-belknap together , and not so much depressed as solemn , defiant — [Jephson]320-jephson in particular , looking unconquerably contemptuous . Then [some one]796-some one calling : " Well , [you]320-jephson did n't get [him]197-clyde off just the same , "[796-some one] and [Jephson]320-jephson replying , with a shrug of [his]320-jephson shoulders , " Not yet , but [this county]600-this county is n't all of the law either . "[320-jephson] Then [Mason]209-mason , immediately afterward — a heavy , baggy overcoat thrown over [his]209-mason shoulder , [his]209-mason worn soft hat pulled low over [his]209-mason eyes — and followed by [Burleigh]211-burton burleigh , [Heit]192-heit , [Newcomb]181-earl newcomb and [others]1118-others as [a royal train]3066-a royal train — while [he]209-mason walked in the manner of one entirely oblivious of the meaning or compliment of [this waiting throng]3067-this waiting throng . For was [he]209-mason not now [a victor]3068-a victor and [an elected judge ! And as instantly being set upon by a circling , huzzahing mass]3069-an elected judge ! and as instantly being set upon by a circling , huzzahing mass — the while a score of those nearest sought to seize [him]209-mason by the hand or place a grateful pat upon [his]209-mason arm or shoulder . " Hurrah for [Orville]185-mason ! "[1585-the crowd] " Good for [you]6133-you , [Judge]1905-judge ! "[1585-the crowd] ( [his]209-mason new or fast - approaching title ) . " By [God]246-god ! "[1585-the crowd] " Three cheers for [Orville Mason]185-mason ! "[1585-the crowd] And with that [the crowd]1585-the crowd bursting into three resounding huzzahs — which [Clyde]197-clyde in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell could clearly hear and at the same time sense the meaning of .

[They]1585-the crowd were cheering [Mason]185-mason for convicting [him]185-mason . In [that large crowd out there]3072-that large crowd out there there was [not one who did not believe [him]185-mason totally and completely guilty]3073-not one who did not believe him totally and completely guilty . [Roberta]195-roberta — [her]195-roberta letters — [her]195-roberta determination to make [him]185-mason marry [her]195-roberta — [her]195-roberta giant fear of exposure — had dragged [him]185-mason down to this . To conviction . To death , maybe . Away from all [he]185-mason had longed for — away from all [he]185-mason had dreamed [he]185-mason might possess . And [Sondra]238-sondra ! [Sondra]238-sondra ! Not a word ! Not a word ! And so now , fearing that [Kraut]290-kraut or [Sissel]283-sissel or [some one]796-some one might be watching ( ready to report even now [his]185-mason every gesture ) , and not willing to show after all how totally collapsed and despondent [he]185-mason really was , [he]185-mason sat down and taking up a magazine pretended to read , the while [he]185-mason looked far , far beyond it to other scenes — [[his]185-mason mother]688-his mother — [[his]185-mason brother]2212-his brother and [sisters]2192-sisters — [the Griffiths]1291-the griffiths — all [he]185-mason had known . But finding these unsubstantiated mind visions a little too much , [he]185-mason finally got up and throwing off [his]185-mason clothes climbed into [his]185-mason iron cot .

" Convicted ! Convicted ! "[185-mason] And that meant that [he]185-mason must die ! [God]246-god ! But how blessed to be able to conceal [his]185-mason face upon a pillow and not let [any one]4181-any one see — however accurately [they]4181-any one might guess !

The dreary aftermath of a great contest and a great failure , with [the general public]2436-the general public from coast to coast — in view of this stern local interpretation of the tragedy — firmly convinced that [Clyde]197-clyde was guilty and , as heralded by the newspapers everywhere , that [he]197-clyde had been properly convicted . The pathos of [that poor little murdered country girl]3081-that poor little murdered country girl ! [Her]3081-that poor little murdered country girl sad letters ! How [she]3081-that poor little murdered country girl must have suffered ! That weak defense ! Even [the Griffiths of [Denver]96-denver]3082-the griffiths of denver were so shaken by the evidence as the trial had progressed that [they]3082-the griffiths of denver scarcely dared read the papers openly — one to the other — but , for the most part , read of it separately and alone , whispering together afterwards of the damning , awful deluge of circumstantial evidence . Yet , after reading [Belknap]323-belknap 's speech and [Clyde]197-clyde 's own testimony , [this little family group that had struggled along together for so long coming to believe in [[their]3083-this little family group that had struggled along together for so long coming to believe in their own son and brother in spite of all they had previously read against him own son]3084-their own son and [brother]4558-brother in spite of all [they]3083-this little family group that had struggled along together for so long coming to believe in their own son and brother in spite of all they had previously read against him had previously read against [him]197-clyde]3083-this little family group that had struggled along together for so long coming to believe in their own son and brother in spite of all they had previously read against him . And because of this — during the trial as well as afterwards — writing [him]197-clyde cheerful and hopeful letters , based frequently on letters from [him]197-clyde in which [he]197-clyde insisted over and over again that [he]197-clyde was not guilty . And because of this further aid to [Clyde]197-clyde absolutely refused . And [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson then sitting down together to consider . At the same time , as [Jephson]320-jephson pointed out , it was folly to assume that [the western Griffiths]1829-the western griffiths might not be able to do anything at all . And then [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , on [her]335-mrs. griffiths knees praying to [her]335-mrs. griffiths God to help [her]335-mrs. griffiths . [An assistant]3164-an assistant , into whose hands [he]3162-the managing editor would now deliver [her]335-mrs. griffiths would instruct [her]335-mrs. griffiths as to the method of preparing and filing [her]335-mrs. griffiths communications . [He]3162-the managing editor would also provide [her]335-mrs. griffiths with some ready cash . [She]335-mrs. griffiths might even leave tonight if [she]335-mrs. griffiths chose — the sooner , the better . The paper would like a photograph or two before [she]335-mrs. griffiths left . But as [he]3162-the managing editor talked , and as [he]3162-the managing editor noticed , [her]335-mrs. griffiths eyes were closed — [her]335-mrs. griffiths head back . [She]335-mrs. griffiths was offering thanks to the God who had thus directly answered [her]335-mrs. griffiths plea .

[Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg and [a slow train]3165-a slow train that set down [a tired , distrait woman at [[its]3165-a slow train depot]3167-its depot]3166-a tired , distrait woman at its depot after midnight on the eighth of December . Bitter cold and bright stars . [A lone depot assistant who on inquiry directed [her]335-mrs. griffiths to [the Bridgeburg Central House]3169-the bridgeburg central house]3168-a lone depot assistant who on inquiry directed her to the bridgeburg central house — straight up [the street]3170-the street which now faced [her]335-mrs. griffiths , then two blocks to [her]335-mrs. griffiths left after [she]335-mrs. griffiths reached [the second street]3171-the second street . [The sleepy night clerk of [the Central House]3173-the central house]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house providing [her]335-mrs. griffiths instantly with [a room]5495-a room and , once [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house knew who [she]335-mrs. griffiths was , directing [her]335-mrs. griffiths to [the county jail]1553-the county jail . But [she]335-mrs. griffiths deciding after due rumination that now was not the hour . [He]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house might be sleeping . [She]335-mrs. griffiths would go to bed and rise early in the morning . [She]335-mrs. griffiths had sent [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house various telegrams . [He]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house knew that [she]335-mrs. griffiths was coming .

But as early as seven in the morning , rising , and by eight appearing at [the jail]1580-the jail , letters , telegrams and credentials in hand . And [[the jail]1580-the jail officials]3178-the jail officials , after examining the letters [she]335-mrs. griffiths carried and being convinced of [her]335-mrs. griffiths identity , notifying [Clyde]197-clyde of [her]335-mrs. griffiths presence . And [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house , depressed and forlorn , on hearing this news , welcoming the thought of [her]335-mrs. griffiths as much as at first [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house had dreaded [her]335-mrs. griffiths coming . For now things were different . All the long grim story had been told . And because of the plausible explanation which [Jephson]320-jephson had provided [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house , [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house could face [her]335-mrs. griffiths perhaps and say without a quaver that it was true — that [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house had not plotted to kill [Roberta]195-roberta — that [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house had not willingly left [her]195-roberta to die in [the water]1009-the water . And then hurrying down to [[the visitor]3180-the visitor 's room]3181-the visitor 's room , where , by the courtesy of [Slack]287-slack , [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house was permitted to talk with [[his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house mother]688-his mother alone .

On seeing [her]335-mrs. griffiths rise at [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house entrance , and hurrying to [her]335-mrs. griffiths , [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house troubled intricate soul not a little dubious , yet confident also that it was to find sanctuary , sympathy , help , perhaps — and that without criticism — in [her]335-mrs. griffiths heart . And exclaiming with difficulty , as a lump thickened in [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house throat : " [Gee]406-gee , [Ma]407-ma ! [I]335-mrs. griffiths 'm glad [you]407-ma 've come . "[335-mrs. griffiths] But [she]335-mrs. griffiths too moved for words — [[her]335-mrs. griffiths condemned boy]3183-her condemned boy in [her]335-mrs. griffiths arms — merely drawing [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house head to [her]335-mrs. griffiths shoulder and then looking up . [The Lord God]246-god had vouchsafed [her]335-mrs. griffiths this much . Why not more ? The ultimate freedom of [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son — or if not that , at least a new trial — a fair consideration of the evidence in [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house favor which had not been had yet , of course . And so [they]3185-they stood for several moments .

Then news of [home]4141-home , the reason for [her]335-mrs. griffiths presence , [her]335-mrs. griffiths duty as [a correspondent]3163-a correspondent to interview [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house — later to appear with [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house in [court]4347-court at the hour of [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house sentence — a situation over which [Clyde]197-clyde winced . Yet now , as [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house heard from [her]335-mrs. griffiths , [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house future was likely to depend on [her]335-mrs. griffiths efforts alone . [The Lycurgus Griffiths]331-lycurgus , for reasons of [their]3185-they own , had decided not to aid [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house further . But [she]335-mrs. griffiths — if [she]335-mrs. griffiths were but able to face [the world]1694-the world with a sound claim — might still aid [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house . Had not [the Lord]3190-the lord aided [her]335-mrs. griffiths thus far ? Yet to face [the world]1694-the world and [the Lord]3114-the lord with [her]335-mrs. griffiths just one plea [she]335-mrs. griffiths must know from [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house — now — the truth as to whether [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house had intentionally or unintentionally struck [Roberta]195-roberta — whether intentionally or unintentionally [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house had left [her]195-roberta to die . [She]335-mrs. griffiths had read the evidence and [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house letters and had noted all the defects in [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house testimony . But were those things as contended by [Mason]185-mason true or false ?

[Clyde]197-clyde , now as always overawed and thrown back on [himself]197-clyde by that uncompromising and shameless honesty which [he]197-clyde had never been able quite to comprehend in [her]335-mrs. griffiths , announced , with all the firmness that [he]197-clyde could muster — yet with a secret quavering chill in [his]197-clyde heart — that [he]197-clyde had sworn to the truth . [He]197-clyde had not done those things with which [he]197-clyde had been charged . [He]197-clyde had not . But , alas , as [she]335-mrs. griffiths now said to [herself]335-mrs. griffiths , on observing [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house , what was that about [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house eyes — a faint flicker perhaps . [He]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house was not so sure — as self - convinced and definite as [she]335-mrs. griffiths had hoped — as [she]335-mrs. griffiths had prayed [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house would be . No , no , there was something in [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house manner , [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house words , as [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house spoke — a faint recessive intonation , a sense of something troubled , dubious , perhaps , which quite froze [her]335-mrs. griffiths now .

[He]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house was not positive enough . And so [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house might have plotted , in part at least , as [she]335-mrs. griffiths had feared at first , when [she]335-mrs. griffiths had first heard of this — might have even struck [her]335-mrs. griffiths on that lone , secret lake!—who could tell ? ( the searing , destroying power of such a thought as that ) . And that in the face of all [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house testimony to the contrary .

But " Jehovah , jirah , [Thou]6169-thou wilt not require of [a mother]5122-a mother , in [her]5122-a mother own and [[her]5122-a mother son]2096-her son 's darkest hour , that [she]5122-a mother doubt him,—make sure [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house death through [her]5122-a mother own lack of faith ? Oh , no — [Thou]6169-thou wilt not . [O Lamb of [God]246-god]6172-o lamb of god , [Thou]6169-thou wilt not ! "[335-mrs. griffiths] [She]335-mrs. griffiths turned ; [she]335-mrs. griffiths bruised under [her]335-mrs. griffiths heel the scaly head of this dark suspicion — as terrifying to [her]335-mrs. griffiths as [his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house guilt was to [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house . " O Absalom , [[my]335-mrs. griffiths Absalom]6173-my absalom ! "[335-mrs. griffiths] Come , come , [we]3193-we will not entertain such a thought .
