Was [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house not here — [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son — before [her]335-mrs. griffiths , declaring firmly that [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house had not done this thing . [She]335-mrs. griffiths must believe — [she]335-mrs. griffiths would believe [him]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house utterly . [She]335-mrs. griffiths would — and did — whatever fiend of doubt might still remain locked in the lowest dungeon of [her]335-mrs. griffiths miserable heart . Come , come , [the public]1815-the public should know how [she]335-mrs. griffiths felt . [She]335-mrs. griffiths and [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son would find a way . [He]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house must believe and pray . Did [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house have a Bible ? Did [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house read it ? And [Clyde]197-clyde having been long since provided with a Bible by [a prison worker]3199-a prison worker , assured [her]335-mrs. griffiths that [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house had and did read it .

But now [she]335-mrs. griffiths must go first to see [[his]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house lawyers]1736-his lawyers , next to file [her]335-mrs. griffiths dispatch , after which [she]335-mrs. griffiths would return . But once out on [the street]3170-the street being immediately set upon by [several reporters]2331-several reporters and eagerly questioned as to the meaning of [her]335-mrs. griffiths presence [here]4244-here . Did [she]335-mrs. griffiths believe in [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son 's innocence ? Did [she]335-mrs. griffiths or did [she]335-mrs. griffiths not think that [he]3172-the sleepy night clerk of the central house had had a fair trial ? Why had [she]335-mrs. griffiths not come on before ? And [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , in [her]335-mrs. griffiths direct and earnest and motherly way , taking [them]3205-they into [her]335-mrs. griffiths confidence and telling how as well as why [she]335-mrs. griffiths came to be [here]4244-here , also why [she]335-mrs. griffiths had not come before .

But now that [she]335-mrs. griffiths was [here]4244-here [she]335-mrs. griffiths hoped to stay . [The Lord]3114-the lord would provide the means for the salvation of [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son , of whose innocence [she]335-mrs. griffiths was convinced . Would [they]3205-they not ask [God]246-god to help [her]335-mrs. griffiths ? Would [they]3205-they not pray for [her]335-mrs. griffiths success ? And with [the several reporters]3210-the several reporters not a little moved and impressed , assuring [her]335-mrs. griffiths that [they]3205-they would , of course , and thereafter describing [her]335-mrs. griffiths to the world at large as [she]335-mrs. griffiths was — middle - aged , homely , religious , determined , sincere and earnest and with a moving faith in the innocence of [[her]335-mrs. griffiths boy]2109-her boy .

But [the Griffiths of Lycurgus]212-lycurgus , on hearing this , resenting [her]335-mrs. griffiths coming as one more blow . And [Clyde]197-clyde , in [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell , on reading of it later , somewhat shocked by the gross publicity now attending everything in connection with [him]197-clyde , yet , because of [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother 's presence , resigned and after a time almost happy . Whatever [her]335-mrs. griffiths faults or defects , after all [she]335-mrs. griffiths was [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , was n't [she]335-mrs. griffiths ? And [she]335-mrs. griffiths had come to [his]197-clyde aid . Let [the public]1815-the public think what it would . Was [he]197-clyde not in the shadow of death and [she]335-mrs. griffiths at least had not deserted [him]197-clyde . And with this , [her]335-mrs. griffiths suddenly manifested skill in connecting [herself]335-mrs. griffiths in this way with [a [Denver]96-denver paper]3216-a denver paper , to praise [her]335-mrs. griffiths for .

[She]335-mrs. griffiths had never done anything like this before . And who knew but that possibly , and even in the face of [her]335-mrs. griffiths dire poverty now , [she]335-mrs. griffiths might still be able to solve this matter of a new trial for [him]197-clyde and to save [his]197-clyde life ? Who knew ? And yet how much and how indifferently [he]197-clyde had sinned against [her]335-mrs. griffiths ! Oh , how much . And still here [she]335-mrs. griffiths was — [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother still anxious and tortured and yet loving and seeking to save [his]197-clyde life by writing up [his]197-clyde own conviction for a western paper . No longer did the shabby coat and the outlandish hat and the broad , immobile face and somewhat stolid and crude gestures seem the racking and disturbing things [they]3218-they had so little time since . [She]335-mrs. griffiths was [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother and [she]335-mrs. griffiths loved [him]197-clyde , and believed in [him]197-clyde and was struggling to save [him]197-clyde .

On the other hand [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson on first encountering [her]335-mrs. griffiths were by no means so much impressed . For some reason [they]3218-they had not anticipated so crude and unlettered and yet convinced [a figure]3220-a figure . The wide , flat shoes . The queer hat . The old brown coat . Yet somehow , after a few moments , arrested by [her]335-mrs. griffiths earnestness and faith and love for [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son and [her]335-mrs. griffiths fixed , inquiring , and humanly clean and pure blue eyes in which dwelt immaterial conviction and sacrifice with no shadow of turning .

Did [they]3218-they personally think [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son innocent ? [She]335-mrs. griffiths must know that first . Or did [they]3218-they secretly believe that [he]197-clyde was guilty ? [She]335-mrs. griffiths had been so tortured by all the contradictory evidence . [God]246-god had laid a heavy cross upon [her]335-mrs. griffiths and [hers]3223-hers . Nevertheless , Blessed be [His]197-clyde name ! And [both]2747-both , seeing and feeling [her]335-mrs. griffiths great concern , were quick to assure [her]335-mrs. griffiths that [they]2747-both were convinced of [Clyde]197-clyde 's innocence . If [he]197-clyde were executed for this alleged crime it would be a travesty on justice .

Yet both , now that [they]2747-both saw [her]335-mrs. griffiths , troubled as to the source of any further funds , [her]335-mrs. griffiths method of getting [here]4244-here , which [she]335-mrs. griffiths now explained , indicating that [she]335-mrs. griffiths had nothing . And an appeal sure to cost not less than two thousand . And [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , after an hour in [their]2747-both presence , in which [they]2747-both made clear to [her]335-mrs. griffiths the basic cost of an appeal — covering briefs to be prepared , arguments , trips to be made — asserting repeatedly that [she]335-mrs. griffiths did not quite see how [she]335-mrs. griffiths was to do . Then suddenly , and to [them]2747-both somewhat inconsequentially , yet movingly and dramatically , exclaiming : " [The Lord]3114-the lord will not desert [me]3227-an exhorter . [I]3227-an exhorter know it . [He]3114-the lord has declared [himself]3114-the lord unto [me]3227-an exhorter . It was [His]3114-the lord voice there in [Denver]96-denver that directed [me]3227-an exhorter to that paper . And now that [I]3227-an exhorter am here , [I]3227-an exhorter will trust [Him]3114-the lord and [He]3114-the lord will guide [me]3227-an exhorter . "[3227-an exhorter]

But [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson merely looking at [one another]3226-one another in unconvinced and pagan astonishment . Such faith ! [An exhorter]3227-an exhorter ! [An Evangelist]3228-an evangelist , no less ! Yet to [Jephson]320-jephson , here was an idea ! There was the religious element to be reckoned with everywhere — strong in its agreement with just such faith . Assuming [the Griffiths of [Lycurgus]212-lycurgus]3229-the griffiths of lycurgus to remain obdurate and unmoved — why then — why then — and now that [she]3230-she was here — there were [the churches]3231-the churches and [the religious people]3232-the religious people generally . Might it not be possible , with such a temperament and such faith as this , to appeal to the very element that had hitherto most condemned [Clyde]197-clyde and made [his]197-clyde conviction a certainty , for funds wherewith to carry this case to [the court of appeals]3233-the court of appeals ? [This lorn mother]3234-this lorn mother . [Her]3234-this lorn mother faith in [[her]3234-this lorn mother boy]2109-her boy .

Presto !

A lecture , at so much for admission , and in which , hard - pressed as [she]3234-this lorn mother was and could show , [she]3234-this lorn mother would set forth the righteousness of [[her]3234-this lorn mother boy]2109-her boy 's claim — seek to obtain the sympathy of [the prejudiced public]3237-the prejudiced public and incidentally two thousand dollars or more with which this appeal could be conducted .

And now [Jephson]320-jephson , turning to [her]3234-this lorn mother and laying the matter before [her]3234-this lorn mother and offering to prepare a lecture or notes — a condensation of [his]320-jephson various arguments — in fact , an entire lecture which [she]3234-this lorn mother could re - arrange and present as [she]3234-this lorn mother chose — all the data which was the ultimate , basic truth in regard to [[her]3234-this lorn mother son]2096-her son . And [she]3234-this lorn mother , [her]3234-this lorn mother brown cheeks flushing and [her]3234-this lorn mother eyes brightening , agreeing [she]3234-this lorn mother would do it . [She]3234-this lorn mother would try . [She]3234-this lorn mother could do no less than try . Verily , verily , was not this the Voice and Hand of [God]246-god in the darkest hour of [her]3234-this lorn mother tribulation ?

On the following morning [Clyde]197-clyde was arraigned for sentence , with [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths given a seat near [him]197-clyde and seeking , paper and pencil in hand , to make notes of , for [her]335-mrs. griffiths , an unutterable scene , while [a large crowd]3239-a large crowd surveyed [her]335-mrs. griffiths . [[His]197-clyde own mother]3240-his own mother ! And acting as [a reporter]3241-a reporter ! Something absurd , grotesque , insensitive , even ludicrous , about [such a family]3242-such a family and such a scene . And to think [the Griffiths of Lycurgus]212-lycurgus should be so immediately related to [them]3243-them .

Yet [Clyde]197-clyde sustained and heartened by [her]335-mrs. griffiths presence . For had [she]335-mrs. griffiths not returned to [the jail]1580-the jail the previous afternoon with [her]335-mrs. griffiths plan ? And as soon as this was over — whatever the sentence might be — [she]335-mrs. griffiths would begin with [her]335-mrs. griffiths work .

And so , and that almost in spite of [himself]197-clyde , in [his]197-clyde darkest hour , standing up before [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer and listening first to a brief recital of [his]197-clyde charge and trial ( which was pronounced by [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer to have been fair and impartial ) , then to the customary : " Have [you]197-clyde any cause which shows why the judgment of death should not now be pronounced against [you]197-clyde according to law ? "[197-clyde] — to which and to the astonishment of [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother and [the auditors]3246-the auditors ( if not [Jephson]320-jephson , who had advised and urged [him]197-clyde so to do ) , [Clyde]197-clyde now in a clear and firm voice replied :

" [I]197-clyde am innocent of the crime as charged in the indictment . [I]197-clyde never killed [Roberta Alden]195-roberta and therefore [I]197-clyde think this sentence should not be passed . "[197-clyde]

And then staring straight before [him]197-clyde conscious only of the look of admiration and love turned on [him]197-clyde by [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother . For had not [[her]688-his mother son]2096-her son now declared [himself]2096-her son , here at this fatal moment , before [all these people]2771-all these people ? And [his]2096-her son word here , if not in [that jail]5761-that jail , would be true , would it not ? Then [[her]688-his mother son]2096-her son was not guilty . [He]2096-her son was not . [He]2096-her son was not . Praised be the name of [the Lord in the highest]3252-the lord in the highest . And deciding to make a great point of this in [her]688-his mother dispatch — so as to get it in all the papers , and in [her]688-his mother lecture afterwards .

However , [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , without the faintest sign of surprise or perturbation , now continued : " Is there anything else [you]197-clyde care to say ? "[326-justice oberwaltzer]

" No , "[197-clyde] replied [Clyde]197-clyde , after a moment 's hesitation .

" [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , "[326-justice oberwaltzer] then concluded [Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer , " the judgment of [the Court]1991-the court is that [you]197-clyde , [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , for the murder in the first degree of one , [Roberta Alden]195-roberta , whereof [you]197-clyde are convicted , be , and [you]197-clyde are hereby sentenced to the punishment of death ; and it is ordered that , within ten days after this day 's session of Court , [the Sheriff of [this county of]6177-this county of [Cataraqui]341-cataraqui]6176-the sheriff of this county of cataraqui deliver [you]197-clyde , together with the warrant of [this Court]4996-this court , to [the Agent and Warden of [[the State]1663-the state Prison of [the State of New York]4997-the state of new york at [Auburn]159-auburn]158-the state prison of the state of new york at auburn]6179-the agent and warden of the state prison of the state of new york at auburn , where [you]197-clyde shall be kept in solitary confinement until the week beginning Monday the 28th day of January , 19 — , and , upon some day within the week so appointed , [the said Agent and Warden of [the State Prison of [the State of New York]4997-the state of new york at [Auburn]159-auburn]158-the state prison of the state of new york at auburn]6182-the said agent and warden of the state prison of the state of new york at auburn is commended to do execution upon [you]197-clyde , [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde , in the mode and manner prescribed by the laws of [the State of]4994-the state of [New York]63-new york . "[326-justice oberwaltzer]

And that done , a smile from [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths to [[her]335-mrs. griffiths boy]2109-her boy and an answering smile from [Clyde]197-clyde to [her]335-mrs. griffiths . For since [he]197-clyde had announced that [he]197-clyde was not guilty — here — [her]335-mrs. griffiths spirit had risen in the face of this sentence . [He]197-clyde was really innocent,—he must be , since [he]197-clyde had declared it here . And [Clyde]197-clyde because of [her]335-mrs. griffiths smile saying to [himself]197-clyde , [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother believed in [him]197-clyde now . [She]688-his mother had not been swayed by all the evidence against [him]197-clyde . And this faith , mistaken or not , was now so sustaining — so needed . What [he]197-clyde had just said was true as [he]197-clyde now saw it . [He]197-clyde had not struck [Roberta]195-roberta . That was true . And therefore [he]197-clyde was not guilty . Yet [Kraut]290-kraut and [Slack]287-slack were once more seizing [him]197-clyde and escorting [him]197-clyde to [the cell]3255-the cell .

Immediately thereafter [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother seating [herself]688-his mother at a press table proceeded to explain to [contiguous press representatives now curiously gathering about [her]688-his mother]3257-contiguous press representatives now curiously gathering about her : " [You]688-his mother must n't think too badly of [me]688-his mother , [[you]688-his mother gentlemen of the papers]6185-you gentlemen of the papers . [I]688-his mother do n't know much about this but it is the only way [I]688-his mother could think of to be with [[my]688-his mother boy]6136-my boy . [I]688-his mother could n't have come otherwise . "[688-his mother] And then [one lanky correspondent]3258-one lanky correspondent stepping up to say : " Do n't worry , [mother]2083-mother . Is there any way [I]3258-one lanky correspondent can help [you]2083-mother ? Want [me]3258-one lanky correspondent to straighten out what [you]2083-mother want to say ? [I]3258-one lanky correspondent 'll be glad to . "[3258-one lanky correspondent] And then sitting down beside [her]688-his mother and proceeding to help [her]688-his mother arrange [her]688-his mother impressions in the form in which [he]3258-one lanky correspondent assumed [her]688-his mother Denver paper might like them . And [others]1118-others as well offering to do anything [they]1118-others could — and all greatly moved .

Two days later , the proper commitment papers having been prepared and [[his]3258-one lanky correspondent mother]688-his mother notified of the change but not permitted to accompany [him]3258-one lanky correspondent , [Clyde]197-clyde was removed to [Auburn]159-auburn , [the Western penitentiary of [the State of New York]160-the state of new york]3261-the western penitentiary of the state of new york , where in [the " death house "]6188-the " death house "[197-clyde] or " [Murderers ' Row]161-murderers ' row , "[197-clyde] as it was called — as gloomy and torturesome an inferno as one could imagine [any human compelled to endure]3262-any human compelled to endure — a combination of some twenty - two cells on two separate levels — [he]197-clyde was to be restrained until ordered retried or executed .

Yet as [he]197-clyde traveled from [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg to [this place]1062-this place , impressive crowds at [every station]3264-every station — young and old — [men]2208-men , [women]2180-women and [children]1570-children — all seeking a glimpse of [the astonishingly youthly slayer]3268-the astonishingly youthly slayer . And [girls]1319-girls and [women]2180-women , under the guise of kindly interest , but which , at best , spelled little more than a desire to achieve a facile intimacy with this daring and romantic , if unfortunate figure , throwing [him]197-clyde a flower here and there and calling to [him]197-clyde gayly and loudly as [the train]4140-the train moved out from [one station]3272-one station or another :

" Hello , [Clyde]197-clyde ! Hope to see [you]197-clyde soon again . Do n't stay too long down there . "[197-clyde]

" If [you]197-clyde take an appeal , [you]197-clyde 're sure to be acquitted . [We]6189-we hope so , anyhow . "[197-clyde]

And with [Clyde]197-clyde not a little astonished and later even heartened by this seemingly favorable discrepancy between the attitude of [the crowds in [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]3273-the crowds in bridgeburg and this sudden , morbid , feverish and even hectic curiosity here , bowing and smiling and even waving with [his]197-clyde hand . Yet thinking , none the less , " [I]197-clyde am on the way to [the death house]6190-the death house and [they]3273-the crowds in bridgeburg can be so friendly . It is a wonder [they]3273-the crowds in bridgeburg dare . "[197-clyde] And with [Kraut]290-kraut and [Sissel]283-sissel , [[his]197-clyde guards]3274-his guards , because of the distinction and notoriety of being both [[his]197-clyde captors]3275-his captors and [jailors]3276-jailors , as well also because of these unusual attentions from [passengers]3277-passengers on [the train]4140-the train and [individuals in these throngs]3279-individuals in these throngs without being [themselves]3279-individuals in these throngs flattered and ennobled .

But after this one brief colorful flight in the open since [his]197-clyde arrest , past these waiting throngs and over winter sunlit fields and [hills of snow]3280-hills of snow that reminded [him]197-clyde of [Lycurgus]212-lycurgus , [Sondra]238-sondra , [Roberta]195-roberta , and all that [he]197-clyde had so kaleidoscopically and fatally known in the twenty months just past , the gray and restraining walls of [Auburn]159-auburn itself — with , once [he]197-clyde was presented to [a clerk in [[the warden]3282-the warden 's office]3283-the warden 's office]3281-a clerk in the warden 's office and [his]197-clyde name and crime entered in the books — [himself]197-clyde assigned to [two assistants]3284-two assistants , who saw to it that [he]197-clyde was given a prison bath and hair cut — all the wavy , black hair [he]197-clyde so much admired cut away — a prison - striped uniform and hideous cap of the same material , prison underwear and heavy gray felt shoes to quiet the restless prison tread in which in time [he]197-clyde might indulge , together with the number , 77221 .

And so accoutered , immediately transferred to [the death house proper]3285-the death house proper , where in [a cell on [the ground floor]3287-the ground floor [he]197-clyde was now locked — [a squarish light clean space]3288-a squarish light clean space , eight by ten feet in size and fitted with sanitary plumbing as well as a cot bed , a table , a chair and a small rack for books]3286-a cell on the ground floor he was now locked — a squarish light clean space , eight by ten feet in size and fitted with sanitary plumbing as well as a cot bed , a table , a chair and a small rack for books . And here then , while [he]197-clyde barely sensed that there were other cells about [him]197-clyde — ranging up and down [a wide hall]3289-a wide hall — [he]197-clyde first stood — and then seated [himself]197-clyde — now no longer buoyed by the more intimate and sociable life of [the jail at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]3290-the jail at bridgeburg — or those strange throngs and scenes that had punctuated [his]197-clyde trip [here]4244-here .

The hectic tensity and misery of these hours ! That sentence to die ; that trip with [all those people calling to [him]197-clyde]3292-all those people calling to him ; that cutting of [his]197-clyde hair [downstairs]1216-downstairs in [that prison barber shop]3294-that prison barber shop — and by [a convict]3295-a convict ; the suit and underwear that was now [his]197-clyde and that [he]197-clyde now had on . There was no mirror here — or anywhere,—but no matter — [he]197-clyde could feel how [he]197-clyde looked . This baggy coat and trousers and this striped cap . [He]197-clyde threw it hopelessly to the floor . For but an hour before [he]197-clyde had been clothed in a decent suit and shirt and tie and shoes , and [his]197-clyde appearance had been neat and pleasing as [he]197-clyde [himself]197-clyde had thought as [he]197-clyde left [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg . But now — how must [he]197-clyde look ? And to - morrow [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother would be coming — and later [Jephson]320-jephson or [Belknap]323-belknap , maybe . [God]246-god !

But worse — there , in [that cell directly opposite [him]197-clyde]3297-that cell directly opposite him , [a sallow and emaciated and sinister - looking Chinaman in a suit exactly like [his]197-clyde own , who had come to the bars of [his]197-clyde door and was looking at [him]197-clyde out of inscrutable slant eyes , but as immediately turning and scratching [himself]197-clyde]3298-a sallow and emaciated and sinister - looking chinaman in a suit exactly like his own , who had come to the bars of his door and was looking at him out of inscrutable slant eyes , but as immediately turning and scratching himself — vermin , maybe , as [Clyde]197-clyde immediately feared . There had been bedbugs at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg .

[A Chinese murderer]3299-a chinese murderer . For was not this [the death house]6190-the death house ? But as good as [himself]197-clyde [here]4244-here . And with a garb like [his]197-clyde own . Thank [God visitors]3302-god visitors were probably not many . [He]197-clyde had heard from [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother that scarcely any were allowed — that only [she]688-his mother and [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson and [any minister [he]197-clyde chose]3304-any minister he chose might come once a week . But now these hard , white - painted walls brightly lighted by wide unobstructed skylights by day and as [he]197-clyde could see — by incandescent lamps in [the hall]515-the hall without at night — yet all so different from [Bridgeburg,—so]162-bridgeburg,—so much more bright or harsh illuminatively . For there , [the jail]1580-the jail being old , the walls were a gray - brown , and not very clean — [the cells]3307-the cells larger , the furnishings more numerous — a table with a cloth on it at times , books , papers , a chess- and checker - board — whereas [here]4244-here — here was nothing , these hard narrow walls — the iron bars rising to a heavy solid ceiling above — and that very , very heavy iron door which yet — like the one at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg , had a small hole through which food would be passed , of course .

But just then a voice from somewhere :

" Hey ! [we]6191-we got a new one wid [us]6191-we , [fellers]6192-fellers ! [Ground tier , [second cell]6194-second cell , east]6193-ground tier , second cell , east . "[197-clyde] And then a second voice : " [You]6192-fellers do n't say . Wot 's [he]197-clyde like ? "[197-clyde] And a third : " Wot 's [yer]6192-fellers name , [new man]6195-new man ? Do n't be scared . [You]6192-fellers ai n't no worse off than [the rest of [us]6191-we]6196-the rest of us . "[197-clyde] And then the first voice , answering number two : " Kinda tall and skinny . [A kid]6197-a kid . Looks a little like [mamma 's boy]6198-mamma 's boy , but not bad at dat . Hey , [you]197-clyde ! Tell [us]6191-we [your]197-clyde name ! "[197-clyde]

And [Clyde]197-clyde , amazed and dumb and pondering . For how was one to take such an introduction as this ? What to say — what to do ? Should [he]197-clyde be friendly with [these men]4351-these men ? Yet , [his]197-clyde instinct for tact prompting [him]197-clyde even here to reply , most courteously and promptly : " [Clyde Griffiths]197-clyde . "[3310-the first voices] And one of [the first voices]3310-the first voices continuing : " Oh , sure ! [We]6191-we know who [you]197-clyde are . Welcome , [Griffiths]197-clyde . [We]6191-we ai n't as bad as [we]6191-we sound . [We]6191-we been readin ' a lot about [you]197-clyde , up dere in [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg . [We]6191-we thought [you]197-clyde 'd be along pretty soon now . "[3310-the first voices] And another voice : " [You]197-clyde do n't want to be too down . It ai n't so worse here . At least [de place]6199-de place is all right — a roof over [your]197-clyde head , as [dey]6191-we say . "[3310-the first voices] And then a laugh from somewhere .

But [Clyde]197-clyde , too horrified and sickened for words , was sadly gazing at the walls and door , then over at the Chinaman , who , silent at [his]197-clyde door , was once more gazing at [him]197-clyde . Horrible ! Horrible ! And [they]3311-they talked to [each other]871-each other like that , and to [a stranger among [them]3311-they so familiarly]3313-a stranger among them so familiarly . No thought for [his]197-clyde wretchedness , [his]197-clyde strangeness , [his]197-clyde timidity — the horror [he]197-clyde must be suffering . But why should [a murderer]1310-a murderer seem timid to [any one]4181-any one , perhaps , or miserable ? Worst of all [they]3311-they had been speculating here as to how long it would be before [he]197-clyde would be along which meant that everything concerning [him]197-clyde was known [here]4244-here . Would [they]3311-they nag — or bully — or make trouble for one unless [one]955-one did just as [they]3311-they wished ? If [Sondra]238-sondra , or [any one of [all the people [he]197-clyde had known]3319-all the people he had known]3318-any one of all the people he had known , should see or even dream of [him]197-clyde as [he]197-clyde was [here]4244-here now ... God!—And [[his]197-clyde own mother]3240-his own mother was coming to - morrow .

And then an hour later , now evening , [a tall , cadaverous guard in a more pleasing uniform , putting an iron tray with food on it through that hole in the door]3322-a tall , cadaverous guard in a more pleasing uniform , putting an iron tray with food on it through that hole in the door . Food ! And for [him]197-clyde here . And [that sallow , rickety Chinaman]3323-that sallow , rickety chinaman over the way taking [his]197-clyde . Whom had [he]197-clyde murdered ? How ? And then the savage scraping of iron trays in [the various cells]3324-the various cells ! Sounds that reminded [him]197-clyde more of hungry animals being fed than [men]2208-men . And [some of [these men]4351-these men]3326-some of these men were actually talking as [they]3326-some of these men ate and scraped . It sickened [him]197-clyde .

" [Gee]406-gee ! It 's a wonder [[them]4351-these men guys in [the mush gallery]6201-the mush gallery]6200-them guys in the mush gallery could n't think of somepin else besides cold beans and fried potatoes and coffee . "[3328-the first voice]

" The coffee tonight ... oh , [boy!]6202-boy! ... Now in [the jail at [Buffalo]92-buffalo]6203-the jail at buffalo — though ... "[3328-the first voice]

" Oh , cut it out , "[3328-the first voice] came from another corner . " [We]6204-we 've heard enough about [the jail at [Buffalo]92-buffalo]6203-the jail at buffalo and [your]6202-boy! swell chow . [You]6202-boy! do n't show any afternoon tea appetite around here , [I]3328-the first voice notice . "[3328-the first voice]

" Just the same , "[3328-the first voice] continued [the first voice]3328-the first voice , " as [I]3328-the first voice look back on't now , it musta been pretty good . Dat 's a way it seems , anyhow , now . "[3328-the first voice]

" Oh , [Rafferty]409-rafferty , do let up , "[3328-the first voice] called still another .

And then , presumably " [Rafferty]409-rafferty "[3328-the first voice] once more , who said : " Now , [I]3328-the first voice 'll just take a little siesta after dis — and den [I]3328-the first voice 'll call [me]3328-the first voice chauffeur and go for a little spin . De air to - night must be fine . "[3328-the first voice]

Then from still another hoarse voice : " Oh , [you]197-clyde with [your]197-clyde sick imagination . Say , [I]3328-the first voice 'd give [me]3328-the first voice life for [a smoker]6206-a smoker . And den a good game of cards . "[3328-the first voice]

" Do [they]6207-they play cards here ? "[197-clyde] thought [Clyde]197-clyde .

" [I]3328-the first voice suppose since [Rosenstein]410-rosenstein was defeated for [mayor]6208-mayor [here]4244-here [he]410-rosenstein wo n't play . "[3328-the first voice]

" Wo n't [he]410-rosenstein , though ? "[410-rosenstein] This presumably from [Rosenstein]410-rosenstein .

To [Clyde]197-clyde 's left , in [the cell next to [him]197-clyde]3329-the cell next to him , a voice , to [a passing guard]3330-a passing guard , low and yet distinctly audible : " Psst ! Any word from [Albany]28-albany yet ? "[3330-a passing guard]

" No word , [Herman]411-herman . "[3328-the first voice]

" And no letter , [I]3330-a passing guard suppose . "[3330-a passing guard]

" No letter . "[3328-the first voice]

The voice was very strained , very tense , very miserable , and after this , silence .

A moment later , from [another cell farther off]3331-another cell farther off , a voice from the lowest hell to which [a soul]3332-a soul can descend — complete and unutterable despair—"Oh , [[my]3330-a passing guard God]4257-my god ! Oh , [my]3330-a passing guard God ! Oh , [my]3330-a passing guard God ! "[3330-a passing guard]

And then from the tier above [another voice]3333-another voice : " Oh , [Jesus]412-christ ! Is that farmer going to begin again ? [I]3333-another voice ca n't stand it . Guard ! Guard ! Ca n't [you]412-christ get some dope for [that guy]6211-that guy ? "[3333-another voice]

Once more the voice from the lowest : " Oh , [[my]3333-another voice God]4257-my god ! Oh , [[my]3333-another voice God]4257-my god ! Oh , [[my]3333-another voice God]4257-my god ! "[3333-another voice]

[Clyde]197-clyde was up , [his]197-clyde fingers clinched . [His]197-clyde nerves were as taut as cords about to snap . [A murderer]1310-a murderer ! And about to die , perhaps . Or grieving over some terrible thing like [his]197-clyde own fate . Moaning — as [he]197-clyde in spirit at least had so often moaned there in [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg . Crying like that ! [God]246-god ! And there must be [others]1118-others !

And day after day and night after night more of this , no doubt , until , maybe — who could tell — unless . But , oh , no ! Oh , no ! Not [himself]197-clyde — not that — not [his]197-clyde day . Oh , no . A whole year must elapse before that could possibly happen — or so [Jephson]320-jephson had said . Maybe two . But , at that—! ... in two years ! ! ! [He]197-clyde found [himself]197-clyde stricken with an ague because of the thought that even in so brief a time as two years ...

[That other room]3336-that other room ! It was in [here]4244-here somewhere too . [This room]1131-this room was connected with [it]3336-that other room . [He]197-clyde knew that . There was a door . It led to that chair . That chair .

And then the voice again , as before , " Oh , [[my]197-clyde God]4257-my god ! Oh , [[my]197-clyde God]4257-my god ! "[197-clyde]

[He]197-clyde sank to [his]197-clyde couch and covered [his]197-clyde ears with [his]197-clyde hands .

[The " death house]6217-the " death house "[197-clyde] in [this particular prison]3339-this particular prison was one of those crass erections and maintenances of human insensitiveness and stupidity principally for which [no one]4176-no one primarily was really responsible . Indeed , its total plan and procedure were the results of a series of primary legislative enactments , followed by decisions and compulsions as devised by the temperaments and seeming necessities of [various wardens]3341-various wardens , until at last — by degrees and without anything worthy of the name of thinking on [any one]4181-any one 's part — there had been gathered and was now being enforced all that could possibly be imagined in the way of unnecessary and really unauthorized cruelty or stupid and destructive torture . And to the end that [a man , once condemned by a jury]3343-a man , once condemned by a jury , would be compelled to suffer not alone the death for which [his]3343-a man , once condemned by a jury sentence called , but [a thousand others before that]3344-a thousand others before that . For [the very room]3345-the very room by [its]3345-the very room arrangement , as well as the rules governing the lives and actions of [the inmates]3346-the inmates , was sufficient to bring about this torture , willy - nilly .

[It]3345-the very room was [a room thirty by fifty feet , of stone and concrete and steel , and surmounted some thirty feet from the floor by a skylight]3347-a room thirty by fifty feet , of stone and concrete and steel , and surmounted some thirty feet from the floor by a skylight . Presumably an improvement over [an older and worse death house]3348-an older and worse death house , with which [it]3345-the very room was still connected by a door , [it]3345-the very room was divided lengthwise by a broad passage , along which , on the ground floor , were [twelve cells , six on a side and eight by ten each and facing each other]3349-twelve cells , six on a side and eight by ten each and facing each other . And above again a second tier of what were known as [balcony cells]3350-balcony cells — five on a side .

There was , however , at the center of [this main passage]3351-this main passage — and dividing [these lower cells]3352-these lower cells equally as to number — a second and narrower passage , which at one end gave into what was now known as [the Old Death House]3353-the old death house ( where at present only visitors to [the inmates of [the new Death House]3355-the new death house]3354-the inmates of the new death house were received ) , and at the other into [the execution room in which stood the electric chair]3356-the execution room in which stood the electric chair . [Two of the cells on the lower passage]3357-two of the cells on the lower passage — those at the junction of [the narrower passage]3358-the narrower passage — faced [the execution - room]3359-the execution - room door . The two opposite these , on the corresponding corners , faced the passage that gave into [the Old Death House]3353-the old death house or what now by a large stretch of the imagination , could be called [[the condemned men]3361-the condemned men 's reception room]3362-the condemned men 's reception room , where twice weekly [an immediate relative]3363-an immediate relative or [a lawyer]3364-a lawyer might be met . But [no others]3365-no others .

In [the Old Death House]3353-the old death house ( or [present reception room]3367-present reception room ) , [the cells still there]3368-the cells still there , and an integral part of this reception plan , were all in a row and on one side only of [a corridor]3369-a corridor , thus preventing prying inspection by [one inmate of another]3370-one inmate of another , and with a wire screen in front as well as green shades which might be drawn in front of [each cell]3371-each cell . For , in an older day , whenever [a new convict]3372-a new convict arrived or departed , or took [his]3372-a new convict daily walk , or went for [his]3372-a new convict bath , or was led eventually through the little iron door to the west where formerly was [the execution chamber]3373-the execution chamber , these shades were drawn . [He]3372-a new convict was not supposed to be seen by [[his]3372-a new convict associates]3374-his associates . Yet [the old death house]3353-the old death house , because of this very courtesy and privacy , although intense solitude , was later deemed inhuman and hence [this newer and better death house]3376-this newer and better death house , as [the thoughtful and condescending authorities]3377-the thoughtful and condescending authorities saw it , was devised .

In this , to be sure , were [no such small and gloomy cells as those which characterized the old]3378-no such small and gloomy cells as those which characterized the old , for there the ceiling was low and the sanitary arrangements wretched , whereas in [the new one]3379-the new one the ceiling was high , [the rooms]3380-the rooms and [corridors]3381-corridors brightly lighted and in every instance no less than eight by ten feet in size . But by contrast with [the older room]3382-the older room , [they]3383-they had the enormous disadvantage of the unscreened if not uncurtained cell doors .

Besides , by housing all together in two such tiers as were here , it placed upon [each convict]3384-each convict the compulsion of enduring all the horrors of all the vicious , morbid or completely collapsed and despairing temperaments about [him]3384-each convict . No true privacy of any kind . By day — a blaze of light pouring through an over - arching skylight high above the walls . By night — glistening incandescents of large size and power which flooded each nook and cranny of [the various cells]3324-the various cells . No privacy , no games other than cards and checkers — the only ones playable without releasing [the prisoners]3386-the prisoners from [[their]3386-the prisoners cells]3387-their cells . Books , newspapers , to be sure , for [all who could read or enjoy them under the circumstances]3388-all who could read or enjoy them under the circumstances . And visits — mornings and afternoons , as a rule , from [a priest]3389-a priest , and less regularly from [a rabbi]3390-a rabbi and [a Protestant minister]3391-a protestant minister , each offering [his]3384-each convict sympathies or services to such as would accept [them]3383-they .

But the curse of [the place]4628-the place was not because of these advantages , such as they were , but in spite of them — this unremitted contact , as [any one]4181-any one could see , with [minds now terrorized and discolored by the thought of an approaching death that was so near for many that it was as an icy hand upon the brow]3394-minds now terrorized and discolored by the thought of an approaching death that was so near for many that it was as an icy hand upon the brow or shoulder . And none — whatever the bravado — capable of enduring it without mental or physical deterioration in some form . The glooms — the strains — the indefinable terrors and despairs that blew like winds or breaths about [this place]1062-this place and depressed or terrorized all by turns ! [They]3383-they were manifest at the most unexpected moments , by curses , sighs , tears even , calls for a song — for [God]246-god 's sake!—or the most unintended and unexpected yells or groans . Worse yet , and productive of perhaps the most grinding and destroying of all the miseries here — the transverse passage leading between [the old death house]3353-the old death house on the one hand and [the execution - chamber]3397-the execution - chamber on the other . For this from time to time — alas , how frequently — was the scene or stage for at least a part of the tragedy that was here so regularly enacted — the final business of execution .

For through this passage , on [his]3384-each convict last day , [a man]4220-a man was transferred from [[his]3384-each convict better cell]3399-his better cell in [the new building]3400-the new building , where [he]3384-each convict might have been incarcerated for so much as a year or two , to [one of [the older ones in [the old death house]3353-the old death house]3402-the older ones in the old death house]3401-one of the older ones in the old death house , in order that [he]3384-each convict might spend [his]3384-each convict last hours in solitude , although compelled at the final moment , none - the - less ( the death march ) , to retrace [his]3384-each convict steps along [this narrower cross passage]3404-this narrower cross passage — and where all might see — into [the execution chamber at the other end of [it]3404-this narrower cross passage]3405-the execution chamber at the other end of it .

Also at any time , in going to visit [a lawyer]3364-a lawyer or relative brought into [the old death house]3353-the old death house for this purpose , it was necessary to pass along [the middle passage]3408-the middle passage to [this smaller one]3409-this smaller one and so into [the old death house]3353-the old death house , there to be housed in [a cell]3411-a cell , fronted by a wire screen two feet distant , between which and [the cell]3255-the cell proper [a guard]3413-a guard must sit while [a prisoner]3414-a prisoner and [[his]3414-a prisoner guest]3415-his guest ( [wife]586-wife , [son]6131-son , [mother]2083-mother , [daughter]798-daughter , [brother]4558-brother , [lawyer]1730-lawyer ) should converse — [the guard]3422-the guard hearing all . No hand - clasps , no kisses , no friendly touches of any kind — not even an intimate word that [a listening guard]3423-a listening guard might not hear . And when the fatal hour for [any one]4181-any one had at last arrived , [every prisoner]3425-every prisoner — if sinister or simple , sensitive or of rugged texture — was actually if not intentionally compelled to hear if not witness the final preparations — the removal of [the condemned man]3426-the condemned man to one of [the cells of [the older death house]3428-the older death house]3427-the cells of the older death house , the final and perhaps weeping visit of [a mother]5122-a mother , [son]6131-son , [daughter]798-daughter , [father]829-father .

No thought in either the planning or the practice of all this of the unnecessary and unfair torture for [those who were brought here , not to be promptly executed , by any means , but rather to be held until the higher courts]3433-those who were brought here , not to be promptly executed , by any means , but rather to be held until the higher courts should have passed upon the merits of [their]3434-their cases — an appeal .

At first , of course , [Clyde]197-clyde sensed little if anything of all this . In so far as [his]197-clyde first day was concerned , [he]197-clyde had but tasted the veriest spoonful of it all . And to lighten or darken [his]197-clyde burden [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother came at noon the very next day . Not having been permitted to accompany [him]197-clyde , [she]688-his mother had waited over for a final conference with [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , as well as to write in full [her]688-his mother personal impressions in connection with [[her]688-his mother son]2096-her son 's departure — ( Those nervously searing impressions ! ) And although anxious to find [a room somewhere near [the penitentiary]3438-the penitentiary]3437-a room somewhere near the penitentiary , [she]688-his mother hurried first to [the office of [the penitentiary]3438-the penitentiary]3439-the office of the penitentiary immediately upon [her]688-his mother arrival at [Auburn]159-auburn and , after presenting an order from [Justice Oberwaltzer]326-justice oberwaltzer as well as a solicitous letter from [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson urging the courtesy of a private interview with [Clyde]197-clyde to begin with at least , [she]688-his mother was permitted to see [[her]688-his mother son]2096-her son in [a room entirely apart from [the old death house]3353-the old death house]3442-a room entirely apart from the old death house . For already [the warden]3282-the warden [himself]3282-the warden had been reading of [her]688-his mother activities and sacrifices and was interested in seeing not only [her]688-his mother but [Clyde]197-clyde also .

But so shaken was [she]688-his mother by [Clyde]197-clyde 's so sudden and amazingly changed appearance here that [she]688-his mother could scarcely speak upon [his]197-clyde entrance , even in recognition of [him]197-clyde , so blanched and gray were [his]197-clyde cheeks and so shadowy and strained [his]197-clyde eyes . [His]197-clyde head clipped that way ! This uniform ! And in this dreadful place of iron gates and locks and [long passages]3445-long passages with [uniformed guards]3446-uniformed guards at every turn !

For a moment [she]688-his mother winced and trembled , quite faint under the strain , although previous to this [she]688-his mother had entered [many [a jail]3448-a jail and larger prison]3447-many a jail and larger prison — in [Kansas City]45-kansas city , [Chicago]43-chicago , [Denver]96-denver — and delivered tracts and exhortations and proffered [her]688-his mother services in connection with anything [she]688-his mother might do . But this — this ! [[Her]688-his mother own son]3449-her own son ! [Her]688-his mother broad , strong bosom began to heave . [She]688-his mother looked , and then turned [her]688-his mother heavy , broad back to hide [her]688-his mother face for the nonce . [Her]688-his mother lips and chin quivered . [She]688-his mother began to fumble in the small bag [she]688-his mother carried for [her]688-his mother handkerchief at the same time that [she]688-his mother was muttering to [herself]688-his mother : " [[My]688-his mother God]4257-my god — why hast [Thou]6219-thou forsaken [me]688-his mother ? "[688-his mother] But even as [she]688-his mother did so there came the thought — no , no , [he]3449-her own son must not see [her]688-his mother so . What a way was this to do — and by [her]688-his mother tears weaken [him]3449-her own son . And yet despite [her]688-his mother great strength [she]688-his mother could not now cease at once but cried on .

And [Clyde]197-clyde seeing this , and despite [his]197-clyde previous determination to bear up and say some comforting and heartening word to [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , now began :

" But [you]688-his mother must n't , [Ma]407-ma . [Gee]406-gee , [you]688-his mother must n't cry . [I]197-clyde know it 's hard on [you]688-his mother . But [I]197-clyde 'll be all right . Sure [I]197-clyde will . It is n't as bad as [I]197-clyde thought . "[197-clyde] Yet inwardly saying : " Oh , [God]246-god how bad ! "[197-clyde]

And [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths adding aloud : " [[My]335-mrs. griffiths poor boy]5538-my poor boy ! [[My]335-mrs. griffiths beloved son]6221-my beloved son ! But [we]6222-we must n't give way . No . No . ' Behold [I]335-mrs. griffiths will deliver [thee]688-his mother out of the snares of the wicked . ' [God]246-god has not deserted either of [us]6222-we . And [He]246-god will not — that [I]335-mrs. griffiths know . ' [He]246-god leadeth [me]335-mrs. griffiths by [the still waters]4954-the still waters . ' ' [He]246-god restoreth [my]335-mrs. griffiths soul . ' [We]6222-we must put [our]6222-we trust in [Him]246-god . Besides , "[335-mrs. griffiths] [she]335-mrs. griffiths added , briskly and practically , as much to strengthen [herself]335-mrs. griffiths as [Clyde]197-clyde , " have n't [I]335-mrs. griffiths already arranged for an appeal ? It is to be made yet this week . [They]6222-we 're going to file a notice . And that means that [your]246-god case ca n't even be considered under a year . But it is just the shock of seeing [you]246-god so . [You]246-god see , [I]335-mrs. griffiths was n't quite prepared for it . "[335-mrs. griffiths] [She]335-mrs. griffiths straightened [her]335-mrs. griffiths shoulders and now looked up and achieved a brave if strained smile . " [The warden]3282-the warden [here]4244-here seems very kind , but still , somehow , when [I]335-mrs. griffiths saw [you]197-clyde just now — "[335-mrs. griffiths]

[She]335-mrs. griffiths dabbed at [her]335-mrs. griffiths eyes which were damp from this sudden and terrific storm , and to divert [herself]335-mrs. griffiths as well as [him]197-clyde [she]335-mrs. griffiths talked of the so very necessary work before [her]335-mrs. griffiths . [Messrs. Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson had been so encouraging to [her]335-mrs. griffiths just before [she]335-mrs. griffiths left . [She]335-mrs. griffiths had gone to [[their]3451-their office]3452-their office and [they]3451-their had urged [her]335-mrs. griffiths and [him]197-clyde to be of good cheer . And now [she]335-mrs. griffiths was going to lecture , and at once , and would soon have means to do with that way . Oh , yes . And [Mr. Jephson]320-jephson would be down to see [him]197-clyde one of these days soon . [He]197-clyde was by no means to feel that the legal end of all this had been reached . Far from it . The recent verdict and sentence was sure to be reversed and a new trial ordered . The recent one was a farce , as [he]197-clyde knew .

And as for [herself]335-mrs. griffiths — as soon as [she]335-mrs. griffiths found [a room near [the prison]3012-the prison]3453-a room near the prison — [she]335-mrs. griffiths was going to [the principal ministers of [Auburn]159-auburn]3455-the principal ministers of auburn and see if [she]335-mrs. griffiths could not secure [a church]3456-a church , or two , or three , in which to speak and plead [his]197-clyde cause . [Mr. Jephson]320-jephson was mailing [her]335-mrs. griffiths some information [she]335-mrs. griffiths could use within a day or two . And after that , [other churches in [Syracuse]119-syracuse]3457-other churches in syracuse , [Rochester]93-rochester , [Albany]28-albany , [Schenectady]121-schenectady — in fact [many cities in [the east]1130-the east]3458-many cities in the east — until [she]335-mrs. griffiths had raised the necessary sum . But [she]335-mrs. griffiths would not neglect [him]197-clyde . [She]335-mrs. griffiths would see [him]197-clyde at least once a week and would write [him]197-clyde a letter every other day , or maybe even daily if [she]335-mrs. griffiths could . [She]335-mrs. griffiths would talk to [the warden]3282-the warden . So [he]197-clyde must not despair . [She]335-mrs. griffiths had much hard work ahead of [her]335-mrs. griffiths , of course , but [the Lord]3114-the lord would guide [her]335-mrs. griffiths in all that [she]335-mrs. griffiths undertook . [She]335-mrs. griffiths knew that . Had [He]197-clyde not already shown [his]197-clyde gracious and miraculous mercy ?

[Clyde]197-clyde must pray for [her]335-mrs. griffiths and for [himself]197-clyde . Read [Isaiah]413-isaiah . Read the psalms — the 23rd and the 51st and 91st daily . Also Habbakuk . " Are there walls against the Hand of [the Lord]3114-the lord ? "[335-mrs. griffiths] And then after more tears , an utterly moving and macerating scene , at last achieving [her]335-mrs. griffiths departure while [Clyde]197-clyde , shaken to [his]197-clyde soul by so much misery , returned to [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell . [[His]197-clyde mother]688-his mother . And at [her]688-his mother age — and with so little money — [she]688-his mother was going out to try to raise the money necessary to save [him]197-clyde . And in the past [he]197-clyde had treated [her]688-his mother so badly — as [he]197-clyde now saw .

[He]197-clyde sat down on the side of [his]197-clyde cot and held [his]197-clyde head in [his]197-clyde hands the while outside [the prison]3012-the prison — the iron door of the same closed and only [a lonely room]3465-a lonely room and the ordeal of [her]688-his mother proposed lecture tour ahead of [her]688-his mother — [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths paused — by no means so assured or convinced of all [she]688-his mother had said to [Clyde]197-clyde . To be sure [God]246-god would aid [her]688-his mother . [He]197-clyde must . Had [He]197-clyde ever failed [her]688-his mother yet — completely ? And now — herein [her]688-his mother darkest hour , [[her]688-his mother son]2096-her son 's ! Would [He]197-clyde ?

[She]335-mrs. griffiths paused for a moment a little later in [a small parking - place , beyond [the prison]3012-the prison]3467-a small parking - place , beyond the prison , to stare at the tall , gray walls , the watch towers with [armed guards in uniform]3469-armed guards in uniform , the barred windows and doors . [A penitentiary]3470-a penitentiary . And [[her]688-his mother son]2096-her son was now within — worse yet , in [that confined and narrow death house]3472-that confined and narrow death house . And doomed to die in an electric chair . Unless — unless — But , no , no — that should not be . It could not be . That appeal . The money for it . [She]335-mrs. griffiths must busy [herself]335-mrs. griffiths as to that at once — not think or brood or despair . Oh , no . " [My]335-mrs. griffiths shield and [my]335-mrs. griffiths buckler . "[335-mrs. griffiths] " [My]335-mrs. griffiths Light and [my]335-mrs. griffiths Strength . "[335-mrs. griffiths] " Oh , [Lord]6227-lord , [Thou]6228-thou art [my]335-mrs. griffiths strength and [my]335-mrs. griffiths deliverance . In [Thee]6228-thou will [I]335-mrs. griffiths trust . "[335-mrs. griffiths] And then dabbing at [her]335-mrs. griffiths eyes once more and adding : " Oh , [Lord]6229-lord , [I]335-mrs. griffiths believe . Help [Thou]6228-thou [mine]335-mrs. griffiths unbelief . "[335-mrs. griffiths]

So [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , alternately praying and crying as [she]335-mrs. griffiths walked .

But after this the long days in [prison]4800-prison for [Clyde]197-clyde . Except for a weekly visit from [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , who , once [she]688-his mother was entered upon [her]688-his mother work , found it difficult to see [him]197-clyde more often than that — traveling as [she]688-his mother did in the next two months between [Albany]28-albany and [Buffalo]92-buffalo and even [New York City]90-new york city — but without the success [she]688-his mother had at first hoped for . For in the matter of [her]688-his mother appeal to [the churches]3231-the churches and [the public]1815-the public — as most wearily ( and in secret if not to [Clyde)—and]414-clyde)—and after three weeks of more or less regional and purely sectarian trying , [she]688-his mother was compelled to report [the Christians]3477-the christians at least were very indifferent — not as Christian as [they]3477-the christians should be . For as all , but more particularly [the ministers of [the region]1359-the region]3478-the ministers of the region , since [they]3478-the ministers of the region most guardedly and reservedly represented [[their]3478-the ministers of the region congregations]3480-their congregations in every instance , unanimously saw it , here was a notorious and , of course , most unsavory trial which had resulted in a conviction with which the more conservative element of [the country]635-the country — if [one]955-one could judge by the papers at least , were in agreement .

Besides who was [this woman]4170-this woman — as well as [[her]4170-this woman son]2096-her son ? [An exhorter]3227-an exhorter — [a secret preacher]3486-a secret preacher — one , who in defiance [of all the tenets and processes of organized and historic , as well as hieratic , religious powers and forms]3487-of all the tenets and processes of organized and historic , as well as hieratic , religious powers and forms ( [theological seminaries]3488-theological seminaries , [organized churches]3489-organized churches and [their]3489-organized churches affiliations and product — all carefully and advisedly and legitimately because historically and dogmatically interpreting the word of [God]246-god ) choosing to walk forth and without ordination after any fashion conduct an unauthorized and hence nondescript mission . Besides if [she]688-his mother had remained at [home]4141-home , as [a good mother]3491-a good mother should , and devoted [herself]688-his mother to [[her]4170-this woman son]2096-her son , as well as to [[her]4170-this woman other children]2106-her other children — [their]2106-her other children care and education — would this — have happened ?

And not only that — but according to [Clyde]197-clyde 's own testimony in this trial , had [he]197-clyde not been guilty of adultery with [this girl]818-this girl — whether [he]197-clyde had slain [her]818-this girl or not ? A sin almost equal to murder in many minds . Had [he]197-clyde not confessed it ? And was an appeal for [a convicted adulterer — if not murderer ( who could tell as to that ? ) to be made]3495-a convicted adulterer — if not murderer ( who could tell as to that ? ) to be made in [a church]3456-a church ? No,—no [Christian church]3497-christian church was the place to debate , and for a charge , the merits of this case , however much [each Christian of each and every church]3498-each christian of each and every church might sympathize with [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths personally — or resent any legal injustice that might have been done [[her]4170-this woman son]2096-her son . No , no . It was not morally advisable . It might even tend to implant in the minds of [the young]3500-the young some of the details of the crime .

Besides , because of what the newspapers had said of [her]4170-this woman coming [east]3501-east to aid [[her]4170-this woman son]2096-her son and the picture that [she]4170-this woman [herself]4170-this woman presented in [her]4170-this woman homely garb , it was assumed by [most ministers]3503-most ministers that [she]4170-this woman was one of [those erratic persons]3504-those erratic persons , [not a constituent of any definite sect]3505-not a constituent of any definite sect , or schooled theology , who tended by [her]4170-this woman very appearance to cast contempt on true and pure religion .

And in consequence , each in turn — not hardening [his]3506-his heart exactly — but thinking twice — and deciding no — there must be some better way — less troublesome to [Christians,—a public hall]3507-christians,—a public hall , perhaps , to which [Christians]3508-christians , if properly appealed to through the press , might well repair . And so [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , in all but one instance , rejected in that fashion and told to go elsewhere — while in regard to [the Catholics]3509-the catholics — instinctively — because of prejudice — as well as a certain dull wisdom not inconsistent with the facts — [she]335-mrs. griffiths failed even to so much as think of them . The mercies of [Christ]412-christ as interpreted by [the holder of the sacred keys of St. Peter]3510-the holder of the sacred keys of st. peter , as [she]335-mrs. griffiths knew , were not for [those who failed to acknowledge the authority of [the Vicar of Christ]3512-the vicar of christ]3511-those who failed to acknowledge the authority of the vicar of christ .

And therefore after many days spent in futile knockings here and there [she]335-mrs. griffiths was at last compelled — and in no little depression , to appeal to [a Jew who controlled [the principal moving picture theater of [Utica]30-utica]3514-the principal moving picture theater of utica]3513-a jew who controlled the principal moving picture theater of utica — [a sinful theater]3515-a sinful theater . And from [him]3513-a jew who controlled the principal moving picture theater of utica , this [she]335-mrs. griffiths secured free for a morning address on the merits of [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son 's case—"A [mother]2083-mother 's appeal for [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son , "[3513-a jew who controlled the principal moving picture theater of utica] it was entitled — which netted [her]335-mrs. griffiths , at twenty - five cents per person — the amazing sum of two hundred dollars . At first this sum , small as it was , so heartened [her]335-mrs. griffiths that [she]335-mrs. griffiths was now convinced that soon — whatever the attitude of [the orthodox Christians]3517-the orthodox christians — [she]335-mrs. griffiths would earn enough for [Clyde]197-clyde 's appeal . It might take time — but [she]335-mrs. griffiths would .

Nevertheless , as [she]335-mrs. griffiths soon discovered , there were other factors to be considered — carfare , [her]335-mrs. griffiths own personal expenses in [Utica]30-utica and elsewhere , to say nothing of certain very necessary sums to be sent to [Denver]96-denver to [[her]335-mrs. griffiths husband , who had little or nothing to go on at present , and who , because of this very great tragedy in [the family]964-the family]3518-her husband , who had little or nothing to go on at present , and who , because of this very great tragedy in the family , had been made ill — so ill indeed that the letters from [Frank]249-frank and [Julia]251-julia were becoming very disturbing . It was possible that [he]2096-her son might not get well at all . Some help was necessary there .

And in consequence , in addition to paying [her]335-mrs. griffiths own expenses here , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths was literally compelled to deduct other reducing sums from this , [her]335-mrs. griffiths present and only source of income . It was terrible — considering [Clyde]197-clyde 's predicament — but nevertheless must [she]335-mrs. griffiths not sustain [herself]335-mrs. griffiths in every way in order to win to victory ? [She]335-mrs. griffiths could not reasonably abandon [[her]335-mrs. griffiths husband]831-her husband in order to aid [Clyde]197-clyde alone .

Yet in the face of this — as time went on , the audiences growing smaller and smaller until at last [they]3521-they constituted little more than a handful — and barely paying [her]335-mrs. griffiths expenses — although through this process none - the - less [she]335-mrs. griffiths finally managed to put aside — over and above all [her]335-mrs. griffiths expenses — eleven hundred dollars .

Yet , also , just at this time , and in a moment of extreme anxiety , [Frank]249-frank and [Julia]251-julia wiring [her]335-mrs. griffiths that if [she]335-mrs. griffiths desired to see [Asa]335-mrs. griffiths again [she]335-mrs. griffiths had better come [home]4141-home at once . [He]197-clyde was exceedingly low and not expected to live . Whereupon , played upon by these several difficulties and there being no single thing other than to visit [him]197-clyde once or twice a week — as [her]335-mrs. griffiths engagements permitted — which [she]335-mrs. griffiths could do for [Clyde]197-clyde , [she]335-mrs. griffiths now hastily conferred with [Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson , setting forth [her]335-mrs. griffiths extreme difficulties .

And these , seeing that eleven hundred dollars of all [she]335-mrs. griffiths had thus far collected was to be turned over to [them]3523-them , now , in a burst of humanity , advised [her]335-mrs. griffiths to return to [[her]335-mrs. griffiths husband]831-her husband . [Decidedly Clyde]197-clyde would do well enough for the present seeing that there was an entire year — or at least ten months before it was necessary to file the record and the briefs in the case . In addition another year assuredly must elapse before a decision could be reached . And no doubt before that time the additional part of the appeal fee could be raised . Or , if not — well , then — anyhow ( seeing how worn and distrait [she]335-mrs. griffiths was at this time ) [she]335-mrs. griffiths need not worry . [Messrs. Belknap]324-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson would see to it that [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son 's interests were properly protected . [They]3523-them would file an appeal and make an argument — and do whatever else was necessary to insure [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son a fair hearing at the proper time .

And with that great burden off [her]335-mrs. griffiths mind — and two last visits to [Clyde]197-clyde in which [she]335-mrs. griffiths assured [him]197-clyde of [her]335-mrs. griffiths determination to return as speedily as possible — once [Asa]335-mrs. griffiths was restored to strength again and [she]335-mrs. griffiths could see [her]335-mrs. griffiths way to financing such a return — [she]335-mrs. griffiths now departed only to find that , once [she]335-mrs. griffiths was in [Denver]96-denver once more , it was not so easy to restore [him]197-clyde by any means .

And in the meantime [Clyde]197-clyde was left to cogitate on and make the best of a world that at its best was a kind of inferno of mental ills — above which — as above [Dante]415-dante 's might have been written—"abandon hope — [ye]6232-ye who enter here . "[415-dante]

The somberness of it . Its slow and yet searing psychic force ! The obvious terror and depression — constant and unshakeable of [those who , in spite of all [their]3527-those who , in spite of all their courage or their fears , their bravado or their real indifference ( there were even those courage or [their]3527-those who , in spite of all their courage or their fears , their bravado or their real indifference ( there were even those fears , [their]3527-those who , in spite of all their courage or their fears , their bravado or their real indifference ( there were even those bravado or [their]3527-those who , in spite of all their courage or their fears , their bravado or their real indifference ( there were even those real indifference ( there were even those]3527-those who , in spite of all their courage or their fears , their bravado or their real indifference ( there were even those ) were still compelled to think and wait . For , now , in connection with this coldest and bitterest form of prison life [he]197-clyde was in constant psychic , if not physical contact , with [twenty other convicted characters of varying temperaments and nationalities]3528-twenty other convicted characters of varying temperaments and nationalities , [each one of whom , like [himself]197-clyde , had responded to some heat or lust or misery of [his]197-clyde nature or [his]197-clyde circumstances]3529-each one of whom , like himself , had responded to some heat or lust or misery of his nature or his circumstances . And with murder , a mental as well as physical explosion , as the final outcome or concluding episode which , being detected , and after what horrors and wearinesses of mental as well as legal contest and failure , such as fairly paralleled [his]197-clyde own , now found [themselves]3530-themselves islanded — immured — in one or another of [these twenty - two iron cages]3531-these twenty - two iron cages and awaiting — awaiting what ?

How well [they]3530-themselves knew . And how well [he]197-clyde knew . And here with what loud public rages and despairs or prayers — at times . At [others]1118-others — what curses — foal or coarse jests — or tales addressed to all — or ribald laughter — or sighings and groanings in these later hours when the straining spirit having struggled to silence , there was supposedly rest for the body and the spirit .

In [an exercise court]3533-an exercise court , beyond the farthermost end of [the long corridor]3534-the long corridor , twice daily , for a few minutes each time , between the hours of ten and five — [the various inmates in groups of five or six]3535-the various inmates in groups of five or six were led forth — to breathe , to walk , to practice calisthenics — or run and leap as [they]3535-the various inmates in groups of five or six chose . But always under the watchful eyes of [sufficient guards]3536-sufficient guards to master [them]3535-the various inmates in groups of five or six in case [they]3535-the various inmates in groups of five or six attempted rebellion in any form . And to this it was , beginning with the second day , that [Clyde]197-clyde [himself]197-clyde was led , now with one set of [men]2208-men and now with another . But with the feeling at first strong in [him]197-clyde that [he]197-clyde could not share in any of these public activities which , nevertheless , [these others]1155-these others — and in spite of [their]1155-these others impending doom — seemed willing enough to indulge in .

[The two dark - eyed sinister - looking Italians]3539-the two dark - eyed sinister - looking italians , [one of whom had slain [a girl]4540-a girl because [she]4540-a girl would not marry [him]197-clyde]3540-one of whom had slain a girl because she would not marry him ; [the other who had robbed and then slain and attempted to burn the body of [[his]197-clyde father - in - law]3543-his father - in - law in order to get money for [himself]197-clyde and [[his]197-clyde wife]494-his wife]3542-the other who had robbed and then slain and attempted to burn the body of his father - in - law in order to get money for himself and his wife ! [Again Miller Nicholson]418-nicholson , [a lawyer of Buffalo of perhaps forty years of age]3560-a lawyer of buffalo of perhaps forty years of age who was tall and slim and decidedly superior looking — [a refined , intellectual type]3561-a refined , intellectual type , one [you]3562-you would have said was [no murderer]3563-no murderer — any more than [Clyde]197-clyde — to look at , who , none - the - less was convicted of poisoning [an old man of great wealth]3564-an old man of great wealth and afterwards attempting to convert [his]3564-an old man of great wealth fortune to [his]3564-an old man of great wealth own use .
