" [[My]197-clyde son]4955-my son ! [[My]197-clyde son]4955-my son ! In [your]4955-my son heart was murder then . "[197-clyde]

" Yes , yes , "[197-clyde] [Clyde]197-clyde said reflectively . " [I]197-clyde have thought since it must have been that way . "[197-clyde]

[The Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan paused and to hearten [himself]438-the reverend mcmillan for this task began to pray — but silently — and to [himself]438-the reverend mcmillan : " [[Our]6297-our Father who art in Heaven]6298-our father who art in heaven — hallowed be [Thy]6298-our father who art in heaven name . [Thy]6298-our father who art in heaven Kingdom come , [Thy]6298-our father who art in heaven will be done — on [earth]6299-earth as it is in [Heaven]390-heaven . "[438-the reverend mcmillan] [He]438-the reverend mcmillan stirred again after a time .

" Ah , [Clyde]197-clyde . The mercy of [God]246-god is equal to every sin . [I]438-the reverend mcmillan know it . [He]438-the reverend mcmillan sent [[His]438-the reverend mcmillan own son]1771-his own son to die for the evil of [the world]1694-the world . It must be so — if [you]197-clyde will but repent . But that thought ! That deed ! [You]197-clyde have much to pray for , [[my]438-the reverend mcmillan son]4955-my son — much . Oh , yes . For in the sight of [God]246-god , [I]438-the reverend mcmillan fear,—yes — And yet — [I]438-the reverend mcmillan must pray for enlightenment . This is a strange and terrible story . There are so many phases . It may be but pray . Pray with [me]438-the reverend mcmillan now that [you]197-clyde and [I]438-the reverend mcmillan may have light . "[438-the reverend mcmillan] [He]438-the reverend mcmillan bowed [his]438-the reverend mcmillan head . [He]438-the reverend mcmillan sat for minutes in silence — while [Clyde]197-clyde , also , in silence and troubled doubt , sat before [him]438-the reverend mcmillan . Then , after a time [he]438-the reverend mcmillan began :

" Oh , [Lord]6303-lord , rebuke [me]438-the reverend mcmillan not in thine anger ; neither chasten [me]438-the reverend mcmillan in [Thy]246-god hot displeasure . Have mercy on [me]438-the reverend mcmillan , [O Lord]6304-o lord , for [I]438-the reverend mcmillan am weak . Heal [me]438-the reverend mcmillan in [my]438-the reverend mcmillan shame and sorrow for [my]438-the reverend mcmillan soul is wounded and dark in [Thy]246-god sight . Oh , let the wickedness of [my]438-the reverend mcmillan heart pass . Lead [me]438-the reverend mcmillan , [O God]6305-o god , into [Thy]246-god righteousness . Let the wickedness of [my]438-the reverend mcmillan heart pass and remember it not . "[438-the reverend mcmillan]

[Clyde]197-clyde — [his]197-clyde head down — sat still — very still . [He]197-clyde , [himself]197-clyde , was at last shaken and mournful . No doubt [his]197-clyde sin was very great . Very , very terrible ! And yet — But then , [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan ceasing and rising , [he]438-the reverend mcmillan , too , rose , the while [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan added : " But [I]438-the reverend mcmillan must go now . [I]438-the reverend mcmillan must think — pray . This has troubled and touched [me]438-the reverend mcmillan deeply . Oh , very , [Lord]6306-lord . And [you]197-clyde — [[my]438-the reverend mcmillan son]4955-my son — [you]197-clyde return and pray — alone . Repent . Ask of [God]246-god on [your]197-clyde knees [His]246-god forgiveness and [He]246-god will hear [you]197-clyde . Yes , [He]246-god will . And to - morrow — or as soon as [I]438-the reverend mcmillan honestly can — [I]438-the reverend mcmillan will come again . But do not despair . Pray always — for in prayer alone , prayer and contrition , is salvation . Rest in the strength of [Him]246-god who holds [the world]1694-the world in the hollow of [His]246-god hand . In [His]246-god abounding strength and mercy , is peace and forgiveness . Oh , yes . "[438-the reverend mcmillan]

[He]3892-he struck the iron door with a small key ring that [he]3892-he carried and at once [the guard]3422-the guard , hearing it , returned .

Then having escorted [Clyde]197-clyde to [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell and seen [him]197-clyde once more shut within [that restraining cage]3895-that restraining cage , [he]3892-he took [his]3892-he own departure , heavily and miserably burdened with all that [he]3892-he had heard . And [Clyde]197-clyde was left to brood on all [he]197-clyde had said — and how it had affected [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , as well as [himself]197-clyde . [[His]197-clyde new friend]3896-his new friend 's stricken mood . The obvious pain and horror with which [he]3892-he viewed it all . Was [he]3892-he really and truly guilty ? Did [he]3892-he really and truly deserve to die for this ? Was that what [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan would decide ? And in the face of all [his]3892-he tenderness and mercy ?

And another week in which , moved by [Clyde]197-clyde 's seeming contrition , and all the confusing and extenuating circumstances of [his]197-clyde story , and having wrestled most earnestly with every moral aspect of it , [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan once more before [his]438-the reverend mcmillan cell door — but only to say that however liberal or charitable [his]438-the reverend mcmillan interpretation of the facts , as at last [Clyde]197-clyde had truthfully pictured them , still [he]197-clyde could not feel that either primarily or secondarily could [he]197-clyde be absolved from guilt for [her]3896-his new friend death . [He]197-clyde had plotted — had [he]197-clyde not ? [He]197-clyde had not gone to [her]3896-his new friend rescue when [he]197-clyde might have . [He]197-clyde had wished [her]3896-his new friend dead and afterwards had not been sorry . In the blow that had brought about the upsetting of [the boat]4231-the boat had been some anger . Also in the mood that had not permitted [him]197-clyde to strike . The facts that [he]197-clyde had been influenced by the beauty and position of [Miss X]354-miss x to the plotting of this deed , and , after [his]197-clyde evil relations with [Roberta]195-roberta , that [she]195-roberta had been determined [he]197-clyde should marry [her]195-roberta , far from being points in extenuation of [his]197-clyde actions , were really further evidence of [his]197-clyde general earthly sin and guilt . Before [the Lord]3114-the lord then [he]197-clyde had sinned in many ways . In those dark days , alas , as [Mr. McMillan]445-mcmillan saw it , [he]197-clyde was little more than a compound of selfishness and unhallowed desire and fornication against the evil of which [Paul]440-paul had thundered . It had endured to the end and had not changed — until [he]197-clyde had been taken by the law . [He]197-clyde had not repented — not even there at [Bear Lake]50-bear lake where [he]197-clyde had time for thought . And besides , had [he]197-clyde not , from the beginning to end , bolstered it with false and evil pretenses ? Verily .

On the other hand , no doubt if [he]197-clyde were sent to the chair now in the face of [his]197-clyde first — and yet so clear manifestation of contrition — when now , for the first time [he]197-clyde was beginning to grasp the enormity of [his]197-clyde offense — it would be but to compound crime with crime — the state in this instance being [the aggressor]3899-the aggressor . For , like [the warden]3282-the warden and [many others]3901-many others , [McMillan]445-mcmillan was against capital punishment — preferring to compel [the wrong - doer]3902-the wrong - doer to serve [the state]1663-the state in some way . But , none - the - less , [he]445-mcmillan felt [himself]445-mcmillan compelled to acknowledge , [Clyde]197-clyde was far from innocent . Think as [he]445-mcmillan would — and however much spiritually [he]445-mcmillan desired to absolve [him]197-clyde , was [he]445-mcmillan not actually guilty ?

In vain it was that [McMillan]445-mcmillan now pointed out to [Clyde]197-clyde that [his]197-clyde awakened moral and spiritual understanding more perfectly and beautifully fitted [him]197-clyde for life and action than ever before . [He]197-clyde was alone . [He]197-clyde had [no one]4176-no one who believed in [him]197-clyde . [No one]4176-no one . [He]197-clyde had [no one]4176-no one , whom , in any of [his]197-clyde troubled and tortured actions before that crime saw anything but the darkest guilt apparently . And yet — and yet—(and this despite [Sondra]238-sondra and [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan and all [the world]1694-the world for that matter , [Mason]185-mason , [the jury at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg]3908-the jury at bridgeburg , [the Court of Appeals at [Albany]28-albany]3909-the court of appeals at albany , if it should decide to confirm the jury at [Bridgeburg]11-bridgeburg ) , [he]197-clyde had a feeling in [his]197-clyde heart that [he]197-clyde was not as guilty as [they]3910-they all seemed to think . After all [they]3910-they had not been tortured as [he]197-clyde had by [Roberta]195-roberta with [her]195-roberta determination that [he]197-clyde marry [her]195-roberta and thus ruin [his]197-clyde whole life . [They]3910-they had not burned with that unquenchable passion for [the Sondra]238-sondra of [his]197-clyde beautiful dream as [he]197-clyde had . [They]3910-they had not been harassed , tortured , mocked by the ill - fate of [his]197-clyde early life and training , forced to sing and pray on [the streets]2141-the streets as [he]197-clyde had in such a degrading way , when [his]197-clyde whole heart and soul cried out for better things . How could [they]3910-they judge [him]197-clyde , [these people]2355-these people , all or [any one of [them]2355-these people]2288-any one of them , even [[his]197-clyde own mother]3240-his own mother , when [they]3910-they did not know what [his]197-clyde own mental , physical and spiritual suffering had been ? And as [he]197-clyde lived through it again in [his]197-clyde thoughts at this moment the sting and mental poison of it was as real to [him]197-clyde as ever . Even in the face of all the facts and as much as [every one]2317-every one felt [him]197-clyde to be guilty , there was something so deep within [him]197-clyde that seemed to cry out against it that , even now , at times , it startled [him]197-clyde . Still — there was [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan — [he]438-the reverend mcmillan was [a very fair and just and merciful man]3916-a very fair and just and merciful man . Surely [he]438-the reverend mcmillan saw all this from a higher light and better viewpoint than [his]438-the reverend mcmillan own . While at times [he]438-the reverend mcmillan felt strongly that [he]438-the reverend mcmillan was innocent , at others [he]438-the reverend mcmillan felt that [he]438-the reverend mcmillan must be guilty .

Oh , these evasive and tangled and torturesome thoughts ! ! Would [he]438-the reverend mcmillan never be able — quite — to get the whole thing straightened out in [his]438-the reverend mcmillan own mind ?

So Clyde not being able to take advantage truly of either the tenderness and faith and devotion of [so good and pure a soul]3917-so good and pure a soul as [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan or [the all merciful and all powerful God of whom here [he]438-the reverend mcmillan stood as [the ambassador]3919-the ambassador]3918-the all merciful and all powerful god of whom here he stood as the ambassador . What was [he]438-the reverend mcmillan to do , really ? How pray , resignedly , unreservedly , faithfully ? And in that mood — and because of the urge of [the Reverend Duncan]438-the reverend mcmillan , who was convinced by [Clyde]197-clyde 's confession that [he]197-clyde must have been completely infused with the spirit of [God]246-god , once more thumbing through the various passages and chapters pointed out to [him]197-clyde — reading and re - reading the Psalms most familiar to [him]197-clyde , seeking from [their]3920-their inspiration to catch the necessary contrition — which once caught would give [him]197-clyde that peace and strength which in those long and dreary hours [he]197-clyde so much desired . Yet never quite catching it .

Parallel with all this , four more months passed . And at the end of that time — in January , 19 — , [the Court of Appeals]3233-the court of appeals finding ( [Fulham]456-fulham , [Jr.]457-jr. , reviewing the evidence as offered by [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson ) — with [Kincaid]458-kincaid , [Briggs]444-hortense briggs , [Truman]459-truman and [Dobshutter]460-dobshutter concurring , that [Clyde]197-clyde was guilty as decided by [the Cataraqui County jury]3922-the cataraqui county jury and sentencing [him]197-clyde to die at some time within the week beginning February 28th or six weeks later — and saying in conclusion :

" [We]6309-we are mindful that this is a case of circumstantial evidence and that [the only eyewitness]6310-the only eyewitness denies that death was the result of crime . But in obedience to the most exacting requirements of that manner of proof , [the counsel for [the people]601-the people]6311-the counsel for the people , with very unusual thoroughness and ability has investigated and presented evidence of a great number of circumstances for the purpose of truly solving the question of [the defendant]4999-the defendant 's guilt or innocence .[323-belknap]

" [We]6309-we might think that the proof of some of these facts standing by [themselves]601-the people was subject to doubt by reason of unsatisfactory or contradictory evidence , and that other occurrences might be so explained or interpreted as to be reconcilable with innocence . The defense — and very ably — sought to enforce this view .[438-the reverend mcmillan]

" But taken all together and considered as a connected whole , [they]601-the people make such convincing proof of guilt that [we]6309-we are not able to escape from its force by any justifiable process of reasoning and [we]6309-we are compelled to say that not only is the verdict not opposed to the weight of evidence , and to the proper inference to be drawn from it , but that it is abundantly justified thereby . Decision of [the lower court]6314-the lower court unanimously confirmed . "[323-belknap]

On hearing this , [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , who was in [Syracuse]119-syracuse at the time , hurrying to [Clyde]197-clyde in the hope that before the news was conveyed officially , [he]438-the reverend mcmillan should be there to encourage [him]197-clyde spiritually , since , only with the aid of [the Lord]3923-the lord , as [he]438-the reverend mcmillan saw it — [the eternal and ever present help in trouble]3924-the eternal and ever present help in trouble — would [Clyde]197-clyde be able to endure so heavy a blow . And finding [him]197-clyde — for which [he]438-the reverend mcmillan was most deeply grateful — wholly unaware of what had occurred , since no news of any kind was conveyed to [any condemned man]3925-any condemned man until the warrant for [his]197-clyde execution had arrived .

After a most tender and spiritual conversation — in which [he]438-the reverend mcmillan quoted from [Matthew]461-matthew , [Paul]440-paul and [John]436-st. john as to the unimportance of [this world]4890-this world — the true reality and joy of the next — [Clyde]197-clyde was compelled to learn from [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan that the decision of [the court]1991-the court had gone against [him]197-clyde . And that though [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan talked of an appeal to [the Governor]4626-the governor which [he]438-the reverend mcmillan — and [some others whom [he]438-the reverend mcmillan was sure to be able to influence]3929-some others whom he was sure to be able to influence would make — unless [the Governor]4626-the governor chose to act , within six weeks , as [Clyde]197-clyde knew , [he]197-clyde would be compelled to die . And then , once the force of that fact had finally burst on [him]197-clyde — and while [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan talked on about faith and the refuge which the mercy and wisdom of [God]246-god provided — [Clyde]197-clyde , standing before [him]438-the reverend mcmillan with more courage and character showing in [his]197-clyde face and eyes than at any time previously in [his]197-clyde brief and eager career .

" So [they]6315-they decided against [me]197-clyde . Now [I]197-clyde will have to go through that door after all,—like [all those others]6316-all those others . [They]6315-they 'll draw the curtains for [me]197-clyde , too . Into [that other room]3336-that other room — then back across [the passage]6318-the passage — saying good - bye as [I]197-clyde go , like [those others]1407-those others . [I]197-clyde will not be [here]4244-here any more . "[197-clyde] [He]197-clyde seemed to be going over each step in [his]197-clyde mind — each step with which [he]197-clyde was so familiar , only now , for the first time , [he]197-clyde was living it for [himself]197-clyde . Now , in the face of this dread news , which somehow was as fascinating as it was terrible , feeling not as distrait or weak as at first [he]197-clyde had imagined [he]197-clyde would be . Rather , to [his]197-clyde astonishment , considering all [his]197-clyde previous terror in regard to this , thinking of what [he]197-clyde would do , what [he]197-clyde would say , in an outwardly calm way .

Would [he]197-clyde repeat prayers read to [him]197-clyde by [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan [here]4244-here ? No doubt . And maybe gladly , too . And yet —

In [his]197-clyde momentary trance [he]197-clyde was unconscious of the fact that [the Reverend Duncan]438-the reverend mcmillan was whispering :

" But [you]197-clyde see [we]6321-we have n't reached the end of this yet . There is [a new Governor]6322-a new governor coming into office in [January]174-january . [He]6322-a new governor is [a very sensible and kindly man]6323-a very sensible and kindly man , [I]438-the reverend mcmillan hear . In fact [I]438-the reverend mcmillan know [several people who know [him]6322-a new governor]6324-several people who know him — and it is [my]438-the reverend mcmillan plan to see [him]6322-a new governor personally — as well as to have [some other people whom [I]438-the reverend mcmillan know]6325-some other people whom i know write [him]6322-a new governor on the strength of what [I]438-the reverend mcmillan will tell [them]6325-some other people whom i know . "[438-the reverend mcmillan]

But from [Clyde]197-clyde 's look at the moment , as well as what [he]197-clyde now said , [he]197-clyde could tell that [he]197-clyde was not listening .

" [[My]197-clyde mother]4154-my mother . [I]197-clyde suppose [some one]796-some one ought to telegraph [her]4154-my mother . [She]4154-my mother is going to feel very bad . "[197-clyde] And then : " [I]197-clyde do n't suppose [they]6325-some other people whom i know believed that those letters should n't have been introduced just as they were , did [they]6325-some other people whom i know ? [I]197-clyde thought maybe [they]6325-some other people whom i know would . "[197-clyde] [He]197-clyde was thinking of [Nicholson]418-nicholson .

" Do n't worry , [Clyde]197-clyde , "[438-the reverend mcmillan] replied the tortured and saddened [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , at this point more eager to take [him]197-clyde in [his]438-the reverend mcmillan arms and comfort [him]197-clyde than to say anything at all . " [I]438-the reverend mcmillan have already telegraphed [[your]197-clyde mother]4643-your mother . As for that decision — [I]438-the reverend mcmillan will see [[your]197-clyde lawyers]5760-your lawyers right away . Besides — as [I]438-the reverend mcmillan say — [I]438-the reverend mcmillan propose to see [the Governor]4626-the governor [myself]438-the reverend mcmillan . [He]4626-the governor is [a new man]4902-a new man , [you]197-clyde see . "[438-the reverend mcmillan]

Once more [he]438-the reverend mcmillan was now repeating all that [Clyde]197-clyde had not heard before .

The scene was [the executive chamber of [the newly elected Governor of [the State of]4994-the state of [New York]63-new york]3933-the newly elected governor of the state of new york]3932-the executive chamber of the newly elected governor of the state of new york some three weeks after the news conveyed to [Clyde]197-clyde by [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan . After many preliminary and futile efforts on the part of [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson to obtain a commutation of the sentence of [Clyde]197-clyde from death to life imprisonment , before [Governor Waltham]462-governor waltham there was now [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths together with [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan . For , moved by the widespread interest in the final disposition of [Clyde]197-clyde 's case , as well as the fact that [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , because of [her]688-his mother unshaken devotion to [him]197-clyde , and having learned of the decision of [the Court of Appeals]3233-the court of appeals , had once more returned to [Auburn]159-auburn and since then had been appealing to the newspapers , as well as to [himself]197-clyde through letters for a correct understanding of the extenuating circumstances surrounding [[her]688-his mother son]2096-her son 's downfall , and because [she]688-his mother [herself]688-his mother had repeatedly appealed to [him]197-clyde for a personal interview in which [she]688-his mother should be allowed to present [her]688-his mother deepest convictions in regard to all this , [the Governor]4626-the governor had at last consented to see [her]688-his mother . It could do no harm . Besides it would tend to soothe [her]688-his mother . Also variable public sentiment , whatever [its]3939-its convictions in any given case , was usually on the side of the form or gesture of clemency — without , however , any violence to its convictions . And , in this case , if [one]955-one could judge by the newspapers , [the public]1815-the public was convinced that [Clyde]197-clyde was guilty . On the other hand , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , owing to [her]335-mrs. griffiths own long meditations in regard to [Clyde]197-clyde , [Roberta]195-roberta , [his]197-clyde sufferings during and since the trial , the fact that according to [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan [he]197-clyde had at last been won to a deep contrition and a spiritual union with [[his]197-clyde Creator]3760-his creator whatever [his]197-clyde original sin , was now more than ever convinced that humanity and even justice demanded that at least [he]197-clyde be allowed to live . And so standing before [the Governor]4626-the governor , [a tall , sober and somewhat somber man who , never in all [his]197-clyde life had even so much as sensed the fevers or fires that [Clyde]197-clyde had known , yet who , being [a decidedly affectionate father]3945-a decidedly affectionate father and [husband]999-husband , could very well sense what [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths ' present emotions must be . Yet greatly exercised by the compulsion which the facts , as [he]197-clyde understood them , as well as a deep - seated and unchangeable submission to law and order , thrust upon [him]197-clyde]3944-a tall , sober and somewhat somber man who , never in all his life had even so much as sensed the fevers or fires that clyde had known , yet who , being a decidedly affectionate father and husband , could very well sense what mrs. griffiths ' present emotions must be . yet greatly exercised by the compulsion which the facts , as he understood them , as well as a deep - seated and unchangeable submission to law and order , thrust upon him . Like [the pardon clerk before [him]197-clyde]3947-the pardon clerk before him , [he]197-clyde had read all the evidence submitted to [the Court of Appeals]3233-the court of appeals , as well as the latest briefs submitted by [Belknap]323-belknap and [Jephson]320-jephson . But on what grounds could [he]197-clyde — [David Waltham]463-david waltham , and without any new or varying data of any kind — just a reinterpretation of the evidence as already passed upon — venture to change [Clyde]197-clyde 's death sentence to life imprisonment ? Had not [a jury]4553-a jury , as well as [the Court of Appeals]3233-the court of appeals , already said [he]197-clyde should die ?

In consequence , as [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths began [her]335-mrs. griffiths plea , [her]335-mrs. griffiths voice shaky — retracing as best [she]335-mrs. griffiths could the story of [Clyde]197-clyde 's life , [his]197-clyde virtues , the fact that at no time ever had [he]197-clyde been [a bad or cruel boy]3951-a bad or cruel boy — that [Roberta]195-roberta , if not [Miss X]354-miss x , was not entirely guiltless in the matter — [he]197-clyde merely gazed at [her]335-mrs. griffiths deeply moved . The love and devotion of [such a mother]3952-such a mother ! [Her]335-mrs. griffiths agony in this hour ; [her]335-mrs. griffiths faith that [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son could not be as evil as the proven facts seemed to indicate to [him]197-clyde and [every one else]3954-every one else . " Oh , [[my]3955-my dear]4640-my dear [Governor]462-governor waltham , how can the sacrifice of [[my]3955-my son]4955-my son 's life now , and when spiritually [he]197-clyde has purged [his]197-clyde soul of sin and is ready to devote [himself]197-clyde to the work of [God]246-god , repay [the state]1663-the state for the loss of [that poor , dear girl]6335-that poor , dear girl 's life , whether it was accidentally or otherwise taken — how can it ? Can not [the millions of people of [the state of [New York]63-new york]4997-the state of new york]6336-the millions of people of the state of new york be merciful ? Can not [you]462-governor waltham as [[their]6336-the millions of people of the state of new york representative]6338-their representative exercise the mercy that [they]6336-the millions of people of the state of new york may feel ? "[3955-my]

[Her]3955-my voice broke — [she]3955-my could not go on . Instead [she]3955-my turned [her]3955-my back and began to cry silently , while [Waltham]462-governor waltham , shaken by an emotion [he]462-governor waltham could not master , merely stood there . [This poor woman]4227-this poor woman ! So obviously honest and sincere . Then [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , seeing [his]438-the reverend mcmillan opportunity , now entering [his]438-the reverend mcmillan plea . [Clyde]197-clyde had changed . [He]197-clyde could not speak as to [his]197-clyde life before — but since [his]197-clyde incarceration — or for the last year , at least , [he]197-clyde had come into a new understanding of life , duty , [his]197-clyde obligations to [man]585-man and [God]246-god . If but the death sentence could be commuted to life imprisonment —

And [the Governor]4626-the governor , who was [a very earnest and conscientious man]3959-a very earnest and conscientious man , listened with all attention to [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , whom , as [he]438-the reverend mcmillan saw and concluded was decidedly [an intense and vital and highly idealistic person]3960-an intense and vital and highly idealistic person . No question in [his]438-the reverend mcmillan own mind but what the words of [this man]749-this man — whatever they were , would be true — in so far as [his]438-the reverend mcmillan own understanding would permit the conception of a truth .

" But [you]438-the reverend mcmillan , personally , [Mr. McMillan]445-mcmillan , "[4626-the governor] [the Governor]4626-the governor at last found voice to say , " because of [your]438-the reverend mcmillan long contact with [him]749-this man in [the prison there]6339-the prison there — do [you]438-the reverend mcmillan know of any material fact not introduced at the trial which would in any way tend to invalidate or weaken any phase of the testimony offered at the trial ? As [you]438-the reverend mcmillan must know this is a legal proceeding . [I]4626-the governor can not act upon sentiment alone — and especially in the face of the unanimous decision of [two separate courts]6340-two separate courts . "[4626-the governor]

[He]438-the reverend mcmillan looked directly at [McMillan]445-mcmillan , who , pale and dumb , now gazed at [him]438-the reverend mcmillan in return . For now upon [his]445-mcmillan word — upon [his]445-mcmillan shoulders apparently was being placed the burden of deciding as to [Clyde]197-clyde 's guilt or innocence . But could [he]445-mcmillan do that ? Had [he]445-mcmillan not decided , after due meditation as to [Clyde]197-clyde 's confessions , that [he]445-mcmillan was guilty before [God]246-god and the law ? And could [he]445-mcmillan now — for mercy 's sake — and in the face of [his]445-mcmillan deepest spiritual conviction , alter [his]445-mcmillan report of [his]445-mcmillan conviction ? Would that be true — white , valuable before [the Lord]3114-the lord ? And as instantly deciding that [he]445-mcmillan , [[Clyde]197-clyde 's spiritual adviser]3964-clyde 's spiritual adviser , must not in any way be invalidated in [his]445-mcmillan spiritual worth to [Clyde]197-clyde . " [Ye]6341-ye are the salt of [the earth]6147-the earth ; but if the salt have lost [his]197-clyde savor , wherewith shall it be salted ? "[445-mcmillan] And forthwith [he]445-mcmillan declared : " As [[his]197-clyde spiritual advisor]6343-his spiritual advisor [I]445-mcmillan have entered only upon the spiritual , not the legal aspect of [his]197-clyde life . "[445-mcmillan] And thereupon [Waltham]462-governor waltham at once deciding , from something in [McMillan]445-mcmillan 's manner that [he]445-mcmillan , like all others , apparently , was satisfied as to [Clyde]197-clyde 's guilt . And so , finally finding courage to say to [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths : " Unless some definite evidence such as [I]335-mrs. griffiths have not yet seen and which will affect the legality of these two findings can be brought [me]335-mrs. griffiths , [I]335-mrs. griffiths have no alternative , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , but to allow the verdict as written to stand . [I]335-mrs. griffiths am very sorry — oh , more than [I]335-mrs. griffiths can tell [you]335-mrs. griffiths . But if the law is to be respected its decisions can never be altered except for reasons that in themselves are full of legal merit . [I]335-mrs. griffiths wish [I]335-mrs. griffiths could decide differently . [I]335-mrs. griffiths do indeed . [My]335-mrs. griffiths heart and [my]335-mrs. griffiths prayers go with [you]335-mrs. griffiths . "[335-mrs. griffiths]

[He]445-mcmillan pressed a button . [[His]445-mcmillan secretary]3965-his secretary entered . It was plain that the interview was ended . [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , violently shaken and deeply depressed by the peculiar silence and evasion of [McMillan]445-mcmillan at the crucial moment of this interview when [the Governor]4626-the governor had asked such an all important and direct question as to the guilt of [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son , was still unable to say a word more . But now what ? Which way ? To whom to turn ? [God]246-god , and [God]246-god only . [She]335-mrs. griffiths and [Clyde]197-clyde must find in [[their]3968-their Creator]3969-their creator the solace for [his]3969-their creator failure and death in [this world]4890-this world . And as [she]335-mrs. griffiths was thinking and still weeping , [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan approached and gently led [her]335-mrs. griffiths from [the room]936-the room .

When [she]335-mrs. griffiths was gone [the Governor]4626-the governor finally turned to [[his]4626-the governor secretary]3965-his secretary :

" Never in [my]4626-the governor life have [I]4626-the governor faced a sadder duty . It will always be with [me]4626-the governor . "[4626-the governor] [He]4626-the governor turned and gazed out upon [a snowy February landscape]3974-a snowy february landscape .

And after this but two more weeks of life for [Clyde]197-clyde , during which time , and because of [his]197-clyde ultimate decision conveyed to [him]197-clyde first by [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , but in company with [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , from whose face [Clyde]197-clyde could read all , even before [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan spoke , and from whom [he]197-clyde heard all once more as to [his]197-clyde need of refuge and peace in [God]246-god , [[his]197-clyde Savior]3976-his savior , [he]197-clyde now walked up and down [[his]197-clyde cell]1588-his cell , unable to rest for any length of time anywhere . For , because of this final completely convincing sensation , that very soon [he]197-clyde was to die , [he]197-clyde felt the need , even now of retracing [his]197-clyde unhappy life . [His]197-clyde youth . [Kansas City]45-kansas city . [Chicago]43-chicago . [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus . [Roberta]195-roberta and [Sondra]238-sondra . How swiftly [they]3978-they and all that was connected with [them]3978-they passed in review . The few , brief , bright intense moments . [His]197-clyde desire for more — more — that intense desire [he]197-clyde had felt there in [Lycurgus]33-lycurgus after [Sondra]238-sondra came and now this , this ! And now even this was ending — this — this — Why , [he]197-clyde had scarcely lived at all as yet — and these last two years so miserably between these crushing walls . And of this life but fourteen , thirteen , twelve , eleven , ten , nine , eight of the filtering and now feverish days left . [They]3978-they were going — going . But life — life — how was [one to do without that]3979-one to do without that — the beauty of the days — of the sun and rain — of work love , energy , desire . Oh , [he]197-clyde really did not want to die . [He]197-clyde did not . Why say to [him]197-clyde so constantly as [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother and [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan now did to resolve all [his]197-clyde care in divine mercy and think only of [God]246-god , when now , now , was all ? And yet [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan insisting that only in [Christ]412-christ and the hereafter was real peace . Oh , yes — but just the same , before [the Governor]4626-the governor might [he]197-clyde not have said — might [he]197-clyde not have said that [he]197-clyde was not guilty — or at least not entirely guilty — if only [he]197-clyde had seen it that way — that time — and then — then — why then [the Governor]4626-the governor might have commuted [his]197-clyde sentence to life imprisonment — might [he]197-clyde not ? For [he]197-clyde had asked [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother what [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan had said to [the Governor—(yet]464-the governor—(yet without saying to [her]688-his mother that [he]197-clyde had ever confessed all to [him]197-clyde ) , and [she]688-his mother had replied that [he]197-clyde had told [him]197-clyde how sincerely [he]197-clyde had humbled [himself]197-clyde before [the Lord]3114-the lord — but not that [he]197-clyde was not guilty . And [Clyde]197-clyde , feeling how strange it was that [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan could not conscientiously bring [himself]197-clyde to do more than that for [him]197-clyde . How sad . How hopeless . Would [no one]4176-no one ever understand — or give [him]197-clyde credit for [his]197-clyde human — if all too human and perhaps wrong hungers — yet from which so many others — along with [himself]197-clyde suffered ?

But worse yet , if anything , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , because of what [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan had said — or failed to say , in answer to the final question asked by [Governor Waltham]462-governor waltham — and although subsequently in answer to an inquiry of [her]335-mrs. griffiths own , [he]197-clyde had repeated the statement , [she]335-mrs. griffiths was staggered by the thought that perhaps , after all , [Clyde]197-clyde was as guilty as at first [she]335-mrs. griffiths had feared . And because of that asking at one point :

" [Clyde]197-clyde , if there is anything [you]197-clyde have not confessed , [you]197-clyde must confess it before [you]197-clyde go . "[197-clyde]

" [I]197-clyde have confessed everything to [God]246-god and to [Mr. McMillan]445-mcmillan , [Mother]2083-mother . Is n't that enough ? "[197-clyde]

" No , [Clyde]197-clyde . [You]197-clyde have told [the world]1694-the world that [you]197-clyde are innocent . But if [you]197-clyde are not [you]197-clyde must say so . "[197-clyde]

" But if [my]197-clyde conscience tells [me]197-clyde that [I]197-clyde am right , is not that enough ? "[197-clyde]

" No , not if [God]246-god 's word says differently , [Clyde]197-clyde , "[335-mrs. griffiths] replied [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths nervously — and with great inward spiritual torture . But [he]3986-he chose to say nothing further at that time . How could [he]3986-he discuss with [[his]3986-he mother]688-his mother or [the world]1694-the world the strange shadings which in [his]3986-he confession and subsequent talks with [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan [he]3986-he had not been able to solve . It was not to be done .

And because of that refusal on [[her]335-mrs. griffiths son]2096-her son 's part to confide in [her]335-mrs. griffiths , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths , tortured , not only spiritually but personally . [[Her]335-mrs. griffiths own son]3449-her own son — and so near death and not willing to say what already apparently [he]3986-he had said to [Mr. McMillan]445-mcmillan . Would not [God]246-god ever be done with this testing [her]335-mrs. griffiths ? And yet on account of what [McMillan]445-mcmillan had already said,—that [he]445-mcmillan considered [Clyde]197-clyde , whatever [his]3986-he past sins , contrite and clean before [the Lord]3114-the lord — [a youth truly ready to meet [[his]3986-he Maker]3607-his maker]3992-a youth truly ready to meet his maker — [she]335-mrs. griffiths was prone to rest . [The Lord]3994-the lord was great ! [He]3986-he was merciful . In [His]3986-he bosom was peace . What was death — what life — to one whose heart and mind were at peace with [Him]3986-he ? It was nothing . A few years ( how very few ) and [she]335-mrs. griffiths and [Asa]335-mrs. griffiths and after [them]3995-them , [[his]3986-he brothers]3996-his brothers and [sisters]2192-sisters , would come to join [him]3986-he — and all [his]3986-he miseries here would be forgotten . But without peace in [the Lord]3114-the lord — the full and beautiful realization of [His]3986-he presence , love , care and mercy ... ! [She]335-mrs. griffiths was tremulous at moments now in [her]335-mrs. griffiths spiritual exaltation — no longer quite normal — as [Clyde]197-clyde could see and feel . But also by [her]335-mrs. griffiths prayers and anxiety as to [his]3986-he spiritual welfare , [he]3986-he was also able to see how little , really , [she]335-mrs. griffiths had ever understood of [his]3986-he true moods and aspirations . [He]3986-he had longed for so much there in [Kansas City]45-kansas city and [he]3986-he had had so little . Things — just things — had seemed very important to [him]3986-he — and [he]3986-he had so resented being taken out on [the street]3170-the street as [he]3986-he had been , before [all the other boys]4000-all the other boys and [girls]1319-girls , many of whom had all the things that [he]3986-he so craved , and when [he]3986-he would have been glad to have been anywhere else in [the world]1694-the world than out there — on [the street]3170-the street ! That mission life that to [[his]3986-he mother]688-his mother was so wonderful , yet , to [him]3986-he , so dreary ! But was it wrong for [him]3986-he to feel so ? Had it been ? Would [the Lord]3114-the lord resent it now ? And , maybe , [she]335-mrs. griffiths was right as to [her]335-mrs. griffiths thoughts about [him]3986-he . Unquestionably [he]3986-he would have been better off if [he]3986-he had followed [her]335-mrs. griffiths advice . But how strange it was , that to [[his]3986-he own mother]3240-his own mother , and even now in these closing hours , when above all things [he]3986-he craved sympathy — but more than sympathy , true and deep understanding — even now — and as much as [she]335-mrs. griffiths loved and sympathized with , and was seeking to aid [him]3986-he with all [her]335-mrs. griffiths strength in [her]335-mrs. griffiths stern and self - sacrificing way,—still [he]3986-he could not turn to [her]335-mrs. griffiths now and tell [her]335-mrs. griffiths , [[his]3986-he own mother]3240-his own mother , just how it all happened . It was as though there was an unsurmountable wall or impenetrable barrier between [them]4008-them , built by the lack of understanding — for it was just that . [She]335-mrs. griffiths would never understand [his]3986-he craving for ease and luxury , for beauty , for love — [his]3986-he particular kind of love that went with show , pleasure , wealth , position , [his]3986-he eager and immutable aspirations and desires . [She]335-mrs. griffiths could not understand these things . [She]335-mrs. griffiths would look on all of it as sin — evil , selfishness . And in connection with all the fatal steps involving [Roberta]195-roberta and [Sondra]238-sondra , as adultery — unchastity — murder , even . And [she]335-mrs. griffiths would and did expect [him]3986-he to be terribly sorry and wholly repentant , when , even now , and for all [he]3986-he had said to [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan and to [her]335-mrs. griffiths , [he]3986-he could not feel so — not wholly so — although great was [his]3986-he desire now to take refuge in [God]246-god , but better yet , if it were only possible , in [her]335-mrs. griffiths own understanding and sympathetic heart . If it were only possible .

Lord , it was all so terrible ! [He]3986-he was so alone , even in these last few and elusive hours ( the swift passing of the days ) , with [[his]3986-he mother]688-his mother and also [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan here with [him]3986-he , but neither understanding .

But , apart from all this and much worse , [he]3986-he was locked up [here]4244-here and [they]4011-they would not let [him]3986-he go . There was a system — a horrible routine system — as long since [he]3986-he had come to feel it to be so . It was iron . It moved automatically like a machine without the aid or the hearts of [men]2208-men . [These guards]4013-these guards ! [They]4013-these guards with [their]4013-these guards letters , [their]4013-these guards inquiries , [their]4013-these guards pleasant and yet really hollow words , [their]4013-these guards trips to do little favors , or to take [the men]652-the men in and out of [the yard]4015-the yard or to [[their]652-the men baths]4016-their baths — [they]4013-these guards were iron , too — mere machines , automatons , pushing and pushing and yet restraining and restraining one — within these walls , as ready to kill as to favor in case of opposition — but pushing , pushing , pushing — always toward that little door over there , from which there was no escape — no escape — just on and on — until at last [they]4011-they would push [him]3986-he through it never to return ! Never to return !

Each time [he]3986-he thought of this [he]3986-he arose and walked the floor . Afterwards , usually , [he]3986-he resumed the puzzle of [his]3986-he own guilt . [He]3986-he tried to think of [Roberta]195-roberta and the evil [he]3986-he had done [her]195-roberta , to read the Bible — even — lying on [his]3986-he face on the iron cot — repeating over and over : " [Lord]6259-lord , give [me]3986-he peace . [Lord]6347-lord , give [me]3986-he light . [Lord]6348-lord , give [me]3986-he strength to resist any evil thoughts that [I]3986-he should not have . [I]3986-he know [I]3986-he am not wholly white . Oh , no . [I]3986-he know [I]3986-he plotted evil . Yes , yes , [I]3986-he know that . [I]3986-he confess . But must [I]3986-he really die now ? Is there no help ? Will [you]6347-lord not help [me]3986-he , [Lord]6349-lord ? Will [you]6347-lord not manifest [yourself]6347-lord , as [[my]3986-he mother]4154-my mother says [you]6347-lord will — for [me]3986-he ? Will [you]6347-lord get [the Governor]4626-the governor to change [my]3986-he sentence before the final moment to life imprisonment ? Will [you]6347-lord get [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan to change [his]438-the reverend mcmillan views and go to [him]438-the reverend mcmillan , and [[my]3986-he mother]4154-my mother , too ? [I]3986-he will drive out all sinful thoughts . [I]3986-he will be different . Oh , yes , [I]3986-he will , if [you]6347-lord will only spare [me]3986-he . Do not let [me]3986-he die now — so soon . Do not . [I]3986-he will pray . Yes , [I]3986-he will . Give [me]3986-he the strength to understand and believe — and pray . Oh , do ! "[3986-he]

It was like this in those short , horrible days between the return of [[his]4017-his mother]688-his mother and [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan from [their]4019-their final visit to [the Governor]4626-the governor and in [his]4017-his last hour that [Clyde]197-clyde thought and prayed — yet finally in a kind of psychic terror , evoked by [his]4017-his uncertainty as to the meaning of the hereafter , [his]4017-his certainty of death , and the faith and emotions of [[his]4017-his mother]688-his mother , as well as those of [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , who was about every day with [his]438-the reverend mcmillan interpretations of divine mercy and [his]438-the reverend mcmillan exhortations as to the necessity of complete faith and reliance upon it , [he]438-the reverend mcmillan , [himself]438-the reverend mcmillan coming at last to believe , not only must [he]438-the reverend mcmillan have faith but that [he]438-the reverend mcmillan had it — and peace — complete and secure . In that state , and at the request of [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , and [[his]4017-his mother]688-his mother , finally composing , with the personal aid and supervision of [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , who changed some of the sentences in [his]438-the reverend mcmillan presence and with [his]438-the reverend mcmillan consent , an address to [the world]1694-the world , and more particularly to [young men of [his]438-the reverend mcmillan own years]4024-young men of his own years , which read :

In the shadow of [the Valley of Death]4025-the valley of death it is [my]0-i desire to do everything that would remove any doubt as to [my]0-i having found [Jesus Christ]412-christ , [the personal Savior and unfailing friend]4026-the personal savior and unfailing friend . [My]0-i one regret at this time is that [I]0-i have not given [Him]412-christ the preeminence in [my]0-i life while [I]0-i had the opportunity to work for [Him]412-christ .

If [I]0-i could only say some one thing that would draw [young men]4027-young men to [Him]412-christ [I]0-i would deem it the greatest privilege ever granted [me]0-i . But all [I]0-i can now say is , " [I]0-i know in whom [I]0-i have believed , and am persuaded that [He]412-christ is able to keep that which [I]0-i have committed unto [Him]412-christ against that day "[0-i] [ a quotation that [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan had familiarized [him]438-the reverend mcmillan with ] .

If [the young men of [this country]4029-this country]4028-the young men of this country could only know the joy and pleasure of a Christian life , [I]0-i know [they]4028-the young men of this country would do all in [their]4028-the young men of this country power to become [earnest , active Christians]4030-earnest , active christians , and would strive to live as [Christ]412-christ would have [them]4028-the young men of this country live .

There is not one thing [I]0-i have left undone which will bar [me]0-i from facing [[my]0-i God]4257-my god , knowing that [my]0-i sins are forgiven , for [I]0-i have been free and frank in [my]0-i talks with [[my]0-i spiritual adviser]4032-my spiritual adviser , and [God]246-god knows where [I]0-i stand .

[My]0-i task is done , the victory won .

[CLYDE GRIFFITHS]197-clyde . Having written this — a statement so unlike all the previous rebellious moods that had characterized [him]197-clyde that even now [he]197-clyde was , not a little impressed by the difference , handing it to [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , who , heartened by this triumph , exclaimed : " And the victory is won , [Clyde]197-clyde . ' This day shalt [thou]6353-thou be with [me]438-the reverend mcmillan in [Paradise]175-paradise . ' [You]197-clyde have [His]438-the reverend mcmillan word . [Your]197-clyde soul and [your]197-clyde body belong to [Him]438-the reverend mcmillan . Praised , everlastingly , be [His]438-the reverend mcmillan name . "[438-the reverend mcmillan]

And then so wrought up was [he]438-the reverend mcmillan by this triumph , taking both [Clyde]197-clyde 's hands in [his]438-the reverend mcmillan and kissing [them]4033-them and then folding [him]197-clyde in [his]438-the reverend mcmillan arms : " [[My]438-the reverend mcmillan son]4955-my son , [[my]438-the reverend mcmillan son]4955-my son , in whom [I]438-the reverend mcmillan am well pleased . In [you]197-clyde [God]246-god has truly manifested [His]246-god truth . [His]246-god power to save . [I]438-the reverend mcmillan see it . [I]438-the reverend mcmillan feel it . [Your]197-clyde address to [the world]1694-the world is really [His]197-clyde own voice to [the world]1694-the world . "[438-the reverend mcmillan] And then pocketing the note with the understanding that it was to be issued after [Clyde]197-clyde 's death — not before . And yet [Clyde]197-clyde having written this , still dubious at moments . Was [he]197-clyde truly saved ? The time was so short ? Could [he]197-clyde rely on [God]246-god with that absolute security which [he]197-clyde had just announced now characterized [him]197-clyde ? Could [he]197-clyde ? Life was so strange . The future so obscure . Was there really a life after death — [a God by whom [he]197-clyde would be welcomed as [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan and [[his]197-clyde own mother]3240-his own mother]4034-a god by whom he would be welcomed as the reverend mcmillan and his own mother insisted ? Was there ?

In the midst of this , two days before [his]197-clyde death and in a final burst of panic , [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths wiring [the Hon . David Waltham]463-david waltham : " Can [you]197-clyde say before [[your]197-clyde God]5738-your god that [you]197-clyde have no doubt of [Clyde]197-clyde 's guilt ? Please wire . "[465-robert fessler]

At last the final day — the final hour — [Clyde]197-clyde 's transfer to [a cell in [the old death house]3353-the old death house]4038-a cell in the old death house , where , after a shave and a bath , [he]197-clyde was furnished with black trousers , a white shirt without a collar , to be opened at the neck afterwards , new felt slippers and gray socks . So accoutered , [he]197-clyde was allowed once more to meet [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother and [McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan , who , from six o'clock in the evening preceding the morning of [his]197-clyde death until four of the final morning , were permitted to remain near [him]197-clyde to counsel with [him]197-clyde as to the love and mercy of [God]246-god . And then at four [the warden]3282-the warden appearing to say that it was time , [he]3282-the warden feared , that [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths depart leaving [Clyde]197-clyde in the care of [Mr. McMillan]445-mcmillan . ( The sad compulsion of the law , as [he]3282-the warden explained . ) And then [Clyde]197-clyde 's final farewell to [[his]197-clyde mother]688-his mother , before which , and in between the silences and painful twistings of heart strings , [he]197-clyde had managed to say :

" [Mama]466-mama , [you]466-mama must believe that [I]197-clyde die resigned and content . It wo n't be hard . [God]246-god has heard [my]197-clyde prayers . And [Mrs. Griffiths]335-mrs. griffiths exclaiming : " [[My]335-mrs. griffiths son]4955-my son ! [[My]335-mrs. griffiths son]4955-my son , [I]335-mrs. griffiths know , [I]335-mrs. griffiths know . And then in the dark of this midwinter morning — the final moment — with [the guards]3618-the guards coming , first to slit [his]197-clyde right trouser leg for the metal plate and then going to draw the curtains before [the cells]3307-the cells : " It is time , [I]3618-the guards fear . But various voices — as [Clyde]197-clyde entered the first door to cross to [the chair room]4049-the chair room , calling : " Good - by , [Clyde]197-clyde . "[197-clyde] And [Clyde]197-clyde , with enough earthly thought and strength to reply : " Good - by , all . "[197-clyde] But [his]197-clyde voice sounding so strange and weak , even to [himself]197-clyde , so far distant as though it emanated from another being walking alongside of [him]197-clyde , and not from [himself]197-clyde . And [his]197-clyde feet were walking , but automatically , it seemed . And [he]197-clyde was conscious of that familiar shuffle — shuffle — as [they]4050-they pushed [him]197-clyde on and on toward that door . Now it was here ; now it was being opened . There it was — at last — the chair [he]197-clyde had so often seen in [his]197-clyde dreams — that [he]197-clyde so dreaded — to which [he]197-clyde was now compelled to go . [He]197-clyde was being pushed toward that — into that — on — on — through the door which was now open — to receive [him]197-clyde — but which was as quickly closed again on all the earthly life [he]197-clyde had ever known .

It was [the Reverend McMillan , who , gray and weary — a quarter of an hour later]4051-the reverend mcmillan , who , gray and weary — a quarter of an hour later , walked desolately — and even a little uncertainly — as [one who is physically very weak]4052-one who is physically very weak — through the cold doors of [the prison]3012-the prison . It was so faint — so weak — so gray as yet — this late winter day — and so like [himself]197-clyde now . Dead ! [He]197-clyde , [Clyde]197-clyde , had walked so nervously and yet somehow trustingly beside [him]197-clyde but a few minutes before — and now [he]197-clyde was dead . The law ! Prisons such as this . [Strong , evil men who scoffed betimes where [Clyde]197-clyde had prayed]4054-strong , evil men who scoffed betimes where clyde had prayed . That confession ! Had [he]197-clyde decided truly — with the wisdom of [God]246-god , as [God]246-god gave [him]197-clyde to see wisdom ? Had [he]197-clyde ? [Clyde]197-clyde 's eyes ! [He]197-clyde , [himself]197-clyde — [the Reverend McMillan]438-the reverend mcmillan had all but fainted beside [him]197-clyde as that cap was adjusted to [his]197-clyde head — that current turned on — and [he]197-clyde had had to be assisted , sick and trembling , from [the room]936-the room — [he]197-clyde upon whom [Clyde]197-clyde had relied . And [he]197-clyde had asked [God]246-god for strength,—was asking it .

[He]197-clyde walked along [the silent street]4056-the silent street — only to be compelled to pause and lean against a tree — leafless in the winter — so bare and bleak . [Clyde]197-clyde 's eyes ! That look as [he]197-clyde sank limply into that terrible chair , [his]197-clyde eyes fixed nervously and , as [he]197-clyde thought , appealingly and dazedly upon [him]197-clyde and [the group surrounding [him]197-clyde]4057-the group surrounding him .

Had [he]197-clyde done right ? Had [his]197-clyde decision before [Governor Waltham]462-governor waltham been truly sound , fair or merciful ? Should [he]197-clyde have said to [him]197-clyde — that perhaps — perhaps — there had been those other influences playing upon [him?]197-clyde ... Was [he]197-clyde never to have mental peace again , perhaps ?

" [I]197-clyde know [[my]197-clyde Redeemer]6363-my redeemer liveth and that [He]6363-my redeemer will keep [him]6363-my redeemer against that day . "[197-clyde]

Dusk , of a summer night .

And the tall walls of [the commercial heart of [the city of]4064-the city of [San Francisco]82-san francisco]4063-the commercial heart of the city of san francisco — tall and gray in the evening shade .

It was hot , with the sweet languor of a Pacific summer about it all .
